SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` import java.io.*; import java.security.*; import javax.net.ssl.*; import com.rabbitmq.client.*; public class Example2 { public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception { char[] keyPassphrase = "MySecretPassword".toCharArray(); KeyStore ks = KeyStore.getInstance("PKCS12"); ks.load(new FileInputStream("/path/to/client_key.p12"), keyPassphrase); KeyManagerFactory kmf = KeyManagerFactory.getInstance("SunX509"); kmf.init(ks, keyPassphrase); char[] trustPassphrase = "rabbitstore".toCharArray(); KeyStore tks = KeyStore.getInstance("JKS"); tks.load(new FileInputStream("/path/to/trustStore"), trustPassphrase); TrustManagerFactory tmf = TrustManagerFactory.getInstance("SunX509"); tmf.init(tks); SSLContext c = SSLContext.getInstance("TLSv1.2"); c.init(kmf.getKeyManagers(), tmf.getTrustManagers(), null); ConnectionFactory factory = new ConnectionFactory(); factory.setHost("localhost"); factory.setPort(5671); factory.useSslProtocol(c); factory.enableHostnameVerification(); Connection conn = factory.newConnection(); Channel channel = conn.createChannel(); channel.queueDeclare("rabbitmq-java-test", false, true, true, null); channel.basicPublish("", "rabbitmq-java-test", null, "Hello, World".getBytes()); GetResponse chResponse = channel.basicGet("rabbitmq-java-test", false); if (chResponse == null) { System.out.println("No message retrieved"); } else { byte[] body = chResponse.getBody(); System.out.println("Received: " + new String(body)); } channel.close(); conn.close(); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RPC Callback Queue Implementation - Elixir DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create a callback queue for RPC responses and publish a request message with the callback queue address. Shows the basic pattern for RPC communication in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-six-elixir.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: elixir CODE: ``` {:ok, %{queue: callback_queue}} = AMQP.Queue.declare(channel, "", exclusive: true) AMQP.Basic.publish(channel, "", "rpc_queue", request, reply_to: callback_queue) # ... and some code to read a response message from the callback_queue ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Definition Import from HTTPS URL on Node Boot DESCRIPTION: Configuration settings to import definitions from a URL accessible over HTTPS when a RabbitMQ node starts, including TLS version specification. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/definitions.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # Does not require management plugin to be enabled. definitions.import_backend = https definitions.https.url = https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rabbitmq/sample-configs/main/queues/5k-queues.json # client-side TLS options for definition import definitions.tls.versions.1 = tlsv1.2 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Handling Publisher Confirms Asynchronously in PHP DESCRIPTION: This code shows how to set up asynchronous handling of publisher confirms. It registers callbacks for both confirmed and nack-ed messages, providing the most flexible approach to handling confirmations. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-seven-php.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` $channel = $connection->channel(); $channel->confirm_select(); $channel->set_ack_handler( function (AMQPMessage $message){ // code when message is confirmed } ); $channel->set_nack_handler( function (AMQPMessage $message){ // code when message is nack-ed } ); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Absolute Memory Limit in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Examples of setting an absolute memory limit for RabbitMQ using different memory units in the configuration file. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/memory.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` vm_memory_high_watermark.absolute = 1073741824 ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` vm_memory_high_watermark.absolute = 1024MiB ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` vm_memory_high_watermark.absolute = 4Gi ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` vm_memory_high_watermark.absolute = 1Ti ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling RabbitMQ MQTT Plugin via Command Line DESCRIPTION: Command to enable the MQTT plugin on all RabbitMQ cluster nodes using rabbitmq-plugins tool. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/mqtt.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_mqtt ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting a RabbitMQ User DESCRIPTION: This command deletes the user 'janeway' from the RabbitMQ broker. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl delete_user janeway ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Publishing a Message to a Direct Exchange in PHP DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to publish a message to a direct exchange with a specific routing key (severity) in PHP using the php-amqplib library. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-php.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` $channel->exchange_declare('direct_logs', 'direct', false, false, false); $channel->basic_publish($msg, 'direct_logs', $severity); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Tutorial Components in JSX DESCRIPTION: React/JSX imports for tutorial components including help documentation, direct exchange diagrams, multiple bindings diagrams, and full routing diagrams. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-go.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` import TutorialsHelp from '@site/src/components/Tutorials/TutorialsHelp.md'; import T4DiagramDirectX from '@site/src/components/Tutorials/T4DiagramDirectX.md'; import T4DiagramMultipleBindings from '@site/src/components/Tutorials/T4DiagramMultipleBindings.md'; import T4DiagramFull from '@site/src/components/Tutorials/T4DiagramFull.md'; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Federation Policy for All Queues in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to create a policy that applies federation to all queues, using the previously defined 'blue' upstream. It uses the rabbitmqctl command to set a policy. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/blue-green-upgrade.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy --apply-to queues blue-green-migration ".*" \ '{"federation-upstream":"blue"}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Virtual Host Parameters in RabbitMQ (PowerShell) DESCRIPTION: Commands for setting, clearing, and listing virtual host-scoped parameters using rabbitmqctl in PowerShell. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/parameters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` # sets a runtime parameter in a virtual host rabbitmqctl.bat set_parameter [-p vhost] # clears (unsets) a runtime parameter in a virtual host rabbitmqctl.bat clear_parameter [-p vhost] # lists runtime parameters in a virtual host rabbitmqctl.bat list_parameters [-p vhost] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Executing Basic RabbitMQ Node Health Check in Bash DESCRIPTION: This command performs a basic health check on a RabbitMQ node using the rabbitmq-diagnostics tool. It pings the node and returns a success code if the node is running and accessible. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/monitoring/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics -q ping # => Ping succeeded if exit code is 0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Executing Basic RabbitMQ Node Health Check in Bash DESCRIPTION: This command performs a basic health check on a RabbitMQ node using the rabbitmq-diagnostics tool. It pings the node and returns a success code if the node is running and accessible. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/monitoring/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics -q ping # => Ping succeeded if exit code is 0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complete Log Message Consumer Implementation in Ruby DESCRIPTION: Full implementation of a log message consumer using RabbitMQ with the Bunny client. It creates a temporary queue, binds it to the 'logs' exchange, and processes incoming messages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-ruby.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` #!/usr/bin/env ruby require 'bunny' connection = Bunny.new connection.start channel = connection.create_channel exchange = channel.fanout('logs') queue = channel.queue('', exclusive: true) queue.bind(exchange) puts ' [*] Waiting for logs. To exit press CTRL+C' begin queue.subscribe(block: true) do |_delivery_info, _properties, body| puts " [x] #{body}" end rescue Interrupt => _ channel.close connection.close end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Attaching an Event to ChangeState in C# DESCRIPTION: Shows how to attach an event listener to the ChangeState event of a RabbitMQ connection in C#. The listener receives information about state changes and potential failures. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/amqp-client-libraries.md#2025-04-09_snippet_65 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` connection.ChangeState += ( sender, // the sender instance ( in this case the connection) fromState, // the previous state toState, // the current (new) state e // the cause of the failure (in case of failure) ) => { }; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Peer Discovery Retry Settings in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration for controlling the number of retries and delay between retry attempts for peer discovery operations in RabbitMQ clusters. These settings help handle temporary failures in discovery services. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_49 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # These are the default values # Retry peer discovery operations up to ten times cluster_formation.discovery_retry_limit = 10 # 500 milliseconds cluster_formation.discovery_retry_interval = 500 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Delete Virtual Host via HTTP API DESCRIPTION: Example of using curl to delete a virtual host named 'vh1' through RabbitMQ's HTTP API SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -u userename:pa$sw0rD -X DELETE http://rabbitmq.local:15672/api/vhosts/vh1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Feature Flags in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Shows how to list all feature flags in a RabbitMQ cluster using the rabbitmqctl command-line tool, displaying their names and current states. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/feature-flags/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_feature_flags # => Listing feature flags ... # => name state # => empty_basic_get_metric enabled # => implicit_default_bindings enabled # => quorum_queue enabled ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Consuming Messages from RabbitMQ Stream with Offset Tracking in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to create a consumer that reads messages from a RabbitMQ stream, tracks offsets, and stops when it encounters a marker message. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-javascript-stream.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const startFrom = rabbit.Offset.first(); let firstOffset = startFrom.value; let lastOffset = startFrom.value; let messageCount = 0; const consumer = await client.declareConsumer({ stream: streamName, offset: startFrom }, (message) => { messageCount++; if (messageCount === 1) { console.log("First message received"); firstOffset = message.offset; } if (message.content.toString() === "marker") { console.log("Marker found"); lastOffset = message.offset; console.log(`Done consuming, first offset was ${firstOffset}, last offset was ${lastOffset}`); } }); console.log(`Start consuming...`); await sleep(2000); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting User Permissions in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Grants a user access to a specific virtual host with configure, write, and read permissions based on regular expressions. This command is essential for setting up fine-grained access control for users in a RabbitMQ environment. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_30 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_permissions -p my-vhost janeway "^janeway-.*" ".*" ".*" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Restricting Specific RabbitMQ User to Localhost Connections DESCRIPTION: This configuration restricts a specific user named 'monitoring' to localhost-only connections. Other users' connection permissions are not affected by this setting. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_29 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` loopback_users.monitoring = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Message Prefetch Count in RabbitMQ with Swift DESCRIPTION: This code sets the prefetch count to 1, instructing RabbitMQ not to give more than one message to a worker at a time. This ensures fair workload distribution among multiple workers by only dispatching a new message after the previous one is acknowledged. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-swift.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: swift CODE: ``` ch.basicQos(1, global: false) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating an AMQP 1.0 Publisher in C# DESCRIPTION: Sets up a Publisher to send messages to a specific exchange and routing key in C#. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/amqp-client-libraries.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` // The publisher can use exchange (optionally with a key) or queue to publish messages. IPublisher publisher = await connection.PublisherBuilder().Exchange("foo").Key("bar") .BuildAsync(); // ... // close the publisher when it is no longer necessary await publisher.CloseAsync(); publisher.Dispose(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ for TLS 1.2 Connections with Restricted Ciphers DESCRIPTION: This configuration sets up RabbitMQ to accept TLSv1.2 connections with restricted cipher suites. It specifies the SSL port, certificate files, and enables peer verification without requiring client certificates. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_42 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` listeners.ssl.default = 5671 ssl_options.cacertfile = /path/to/ca_certificate.pem ssl_options.certfile = /path/to/server_certificate.pem ssl_options.keyfile = /path/to/server_key.pem ssl_options.versions.1 = tlsv1.2 ssl_options.verify = verify_peer ssl_options.fail_if_no_peer_cert = false ssl_options.honor_cipher_order = true ssl_options.honor_ecc_order = true # These are highly recommended for TLSv1.2 but cannot be used ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Downloading RabbitMQ-Web-Stomp Plugin Files DESCRIPTION: This shell command downloads the necessary Erlang plugin files for RabbitMQ-Web-Stomp. It retrieves the cowboy, sockjs, rabbitmq_web_stomp, and rabbitmq_web_stomp_examples plugin files. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2012-05-14-introducing-rabbitmq-web-stomp/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` wget \ https://www.rabbitmq.com/releases/plugins/v2.8.2-web-stomp-preview/cowboy-0.5.0-rmq2.8.2-git4b93c2d.ez \ https://www.rabbitmq.com/releases/plugins/v2.8.2-web-stomp-preview/sockjs-0.2.1-rmq2.8.2-gitfa1db96.ez \ https://www.rabbitmq.com/releases/plugins/v2.8.2-web-stomp-preview/rabbitmq_web_stomp-2.8.2.ez \ https://www.rabbitmq.com/releases/plugins/v2.8.2-web-stomp-preview/rabbitmq_web_stomp_examples-2.8.2.ez ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Publishing Persistent Messages in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Shows how to publish messages with persistence enabled to ensure they survive broker restarts. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-ruby.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` exchange.publish(message, persistent: true) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting RabbitMQ Management Plugin DESCRIPTION: Command to enable the RabbitMQ management plugin and its dependencies while disabling all other plugins. This is used for configuring which plugins are active in a RabbitMQ installation. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmq-plugins.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins set rabbitmq_management ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Opening a Channel in C# DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to open a new channel (called 'model' in the .NET client) after establishing a connection using the RabbitMQ .NET client. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/channels/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` var cf = new ConnectionFactory(); var conn = cf.newConnection(); // the .NET client calls channels "models" var ch = conn.CreateModel(); // ... use the channel to declare topology, publish, consume ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Kubernetes Plugin Configuration DESCRIPTION: Basic configuration for using Kubernetes peer discovery backend SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = k8s ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Message TTL Using Queue Arguments in C# DESCRIPTION: This C# example demonstrates how to create a queue with a message TTL of 60 seconds using the x-message-ttl argument. The queue is declared with the TTL parameter in the arguments dictionary. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ttl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` var args = new Dictionary(); args.Add("x-message-ttl", 60000); model.QueueDeclare("myqueue", false, false, false, args); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Kubernetes Plugin Configuration DESCRIPTION: Basic configuration for using Kubernetes peer discovery backend SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = k8s ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Mutual TLS for RabbitMQ Cluster on Kubernetes DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for a RabbitMQ cluster with mutual TLS enabled. It references both the server TLS secret and the CA secret for client certificate verification. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-operator/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_30 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiVersion: rabbitmq.com/v1beta1 kind: RabbitmqCluster metadata: name: mtls spec: replicas: 1 tls: secretName: tls-secret caSecretName: ca-secret ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Fibonacci Function in Java DESCRIPTION: A recursive implementation of the Fibonacci sequence calculator. This function takes an integer parameter and returns the corresponding Fibonacci number. Note that this implementation is not efficient for large numbers. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-six-spring-amqp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` public int fib(int n) { return n == 0 ? 0 : n == 1 ? 1 : (fib(n - 1) + fib(n - 2)); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Permissions in RabbitMQ Virtual Host (Bash) DESCRIPTION: This command lists all users who have been granted access to a specific virtual host and their permissions. It requires the virtual host name as a parameter. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_permissions -p my-vhost ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Granting Permissions Across Multiple Virtual Hosts in RabbitMQ (Bash and PowerShell) DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to grant permissions to a user across all virtual hosts in RabbitMQ using a script in both Bash and PowerShell. It uses rabbitmqctl to list all virtual hosts and then applies permissions for each. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Assumes a Linux shell. # Grants a user permissions to all virtual hosts. for v in $(rabbitmqctl list_vhosts --silent); do rabbitmqctl set_permissions -p $v "a-user" ".*" ".*" ".*"; done ``` LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat list_vhosts --silent | %{ rabbitmqctl.bat set_permissions -p $_ 'a-user' '.*' '.*' '.*' } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling RabbitMQ Feature Flags DESCRIPTION: Command to enable all feature flags on a running RabbitMQ node, which is important for feature access and future compatibility. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-homebrew.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` /opt/homebrew/sbin/rabbitmqctl enable_feature_flag all ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic HTTPS Configuration for RabbitMQ Management Plugin DESCRIPTION: Configures the management plugin to use HTTPS with TLS certificates. Requires specifying the port, CA certificate, server certificate, and private key file paths. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.ssl.port = 15671 management.ssl.cacertfile = /path/to/ca_certificate.pem management.ssl.certfile = /path/to/server_certificate.pem management.ssl.keyfile = /path/to/server_key.pem ## This key must only be used if private key is password protected # management.ssl.password = bunnies ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting RabbitMQ Instance in Kubernetes DESCRIPTION: Commands to delete a RabbitMQ cluster instance using either the instance name or YAML configuration file. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-operator/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_40 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl delete rabbitmqcluster INSTANCE ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl delete -f INSTANCE.yaml ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting a Member from a Quorum Queue in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: CLI command to remove a member (replica) from a specified quorum queue in a given virtual host. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/quorum-queues/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-queues delete_member [-p ] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing RPC Server with RabbitMQ in PHP DESCRIPTION: This code sets up an RPC server using RabbitMQ in PHP. It declares a queue, defines a callback function to process requests, and continuously listens for incoming messages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-six-php.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: php CODE: ``` channel(); $channel->queue_declare('rpc_queue', false, false, false, false); function fib($n) { if ($n == 0) { return 0; } if ($n == 1) { return 1; } return fib($n-1) + fib($n-2); } echo " [x] Awaiting RPC requests\n"; $callback = function ($req) { $n = intval($req->getBody()); echo ' [.] fib(', $n, ")\n"; $msg = new AMQPMessage( (string) fib($n), array('correlation_id' => $req->get('correlation_id')) ); $req->getChannel()->basic_publish( $msg, '', $req->get('reply_to') ); $req->ack(); }; $channel->basic_qos(null, 1, false); $channel->basic_consume('rpc_queue', '', false, false, false, false, $callback); try { $channel->consume(); } catch (\Throwable $exception) { echo $exception->getMessage(); } $channel->close(); $connection->close(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Single Active Consumer on Queues in RabbitMQ with Java DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to enable the Single Active Consumer feature when declaring a queue in RabbitMQ using the Java client. The x-single-active-consumer argument is set to true in the queue declaration arguments. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/consumers.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` Channel ch = ...; Map arguments = new HashMap(); arguments.put("x-single-active-consumer", true); ch.queueDeclare("my-queue", false, false, false, arguments); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Minimal OAuth 2.0 Configuration DESCRIPTION: Essential configuration settings for OAuth 2.0 authentication including resource server ID and issuer URL SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_oauth2.resource_server_id = new_resource_server_id auth_oauth2.issuer = https://my-oauth2-provider.com/realm/rabbitmq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Closing a Consumer Gracefully with RabbitMQ in Java DESCRIPTION: Shows how to properly close a consumer in Java by pausing message delivery, ensuring all messages are settled, and then closing the consumer to avoid duplicate message processing. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/amqp-client-libraries.md#2025-04-09_snippet_30 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` // pause the delivery of messages consumer.pause(); // ensure the number of unsettled messages reaches 0 long unsettledMessageCount = consumer.unsettledMessageCount(); // close the consumer consumer.close(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying ssl Property in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: A boolean property indicating whether the RabbitMQ connection is secured with SSL. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_83 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ssl ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Prefetch Count for Flow Control in Erlang DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to set the prefetch buffer size for a channel to implement flow control. This limits how many unacknowledged messages the server will deliver to consumers on a channel. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/erlang-client-user-guide.md#2025-04-09_snippet_24 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` amqp_channel:call(Channel, #'basic.qos'{prefetch_count = Prefetch}) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Temporary Queue in Ruby with Bunny DESCRIPTION: Creates a non-durable, exclusive queue with a server-generated name. The queue will be automatically deleted when the connection closes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-ruby.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` queue = channel.queue('', exclusive: true) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring HTTP Auth in Erlang Terms DESCRIPTION: Erlang configuration to enable HTTP Basic Authentication for Web STOMP. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/web-stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [ {rabbitmq_web_stomp, [{use_http_auth, true}]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using RabbitMQ CLI Tools for Server Diagnostics DESCRIPTION: A set of diagnostic commands using RabbitMQ CLI tools to check node status, connectivity, cluster status, and effective configuration. These commands require administrator privileges. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-rpm.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # checks if the local node is running and CLI tools can successfully authenticate with it sudo rabbitmq-diagnostics ping # prints enabled components (applications), TCP listeners, memory usage breakdown, alarms # and so on sudo rabbitmq-diagnostics status # prints cluster membership information sudo rabbitmq-diagnostics cluster_status # prints effective node configuration sudo rabbitmq-diagnostics environment ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running RabbitMQ Stream Consumer with Offset Tracking DESCRIPTION: Shell command to compile and execute the OffsetTrackingReceive Java class, which demonstrates the offset tracking functionality in RabbitMQ Streams. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-java-stream.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` ./mvnw -q compile exec:java '-Dexec.mainClass=OffsetTrackingReceive' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring HashiCorp Vault for RabbitMQ Admin Credentials DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration snippet to configure a RabbitMQ cluster to read admin credentials from HashiCorp Vault instead of generating them in Kubernetes secrets. This supports credential rotation without RabbitMQ restarts. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-operator/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_35 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` spec: secretBackend: vault: role: rabbitmq # Optionally, set Vault annotations as listed in # https://www.vaultproject.io/docs/platform/k8s/injector/annotations annotations: vault.hashicorp.com/template-static-secret-render-interval: "15s" defaultUserPath: secret/data/rabbitmq/config ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TLS Cipher Suites in RabbitMQ (Classic Config Format) DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to configure TLS cipher suites and other SSL options in RabbitMQ using the classic configuration format. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_34 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` %% list allowed ciphers [ {ssl, [{versions, ['tlsv1.2', 'tlsv1.1']}]}, {rabbit, [ {ssl_listeners, [5671]}, {ssl_options, [{cacertfile,"/path/to/ca_certificate.pem"}, {certfile, "/path/to/server_certificate.pem"}, {keyfile, "/path/to/server_key.pem"}, {versions, ['tlsv1.2', 'tlsv1.1']}, %% This list is just an example! %% Not all cipher suites are available on all machines. %% Cipher suite order is important: preferred suites %% should be listed first. %% Different suites have different security and CPU load characteristics. {ciphers, [ "ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384", "ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384", "ECDH-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384", "ECDH-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384", "DHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384", "DHE-DSS-AES256-GCM-SHA384", "ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256", "ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256", "ECDH-ECDSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256", "ECDH-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256", "DHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256", "DHE-DSS-AES128-GCM-SHA256" ]} ]} ]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Global Parameter in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Sets a global runtime parameter 'mqtt_default_vhosts' with a JSON value. Global parameters are not tied to a specific virtual host. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_50 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_global_parameter mqtt_default_vhosts '{"O=client,CN=guest":"/"}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Requeueing Messages with Custom Annotations in AMQP 1.0 DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to requeue a message with custom annotations using the RabbitMQ AMQP 1.0 Java Client. The code shows setting specific message annotations like requeue reason, time, and consumer identity before requeueing the message at the head of a quorum queue. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2024-10-11-modified-outcome/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` Consumer consumer = connection.consumerBuilder() .queue(ordersQueue) .messageHandler((context, message) -> { Map annotations = new HashMap<>(); annotations.put("x-opt-requeue-reason", "external_service_unavailable"); annotations.put("x-opt-requeue-time", System.currentTimeMillis()); annotations.put("x-opt-requeued-by", "consumer_1"); context.requeue(annotations); }).build(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Handling Initial Connection Failures in RabbitMQ Client DESCRIPTION: Shows how to handle initial connection failures to RabbitMQ, which aren't automatically recovered. This example implements basic retry logic with a sleep interval between attempts. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/java-api-guide.md#2025-04-09_snippet_37 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` ConnectionFactory factory = new ConnectionFactory(); // configure various connection settings try { Connection conn = factory.newConnection(); } catch (java.net.ConnectException e) { Thread.sleep(5000); // apply retry logic } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Publishing Persistent Messages to RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Code to mark messages as persistent so they survive RabbitMQ restarts by setting DeliveryMode to amqp.Persistent. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-go.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: go CODE: ``` err = ch.PublishWithContext(ctx, "", // exchange q.Name, // routing key false, // mandatory false, amqp.Publishing { DeliveryMode: amqp.Persistent, ContentType: "text/plain", Body: []byte(body), }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring OAuth2 Credentials Provider in RabbitMQ Java DESCRIPTION: Sets up OAuth2 authentication using client credentials grant flow with example configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/java-api-guide.md#2025-04-09_snippet_48 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` import com.rabbitmq.client.impl.OAuth2ClientCredentialsGrantCredentialsProvider. OAuth2ClientCredentialsGrantCredentialsProviderBuilder; ... CredentialsProvider credentialsProvider = new OAuth2ClientCredentialsGrantCredentialsProviderBuilder() .tokenEndpointUri("http://localhost:8080/uaa/oauth/token/") .clientId("rabbit_client").clientSecret("rabbit_secret") .grantType("password") .parameter("username", "rabbit_super") .parameter("password", "rabbit_super") .build(); connectionFactory.setCredentialsProvider(credentialsProvider); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Filtering Queues by Virtual Host DESCRIPTION: API endpoint example demonstrating queue filtering for a specific virtual host with pagination parameters and name filtering. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_41 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` http://localhost:15672/api/queues/my-vhost?page=1&page_size=100&name=&use_regex=false&pagination=true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Queue Binding in RabbitMQ with Python DESCRIPTION: Example of creating a basic binding between a queue and an exchange without a routing key. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-python.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` channel.queue_bind(exchange=exchange_name, queue=queue_name) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring OAuth 2.0 Signing Keys in RabbitMQ (INI) DESCRIPTION: Example of statically configuring OAuth 2.0 signing keys in RabbitMQ using a PEM file. This is typically used in edge cases where automatic key download is not possible. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_oauth2.resource_server_id = my_rabbit_server auth_oauth2.signing_keys.a-key-ID = /path-to-signing-key-pem-file ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Discovering Peers in RabbitMQ Cluster (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Runs a peer discovery on the target node and prints the discovered nodes. This command is useful for verifying cluster formation and node discovery in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics discover_peers --timeout 60 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: TLS Versions Check DESCRIPTION: Command to list supported TLS versions on the target node SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics tls_versions -q ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ Peer Discovery Backend (INI) DESCRIPTION: Configuration examples showing how to specify the peer discovery mechanism using either the shortened name or full module name. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = classic_config # The backend can also be specified using its module name. Note that # module names do not necessarily match plugin names exactly. # cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = rabbit_peer_discovery_classic_config ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.registration.enabled = false ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Management Plugin Port in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Sets the TCP port for the RabbitMQ management plugin HTTP API. The default port is 15672. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_20 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.tcp.port = 15672 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using RabbitMQ CLI Tools for Server Diagnostics DESCRIPTION: A set of diagnostic commands using RabbitMQ CLI tools to check node status, connectivity, cluster status, and effective configuration. These commands require administrator privileges. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-rpm.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # checks if the local node is running and CLI tools can successfully authenticate with it sudo rabbitmq-diagnostics ping # prints enabled components (applications), TCP listeners, memory usage breakdown, alarms # and so on sudo rabbitmq-diagnostics status # prints cluster membership information sudo rabbitmq-diagnostics cluster_status # prints effective node configuration sudo rabbitmq-diagnostics environment ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Publishing Persistent Messages to RabbitMQ in Swift DESCRIPTION: This code shows how to publish a message with the persistent flag set to true, which tells RabbitMQ to save the message to disk, providing better durability guarantees in case of server restarts. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-swift.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: swift CODE: ``` ch.defaultExchange().publish(msgData, routingKey: q.name, persistent: true) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Independent Prefetch Limits for Multiple Consumers in Java DESCRIPTION: This code shows how to set up two consumers on the same channel, each with an independent prefetch limit of 10 unacknowledged messages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/consumer-prefetch.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` Channel channel = ...; Consumer consumer1 = ...; Consumer consumer2 = ...; channel.basicQos(10); // Per consumer limit channel.basicConsume("my-queue1", false, consumer1); channel.basicConsume("my-queue2", false, consumer2); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Establishing a Connection to RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Code to establish a connection to a RabbitMQ server running on localhost and create a channel for communication. This is the first step required for any RabbitMQ operation. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-python.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` #!/usr/bin/env python import pika connection = pika.BlockingConnection(pika.ConnectionParameters('localhost')) channel = connection.channel() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling RabbitMQ Web STOMP Plugin with rabbitmq-plugins DESCRIPTION: Command to enable the rabbitmq_web_stomp plugin using the rabbitmq-plugins tool. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/web-stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_web_stomp ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Single Active Consumer on Queues in RabbitMQ with Java DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to enable the Single Active Consumer feature when declaring a queue in RabbitMQ using the Java client. The x-single-active-consumer argument is set to true in the queue declaration arguments. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/consumers.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` Channel ch = ...; Map arguments = new HashMap(); arguments.put("x-single-active-consumer", true); ch.queueDeclare("my-queue", false, false, false, arguments); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling RabbitMQ Web STOMP Plugin with rabbitmq-plugins DESCRIPTION: Command to enable the rabbitmq_web_stomp plugin using the rabbitmq-plugins tool. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/web-stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_web_stomp ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Alarms on a Specific RabbitMQ Node DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to specify a target node when running the rabbitmq-diagnostics check_alarms command. This demonstrates using the -n option with a node name. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics -n rabbit@warp10 check_alarms ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Relative Memory Threshold in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Example of setting a relative memory threshold for RabbitMQ in the configuration file. This sets the threshold to 60% of available RAM. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/memory.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` vm_memory_high_watermark.relative = 0.6 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Super Stream Consumer with Single Active Consumer in Java DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create a consumer for a Super Stream with single active consumer enabled for coordinated consumption across partitions. Includes message handler setup and consumer naming. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2022-07-13-rabbitmq-3-11-feature-preview-super-streams/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` Consumer consumer = environment.consumerBuilder() .superStream("invoices") // set the super stream name .name("application-1") // set the consumer name (mandatory) .singleActiveConsumer() // enable single active consumer .messageHandler((context, message) -> { // message processing }) .build(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Publishing to a Named Exchange in Swift DESCRIPTION: Publishes a message to the 'logs' fanout exchange using the RabbitMQ Swift client. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-swift.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Swift CODE: ``` var x = ch.fanout("logs") x.publish(msg.data(using: .utf8)) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying RabbitMQ Schema Information DESCRIPTION: Command to list schema database table names and their active replicas. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_44 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl schema_info name active_replicas ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying RabbitMQ Schema Information DESCRIPTION: Command to list schema database table names and their active replicas. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_44 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl schema_info name active_replicas ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Passwordless User in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Bash commands to create a passwordless user using rabbitmqctl. This involves creating a user with a temporary password and then clearing it. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/passwords.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl add_user passwordless-user "pa$$wordless" rabbitmqctl clear_password passwordless-user ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Stopping All OAuth 2.0 Test Applications DESCRIPTION: This command stops all running OAuth 2.0 test applications for RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make stop-all-apps ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying RabbitMQ Schema Information DESCRIPTION: Command to list schema database table names and their active replicas. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_44 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl schema_info name active_replicas ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Permissions in RabbitMQ Virtual Host (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Displays all users who have been granted access to a specific virtual host and their associated permissions. This command is useful for auditing and managing access control within a RabbitMQ cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_permissions -p my-vhost ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: JavaScript MQTT WebSocket Client Initialization DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code that initializes the Paho MQTT client and sets up event handlers for connection loss and message reception. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/web-mqtt.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Shutting Down RabbitMQ Node DESCRIPTION: Command to shut down both RabbitMQ and its runtime on the local node. Returns after runtime process exits and provides non-zero exit code if shutdown fails. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl shutdown ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Exporting Definitions Using rabbitmqadmin CLI DESCRIPTION: Command to export RabbitMQ definitions to a JSON file using rabbitmqadmin, which requires the management plugin to be enabled. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/definitions.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Requires management plugin to be enabled rabbitmqadmin export /path/to/definitions.file.json ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TLS Certificate Authentication for MQTT in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Sets up TLS certificate-based authentication for MQTT connections, including options for extracting the username from the certificate. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/mqtt.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` mqtt.ssl_cert_login = true ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` ssl_cert_login_from = common_name ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting User Permissions in RabbitMQ API DESCRIPTION: JSON payload for granting permissions to a user in a specific virtual host. The payload includes configure, write, and read permissions using regular expression patterns. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` {"configure":".*","write":".*","read":".*"} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Docker Container Limits for RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for setting default ulimits in Docker containers. This configuration should be added to the Docker daemon configuration file at /etc/docker/daemon.json to set the maximum number of open file handles to 64000. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_60 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "default-ulimits": { "nofile": { "Name": "nofile", "Hard": 64000, "Soft": 64000 } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: TLS Configuration Settings DESCRIPTION: INI configuration for enabling TLS (WSS) with essential SSL parameters SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/web-mqtt.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` web_mqtt.ssl.port = 15676 web_mqtt.ssl.backlog = 1024 web_mqtt.ssl.cacertfile = /path/to/ca_certificate.pem web_mqtt.ssl.certfile = /path/to/server_certificate.pem web_mqtt.ssl.keyfile = /path/to/server_key.pem # needed when private key has a passphrase # web_mqtt.ssl.password = changeme ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Default Consumer Prefetch in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This Erlang configuration sets a default prefetch count of 250 for all consumers that don't explicitly specify one. This is set in the advanced.config file. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/consumer-prefetch.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` %% advanced.config file [ {rabbit, [ {default_consumer_prefetch, {false,250}} ] } ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Locating RabbitMQ plugin directories DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the rabbitmq-plugins directories command to locate the plugin archives directory, plugin expansion directory, and enabled plugins file path. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/plugins.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins directories -s # => Plugin archives directory: /path/to/rabbitmq/plugins # => Plugin expansion directory: /path/to/node/node-plugins-expand # => Enabled plugins file: /path/to/enabled_plugins ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ SSL Acceptors Configuration DESCRIPTION: Number of Erlang processes that accept TLS connections SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` num_acceptors.ssl = 10 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Stopping RabbitMQ Application DESCRIPTION: Stops the RabbitMQ application while keeping the Erlang VM running. Typically used before performing management actions that require the application to be stopped. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl stop_app ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Authentication Mechanisms in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration for specifying which authentication mechanisms are offered to connecting clients. This example shows the default configuration with PLAIN, AMQPLAIN, and ANONYMOUS mechanisms enabled. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_mechanisms.1 = PLAIN auth_mechanisms.2 = AMQPLAIN auth_mechanisms.3 = ANONYMOUS ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring System Limits for RabbitMQ with systemd DESCRIPTION: Sets the maximum number of open file handles for the RabbitMQ service using systemd configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` [Service] LimitNOFILE=64000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Exporting Definitions Using HTTP API DESCRIPTION: Command to export RabbitMQ definitions using the HTTP API directly, which requires the management plugin to be enabled. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/definitions.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Requires management plugin to be enabled, # placeholders are used for credentials and hostname. # Use HTTPS when possible. curl -u {username}:{password} -X GET http://{hostname}:15672/api/definitions ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ TLS Listener Configuration Output DESCRIPTION: Example output showing RabbitMQ listener configuration including TLS-enabled ports for various protocols. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/troubleshooting-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` Interface: [::], port: 25672, protocol: clustering, purpose: inter-node and CLI tool communication Interface: [::], port: 5672, protocol: amqp, purpose: AMQP 0-9-1 and AMQP 1.0 Interface: [::], port: 5671, protocol: amqp/ssl, purpose: AMQP 0-9-1 and AMQP 1.0 over TLS Interface: [::], port: 15672, protocol: http, purpose: HTTP API Interface: [::], port: 15671, protocol: https, purpose: HTTP API over TLS (HTTPS) Interface: [::], port: 1883, protocol: mqtt, purpose: MQTT ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Stream Consumer Groups in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This command lists groups of stream single active consumers for a vhost. It allows specifying which group information items to include in the results, such as stream, reference, partition_index, and number of consumers. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmq-streams.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-streams list_stream_consumer_groups stream reference consumers ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling OAuth 2.0 Authentication for RabbitMQ Management UI (INI) DESCRIPTION: Configuration to enable OAuth 2.0 authentication in the RabbitMQ management UI. It sets the OAuth client ID and scopes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.oauth_enabled = true management.oauth_client_id = rabbit_user_client management.oauth_scopes = ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Consuming Messages from RabbitMQ Queue Using Java QueueingConsumer DESCRIPTION: This code shows how to consume messages from a RabbitMQ queue using the QueueingConsumer class. It sets up a consumer that acknowledges messages automatically (auto-ack) and processes them sequentially. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2011-02-10-introducing-publisher-confirms/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` QueueingConsumer qc = new QueueingConsumer(ch); ch.basicConsume(QUEUE_NAME, true, qc); for (int i = 0; i < MSG_COUNT; ++i) { qc.nextDelivery(); System.out.printf("Consumed %d\n", i); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Cloning the RabbitMQ Java Client Repository DESCRIPTION: Bash command for cloning the RabbitMQ Java client source code repository from GitHub using git. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/java-client.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` git clone https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-java-client.git ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating an Exchange of a Non-built-in Type in Go DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create an exchange of a non-built-in type (x-delayed-message) with custom arguments using the Go client library's management API. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/amqp-client-libraries.md#2025-04-09_snippet_51 LANGUAGE: go CODE: ``` _, err := management.DeclareExchange(context.TODO(), &CustomExchangeSpecification{ Name: "myExchange", ExchangeTypeName: "x-delayed-message", Arguments: map[string]any{ "x-delayed-type": "direct", }, }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Multiple RabbitMQ Plugins DESCRIPTION: Command to enable the 'shovel' and 'management' plugins along with all their dependencies. This demonstrates how to activate multiple plugins in a single command. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmq-plugins.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_shovel rabbitmq_management ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Up Federation Policy for All Queues in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to create a policy that applies federation to all queues in the 'green' cluster, using the previously defined 'blue' upstream. This ensures messages published to the blue cluster can be consumed from the green cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/blue-green-upgrade.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy --apply-to queues blue-green-migration ".*" \ '{"federation-upstream":"blue"}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Publishing by Setting Memory Watermark to Zero in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to effectively block all publishing in a RabbitMQ cluster by setting the memory high watermark to 0, which triggers a resource alarm immediately. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/publishers/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_vm_memory_high_watermark 0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Managing Vhost-Scoped Parameters in RabbitMQ (PowerShell) DESCRIPTION: Commands for setting, clearing, and listing vhost-scoped parameters using rabbitmqctl in a PowerShell environment. These parameters are specific to a virtual host and include a component name, name, and value. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/parameters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` # sets a runtime parameter in a virtual host rabbitmqctl.bat set_parameter [-p vhost] # clears (unsets) a runtime parameter in a virtual host rabbitmqctl.bat clear_parameter [-p vhost] # lists runtime parameters in a virtual host rabbitmqctl.bat list_parameters [-p vhost] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling RabbitMQ Feature Flags DESCRIPTION: Command to enable all feature flags on a running RabbitMQ node, which is important for feature access and future compatibility. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/install-homebrew.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` /opt/homebrew/sbin/rabbitmqctl enable_feature_flag all ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Including MQTT WebSocket Client Library DESCRIPTION: HTML script tag to include the Paho MQTT client library SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/web-mqtt.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Channel Limit in RabbitMQ .NET Client DESCRIPTION: Shows how to set the channel limit to 32 using the ConnectionFactory in the RabbitMQ .NET client. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/channels/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` var cf = new ConnectionFactory(); // Ask for up to 32 channels per connection. Will have an effect as long as the server is configured // to use a higher limit, otherwise the server's limit will be used. cf.RequestedChannelMax = 32; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Extra Parameters for OAuth 2.0 Endpoints in RabbitMQ (INI) DESCRIPTION: Example configuration to add extra parameters to the OAuth 2.0 authorization and token endpoints in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.oauth_authorization_endpoint_params.audience = some-audience-id management.oauth_token_endpoint_params.audience = some-audience-id ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Third-Party Authentication Backend in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to configure a third-party authentication backend plugin in RabbitMQ using the full module name. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # note that the module name begins with a "rabbit_", not "rabbitmq_", like plugin # names usually do auth_backends.1 = rabbit_auth_backend_ip_range ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Disk Free Limit in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: The set_disk_free_limit command configures the minimum free disk space threshold. When free disk space falls below this limit, a disk alarm is triggered. The limit can be specified as an absolute value with memory unit symbol (e.g., 512M or 1G) or as a fraction relative to total RAM. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_66 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` set_disk_free_limit disk_limit ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` set_disk_free_limit mem_relative fraction ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Listener Configuration Sample DESCRIPTION: Example output showing RabbitMQ listener configuration including TLS-enabled ports for various protocols SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/troubleshooting-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` Interface: [::], port: 25672, protocol: clustering, purpose: inter-node and CLI tool communication Interface: [::], port: 5672, protocol: amqp, purpose: AMQP 0-9-1 and AMQP 1.0 Interface: [::], port: 5671, protocol: amqp/ssl, purpose: AMQP 0-9-1 and AMQP 1.0 over TLS Interface: [::], port: 15672, protocol: http, purpose: HTTP API Interface: [::], port: 15671, protocol: https, purpose: HTTP API over TLS (HTTPS) Interface: [::], port: 1883, protocol: mqtt, purpose: MQTT ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Erlang Packages for RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Installs the recommended Erlang packages for RabbitMQ. This command installs specific Erlang components required for RabbitMQ operation, avoiding the use of metapackages which do not pin dependency versions. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_28 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # This is recommended. Metapackages such as erlang and erlang-nox must only be used # with apt version pinning. They do not pin their dependency versions. sudo apt-get install -y erlang-base \ erlang-asn1 erlang-crypto erlang-eldap erlang-ftp erlang-inets \ erlang-mnesia erlang-os-mon erlang-parsetools erlang-public-key \ erlang-runtime-tools erlang-snmp erlang-ssl \ erlang-syntax-tools erlang-tftp erlang-tools erlang-xmerl ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Exporting Definitions using HTTP API DESCRIPTION: Command to export RabbitMQ definitions directly using the HTTP API. This requires the management plugin to be enabled and proper authentication credentials. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/definitions.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Requires management plugin to be enabled, # placeholders are used for credentials and hostname. # Use HTTPS when possible. curl -u {username}:{password} -X GET http://{hostname}:15672/api/definitions ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Tutorial Components in JSX DESCRIPTION: React/JSX import statements for tutorial-related components including diagrams and help text for the RabbitMQ Publish/Subscribe pattern documentation. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-go.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` import TutorialsHelp from '@site/src/components/Tutorials/TutorialsHelp.md'; import T3DiagramExchange from '@site/src/components/Tutorials/T3DiagramExchange.md'; import T3DiagramBinding from '@site/src/components/Tutorials/T3DiagramBinding.md'; import T3DiagramFull from '@site/src/components/Tutorials/T3DiagramFull.md'; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring HTTP Options for RabbitMQ Web STOMP DESCRIPTION: Configuration options for fine-tuning the HTTP server behavior of the Web STOMP plugin, including timeouts and request limits. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/web-stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # connection inactivity timeout web_stomp.cowboy_opts.idle_timeout = 60000 # max number of pending requests allowed on a connection web_stomp.cowboy_opts.max_keepalive = 200 # max number of headers in a request web_stomp.cowboy_opts.max_headers = 100 # max number of empty lines before request body web_stomp.cowboy_opts.max_empty_lines = 5 # max request line length allowed in requests web_stomp.cowboy_opts.max_request_line_length ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Inspecting etcd Keys for RabbitMQ Peer Discovery DESCRIPTION: This bash command demonstrates how to list all keys used by the etcd-based peer discovery mechanism for RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_42 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` etcdctl get --prefix=true "/rabbitmq" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Changing a User's Password in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to update the password for an existing RabbitMQ user. This only works for users in the internal RabbitMQ database, not for users from external authentication sources like LDAP. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl change_password janeway newpass ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complete Log Receiver Implementation DESCRIPTION: Full implementation of a log message consumer that receives and processes messages from the 'logs' exchange. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-php.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: php CODE: ``` channel(); $channel->exchange_declare('logs', 'fanout', false, false, false); list($queue_name, ,) = $channel->queue_declare("", false, false, true, false); $channel->queue_bind($queue_name, 'logs'); echo " [*] Waiting for logs. To exit press CTRL+C\n"; $callback = function ($msg) { echo ' [x] ', $msg->getBody(), "\n"; }; $channel->basic_consume($queue_name, '', false, true, false, false, $callback); try { $channel->consume(); } catch (\Throwable $exception) { echo $exception->getMessage(); } $channel->close(); $connection->close(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Management Plugin DB Cache Multiplier in RabbitMQ (INI) DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to configure the database cache multiplier for the RabbitMQ management plugin. The default value is set to 5. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_38 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.db_cache_multiplier = 5 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring STOMP TLS Support DESCRIPTION: INI configuration for enabling TLS support for STOMP connections, including certificate paths and verification options. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` ssl_options.cacertfile = /path/to/tls/ca_certificate.pem ssl_options.certfile = /path/to/tls/server_certificate.pem ssl_options.keyfile = /path/to/tls/server_key.pem ssl_options.verify = verify_peer ssl_options.fail_if_no_peer_cert = true stomp.listeners.tcp.1 = 61613 # default TLS-enabled port for STOMP connections stomp.listeners.ssl.1 = 61614 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Java Stream Client with Load Balancer DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to configure the RabbitMQ stream Java client to always use a load balancer as the entry point, regardless of the metadata returned by the server. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2021-07-23-connecting-to-streams/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` Address entryPoint = new Address("my-load-balancer", 5552); Environment environment = Environment.builder() .host(entryPoint.host()) .port(entryPoint.port()) .addressResolver(address -> entryPoint) .build(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Advanced Configuration for RabbitMQ Cluster Formation with etcd DESCRIPTION: Advanced configuration using the advanced.config file for RabbitMQ cluster formation with etcd. This snippet shows how to encrypt the password and configure various etcd-related settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_40 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` %% advanced.config file [ {rabbit, [{cluster_formation, [{peer_discovery_etcd, [ {endpoints, [ "one.etcd.eng.example.local:2379", "two.etcd.eng.example.local:2479", "three.etcd.eng.example.local:2579" ]}, {etcd_prefix, "rabbitmq"}, {cluster_name, "default"}, {etcd_username, "etcd user"}, {etcd_password, {encrypted, <<"cPAymwqmMnbPXXRVqVzpxJdrS8mHEKuo2V+3vt1u/fymexD9oztQ2G/oJ4PAaSb2c5N/hRJ2aqP/X0VAfx8xOQ==">>} }] }] }] }, {config_entry_decoder, [ {passphrase, <<"decryption key passphrase">>} ]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Channel and Declaring a Queue in Objective-C DESCRIPTION: Creates a channel and declares a queue for sending messages in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-objectivec.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Objective-C CODE: ``` id ch = [conn createChannel]; RMQQueue *q = [ch queue:@"hello"]; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding a Member to a Quorum Queue in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: CLI command to add a new member (replica) to a specified quorum queue in a given virtual host. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/quorum-queues/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-queues add_member [-p ] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Cluster Status in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to verify cluster status after a node upgrade. This helps ensure the node has successfully rejoined the cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/rolling-upgrade.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl cluster_status ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Specifying Requeue Parameter in Markdown DESCRIPTION: These snippets show how to reference the requeue parameter for the basic.reject method in markdown. They are used to explain the different behaviors of the method based on this parameter. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2010-08-03-well-ill-let-you-go-basicreject-in-rabbitmq/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` `requeue=false` ``` LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` `requeue=true` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Directory Structure Configuration DESCRIPTION: Default path configurations for RabbitMQ installation, including locations for configuration files, logs, plugins, and data storage. All paths are relative to $RABBITMQ_HOME, which represents the root directory created when extracting the binary archive. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/relocate.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` $RABBITMQ_HOME/etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq $RABBITMQ_HOME/var/lib/rabbitmq/mnesia $RABBITMQ_MNESIA_BASE/$RABBITMQ_NODENAME $RABBITMQ_HOME/var/log/rabbitmq $RABBITMQ_LOG_BASE/$RABBITMQ_NODENAME.log $RABBITMQ_HOME/plugins $RABBITMQ_MNESIA_BASE/$RABBITMQ_NODENAME-plugins-expand $RABBITMQ_MNESIA_DIR.pid ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ Statistics Collection Interval DESCRIPTION: This configuration snippet sets the interval for collecting statistics to 30 seconds, which can help reduce CPU and memory usage in systems with many connections, channels, and queues. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_47 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # sets the interval to 30 seconds collect_statistics_interval = 30000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Increasing Erlang Process Limit via Environment Variable DESCRIPTION: Setting a higher limit (2 million) for the maximum number of Erlang processes using the environment variable approach for high-connection environments. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/runtime.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` RABBITMQ_MAX_NUMBER_OF_PROCESSES=2000000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Combined Federation and TTL Policy in RabbitMQ via HTTP API DESCRIPTION: Uses the RabbitMQ HTTP API to set a policy named 'ttl-fed' in the root virtual host that applies to queues with names starting with 'tf.' and configures both federation upstreams and a 60-second message TTL with priority 1. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/parameters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` PUT /api/policies/%2f/ttl-fed {"pattern": "^tf\.", "definition": {"federation-upstream-set":"all", "message-ttl":60000}, "priority": 1, "apply-to": "queues"} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Closing Multiple Connections in RabbitMQ with Limit DESCRIPTION: Command to close a limited number of connections on a specific vhost in RabbitMQ. This example closes 10 connections on the 'qa_env' vhost with an explanation message. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_77 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl close_all_connections -p qa_env --limit 10 'Please close' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Growing Quorum Queue Replicas in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: CLI command to grow quorum queue replicas on a specific node, with options to target all or even queues and filter by vhost or queue patterns. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/quorum-queues/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-queues grow [--vhost-pattern ] [--queue-pattern ] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring APT Repository for RabbitMQ on Debian Bookworm DESCRIPTION: This bash script configures the APT repository for installing RabbitMQ and Erlang on Debian Bookworm. It adds the necessary repository sources for both RabbitMQ server and Erlang packages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/rabbitmq.list < # clears (unsets) a global (virtual-host-independent) runtime parameter rabbitmqctl.bat clear_global_parameter # lists global (virtual-host-independent) runtime parameters rabbitmqctl.bat list_global_parameters ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining a Basic RabbitmqCluster Resource in YAML DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet defines a basic RabbitmqCluster resource named 'definition' using the rabbitmq.com/v1beta1 API version. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-operator/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiVersion: rabbitmq.com/v1beta1 kind: RabbitmqCluster metadata: name: definition ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Lock Timeout for RabbitMQ etcd Peer Discovery DESCRIPTION: Configuration for setting the lock acquisition timeout in RabbitMQ's etcd-based peer discovery. This determines how long a node will wait to acquire a lock during cluster formation. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_43 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = etcd cluster_formation.etcd.endpoints.1 = one.etcd.eng.example.local:2379 cluster_formation.etcd.endpoints.2 = two.etcd.eng.example.local:2479 # lock acquisition timeout in seconds # default: 300 # cluster_formation.consul.lock_wait_time is an alias cluster_formation.etcd.lock_timeout = 60 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Federation Plugin in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Commands to enable the RabbitMQ federation plugin and its management UI extension using rabbitmq-plugins. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/federation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_federation ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_federation_management ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting CLI Observer Interface for RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Launches a CLI observer interface on the target RabbitMQ node with a specified refresh interval in seconds. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_24 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics observer --interval 10 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring a Dynamic Shovel Using RabbitMQ CLI on Windows DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to declare a dynamic shovel using the rabbitmqctl.bat command on Windows.
