SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/amqp-client-libraries.md#2025-04-09_snippet_34 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` class MyMessageHandler(AMQPMessagingHandler): def __init__(self): super().__init__() def on_message(self, event: Event): # accepting self.delivery_context.accept(event) # deal with the message stream_address = AddressHelper.queue_address("some-stream") consumer = consumer_connection.consumer( stream_address, message_handler=MyMessageHandler(), # can be first, last, next or an offset long # you can also specify stream filters with methods: apply_filters and filter_match_unfiltered stream_filter_options=StreamOptions(offset_specification=OffsetSpecification.first), ) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Component Flow Visualization in Mermaid DESCRIPTION: A mermaid flowchart showing message flow in RabbitMQ from Producer (P) through Exchange (X) to two Queues (Q₁,Q₂) and their Consumers (C₁,C₂). Uses custom CSS classes to style different component types. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/src/components/Tutorials/T3DiagramToC.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: mermaid CODE: ``` flowchart LR P((P)) X{{X}} Q1[[Q₁]] Q2[[Q₂]] C1((C₁)) C2((C₂)) P --> X --> Q1 & Q2 Q1 --> C1 Q2 --> C2 class P mermaid-producer class X mermaid-exchange class Q1 mermaid-queue class Q2 mermaid-queue class C1 mermaid-consumer class C2 mermaid-consumer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Definition Import from Local File on Node Boot DESCRIPTION: Configuration settings to import definitions from a local JSON file when a RabbitMQ node starts, not requiring the management plugin. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/definitions.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # Does not require management plugin to be enabled. definitions.import_backend = local_filesystem definitions.local.path = /path/to/definitions/defs.json ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Stream Consumer Groups in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: This command lists groups of stream single active consumers for a vhost in RabbitMQ. It allows specifying which group information items to include in the results, such as stream, reference, partition_index, and consumers. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmq-streams.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-streams list_stream_consumer_groups stream reference consumers ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Erlang Port Usage with epmd DESCRIPTION: Command to verify which ports are being used for Erlang inter-node and CLI tool communication after configuring a custom distribution port. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/windows-configuration.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` epmd -names ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Closing a Channel in C# DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to close a channel (called 'model' in the .NET client) when it's no longer needed using the RabbitMQ .NET client. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/channels/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` // the .NET client calls channels "models" var ch = conn.CreateModel(); // do some work // close the channel when it is no longer needed ch.Close(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deactivating Console Logging DESCRIPTION: Disables logging to console. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.console = false ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Filtering Exchanges with Regex in RabbitMQ API (HTTP) DESCRIPTION: This HTTP GET request fetches the first page of exchanges, filtered by a regular expression. It demonstrates the use of 'name' parameter with 'use_regex=true' to filter exchanges whose names start with 'amq'. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_31 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` http://localhost:15672/api/exchanges?page=1&page_size=100&name=%5Eamq&use_regex=true&pagination=true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting a Federation Policy in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to set a policy named 'federate-me' that applies to exchanges with names starting with 'federated.'. The policy sets the federation-upstream-set to 'all' with a priority of 1. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/parameters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy federate-me \ "^federated\." '{"federation-upstream-set":"all"}' \ --priority 1 \ --apply-to exchanges ``` LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat set_policy federate-me ^ "^federated\." "{""federation-upstream-set"":""all""}" ^ --priority 1 ^ --apply-to exchanges ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` PUT /api/policies/%2f/federate-me {"pattern": "^federated\.", "definition": {"federation-upstream-set":"all"}, "priority": 1, "apply-to": "exchanges"} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Feature Flags with Shell Command DESCRIPTION: Command to list all feature flags and their current state in a RabbitMQ cluster using rabbitmqadmin CLI tool. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin feature_flags list ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing RPC Client in RabbitMQ Java DESCRIPTION: Creates an RPC client instance for request-reply pattern communication using a temporary reply queue. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/java-api-guide.md#2025-04-09_snippet_45 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` import com.rabbitmq.client.RpcClient; RpcClient rpc = new RpcClient(channel, exchangeName, routingKey); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Managing RabbitMQ Cluster Operations DESCRIPTION: Various commands for managing RabbitMQ clusters including viewing secrets, managing UI, debugging, and log viewing. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/kubectl-plugin.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl rabbitmq secrets INSTANCE ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl rabbitmq manage INSTANCE ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl rabbitmq debug INSTANCE ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl rabbitmq tail INSTANCE ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TCP Listeners in RabbitMQ (INI) DESCRIPTION: Default configuration for the TCP port on which RabbitMQ listens for 'plain' AMQP 0-9-1 and AMQP 1.0 connections without TLS. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` listeners.tcp.default = 5672 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Modifying Shell Script Shebang for Solaris Compatibility DESCRIPTION: Instructions for modifying the shell script interpreter line to use Solaris POSIX-compliant shell instead of the default shell. This change is required for proper script execution on Solaris systems. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-solaris.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` #!/usr/xpg4/bin/sh ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing RabbitMQ Global Parameters DESCRIPTION: Displays all global runtime parameters in RabbitMQ. The command uses the 'list_global_parameters' action without any additional arguments. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_48 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_global_parameters ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Definitions after Node Boot with CLI DESCRIPTION: Commands to import definitions after node startup by first waiting for the node to be ready and then importing the definitions. Useful for older RabbitMQ versions or scripted deployments. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/definitions.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # await startup for up to 5 minutes rabbitmqctl await_startup --timeout 300 # import definitions using rabbitmqctl rabbitmqctl import_definitions /path/to/definitions.file.json # OR, import using rabbitmqadmin # Requires management plugin to be enabled rabbitmqadmin import /path/to/definitions.file.json ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Definitions Using rabbitmqctl CLI DESCRIPTION: Command to import RabbitMQ definitions from a JSON file using rabbitmqctl, which doesn't require the management plugin to be enabled. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/definitions.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # Does not require management plugin to be enabled rabbitmqctl import_definitions /path/to/definitions.file.json ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Certificate to Windows System-Wide Trust Store DESCRIPTION: PowerShell command to add a certificate to the Windows system-wide (machine) Root certificate store. This makes the certificate available to all users on the machine. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` # Windows certmgr -add -all \path\to\cacert.cer -s -r localMachine Root ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Encrypting Configuration Values with RabbitMQ CLI (PowerShell) DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the rabbitmqctl encode command to encrypt configuration values on Windows using PowerShell. It includes examples for encoding both Erlang binary and string values. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_47 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl encode "<<""guest"">>" mypassphrase {encrypted,<<"... long encrypted value...">> rabbitmqctl encode '"amqp://fred:secret@host1.domain/my_vhost"' mypassphrase {encrypted,<<"... long encrypted value...">> ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Daily Log Rotation at Midnight DESCRIPTION: Configuration settings for daily log rotation at midnight with compression and retention of 5 archived files. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # rotate every night at midnight log.file.rotation.date = $D0 # keep up to 5 archived log files in addition to the current one log.file.rotation.count = 5 # archived log files will be compressed log.file.rotation.compress = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enforcing Cipher Suite Order (Classic Config Format) DESCRIPTION: This configuration snippet shows how to enforce server-preferred cipher suite ordering in the classic RabbitMQ configuration format using Erlang syntax. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_39 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` %% Enforce server-provided cipher suite order (preference) [ {ssl, [{versions, ['tlsv1.2', 'tlsv1.1']}]}, {rabbit, [ {ssl_listeners, [5671]}, {ssl_options, [{cacertfile, "/path/to/ca_certificate.pem"}, {certfile, "/path/to/server_certificate.pem"}, {keyfile, "/path/to/server_key.pem"}, {versions, ['tlsv1.2', 'tlsv1.1']}, %% ... {honor_cipher_order, true}, {honor_ecc_order, true}, ]} ]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring Queue with Message TTL in C# DESCRIPTION: This C# code snippet shows how to declare a queue with a 60-second message TTL using the x-message-ttl argument. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ttl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` var args = new Dictionary(); args.Add("x-message-ttl", 60000); model.QueueDeclare("myqueue", false, false, false, args); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring OAuth 2.0 Provider in RabbitMQ using Issuer URL DESCRIPTION: This configuration snippet shows how to set up an OAuth 2.0 provider in RabbitMQ using the issuer URL. It includes settings for resource server ID, scope prefix, and TLS certificate. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_oauth2.resource_server_id = rabbitmq-prod auth_oauth2.scope_prefix = rabbitmq. auth_oauth2.issuer = https://prodkeycloak:8080/realm/prod auth_oauth2.https.cacertfile = /opts/certs/prodcacert.pem ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Federation Upstream in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to set up a federation upstream parameter with URI and expiration settings using rabbitmqctl in Bash. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/federation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_parameter federation-upstream my-upstream \ '{"uri":"amqp://target.hostname","expires":3600000}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing a Fibonacci Function in Go DESCRIPTION: A recursive implementation of the Fibonacci sequence calculation in Go. This function takes an integer as input and returns the corresponding Fibonacci number. Note that this is an inefficient implementation for large numbers. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-six-go.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: go CODE: ``` func fib(n int) int { if n == 0 { return 0 } else if n == 1 { return 1 } else { return fib(n-1) + fib(n-2) } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Free Disk Space Monitoring Log Entry in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Example log entries showing the initialization of RabbitMQ's disk space monitoring system, displaying the configured free disk space limit of 950MB. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/disk-alarms.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` 2019-04-01 12:02:11.564 [info] <0.329.0> Enabling free disk space monitoring 2019-04-01 12:02:11.564 [info] <0.329.0> Disk free limit set to 950MB ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Consul Node Deregistration Configuration DESCRIPTION: Settings for automatic deregistration of failed nodes in Consul. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_31 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = consul cluster_formation.consul.host = consul.eng.example.local # health check interval (node TTL) in seconds cluster_formation.consul.svc_ttl = 30 # how soon should nodes that fail their health checks be unregistered by Consul? # this value is in seconds and must not be lower than 60 (a Consul requirement) cluster_formation.consul.deregister_after = 90 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Worker Consumer Implementation - PHP DESCRIPTION: Worker implementation that consumes messages from the queue and processes them. Simulates work by sleeping for one second per dot in the message. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-php.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: php CODE: ``` $callback = function ($msg) { echo ' [x] Received ', $msg->getBody(), "\n"; sleep(substr_count($msg->getBody(), '.')); echo " [x] Done\n"; }; $channel->basic_consume('hello', '', false, true, false, false, $callback); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Disk Free Limit Configuration DESCRIPTION: Disk space limit configuration for flow control triggering SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` disk_free_limit.absolute = 2GB ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` disk_free_limit.absolute = 50MB ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring OAuth 2.0 Provider in RabbitMQ using oauth_providers DESCRIPTION: This configuration demonstrates how to set up an OAuth 2.0 provider in RabbitMQ using the oauth_providers variable. It allows for more detailed provider configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_27 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_oauth2.resource_server_id = rabbitmq-prod auth_oauth2.scope_prefix = rabbitmq. auth_oauth2.default_oauth_provider = prodkeycloak auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.prodkeycloak.issuer = https://prodkeycloak:8080/realm/prod auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.prodkeycloak.https.cacertfile = /opts/certs/prodcacert.pem ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running RabbitMQ Benchmark for AMQP 1.0 and 0.9.1 DESCRIPTION: Instructions for running a benchmark to compare AMQP 1.0 and AMQP 0.9.1 performance in RabbitMQ. It includes steps to start the RabbitMQ server, execute a Go program, and list the number of messages in each queue after the benchmark. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2024-09-02-amqp-flow-control/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ./sbin/rabbitmqctl --silent list_queues name type messages --formatter=pretty_table ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Stopping RabbitMQ Node DESCRIPTION: Command to stop the Erlang node running RabbitMQ. Can optionally wait for a specified process to terminate if pid_file is provided. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl stop ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring UNIX Epoch Timestamp Format for Console Logging in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This configuration sets up console logging with 'info' level, disables file logging, and uses microseconds since UNIX epoch for timestamp format. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.console = true log.console.level = info log.file = false # use microseconds since UNIX epoch for timestamp format log.console.formatter.time_format = epoch_usecs ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Runtime Thread Statistics DESCRIPTION: Command to sample and report runtime thread activity statistics SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_24 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics runtime_thread_stats --sample-interval 15 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Binding List Command DESCRIPTION: Command to list the bindings in RabbitMQ, showing the exchange-to-queue bindings created by the tutorial application. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-spring-amqp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo rabbitmqctl list_bindings tut.fanout exchange 8b289c9c-a1eb-4a3a-b6a9-163c4fdcb6c2 queue [] tut.fanout exchange d7e7d193-65b1-4128-a532-466a5256fd31 queue [] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enforcing Server-Preferred Cipher Suite Order in RabbitMQ (New Config Format) DESCRIPTION: This configuration enforces the server's preferred cipher suite order during TLS negotiation, which is recommended for security. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_35 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` listeners.ssl.1 = 5671 ssl_options.cacertfile = /path/to/ca_certificate.pem ssl_options.certfile = /path/to/server_certificate.pem ssl_options.keyfile = /path/to/server_key.pem ssl_options.versions.1 = tlsv1.2 ssl_options.honor_cipher_order = true ssl_options.honor_ecc_order = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting User Connection Limit via HTTP API using curl DESCRIPTION: This curl command demonstrates how to set the maximum connections limit for a user using the RabbitMQ HTTP API. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/user-limits.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -v -u guest:guest -X PUT http://localhost:15672/api/user-limits/user1/max-connections \ -H "content-type: application/json" \ -d @- < accepting AMQP connection <0.1613.0> (127.0.0.1:63839 -> 127.0.0.1:5672) 2019-03-25 12:28:19.056 [error] <0.1613.0> Error on AMQP connection <0.1613.0> (127.0.0.1:63839 -> 127.0.0.1:5672, state: starting): PLAIN login refused: user 'user2' - invalid credentials 2019-03-25 12:28:22.057 [info] <0.1613.0> closing AMQP connection <0.1613.0> (127.0.0.1:63839 -> 127.0.0.1:5672) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Node TTL for etcd Peer Discovery DESCRIPTION: Configuration for setting the Time-To-Live (TTL) value for node registration keys in etcd. This determines how frequently nodes must refresh their presence in etcd. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_42 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = etcd cluster_formation.etcd.endpoints.1 = one.etcd.eng.example.local:2379 cluster_formation.etcd.endpoints.2 = two.etcd.eng.example.local:2479 cluster_formation.etcd.endpoints.3 = three.etcd.eng.example.local:2579 # node TTL in seconds # default: 30 cluster_formation.etcd.node_ttl = 40 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring network partition handling in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Setting to control how the node handles network partitions. Available modes include ignore, autoheal, pause_minority, and pause_if_all_down. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_43 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_partition_handling = ignore ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Named Federation Upstream Set in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Commands to create a named upstream set with multiple upstreams and apply it via policy. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/federation-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_parameter federation-upstream-set location-1 '[{"upstream": "up-1"}, {"upstream": "up-2"}]' rabbitmqctl set_policy federate-me '^federated\.' '{"federation-upstream-set":"location-1"}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Removing Queue Limits in RabbitMQ Virtual Host DESCRIPTION: Command to lift the queue limit on a specific virtual host by setting max-queues to a negative value. Uses rabbitmqctl with a JSON configuration parameter. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_vhost_limits -p vhost_name '{"max-queues": -1}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting Multiple RabbitMQ Nodes with Management Plugin in Bash DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to start two RabbitMQ nodes on the same machine with different management plugin ports to avoid conflicts. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/clustering.md#2025-04-09_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` RABBITMQ_NODE_PORT=5672 RABBITMQ_SERVER_START_ARGS="-rabbitmq_management listener [{port,15672}]" RABBITMQ_NODENAME=rabbit rabbitmq-server -detached RABBITMQ_NODE_PORT=5673 RABBITMQ_SERVER_START_ARGS="-rabbitmq_management listener [{port,15673}]" RABBITMQ_NODENAME=hare rabbitmq-server -detached ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Preferred Username Claims for OAuth 2.0 in RabbitMQ (INI) DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to configure preferred username claims for OAuth 2.0 in RabbitMQ using the INI format. It sets up a priority list of claims to use for the username. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # ... auth_oauth2.resource_server_id = rabbitmq auth_oauth2.preferred_username_claims.1 = user_name auth_oauth2.preferred_username_claims.2 = email # ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic HTTPS Configuration for RabbitMQ Management Plugin DESCRIPTION: Configuration for enabling HTTPS with SSL/TLS certificates and key files for the management plugin. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_27 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.ssl.port = 15671 management.ssl.cacertfile = /path/to/ca_certificate.pem management.ssl.certfile = /path/to/server_certificate.pem management.ssl.keyfile = /path/to/server_key.pem ## This key must only be used if private key is password protected # management.ssl.password = bunnies ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running the RabbitMQ Streams Offset Tracking Example DESCRIPTION: Shell commands to run the offset tracking example and observe how the consumer resumes from where it left off between executions. The first run starts at offset 0, while the second run starts at offset 100 because it uses the stored offset from the previous run. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-rust-stream.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` cargo run --bin receive_offset_tracking ``` LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` Started consuming: Press control +C to close First message received. Done consuming, first offset 0, last offset 99. ``` LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` cargo run --bin receive_offset_tracking ``` LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` Started consuming First message received. Done consuming first_offset: 100 last_offset: 199 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing In Group Query for LDAP Authorization in Erlang DESCRIPTION: An in_group query that returns true if the logged-in user is a member of a specified group. The query checks membership either against the 'member' attribute or any named attribute. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {in_group, Pattern} ``` LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {in_group, Pattern, AttributeName} ``` LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {vhost_access_query, {in_group, "cn=${vhost}-users,ou=vhosts,dc=example,dc=com"}} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Maximum Channels Limit via HTTP API in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This curl command demonstrates how to set a user limit (max-channels) to 20 using the RabbitMQ HTTP API. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/user-limits.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -v -u guest:guest -X PUT http://localhost:15672/api/user-limits/user1/max-channels \ -H "content-type: application/json" \ -d @- < Trying ::1... # => telnet: connect to address ::1: Connection refused # => Trying 127.0.0.1... # => telnet: connect to address 127.0.0.1: Connection refused ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Busy Distribution Port Warning Log Example DESCRIPTION: Example of a warning log entry that indicates the inter-node communication buffer is operating at full capacity. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/runtime.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` 2019-04-06 22:48:19.031 [warning] <0.242.0> rabbit_sysmon_handler busy_dist_port <0.1401.0> ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Testing Port Connectivity with Telnet - Failure Case DESCRIPTION: Example of using telnet to test connectivity to an unused port 5673, demonstrating connection failure when the port is not in use. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/troubleshooting-networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` telnet localhost 5673 # => Trying ::1... # => telnet: connect to address ::1: Connection refused # => Trying 127.0.0.1... # => telnet: connect to address 127.0.0.1: Connection refused ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Policies in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Lists all policies for the default virtual host using the rabbitmqctl command. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_51 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_policies ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a RabbitMQ Cluster using CLI DESCRIPTION: Example command to join a node to an existing RabbitMQ cluster using the rabbitmqctl CLI tool. This command connects the local node to a remote host's RabbitMQ instance. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/metadata-store/clustering.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl join_cluster rabbit@remote-host ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using long node names in rabbitmq-upgrade DESCRIPTION: Command option required when the cluster is configured to use fully qualified domain names (FQDN) as node names. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmq-upgrade.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` -l, --longnames ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Log Location in RabbitMQ with cmd DESCRIPTION: Command to find the current log file location using rabbitmq-diagnostics CLI tool in Windows command prompt. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: batch CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics.bat -q log_location ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Message Processing Worker Method in Java DESCRIPTION: A worker method that simulates message processing by adding delays when encountering periods in the input string. The method sleeps for 1 second for each period character found. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-spring-amqp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` private void doWork(String in) throws InterruptedException { for (char ch : in.toCharArray()) { if (ch == '.') { Thread.sleep(1000); } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring MacOS Application Firewall for Erlang Server Nodes DESCRIPTION: Commands to allow Erlang server nodes (beam.smp) to bind to ports and accept inbound connections through the MacOS Application Firewall. This is essential for RabbitMQ nodes to function properly. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_40 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # allow server nodes (Erlang VM) to bind to ports and accept inbound connections sudo /usr/libexec/ApplicationFirewall/socketfilterfw --add /usr/local/Cellar/erlang/{version}/lib/erlang/erts-{erts version}/bin/beam.smp sudo /usr/libexec/ApplicationFirewall/socketfilterfw --unblockapp /usr/local/Cellar/erlang/{version}/lib/erlang/erts-{erts version}/bin/beam.smp ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring LDAP DN Lookup Binds in INI Format DESCRIPTION: Configuration example showing how to set up DN lookup binding credentials, lookup attribute and base DN for LDAP authentication SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_ldap.dn_lookup_bind.user_dn = CN=myuser,OU=users,DC=gopivotal,DC=com auth_ldap.dn_lookup_bind.password = test1234 auth_ldap.dn_lookup_attribute = userPrincipalName auth_ldap.dn_lookup_base = DC=gopivotal,DC=com ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Global User Permissions in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Grants a user access to all virtual hosts with specified configure, write, and read permissions based on regular expressions. This command is useful for setting up permissions that apply across all virtual hosts in a RabbitMQ cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_31 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_permissions_globally janeway "^janeway-.*" ".*" ".*" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Compiling and Running RabbitMQ Publish/Subscribe Example in Java DESCRIPTION: Command line instructions for compiling and running the log publisher and consumer examples. Shows how to save logs to a file or display them on screen by running multiple instances of the receiver. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-java.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` javac -cp $CP EmitLog.java ReceiveLogs.java ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` java -cp $CP ReceiveLogs > logs_from_rabbit.log ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` java -cp $CP ReceiveLogs ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` java -cp $CP EmitLog ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo rabbitmqctl list_bindings # => Listing bindings ... # => logs exchange amq.gen-JzTY20BRgKO-HjmUJj0wLg queue [] # => logs exchange amq.gen-vso0PVvyiRIL2WoV3i48Yg queue [] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Testing Authentication with rabbitmqctl in Bash DESCRIPTION: This command uses rabbitmqctl to test authentication for a username and password pair in a Bash environment. It demonstrates how to use the authenticate_user command. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl authenticate_user "a-username" "a/password" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Overriding OAuth Logon Type for Specific Resource DESCRIPTION: Configuration to override default logon type for a specific resource (QA) and set custom provider URL. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.oauth_resource_servers.3.id = rabbit_qa management.oauth_resource_servers.3.label = RabbitMQ QA management.oauth_resource_servers.3.oauth_initiated_logon_type = idp_initiated management.oauth_resource_servers.3.oauth_provider_url = http://qa_url ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Frame Ancestors Content Security Policy in RabbitMQ Management DESCRIPTION: Sets a Content Security Policy (CSP) header with frame-ancestors directive to prevent iframe embedding of the management UI, mitigating cross-frame scripting attacks. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_34 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # prohibits iframe embedding of the UI management.csp.policy = frame-ancestors 'none' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Consul Service Tags Configuration DESCRIPTION: Example of adding service tags to RabbitMQ service registration in Consul. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_28 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = consul cluster_formation.consul.host = consul.eng.example.local # Define tags for the RabbitMQ service: "qa" and "3.8" cluster_formation.consul.svc_tags.1 = qa cluster_formation.consul.svc_tags.2 = 3.8 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Cancelling an Active Consumer in C# DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to cancel an active consumer using the BasicCancelAsync method of the IChannel interface. The consumer is identified by its tag. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/dotnet-api-guide.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` await channel.BasicCancelAsync(consumerTag); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Feature Flags Status in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command for listing all feature flags and their current state (enabled/disabled) in RabbitMQ with formatted output as a table. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/feature-flags/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl -q --formatter pretty_table list_feature_flags ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: AWS Instance Tags Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration for using EC2 instance tags for peer discovery SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = aws cluster_formation.aws.region = us-east-1 cluster_formation.aws.access_key_id = ANIDEXAMPLE cluster_formation.aws.secret_key = WjalrxuTnFEMI/K7MDENG+bPxRfiCYEXAMPLEKEY cluster_formation.aws.instance_tags.region = us-east-1 cluster_formation.aws.instance_tags.service = rabbitmq cluster_formation.aws.instance_tags.environment = staging ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Docker Daemon Limits DESCRIPTION: Docker daemon configuration JSON for setting container-wide kernel limits, specifically configuring the maximum number of open file handles (nofile) to 64000 for both soft and hard limits. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_61 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "default-ulimits": { "nofile": { "Name": "nofile", "Hard": 64000, "Soft": 64000 } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Linux TCP Buffer Configuration DESCRIPTION: Reference to Linux kernel TCP buffer configuration parameters recbuf and sndbuf that control kernel-level network buffers. These remain configurable separately from the user-space auto-tuning feature. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2025-04-08-4.1-performance-improvements/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` recbuf / sndbuf ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running RabbitMQ Topic Exchange Consumers with Different Binding Patterns DESCRIPTION: These bash commands demonstrate how to run the topic exchange consumer with different binding patterns. Examples include receiving all logs, logs from a specific facility, logs with a specific severity, or multiple binding patterns simultaneously. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-five-go.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` go run receive_logs_topic.go "#" ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` go run receive_logs_topic.go "kern.*" ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` go run receive_logs_topic.go "*.critical" ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` go run receive_logs_topic.go "kern.*" "*.critical" ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` go run emit_log_topic.go "kern.critical" "A critical kernel error" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Receiving Critical Logs with Topic Exchange in RabbitMQ using Objective-C DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to receive only critical logs using a topic exchange in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-five-objectivec.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: Objective-C CODE: ``` [self receiveLogsTopic:@[@"*.critical"]]; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Path Prefix for HTTP Requests in RabbitMQ Management DESCRIPTION: Sets a custom path prefix for all HTTP requests to the management plugin, making the API available at host:port/my-prefix/api/ and the UI login page at host:port/my-prefix/. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_42 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.path_prefix = /my-prefix ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Queue Configuration DESCRIPTION: Shows how to specify the source queue name in a shovel configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/shovel-static.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {queue, <<"queue.1">>} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Connections and Channel Counts with RabbitMQ CLI DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use rabbitmqctl to list connections and their associated channel counts. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/channels/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_connections name channels -q # => name channels # => 127.0.0.1:52956 -> 127.0.0.1:5672 10 # => 127.0.0.1:52964 -> 127.0.0.1:5672 33 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: SSL Configuration Parameters in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: SSL/TLS related configuration parameters including protocol, key exchange, cipher, and hash settings for secure connections. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_82 LANGUAGE: markup CODE: ``` ssl ssl_protocol ssl_key_exchange ssl_cipher ssl_hash ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling RabbitMQ Auth Cache Plugin DESCRIPTION: Command to enable the rabbitmq_auth_backend_cache plugin using rabbitmqctl. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/auth-cache-backend.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_auth_backend_cache ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting RabbitMQ with Scope Aliases Configuration DESCRIPTION: This command starts RabbitMQ with the advanced scope aliases configuration, which enables mapping of custom scopes to RabbitMQ-compliant scopes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ADVANCED=advanced-scope-aliases.config make start-rabbitmq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying Log Locations in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: This command shows log file locations on the target RabbitMQ node. It supports flags for displaying all locations and setting a timeout. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_28 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` log_location [--all | -a] [--timeout milliseconds] ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics log_location -a ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Overriding RabbitMQ Configuration File Locations with Environment Variables in INI format DESCRIPTION: Environment variables that can be used to override the default locations of RabbitMQ configuration files, including the primary config file, advanced config file, and environment variable file. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # overrides primary config file location RABBITMQ_CONFIG_FILE=/path/to/a/custom/location/rabbitmq.conf # overrides advanced config file location RABBITMQ_ADVANCED_CONFIG_FILE=/path/to/a/custom/location/advanced.config # overrides environment variable file location RABBITMQ_CONF_ENV_FILE=/path/to/a/custom/location/rabbitmq-env.conf ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating an Exchange of a Built-in Type in C# DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create an exchange of a built-in type (topic) using the C# client library's management API. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/amqp-client-libraries.md#2025-04-09_snippet_45 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` IExchangeSpecification exchangeSpec = management .Exchange(exchangeName) .Type(ExchangeType.TOPIC); await exchangeSpec.DeclareAsync(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Cluster Partition Handling DESCRIPTION: Default configuration for handling network partitions in cluster SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_44 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_partition_handling = ignore ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Passwordless RabbitMQ User DESCRIPTION: Kubernetes manifest for creating a passwordless RabbitMQ user by providing an empty string as the passwordHash value in the credentials Secret. This creates a user that can only authenticate through other means like x509 certificates. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-topology-operator.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` --- apiVersion: v1 kind: Secret metadata: name: my-user-credentials type: Opaque stringData: username: my-user passwordHash: "" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Bindings in RabbitMQ with Bash DESCRIPTION: Lists exchange and queue name bindings for a specific virtual host in RabbitMQ. This command displays the source exchange name and destination queue name for all bindings in the 'my-vhost' virtual host. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_34 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_bindings -p my-vhost exchange_name queue_name ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Queue Length Policy for STOMP Queues Using rabbitmqctl DESCRIPTION: Command to create a policy that limits the length of all STOMP-created queues to 1000 messages. This uses the pattern matching of queue names prefixed with 'stomp-'. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy stomp-queues "^stomp-" '{"max-length":1000}' --apply-to queues ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Monitoring-Only User in RabbitMQ (PowerShell) DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to create a user with monitoring-only access to the RabbitMQ management UI using PowerShell commands. It includes steps to add a user with different password examples and grant empty permissions. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat add_user 'monitoring' '9a55f70a841f18b97c3a7db939b7adc9e34a0f1d' rabbitmqctl.bat add_user 'monitoring' '"w63pnZ&LnYMO(t"' rabbitmqctl.bat set_permissions --vhost 'vhost-name' 'monitoring' '^$' '^$' '^$' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Frame Ancestors Content Security Policy in RabbitMQ Management DESCRIPTION: Sets a Content Security Policy (CSP) header with frame-ancestors directive to prevent iframe embedding of the management UI, mitigating cross-frame scripting attacks. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_34 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # prohibits iframe embedding of the UI management.csp.policy = frame-ancestors 'none' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example rabbitmq-env.conf Configuration for Unix Systems DESCRIPTION: Example of a rabbitmq-env.conf file that configures node name and config file locations on Unix-based systems. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_59 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Example rabbitmq-env.conf file entries. Note that the variables # do not have the RABBITMQ_ prefix. # # Overrides node name NODENAME=bunny@myhost # Specifies new style config file location CONFIG_FILE=/etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.conf # Specifies advanced config file location ADVANCED_CONFIG_FILE=/etc/rabbitmq/advanced.config ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Maintenance Mode in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to revive a node from maintenance mode and restore normal operations. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/upgrade.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-upgrade revive ``` LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmq-upgrade.bat revive ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TLS (WSS) for RabbitMQ Web STOMP DESCRIPTION: Configuration for enabling secure WebSocket connections (WSS) with TLS, including port, certificate files, and other security settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/web-stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` web_stomp.ssl.port = 15673 web_stomp.ssl.backlog = 1024 web_stomp.ssl.cacertfile = /path/to/ca_certificate.pem web_stomp.ssl.certfile = /path/to/server_certificate.pem web_stomp.ssl.keyfile = /path/to/server_key.pem web_stomp.ssl.password = changeme ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Debug Log Level in RabbitMQ Messaging Topology Operator DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration to set the log level to 'debug' for the Messaging Topology Operator by modifying the deployment manifest with the '--zap-log-level=debug' argument. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-topology-operator.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiVersion: apps/v1 kind: Deployment metadata: name: messaging-topology-operator namespace: rabbitmq-system spec: template: spec: containers: - args: - --zap-log-level=debug command: - /manager ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Custom Configuration File Path in RabbitMQ Environment DESCRIPTION: Example configuration that specifies a custom path for the RabbitMQ configuration file. Sets the configuration file location to a specific path in the data directory. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmq-env.conf.5.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # I am a complete rabbitmq-env.conf file. # Comment lines start with a hash character. # This is a /bin/sh script file - use ordinary envt var syntax CONFIG_FILE=/data/services/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.conf ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Users in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Shows how to list users in a RabbitMQ cluster using the rabbitmqctl command. It includes examples for both Bash and PowerShell, as well as how to output the list in JSON format. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_users ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_users --formatter=json ``` LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat list_users ``` LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat list_users --formatter=json ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating RabbitMQ Stream with Environment Setup in Rust DESCRIPTION: Creates a new stream with 2GB max length capacity and handles potential stream creation errors. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-rust-stream.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: rust CODE: ``` let create_response = environment .stream_creator() .max_length(ByteCapacity::GB(2)) .create(stream) .await; if let Err(e) = create_response { if let StreamCreateError::Create { stream, status } = e { match status { // we can ignore this error because the stream already exists ResponseCode::StreamAlreadyExists => {} err => { println!("Error creating stream: {:?} {:?}", stream, err); std::process::exit(1); } } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Enabled Plugins File Format DESCRIPTION: Example of the enabled_plugins file format showing enabled plugins list in Erlang term format. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/plugins.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [rabbitmq_management,rabbitmq_management_agent,rabbitmq_shovel]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Establishing TLS Connection to RabbitMQ with Java Client and Certificate Verification DESCRIPTION: Java implementation that sets up a secure TLS connection to RabbitMQ with certificate-based authentication. The code configures both a KeyManager for client authentication and a TrustManager for server verification, then creates a connection to send and receive a message. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` import java.io.*; import java.security.*; import javax.net.ssl.*; import com.rabbitmq.client.*; public class Example2 { public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception { char[] keyPassphrase = "MySecretPassword".toCharArray(); KeyStore ks = KeyStore.getInstance("PKCS12"); ks.load(new FileInputStream("/path/to/client_key.p12"), keyPassphrase); KeyManagerFactory kmf = KeyManagerFactory.getInstance("SunX509"); kmf.init(ks, keyPassphrase); char[] trustPassphrase = "rabbitstore".toCharArray(); KeyStore tks = KeyStore.getInstance("JKS"); tks.load(new FileInputStream("/path/to/trustStore"), trustPassphrase); TrustManagerFactory tmf = TrustManagerFactory.getInstance("SunX509"); tmf.init(tks); SSLContext c = SSLContext.getInstance("TLSv1.2"); c.init(kmf.getKeyManagers(), tmf.getTrustManagers(), null); ConnectionFactory factory = new ConnectionFactory(); factory.setHost("localhost"); factory.setPort(5671); factory.useSslProtocol(c); factory.enableHostnameVerification(); Connection conn = factory.newConnection(); Channel channel = conn.createChannel(); channel.queueDeclare("rabbitmq-java-test", false, true, true, null); channel.basicPublish("", "rabbitmq-java-test", null, "Hello, World".getBytes()); GetResponse chResponse = channel.basicGet("rabbitmq-java-test", false); if (chResponse == null) { System.out.println("No message retrieved"); } else { byte[] body = chResponse.getBody(); System.out.println("Received: " + new String(body)); } channel.close(); conn.close(); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Limiting Maximum Channels per Connection in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration to limit the maximum number of channels per connection, which can help reduce overall memory consumption in environments with many connections. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` channel_max = 16 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Advanced Cluster Management Commands DESCRIPTION: Commands for advanced cluster management including node observation, feature flags, and reconciliation control. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/kubectl-plugin.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl rabbitmq observe INSTANCE INDEX ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl rabbitmq enable-all-feature-flags INSTANCE ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl rabbitmq pause-reconciliation INSTANCE ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl rabbitmq resume-reconciliation INSTANCE ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Channel Information in RabbitMQ with Bash DESCRIPTION: Displays connection process ID and count of unacknowledged messages for each channel. This command provides channel-level metrics that can be useful for monitoring AMQP channel performance and status. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_35 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_channels connection messages_unacknowledged ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Delivery Limit for Quorum Queues via HTTP API DESCRIPTION: HTTP API request to disable the delivery limit for quorum queues by setting delivery-limit to -1. Uses a PUT request to the policies endpoint with a pattern matching quorum queues that should have unlimited delivery attempts. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/quorum-queues/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` PUT /api/policies/%2f/qq-overrides {"pattern": "^qq\.unlimited", "definition": {"delivery-limit": -1}, "priority": 1, "apply-to": "quorum_queues"} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: CORS Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configures Cross-origin Resource Sharing settings including allowed origins and cache timeout SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_35 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.cors.allow_origins.1 = https://origin1.org management.cors.allow_origins.2 = https://origin2.org ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.cors.allow_origins.1 = * ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.cors.allow_origins.1 = https://origin1.org management.cors.allow_origins.2 = https://origin2.org management.cors.max_age = 3600 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Path Prefix Configuration DESCRIPTION: Sets custom prefix for all HTTP requests to the management plugin SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_38 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.path_prefix = /my-prefix ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: TLS Configuration for Web MQTT DESCRIPTION: Configuration example for enabling TLS (WSS) connections for the Web MQTT plugin, including port, certificate paths, and key settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/web-mqtt.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` web_mqtt.ssl.port = 15676\nweb_mqtt.ssl.backlog = 1024\nweb_mqtt.ssl.cacertfile = /path/to/ca_certificate.pem\nweb_mqtt.ssl.certfile = /path/to/server_certificate.pem\nweb_mqtt.ssl.keyfile = /path/to/server_key.pem\n# needed when private key has a passphrase\n# web_mqtt.ssl.password = changeme ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting Users in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to delete a user in RabbitMQ using the rabbitmqctl command. Examples are provided for both Bash and PowerShell environments. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl delete_user 'username' ``` LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat delete_user 'username' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting AMQP 1.0 Source Address DESCRIPTION: Configures the source address for an AMQP 1.0 link connection. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/shovel-static.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {source_address, <<"my-address">>} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: JSON Log Configuration in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration for customizing JSON logging output with field mapping. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_29 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.file.formatter = json log.file.formatter.json.field_map = 'time:ts level:lvl msg:message *:-' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Clearing a RabbitMQ Vhost-Scoped Parameter DESCRIPTION: Removes a vhost-scoped parameter from RabbitMQ. This example clears the 'node01' parameter for the 'federation-upstream' component in the default virtual host. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_47 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl clear_parameter federation-upstream node01 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Reconnection Delay for RabbitMQ Shovel Destination DESCRIPTION: Configuration that specifies how long (in seconds) the Shovel should wait before attempting to reconnect after a connection failure. Default is 1 second, and 0 means no reconnection. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/shovel-static.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {reconnect_delay, 5} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Mixed Authentication and Authorization Backends in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to configure RabbitMQ to use the internal database for authentication and a third-party IP range backend for authorization. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # rabbitmq.conf # auth_backends.1.authn = internal # uses module name because this backend is from a 3rd party auth_backends.1.authz = rabbit_auth_backend_ip_range ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Demonstrating AMQP Transaction Commands in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet showcases the AMQP commands used in transactions, including basic.publish, basic.ack, and basic.reject. It highlights the transactional nature of these commands across different versions of RabbitMQ and AMQP specifications. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/semantics.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: AMQP CODE: ``` basic.publish basic.ack basic.reject tx.commit tx.commit-ok ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Erlang Packages DESCRIPTION: This command installs the recommended Erlang packages for use with RabbitMQ. It includes the base Erlang package and several additional modules required for RabbitMQ functionality. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # This is recommended. Metapackages such as erlang and erlang-nox must only be used # with apt version pinning. They do not pin their dependency versions. sudo apt-get install -y erlang-base \ erlang-asn1 erlang-crypto erlang-eldap erlang-ftp erlang-inets \ erlang-mnesia erlang-os-mon erlang-parsetools erlang-public-key \ erlang-runtime-tools erlang-snmp erlang-ssl \ erlang-syntax-tools erlang-tftp erlang-tools erlang-xmerl ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining RabbitMQ Log Base Directory in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Specifies the default base directory for RabbitMQ logs in a generic binary build. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/relocate.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` `$RABBITMQ_HOME/var/log/rabbitmq` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing vcprompt using Homebrew DESCRIPTION: This command installs vcprompt, a tool for displaying version control information in the command prompt, using the Homebrew package manager. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2010-10-02-prompt-a-licious/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` $ brew install vcprompt ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Check TLS Versions in RabbitMQ (Windows) DESCRIPTION: Command to verify TLS version support in RabbitMQ's Erlang runtime on Windows SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/troubleshooting-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics.bat --silent tls_versions ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ to Listen on a Specific IPv6 Interface DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to configure RabbitMQ to listen on a specific IPv6 interface only. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` listeners.tcp.1 = fe80::2acf:e9ff:fe17:f97b:5672 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Syslog Output DESCRIPTION: Basic configuration to enable Syslog output in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.syslog = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing User Topic Permissions in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to list all topic permissions for a specific user across all virtual hosts. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_27 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_user_topic_permissions janeway ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Publishing Tasks to RabbitMQ Queue - PHP DESCRIPTION: Code showing how to publish messages as tasks to a RabbitMQ queue. Takes command line input as the task message, defaulting to 'Hello World!' if no input is provided. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-php.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: php CODE: ``` $data = implode(' ', array_slice($argv, 1)); if (empty($data)) { $data = "Hello World!"; } $msg = new AMQPMessage($data); $channel->basic_publish($msg, '', 'hello'); echo ' [x] Sent ', $data, "\n"; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Mnesia table loading retry limit in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Setting to control the number of retries when waiting for Mnesia tables during cluster startup. This does not apply to Mnesia upgrades or node deletions. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_47 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` mnesia_table_loading_retry_limit = 10 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using RabbitMQ CLI Tools for Diagnostics DESCRIPTION: These commands show how to use various RabbitMQ CLI tools for diagnostics and status checking, including ping, status, cluster status, and environment checks. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo rabbitmq-diagnostics ping sudo rabbitmq-diagnostics status sudo rabbitmq-diagnostics cluster_status sudo rabbitmq-diagnostics environment ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking RabbitMQ Running Status (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Reports if the RabbitMQ application is fully booted and running on the target node. Essential for service availability checks. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics is_running ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running the RPC Server in Go with RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to run the RPC server implementation. This starts the server process which will listen for incoming RPC requests on the 'rpc_queue'. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-six-go.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` go run rpc_server.go # => [x] Awaiting RPC requests ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Combined Running and Alarm Check DESCRIPTION: Combines checks for running status and local alarms. Verifies both that RabbitMQ is running normally and no local alarms are in effect. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/monitoring/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics -q check_running && rabbitmq-diagnostics -q check_local_alarms ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Multiple OAuth 2.0 Resources in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Basic OAuth 2.0 plugin configuration defining four resource servers with different IDs for production, development, QA and internal use. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_oauth2.issuer = http://some_idp_url auth_oauth2.scope_prefix = rabbitmq. auth_oauth2.resource_servers.1.id = rabbit_prod auth_oauth2.resource_servers.2.id = rabbit_dev auth_oauth2.resource_servers.3.id = rabbit_qa auth_oauth2.resource_servers.4.id = rabbit_internal ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Fibonacci Function in Java DESCRIPTION: A recursive implementation of the Fibonacci sequence calculation that will be used as the RPC service task. This function takes an integer input and returns the corresponding Fibonacci number. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-six-java.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` private static int fib(int n) { if (n == 0) return 0; if (n == 1) return 1; return fib(n-1) + fib(n-2); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Service Annotations for RabbitmqCluster in YAML DESCRIPTION: Specifies Kubernetes Service annotations for the RabbitmqCluster Service. The example adds an annotation for an internal AWS load balancer. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-operator/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiVersion: rabbitmq.com/v1beta1 kind: RabbitmqCluster metadata: name: rabbitmqcluster-sample spec: service: annotations: service.beta.kubernetes.io/aws-load-balancer-internal: 0.0.0.0/0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Growing Quorum Queue Replicas in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Adds a new replica on the specified node for all or a subset of matching quorum queues. This command can target queues in a specific virtual host using patterns. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmq-queues.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-queues grow "rabbit@newhost" "all" --vhost-pattern "a-vhost" --queue-pattern ".*" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring SHA-512 Password Hashing in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Example configuration to use SHA-512 as the password hashing algorithm in RabbitMQ. This is set in the RabbitMQ configuration file. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/passwords.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` password_hashing_module = rabbit_password_hashing_sha512 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Cross-Origin Resource Sharing in RabbitMQ Management DESCRIPTION: Configuration examples for setting up Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) in RabbitMQ Management. This includes whitelisting specific origins and configuring pre-flight request caching. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_38 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.cors.allow_origins.1 = https://origin1.org management.cors.allow_origins.2 = https://origin2.org ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.cors.allow_origins.1 = * ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.cors.allow_origins.1 = https://origin1.org management.cors.allow_origins.2 = https://origin2.org management.cors.max_age = 3600 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deactivating Recovery in Python DESCRIPTION: Shows how to deactivate automatic recovery in Python by setting active_recovery to False in the RecoveryConfiguration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/amqp-client-libraries.md#2025-04-09_snippet_79 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` environment = Environment( "amqp://guest:guest@localhost:5672/", recovery_configuration=RecoveryConfiguration(active_recovery=False), ) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Independent Prefetch Limits for Multiple Consumers in Java DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to set independent prefetch limits of 10 unacknowledged messages for two consumers on the same channel. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/consumer-prefetch.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` Channel channel = ...; Consumer consumer1 = ...; Consumer consumer2 = ...; channel.basicQos(10); // Per consumer limit channel.basicConsume("my-queue1", false, consumer1); channel.basicConsume("my-queue2", false, consumer2); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TLS for Syslog Logging in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This configuration sets up TLS for Syslog logging in RabbitMQ, including specifying certificate files. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.syslog = true log.syslog.transport = tls log.syslog.protocol = rfc5424 log.syslog.ssl_options.cacertfile = /path/to/ca_certificate.pem log.syslog.ssl_options.certfile = /path/to/client_certificate.pem log.syslog.ssl_options.keyfile = /path/to/client_key.pem ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: List Federation Parameters via CLI DESCRIPTION: Command to list federation parameters using the diagnostics tool with pretty table formatting. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/federation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics list_parameters --formatter=pretty_table ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Fetching the New RabbitMQ Signing Key Using GnuPG DESCRIPTION: Command to download the new RabbitMQ nightly signing key from a public key server using GnuPG. This retrieves the key with ID 0xD441A9DDBA058EF7. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/static/key-transition-0x0697F46E2DF405B6.txt#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` gpg --recv-key 0xD441A9DDBA058EF7 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing User Topic Permissions in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to list all topic permissions for a specific user across all virtual hosts. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_27 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_user_topic_permissions janeway ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Log File Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration settings for specifying log file name and location in rabbitmq.conf. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.file = rabbit.log ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.file = /opt/custom/var/log/rabbit.log ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TCP socket closing behavior in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Setting to control whether RabbitMQ tries to immediately close TCP sockets when clients disconnect. This cannot guarantee immediate resource release by the kernel. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_41 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` tcp_listen_options.exit_on_close = false ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Cluster Status for Network Partitions in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This bash command uses rabbitmq-diagnostics to check the cluster status and detect network partitions. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/partitions.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics cluster_status ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Message TTL Policy using rabbitmqctl in Bash DESCRIPTION: This command sets a policy that applies a 60-second TTL to all queues using rabbitmqctl in a Bash environment. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ttl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy TTL ".*" '{"message-ttl":60000}' --apply-to queues ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining the available field in AMQP 1.0 flow frame DESCRIPTION: XML definition of the available field in AMQP 1.0 flow frame. The available field is an unsigned integer that RabbitMQ uses to inform consumers about the approximate number of messages available in a queue. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2024-09-02-amqp-flow-control/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: xml CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Conditional Import from Directory DESCRIPTION: Configuration settings to only import definitions if the file contents in a directory have changed. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/definitions.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # when set to true, definition import will only happen # if definition file contents change definitions.skip_if_unchanged = true definitions.import_backend = local_filesystem definitions.local.path = /path/to/definitions/conf.d/ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running RabbitMQ Server as Detached Application in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: Command to start a RabbitMQ broker node as a detached process running in the background, not attached to the Command Prompt window. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/install-windows-manual.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` rabbitmq-server.bat -detached ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Monitoring-Only User in RabbitMQ using PowerShell DESCRIPTION: This PowerShell script demonstrates how to create a user with monitoring-only access to the RabbitMQ management UI. It creates a user with a regular or complex password and grants empty permissions which allow viewing but not modifying resources. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` # See the Access Control guide to learn about user management. # # password is provided as a command line argument rabbitmqctl.bat add_user 'monitoring' '9a55f70a841f18b97c3a7db939b7adc9e34a0f1d' # passwords with special characters must be quoted correctly rabbitmqctl.bat add_user 'monitoring' '"w63pnZ&LnYMO(t"' # grant the user empty permissions rabbitmqctl.bat set_permissions --vhost 'vhost-name' 'monitoring' '^$' '^$' '^$' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Shovel Definition Structure DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the top-level structure of a single shovel definition, including source, destination, acknowledgment mode, and reconnection delay settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/shovel-static.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {shovel_name, [ {source, [ %% protocol-specific source configuration goes here ]}, {destination, [ %% protocol-specific destination configuration goes here ]}, %% 'confirm' is the default acknowledgement mode {ack_mode, confirm}, %% reconnect with a 5 second delay {reconnect_delay, 5} ]} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Message Acknowledgment in Ruby with RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Shows how to implement manual message acknowledgment in a RabbitMQ consumer to ensure messages aren't lost if a worker dies. Uses the manual_ack option and explicitly acknowledges messages after processing.
