SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-ruby.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` queue.subscribe(manual_ack: true, block: true) do |delivery_info, _properties, body| puts " [x] Received '#{body}'" # imitate some work sleep body.count('.').to_i puts ' [x] Done' channel.ack(delivery_info.delivery_tag) end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Global Parameters in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Lists all global runtime parameters using the rabbitmqctl command. Global parameters are not tied to any specific virtual host. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_47 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_global_parameters ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Console Logging via Environment Variable DESCRIPTION: Bash environment variable setting to instruct RabbitMQ to log to standard I/O streams instead of a file, which takes precedence over configuration file settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Instructs the node to log to standard streams. # IMPORTANT: the environment variable takes precedence over the configuration file. # When it is set, all logging-related rabbitmq.conf settings will be # effectively ignored. RABBITMQ_LOGS=- ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ for TLSv1.2 with SSL Options DESCRIPTION: Example configuration that disables TLS versions older than TLSv1.2, specifying the listener port, certificate paths, and allowed TLS version. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_27 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` listeners.ssl.1 = 5671 ssl_options.cacertfile = /path/to/ca_certificate.pem ssl_options.certfile = /path/to/server_certificate.pem ssl_options.keyfile = /path/to/server_key.pem ssl_options.versions.1 = tlsv1.2 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Combining Multiple Policies in a Single Command DESCRIPTION: Sets multiple queue constraints (max-length, expiration, and message-ttl) in a single policy using the RabbitMQ management CLI. This policy applies to queues with names starting with 'capped.'. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2014-01-23-preventing-unbounded-buffers-with-rabbitmq/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy capped_queues "^capped\." \ '{"max-length":10, "expires":900000, "message-ttl":60000}' --apply-to queues ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Consuming Stream Messages with the RabbitMQ Stream Java Client DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to consume messages from a RabbitMQ stream using the Stream Java client. It retrieves the original message properties from AMQP 0.9.1 messages including message ID, creation time, content type, exchange, and routing key. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2021-10-07-rabbitmq-streams-interoperability/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` environment.consumerBuilder() .stream("world") .offset(OffsetSpecification.first()) .messageHandler((context, message) -> { String body = new String(message.getBodyAsBinary()); log( "Message #%s, creation time %tF %tT, content type '%s', from exchange %s with routing key %s", message.getProperties().getMessageId(), message.getProperties().getCreationTime(), message.getProperties().getCreationTime(), message.getProperties().getContentType(), message.getMessageAnnotations().get("x-exchange"), message.getMessageAnnotations().get("x-routing-key")); }) .build(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting Virtual Host in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to delete a virtual host named 'a-vhost' including all its exchanges, queues, bindings, user permissions, parameters, and policies. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_57 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl delete_vhost a-vhost ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Establishing a WebSocket Connection with STOMP DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code to create a WebSocket connection to the RabbitMQ STOMP endpoint and initialize the STOMP client. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/web-stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TLS Version for RabbitMQ .NET Client DESCRIPTION: Sets up a ConnectionFactory with TLS enabled and configures it to use TLSv1.2. Starting with .NET client 6.0, the default TLS version changes to SslProtocols.None which delegates the selection to the .NET framework. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_24 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` using System.Security.Authentication; // ... ConnectionFactory cf = new ConnectionFactory(); cf.Ssl.Enabled = true; cf.Ssl.ServerName = System.Net.Dns.GetHostName(); cf.Ssl.CertPath = "/path/to/client_key.p12"; cf.Ssl.CertPassphrase = "MySecretPassword"; // Use TLSv1.2 for this connection cf.Ssl.Version = SslProtocols.Tls12; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Nagle's Algorithm in RabbitMQ with INI-Style Config DESCRIPTION: Configuration example showing how to disable Nagle's algorithm to reduce latency using the rabbitmq.conf file format. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` tcp_listen_options.backlog = 4096 tcp_listen_options.nodelay = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ Connection with Basic Parameters (INI) DESCRIPTION: Example of a RabbitMQ connection URI with TLS disabled, setting heartbeat and connection timeout parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/uri-query-parameters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` amqp://myhost?heartbeat=5&connection_timeout=10000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Per-Object Metrics on /metrics Endpoint DESCRIPTION: This configuration setting enables the return of per-object (unaggregated) metrics on the /metrics endpoint, which can be resource-intensive for environments with many objects. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/prometheus/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` prometheus.return_per_object_metrics = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ Shovel from AMQP 1.0 to AMQP 0.9.1 DESCRIPTION: Configuration for a shovel that transfers messages from an AMQP 1.0 source to an AMQP 0.9.1 destination. Includes source address configuration and destination broker settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/shovel-static.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {rabbitmq_shovel, [ {shovels, [ {my_first_shovel, [ {source, [ {protocol, amqp10}, {uris, [ "amqp://fred:secret@host1.domain/my_vhost", ]}, {source_address, <<"my-source">>}, {prefetch_count, 10} ]}, {destination, [ {protocol, amqp091}, {uris, ["amqp://"]}, {declarations, [ {'exchange.declare', [ {exchange, <<"my_direct">>}, {type, <<"direct">>}, durable ]} ]}, {publish_properties, [ {delivery_mode, 2} ]}, {add_forward_headers, true}, {publish_fields, [ {exchange, <<"my_direct">>}, {routing_key, <<"from_shovel">>} ]} ]}, {ack_mode, on_confirm}, {reconnect_delay, 5} ]} ]} ]} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Overriding RabbitMQ Configuration File Locations using Environment Variables in INI format DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use environment variables to override the default locations of RabbitMQ configuration files. It includes variables for the primary config file, advanced config file, and environment variable file. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # overrides primary config file location RABBITMQ_CONFIG_FILE=/path/to/a/custom/location/rabbitmq.conf # overrides advanced config file location RABBITMQ_ADVANCED_CONFIG_FILE=/path/to/a/custom/location/advanced.config # overrides environment variable file location RABBITMQ_CONF_ENV_FILE=/path/to/a/custom/location/rabbitmq-env.conf ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Overriding RabbitMQ Configuration File Locations using Environment Variables in INI format DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use environment variables to override the default locations of RabbitMQ configuration files. It includes variables for the primary config file, advanced config file, and environment variable file. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # overrides primary config file location RABBITMQ_CONFIG_FILE=/path/to/a/custom/location/rabbitmq.conf # overrides advanced config file location RABBITMQ_ADVANCED_CONFIG_FILE=/path/to/a/custom/location/advanced.config # overrides environment variable file location RABBITMQ_CONF_ENV_FILE=/path/to/a/custom/location/rabbitmq-env.conf ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring SSL Acceptors in RabbitMQ (INI) DESCRIPTION: Default setting for the number of Erlang processes that will accept TLS connections from clients. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` num_acceptors.ssl = 10 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing RabbitMQ Exchange Information via HTTP API DESCRIPTION: Endpoints for retrieving information about exchanges in RabbitMQ. These provide similar data to the rabbitmqctl list_exchanges command plus message statistics. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_35 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` /api/exchanges ``` LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` /api/exchanges/(vhost) ``` LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` /api/exchanges/(vhost)/(name) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: For Query Example for RabbitMQ LDAP Authorization DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates conditional query handling based on variable values, useful for implementing complex authorization rules. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_36 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {for, [{Name, Value, SubQuery}, ...]} ``` LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {resource_access_query, {for, [{resource, exchange, {for, [{permission, configure, {in_group, "cn=wheel,dc=example,dc=com"} }, {permission, write, {constant, true}}, {permission, read, {constant, true}} ]}}, {resource, queue, {constant, true}}]}} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Erlang 24 Support Announcement Reference in HTML DESCRIPTION: HTML code snippet showing a link to the Erlang 24 support announcement for RabbitMQ, referenced in the compatibility matrix for versions 3.9.0 through 3.9.14. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/which-erlang.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` Erlang/OTP 24 support announcement ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring AMQP 1.0 Protocol for Event Exchange DESCRIPTION: Configuration option that enables the Event Exchange plugin to publish events using the AMQP 1.0 protocol format instead of the default AMQP 0.9.1. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/event-exchange.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` event_exchange.protocol = amqp_1_0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting Queue in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to delete a queue from RabbitMQ using the management API. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/amqp-client-libraries.md#2025-04-09_snippet_60 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` management.queueDelete("my-queue"); ``` LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` await management.Queue("myqueue").DeleteAsync(); ``` LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` management.delete_queue(name="myqueue") ``` LANGUAGE: go CODE: ``` management.DeleteExchange(context.TODO(),"myqueue") ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Queue Federation Policy in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: PowerShell command to create a policy that enables federation for queues with names starting with 'federated.' prefix, applying to all configured upstreams. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/federated-queues/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat set_policy queue-federation '^federated\.' '"{""federation-upstream-set":""all""}"' --priority 10 --apply-to queues ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing RabbitMQ Server Version Components in JSX DESCRIPTION: Imports React components that display RabbitMQ server version information. These components are used in the documentation to dynamically show the current server release branch and version. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` import { RabbitMQServerReleaseBranch, RabbitMQServerVersion, } from '@site/src/components/RabbitMQServer'; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Publishing Messages to RabbitMQ Stream in Go DESCRIPTION: Creates a producer that publishes 100 messages to a stream, with the last message marked as a sentinel. Uses a channel to wait for publish confirmations before completing. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-go-stream.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: go CODE: ``` producer, _ := env.NewProducer(streamName, stream.NewProducerOptions()) messageCount := 100 ch := make(chan bool) chPublishConfirm := producer.NotifyPublishConfirmation() handlePublishConfirm(chPublishConfirm, messageCount, ch) fmt.Printf("Publishing %d messages\n", messageCount) for i := 0; i < messageCount; i++ { var body string if i == messageCount-1 { body = "marker" } else { body = "hello" } producer.Send(amqp.NewMessage([]byte(body))) } _ = <-ch fmt.Println("Messages confirmed") producer.Close() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Java TLS Client with Hostname Verification DESCRIPTION: Java example demonstrating how to enable hostname verification when connecting to RabbitMQ with TLS. This verifies that the server certificate was issued for the hostname the client is connecting to. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` import java.io.*; import java.security.*; import javax.net.ssl.*; import com.rabbitmq.client.*; public class Example2 { public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception { char[] keyPassphrase = "MySecretPassword".toCharArray(); KeyStore ks = KeyStore.getInstance("PKCS12"); ks.load(new FileInputStream("/path/to/client_key.p12"), keyPassphrase); KeyManagerFactory kmf = KeyManagerFactory.getInstance("SunX509"); kmf.init(ks, keyPassphrase); char[] trustPassphrase = "rabbitstore".toCharArray(); KeyStore tks = KeyStore.getInstance("JKS"); tks.load(new FileInputStream("/path/to/trustStore"), trustPassphrase); TrustManagerFactory tmf = TrustManagerFactory.getInstance("SunX509"); tmf.init(tks); SSLContext c = SSLContext.getInstance("TLSv1.2"); c.init(kmf.getKeyManagers(), tmf.getTrustManagers(), null); ConnectionFactory factory = new ConnectionFactory(); factory.setHost("localhost"); factory.setPort(5671); factory.useSslProtocol(c); factory.enableHostnameVerification(); // this connection will both perform peer verification // and server hostname verification Connection conn = factory.newConnection(); // snip ... } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Application Properties for AMQP 1.0 Destination in RabbitMQ Shovel DESCRIPTION: Optional configuration that declares additional application properties to be added when republishing messages to an AMQP 1.0 destination. Keys and values should be binary strings. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/shovel-static.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {application_properties, [ {<<"application-key-1">>, <<"value-1">>}, {<<"application-key-2">>, <<"value-2">>} ]} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Cluster Name in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: The set_cluster_name command assigns a name to the RabbitMQ cluster. The cluster name is announced to clients on connection and used by federation and shovel plugins to record message origin. By default, the cluster name is derived from the hostname of the first node in the cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_65 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_cluster_name london ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running RabbitMQ Broker with Custom Node Name DESCRIPTION: Command to run RabbitMQ broker with a custom Erlang node name. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/build-server.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make run-broker RABBITMQ_NODENAME=rmq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling RabbitMQ Web STOMP Examples Plugin DESCRIPTION: Command to enable the RabbitMQ Web STOMP examples plugin. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/web-stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_web_stomp_examples ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Supported Cipher Suites in RabbitMQ with Bash DESCRIPTION: Lists all cipher suites supported by encoding commands in RabbitMQ. This can be useful for security auditing and configuration of secure connections to the broker. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_36 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_ciphers ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Console Code Page for UTF-8 Support DESCRIPTION: Command to change the Windows console code page to 65001 (UTF-8), allowing proper display and parsing of non-ASCII characters in RabbitMQ CLI tools. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/windows-configuration.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` chcp 65001 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ TLS Configuration File (Linux) DESCRIPTION: Detailed TLS configuration file specifying certificate paths, verification settings, and security options for both server and client sides. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/clustering-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` [ {server, [ {cacertfile, "/full/path/to/ca_certificate.pem"}, {certfile, "/full/path/to/server_certificate.pem"}, {keyfile, "/full/path/to/server_key.pem"}, {password, "password-if-keyfile-is-encrypted"}, {secure_renegotiate, true}, {verify, verify_peer}, {fail_if_no_peer_cert, true} ]}, {client, [ {cacertfile, "/full/path/to/ca_certificate.pem"}, {certfile, "/full/path/to/client_certificate.pem"}, {keyfile, "/full/path/to/client_key.pem"}, {password, "password-if-keyfile-is-encrypted"}, {secure_renegotiate, true}, {verify, verify_peer} ]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Docker Commands for Environment Setup DESCRIPTION: Commands to start Keycloak and RabbitMQ services with specific configurations. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples-multiresource.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make start-keycloak MODE="multi-keycloak" CONF="rabbitmq.scenario1.conf" make start-rabbitmq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Clearing Global Parameter in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Clears the global runtime parameter 'mqtt_default_vhosts' using the rabbitmqctl command. Global parameters are not tied to a specific virtual host. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_45 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl clear_global_parameter mqtt_default_vhosts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring a Queue with a Server-Generated Name in Elixir DESCRIPTION: Creates a new queue with a server-generated name by not providing a queue name parameter. Returns the generated queue name which can be used for binding to exchanges. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-elixir.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: elixir CODE: ``` {:ok, %{queue: queue_name}} = AMQP.Queue.declare(channel) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ to Listen on Localhost for IPv4 and IPv6 DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to configure RabbitMQ to listen on localhost for both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` listeners.tcp.1 = 127.0.0.1:5672 listeners.tcp.2 = ::1:5672 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Batch Message Rejection in .NET DESCRIPTION: Shows batch rejection implementation using RabbitMQ .NET client. Uses IModel#BasicNack to reject multiple messages simultaneously. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/confirms.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` var consumer = new EventingBasicConsumer(channel); consumer.Received += (ch, ea) => { var body = ea.Body.ToArray(); // requeue all unacknowledged deliveries up to // this delivery tag channel.BasicNack(ea.DeliveryTag, true, true); }; String consumerTag = channel.BasicConsume(queueName, false, consumer); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Cache TTL Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration example for setting cache TTL and backend type. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/auth-cache-backend.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_cache.cached_backend = ldap auth_cache.cache_ttl = 5000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Net Tick Time in RabbitMQ Advanced Config DESCRIPTION: Sample advanced.config configuration to double the default net_ticktime from 60 to 120 seconds for all nodes in a RabbitMQ cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/nettick.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [ {kernel, [{net_ticktime, 120}]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Stopping All Publishing DESCRIPTION: Command to immediately trigger the memory alarm by setting the threshold to 0, which blocks all publishing connections. This can be used as a mechanism to temporarily stop all publishing activity across the cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/memory.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_vm_memory_high_watermark 0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Net Tick Time in RabbitMQ Advanced Config DESCRIPTION: Sample advanced.config configuration to double the default net_ticktime from 60 to 120 seconds for all nodes in a RabbitMQ cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/nettick.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [ {kernel, [{net_ticktime, 120}]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Stopping Docker Workload Containers in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to stop and remove all containers used by monitoring workloads SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/prometheus/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` gmake down ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Extra OAuth Parameters for Authorization Endpoints DESCRIPTION: Configuration for adding custom parameters to OAuth authorization and token endpoint requests. This allows sending provider-specific parameters like 'audience' that some OAuth providers require. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.oauth_resource_servers.2.id = some-resource-id management.oauth_resource_servers.2.oauth_authorization_endpoint_params.audience = some-resource-id management.oauth_resource_servers.2.oauth_token_endpoint_params.audience = some-resource-id ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Consuming RabbitMQ Event Stream DESCRIPTION: Command to consume internal event stream in JSON format using rabbitmq-diagnostics. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_53 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics consume_event_stream ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling MQTT Plugin in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to enable the MQTT plugin using rabbitmq-plugins tool. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2012-09-12-mqtt-adapter/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` sudo rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_mqtt ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Reverse DNS Lookups in RabbitMQ Configuration DESCRIPTION: This configuration snippet shows how to explicitly enable reverse DNS lookups in RabbitMQ. When set to true, RabbitMQ will perform reverse DNS lookups for client IP addresses. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_37 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` reverse_dns_lookups = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Proxy Exclusions for RabbitMQ Peer Discovery DESCRIPTION: This configuration sets up HTTP and HTTPS proxies for RabbitMQ peer discovery and specifies exclusions for certain hosts. It uses cluster_formation.proxy.proxy_exclusions to list IPs and hostnames that should bypass the proxy. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_50 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.proxy.http_proxy = 192.168.0.98 cluster_formation.proxy.https_proxy = 192.168.0.98 cluster_formation.proxy.proxy_exclusions.1 = 169.254.169.254 cluster_formation.proxy.proxy_exclusions.2 = excluded.example.local ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing RabbitMQ and Erlang Packages on RPM-based Systems DESCRIPTION: Commands for updating package metadata, installing dependencies, and installing RabbitMQ and Erlang packages using dnf (yum) on RPM-based systems. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/install-rpm.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` dnf update -y ## install these dependencies from standard OS repositories dnf install -y logrotate ## install RabbitMQ and zero dependency Erlang dnf install -y erlang rabbitmq-server ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring STOMP TCP Listener Port DESCRIPTION: INI configuration to change the STOMP listener port to 12345. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` stomp.listeners.tcp.1 = 12345 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Reinstalling RabbitMQ Formula DESCRIPTION: Complete sequence of commands to properly uninstall, clean up, and reinstall RabbitMQ via Homebrew. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/install-homebrew.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` brew services stop rabbitmq brew uninstall rabbitmq rm -rf /opt/homebrew/etc/rabbitmq/ rm -rf /opt/homebrew/opt/rabbitmq/ rm -rf /opt/homebrew/var/lib/rabbitmq/ rm -f $HOME/Library/LaunchAgents/homebrew.mxcl.rabbitmq.plist brew install rabbitmq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Getting Virtual Host Details using HTTP API DESCRIPTION: Retrieves information about a specific virtual host, including its metadata, using the HTTP API GET endpoint. This allows inspecting the current configuration of a virtual host. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -u userename:pa$sw0rD -X GET http://rabbitmq.local:15672/api/vhosts/qa1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Match Query Syntax DESCRIPTION: Shows the syntax for match queries used with regular expressions in LDAP authentication. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_41 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {match, StringSubQuery, RESubQuery} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Consuming Messages from RabbitMQ Stream with Offset Tracking DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to consume messages from a RabbitMQ stream using offset tracking. It demonstrates restarting a consumer that picks up from where it left off, consuming only the new messages added since the last run. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2021-09-13-rabbitmq-streams-offset-tracking/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` ./mvnw -q compile exec:java -Dexec.mainClass='com.rabbitmq.stream.OffsetTracking$Consume' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Feature Flags in RabbitMQ using Bash DESCRIPTION: This command lists all feature flags and their states in RabbitMQ using the rabbitmqctl CLI tool. It uses the pretty_table formatter for readable output. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/feature-flags/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl -q --formatter pretty_table list_feature_flags ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting RabbitMQ User Permissions DESCRIPTION: Kubernetes manifest for assigning permissions to an existing RabbitMQ user named 'rabbit-user-1' in the root virtual host. The permissions grant full read, write, and configure access using wildcard patterns. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-topology-operator.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` apiVersion: rabbitmq.com/v1beta1 kind: Permission metadata: name: rabbit-user-1-permission namespace: rabbitmq-system spec: vhost: "/" user: "rabbit-user-1" # name of the RabbitMQ user permissions: write: ".*" configure: ".*" read: ".*" rabbitmqClusterReference: name: sample ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring STOMP TCP Listener Port DESCRIPTION: INI configuration to change the STOMP listener port to 12345. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` stomp.listeners.tcp.1 = 12345 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Verifying the RabbitMQ Key Transition Statement DESCRIPTION: Command to download and verify the integrity of the key transition statement. This uses wget to fetch the statement and pipes it to gpg for signature verification. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/static/key-transition-0x0697F46E2DF405B6.txt#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` wget -q -O- https://www.rabbitmq.com/key-transition-0x0697F46E2DF405B6.txt | gpg --verify ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Emitting an Error Log Message with RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This bash command shows how to run the EmitLogDirect program to send an error log message to the RabbitMQ exchange. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-java.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` java -cp $CP EmitLogDirect error "Run. Run. Or it will explode." # => [x] Sent 'error':'Run. Run. Or it will explode.' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring IPv6-Only Listener DESCRIPTION: Example of configuring RabbitMQ to listen only on an IPv6 interface. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` listeners.tcp.1 = fe80::2acf:e9ff:fe17:f97b:5672 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying RabbitMQ Schema Information DESCRIPTION: Lists schema database tables and their properties. This example uses the 'schema_info' action to display the table names and their active replicas. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_44 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl schema_info name active_replicas ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Preparing and Starting Stunnel DESCRIPTION: Commands to prepare certificate files and start stunnel for TLS connection testing. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/troubleshooting-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cat client_key.pem client_certificate.pem > client/key-cert.pem stunnel stunnel.conf ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Blocking Client Connections to a RabbitMQ Virtual Host DESCRIPTION: Command to block all client connections to a specific virtual host by setting the max-connections limit to zero. Uses rabbitmqctl with a JSON configuration parameter. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_vhost_limits -p vhost_name '{"max-connections": 0}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring OAuth 2.0 JWKS URL in RabbitMQ (Erlang) DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to configure the OAuth 2.0 JWKS URL in RabbitMQ using the Erlang format. It sets the resource server ID and the JWKS URL. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [ {rabbitmq_auth_backend_oauth2, [ {resource_server_id, <<"my_rabbit_server">>}, {key_config, [ {jwks_url, <<"https://my-jwt-issuer/jwks.json">>} ]} ]}, ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Putting a Remote Node into Maintenance Mode in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: This command puts a specific remote RabbitMQ node into maintenance mode by using the -n flag to target it. Useful for managing maintenance mode across a cluster from a single control point. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/upgrade.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # puts node rabbit@node2.cluster.rabbitmq.svc into maintenance mode rabbitmq-upgrade drain -n rabbit@node2.cluster.rabbitmq.svc ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Publishing MQTT Message with OAuth Token (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Command to publish an MQTT message using a JWT token for authentication, demonstrating OAuth usage with MQTT protocol. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make start-mqtt-publish TOKEN=$(bin/jwt_token scopes-for-mqtt.json legacy-token-key private.pem public.pem) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring STOMP TCP Listener Port DESCRIPTION: INI configuration to change the STOMP listener port to 12345. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` stomp.listeners.tcp.1 = 12345 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Pause-If-All-Down Partition Handling in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This configuration snippet sets up the pause-if-all-down partition handling strategy, specifying nodes to check and the recovery action. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/partitions.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` cluster_partition_handling = pause_if_all_down ## Recovery strategy. Can be either 'autoheal' or 'ignore' cluster_partition_handling.pause_if_all_down.recover = ignore ## Node names to check cluster_partition_handling.pause_if_all_down.nodes.1 = rabbit@myhost1 cluster_partition_handling.pause_if_all_down.nodes.2 = rabbit@myhost2 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Clearing Policies in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Removes a policy by name. The example demonstrates how to clear the 'federate-me' policy from the default virtual host. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_54 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl clear_policy federate-me ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Log Location with rabbitmq-diagnostics in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: Command to find the current log file location using the rabbitmq-diagnostics CLI tool in PowerShell. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics.bat -q log_location ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring OAuth 2.0 JWKS URL in RabbitMQ (Erlang) DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to configure the OAuth 2.0 JWKS URL in RabbitMQ using the Erlang format. It sets the resource server ID and the JWKS URL. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [ {rabbitmq_auth_backend_oauth2, [ {resource_server_id, <<"my_rabbit_server">>}, {key_config, [ {jwks_url, <<"https://my-jwt-issuer/jwks.json">>} ]} ]}, ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Cache TTL for RabbitMQ Auth Cache DESCRIPTION: Configuration example showing how to set the time-to-live (TTL) for cache items in milliseconds. In this example, LDAP is the cached backend and the cache TTL is set to 5000 milliseconds (5 seconds). SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/auth-cache-backend.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_cache.cached_backend = ldap auth_cache.cache_ttl = 5000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating RabbitMQ Stream Environment DESCRIPTION: Java code for creating a RabbitMQ stream Environment instance. The Environment is the main entry point of the stream Java client and handles connection details. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-java-stream.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` Environment environment = Environment.builder().build(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RPC Client Implementation with RabbitMQ in Go DESCRIPTION: Complete implementation of an RPC client using RabbitMQ in Go. The client creates an exclusive callback queue, sends a request with a correlation ID, and waits for the response matching that ID. It includes utilities for generating random strings and processing command-line arguments. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-six-go.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: go CODE: ``` package main import ( "context" "log" "math/rand" "os" "strconv" "strings" "time" amqp "github.com/rabbitmq/amqp091-go" ) func failOnError(err error, msg string) { if err != nil { log.Panicf("%s: %s", msg, err) } } func randomString(l int) string { bytes := make([]byte, l) for i := 0; i < l; i++ { bytes[i] = byte(randInt(65, 90)) } return string(bytes) } func randInt(min int, max int) int { return min + rand.Intn(max-min) } func fibonacciRPC(n int) (res int, err error) { conn, err := amqp.Dial("amqp://guest:guest@localhost:5672/") failOnError(err, "Failed to connect to RabbitMQ") defer conn.Close() ch, err := conn.Channel() failOnError(err, "Failed to open a channel") defer ch.Close() q, err := ch.QueueDeclare( "", // name false, // durable false, // delete when unused true, // exclusive false, // noWait nil, // arguments ) failOnError(err, "Failed to declare a queue") msgs, err := ch.Consume( q.Name, // queue "", // consumer true, // auto-ack false, // exclusive false, // no-local false, // no-wait nil, // args ) failOnError(err, "Failed to register a consumer") corrId := randomString(32) ctx, cancel := context.WithTimeout(context.Background(), 5*time.Second) defer cancel() err = ch.PublishWithContext(ctx, "", // exchange "rpc_queue", // routing key false, // mandatory false, // immediate amqp.Publishing{ ContentType: "text/plain", CorrelationId: corrId, ReplyTo: q.Name, Body: []byte(strconv.Itoa(n)), }) failOnError(err, "Failed to publish a message") for d := range msgs { if corrId == d.CorrelationId { res, err = strconv.Atoi(string(d.Body)) failOnError(err, "Failed to convert body to integer") break } } return } func main() { rand.Seed(time.Now().UTC().UnixNano()) n := bodyFrom(os.Args) log.Printf(" [x] Requesting fib(%d)", n) res, err := fibonacciRPC(n) failOnError(err, "Failed to handle RPC request") log.Printf(" [.] Got %d", res) } func bodyFrom(args []string) int { var s string if (len(args) < 2) || os.Args[1] == "" { s = "30" } else { s = strings.Join(args[1:], " ") } n, err := strconv.Atoi(s) failOnError(err, "Failed to convert arg to integer") return n } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TLS for OAuth 2.0 Endpoints in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration of TLS variables like cacertfile for the issuer or JWKS URL. This is needed to establish secure connections to the OAuth provider endpoints. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` ... auth_oauth2.https.cacertfile = /opts/certs/cacert.pem ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Host Entries for Local Development DESCRIPTION: Host file entries that need to be added to /etc/hosts for proper DNS resolution in the OAuth 2.0 setup with forward proxy. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples-forward-proxy.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: plain CODE: ``` localhost keycloak rabbitmq forward-proxy ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Alternate Exchange Using Java Client Arguments DESCRIPTION: Java code demonstrating how to set up an alternate exchange using client-provided arguments during exchange declaration. Creates a direct exchange with an alternate fanout exchange and sets up routing queues. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ae.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` Map args = new HashMap(); args.put("alternate-exchange", "my-ae"); channel.exchangeDeclare("my-direct", "direct", false, false, args); channel.exchangeDeclare("my-ae", "fanout"); channel.queueDeclare("routed"); channel.queueBind("routed", "my-direct", "key1"); channel.queueDeclare("unrouted"); channel.queueBind("unrouted", "my-ae", ""); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Alternate Exchange Using Java Client Arguments DESCRIPTION: Java code demonstrating how to set up an alternate exchange using client-provided arguments during exchange declaration. Creates a direct exchange with an alternate fanout exchange and sets up routing queues. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ae.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` Map args = new HashMap(); args.put("alternate-exchange", "my-ae"); channel.exchangeDeclare("my-direct", "direct", false, false, args); channel.exchangeDeclare("my-ae", "fanout"); channel.queueDeclare("routed"); channel.queueBind("routed", "my-direct", "key1"); channel.queueDeclare("unrouted"); channel.queueBind("unrouted", "my-ae", ""); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Source Address for AMQP 1.0 Link in RabbitMQ Shovel Plugin DESCRIPTION: Mandatory configuration that specifies the source address of the AMQP 1.0 link for a Shovel connection. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/shovel-static.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {source_address, <<"my-address">>} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating an Exchange-to-Exchange Binding using POST /api/bindings/{vhost}/e/{source}/e/{destination} DESCRIPTION: This JSON payload is used to create an exchange-to-exchange binding. It includes an optional routing key and additional arguments for the binding. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "routing_key": "my_routing_key", "arguments": { "x-arg": "value" } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: LDAP Peer Verification Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configures peer verification settings for LDAP TLS connections. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # Enables peer certificate chain verification. # This behavior is the default starting with Erlang 26 (and thus RabbitMQ 3.13+)/ auth_ldap.ssl_options.verify = verify_peer ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # Disables peer certificate chain verification. # # Doing so loses one of the key benefits of TLS and make the setup less secure # but also simplifies node configuration. auth_ldap.ssl_options.verify = verify_none ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # if target LDAP server does not present a certificate, should the connection be aborted? auth_ldap.ssl_options.fail_if_no_peer_cert = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Multiple OAuth 2.0 Providers with Resource Servers in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This configuration demonstrates how to set up multiple OAuth 2.0 providers (prod and dev) with corresponding resource servers in RabbitMQ. Each provider has its own issuer URL and certificate file, and the dev resource server uses a custom scope prefix. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_30 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_oauth2.scope_prefix = rabbitmq. auth_oauth2.resource_servers.1.id = rabbit_prod auth_oauth2.resource_servers.1.oauth_provider_id = prod auth_oauth2.resource_servers.2.id = rabbit_dev auth_oauth2.resource_servers.2.oauth_provider_id = dev auth_oauth2.resource_servers.2.scope_prefix = dev-rabbitmq. auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.prod.issuer = https://rabbit_prod:8080 auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.prod.https.cacertfile = /opts/certs/prod.pem auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.dev.issuer = https://rabbit_dev:8080 auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.dev.https.cacertfile = /opts/certs/dev.pem ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running PerfTest with High Confirm Count for AMQP 0.9.1 Quorum Queue Benchmark DESCRIPTION: Java command for benchmarking a quorum queue with AMQP 0.9.1 protocol, using a high confirm count (3000) to allow for a maximum of 3,000 unconfirmed messages in the publisher. The benchmark sends 1 million persistent messages of 12 bytes each. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2024-08-21-amqp-benchmarks/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ java -jar target/perf-test.jar \ --predeclared --exchange amq.default \ --routing-key my-quorum-queue --queue my-quorum-queue \ --flag persistent --flag mandatory \ --pmessages 1000000 --size 12 --confirm 3000 --qos 5000 --multi-ack-every 5000 id: test-085526-136, sending rate avg: 70067 msg/s id: test-085526-136, receiving rate avg: 70067 msg/s id: test-085526-136, consumer latency min/median/75th/95th/99th 8803/33127/40424/53407/62883 µs id: test-085526-136, confirm latency min/median/75th/95th/99th 8551/30323/38317/52103/63131 µs ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Subscribing to RabbitMQ Queue in Objective-C DESCRIPTION: Subscribes to the declared queue and sets up a callback to handle received messages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-objectivec.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: Objective-C CODE: ``` NSLog(@"Waiting for messages."); [q subscribe:^(RMQMessage * _Nonnull message) { NSLog(@"Received %@", [[NSString alloc] initWithData:message.body encoding:NSUTF8StringEncoding]); }]; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Max Length Policy with rabbitmqctl on Windows DESCRIPTION: Windows-specific command for setting a 1MiB queue size limit using rabbitmqctl. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/maxlength/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat set_policy my-pol "^one-meg$" ^ "{""max-length-bytes"":1048576}" ^ --apply-to queues ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Reinstalling RabbitMQ Windows Service DESCRIPTION: PowerShell commands to remove, reinstall, and start the RabbitMQ Windows service. Used when upgrading Erlang or when environment variables have changed. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/windows-configuration.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` .\rabbitmq-service.bat remove .\rabbitmq-service.bat install .\rabbitmq-service.bat start ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Advertised Hosts and Ports for RabbitMQ Stream Protocol DESCRIPTION: Sets up separate advertised hosts and ports for both regular and TLS connections. This is useful when the internal network addresses differ from those that should be advertised to clients. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/stream.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` stream.advertised_host = private-rabbitmq-1 stream.advertised_port = 12345 stream.advertised_tls_host = public-rabbitmq-1 stream.advertised_tls_port = 12344 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Removing Certificate from Mono Trust Store DESCRIPTION: Bash command for removing a certificate from the Mono Trust store on Linux using its unique hash. This is useful for removing certificates that are no longer needed or trusted. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Linux with Mono certmgr -del -c Trust 1F04D1D2C20B97BDD5DB70B9EB2013550697A05E # … snip … Certificate removed from store. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking RabbitMQ Node Status DESCRIPTION: Command to perform a basic health check and display information about the running RabbitMQ node. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/install-windows.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` # A basic health check of both the node and CLI tool connectivity/authentication rabbitmqctl.bat status ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting RabbitMQ Application DESCRIPTION: Command to start the RabbitMQ application on a node. Typically used after performing management actions that require the application to be stopped. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl start_app ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting RabbitMQ Server in Background DESCRIPTION: Command to start the RabbitMQ AMQP server in detached mode (background). When run with the -detached flag, the process runs in the background and the PID is not written to the PID file. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmq-server.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-server -detached ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Global Parameter with String Value in RabbitMQ API DESCRIPTION: JSON payload for setting a global runtime parameter with a string value. This example sets the cluster_name parameter to 'prod-456'. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "name": "cluster_name", "value": "prod-456" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Comprehensive TCP configuration for RabbitMQ high connection churn scenarios DESCRIPTION: This configuration combines TCP fin timeout, keepalive settings, and TIME_WAIT socket reuse to optimize connection handling in RabbitMQ under high connection churn. The settings reduce connection detection time and allow socket reuse when safe. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_32 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` net.ipv4.tcp_fin_timeout = 30 net.ipv4.tcp_keepalive_time=30 net.ipv4.tcp_keepalive_intvl=10 net.ipv4.tcp_keepalive_probes=4 net.ipv4.tcp_tw_reuse = 1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Manual Queue Synchronization Commands DESCRIPTION: Commands to manually synchronize a queue or cancel ongoing synchronization SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ha/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl sync_queue "{name}" ``` LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat sync_queue '{name}' ``` LANGUAGE: batch CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat sync_queue "{name}" ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl cancel_sync_queue "{name}" ``` LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat cancel_sync_queue '{name}' ``` LANGUAGE: batch CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat cancel_sync_queue "{name}" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Viewing PerfTest Producer Logs (Bash) DESCRIPTION: This command shows how to view the logs of the PerfTest producer application running in a Docker container. It uses the docker logs command with the -f flag to follow the log output. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_39 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker logs producer_with_roles -f ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Administrator Tag for a RabbitMQ User DESCRIPTION: Command to grant administrative privileges to a RabbitMQ user by adding the 'administrator' tag. This allows the user to manage other users, virtual hosts, and permissions through management interfaces. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_user_tags janeway administrator ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Federation Status via CLI DESCRIPTION: Command to check federation status of links running on the target node. The output includes details like type, name, vhost, upstream name, status, connection and timestamp. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/federation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl federation_status ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Batch Message Acknowledgement in .NET DESCRIPTION: Shows batch acknowledgement implementation using RabbitMQ .NET client. Uses IModel#BasicAck with multiple flag to acknowledge multiple messages simultaneously. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/confirms.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` var consumer = new EventingBasicConsumer(channel); consumer.Received += (ch, ea) => { var body = ea.Body.ToArray(); // positively acknowledge all deliveries up to // this delivery tag channel.BasicAck(ea.DeliveryTag, true); }; String consumerTag = channel.BasicConsume(queueName, false, consumer); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Core Feature Flags Table Structure DESCRIPTION: HTML table structure showing core RabbitMQ feature flags with their required versions, stability status, names and descriptions. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/feature-flags/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```
Required Stable Feature flag name Description
4.0 rabbitmq_4.0.0 Enables multiple features and changes introduced in RabbitMQ 4.0.
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining MQTT 5.0 to AMQP 1.0 Type Conversion Table in Markdown DESCRIPTION: This markdown table outlines the conversion of MQTT 5.0 data types to AMQP 1.0 types. It includes the original MQTT type, any specific conditions, the corresponding AMQP type, and additional comments for clarity. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/conversions.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | MQTT 5.0 Type | Condition | AMQP 1.0 Type | Comment | | -------------------- | -------------| ------------- | ------------------------------------- | | Bits | | boolean | only selected flags are converted | | ushort | | ushort | | | uint | | uint | | | utf8 | | utf8 | | | binary data | utf8 | utf8 | | | binary data | | binary | | | utf8 string pairs | | map | de-duplicate keys, but maintains order| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Synchronous Message Publishing with Puka DESCRIPTION: This example shows synchronous message publishing using Puka. The code waits for confirmation from the broker that the message has been received before proceeding. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2011-07-08-puka-rethinking-amqp-clients/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` promise = client.basic_publish(exchange='', routing_key='test', body="Hello world!") client.wait(promise) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Channel Maximum in RabbitMQ Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration setting to limit the maximum number of channels that can be opened on a connection. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/channels/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` channel_max = 100 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Prometheus Operator Installation in Kubernetes DESCRIPTION: Command to verify if Prometheus Operator custom resource definitions are installed in the Kubernetes cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/operator-monitoring.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl get customresourcedefinitions.apiextensions.k8s.io servicemonitors.monitoring.coreos.com ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding a Stream Replica in RabbitMQ using Bash DESCRIPTION: This command adds a stream replica on a specified node within a given virtual host. It requires the queue name, node name, and virtual host to be provided. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmq-streams.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-streams add_replica --vhost "a-vhost" "a-queue" "rabbit@new-node" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Event Stream Consumer Command - Bash DESCRIPTION: Streams internal events with configurable duration and pattern matching SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics consume_event_stream -n rabbit@hostname --duration 20 --pattern queue_.* ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: SslContextFactory Interface for Flexible Client Certificate Management DESCRIPTION: Definition of the SslContextFactory interface that allows dynamic selection of client certificates based on connection names. This enables multiple client connections with different certificates in a single JVM process. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2017-09-29-rabbitmq-java-client-5-0-is-released/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` public interface SslContextFactory { SSLContext create(String name); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Sender-selected Distribution with CC Headers in Java DESCRIPTION: This Java code demonstrates how to use the CC header with multiple routing keys in RabbitMQ. It creates a list of routing keys, adds them to a headers map, and then sets this map on the message properties before publishing the message. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2011-03-23-sender-selected-distribution/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` BasicProperties props = new BasicProperties(); Map headers = new HashMap(); List ccList = new ArrayList(); ccList.add("routingkey2"); ccList.add("routingkey3"); headers.put("CC", ccList); props.setHeaders(headers); channel.basicPublish(exchange, "routingkey1", props, payload); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting a Virtual Host using HTTP API DESCRIPTION: Deletes a virtual host named 'vh1' using the HTTP API DELETE endpoint. This performs the same operation as the CLI command but through the REST API. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -u userename:pa$sw0rD -X DELETE http://rabbitmq.local:15672/api/vhosts/vh1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Server Version Check DESCRIPTION: Command to display the target node's version information SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics server_version -q ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Receiving Multiple Log Types with Topic Exchange in Bash DESCRIPTION: This command runs the receive_logs_topic.js script to receive both kernel logs and critical logs by specifying multiple routing key patterns. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-five-javascript.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ./receive_logs_topic.js "kern.*" "*.critical" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying Non-Interactive Output for Scripting DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the --non-interactive flag to get output suitable for parsing in scripts. This produces output without table formatting that is easier to parse programmatically. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin --non-interactive show overview ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ APT Repositories DESCRIPTION: APT repository configuration for RabbitMQ and Erlang packages. Includes primary and redundant mirror sources for both RabbitMQ server and Erlang packages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` deb [arch=amd64 signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/rabbitmq.E495BB49CC4BBE5B.gpg] https://ppa1.rabbitmq.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-erlang/deb/ubuntu jammy main deb-src [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/rabbitmq.E495BB49CC4BBE5B.gpg] https://ppa1.rabbitmq.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-erlang/deb/ubuntu jammy main deb [arch=amd64 signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/rabbitmq.E495BB49CC4BBE5B.gpg] https://ppa2.rabbitmq.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-erlang/deb/ubuntu jammy main deb-src [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/rabbitmq.E495BB49CC4BBE5B.gpg] https://ppa2.rabbitmq.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-erlang/deb/ubuntu jammy main deb [arch=amd64 signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/rabbitmq.9F4587F226208342.gpg] https://ppa1.rabbitmq.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/deb/ubuntu jammy main deb-src [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/rabbitmq.9F4587F226208342.gpg] https://ppa1.rabbitmq.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/deb/ubuntu jammy main deb [arch=amd64 signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/rabbitmq.9F4587F226208342.gpg] https://ppa2.rabbitmq.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/deb/ubuntu jammy main deb-src [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/rabbitmq.9F4587F226208342.gpg] https://ppa2.rabbitmq.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/deb/ubuntu jammy main ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Users in PowerShell with Password as Command Line Argument DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to add a RabbitMQ user using PowerShell by providing the password as a command line argument, including handling special characters in passwords. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` # password is provided as a command line argument rabbitmqctl.bat add_user 'username' '9a55f70a841f18b97c3a7db939b7adc9e34a0f1d' # passwords with special characters must be quoted correctly rabbitmqctl.bat add_user 'username' '"w63pnZ&LnYMO(t"' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Web MQTT Examples Plugin DESCRIPTION: Command to enable the Web MQTT examples plugin which provides sample implementations. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/web-mqtt.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_web_mqtt_examples ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Consuming RabbitMQ Stream from Specific Offset in Java DESCRIPTION: Shows how to consume messages from a stream starting from a specific numerical offset value. Includes required QoS configuration and message acknowledgment. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/streams.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` channel.basicQos(100); // QoS must be specified channel.basicConsume( "my-stream", false, Collections.singletonMap("x-stream-offset", 5000), // offset value (consumerTag, message) -> { // message processing // ... channel.basicAck(message.getEnvelope().getDeliveryTag(), false); // ack is required }, consumerTag -> { }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Basic Authentication for Management HTTP API DESCRIPTION: Configuration to disable HTTP basic authentication for the management HTTP API, enforcing OAuth 2.0 token-based authentication only. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` ... management.disable_basic_auth = true ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example Output for Successful TLSv1.3 Connection DESCRIPTION: Sample output from OpenSSL showing successful TLSv1.3 connection negotiation with the TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384 cipher suite. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_30 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` New, TLSv1.3, Cipher is TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting a Combined Federation and TTL Policy in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to set a policy named 'ttl-fed' that applies to queues with names starting with 'tf.'. The policy combines federation settings with a message TTL of 60000 milliseconds and has a priority of 1. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/parameters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy ttl-fed \ "^tf\." '{"federation-upstream-set":"all", "message-ttl":60000}' \ --priority 1 \ --apply-to queues ``` LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy ttl-fed ^ "^tf\." "{""federation-upstream-set"":""all"", ""message-ttl"":60000}" ^ --priority 1 ^ --apply-to queues ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` PUT /api/policies/%2f/ttl-fed {"pattern": "^tf\.", "definition": {"federation-upstream-set":"all", "message-ttl":60000}, "priority": 1, "apply-to": "queues"} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking RabbitMQ Node Status in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: Shows how to check the status of a RabbitMQ node using the rabbitmq-diagnostics tool in PowerShell, with an optional node specification. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics .bat status rabbitmq-diagnostics .bat status --node rabbit@target-hostname.local ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Customizing Syslog Service IP and Port in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to configure a custom IP address and port for Syslog logging in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.syslog = true log.syslog.ip = 10.10.10.10 log.syslog.port = 1514 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Connecting to RabbitMQ Using URI DESCRIPTION: Shows an alternative method of connecting to RabbitMQ using a URI string. This approach allows specifying connection details in a single string format. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/java-api-guide.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Java CODE: ``` ConnectionFactory factory = new ConnectionFactory(); factory.setUri("amqp://userName:password@hostName:portNumber/virtualHost"); Connection conn = factory.newConnection(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Verifying Configuration File Location in RabbitMQ Log DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how the active configuration file location appears in the RabbitMQ log file. It includes examples of successful and failed configuration file loading. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` node : rabbit@example home dir : /var/lib/rabbitmq config file(s) : /etc/rabbitmq/advanced.config : /etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.conf ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` node : rabbit@example home dir : /var/lib/rabbitmq config file(s) : /var/lib/rabbitmq/hare.conf (not found) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding a RabbitMQ User with Special Password Handling in Bash DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to add a user with a password that starts with dashes by using the double hyphen separator to prevent option parsing confusion. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl add_user --node rabbit@host1.messaging.eng.coolcorporation.banana -- "a-user" "--!a-pa$$w0rd" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Customizing Encryption Settings in RabbitMQ (Erlang) DESCRIPTION: Shows how to customize encryption settings in RabbitMQ's configuration, including cipher, hash function, and iteration count. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_58 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [ {rabbit, [ ... {config_entry_decoder, [ {passphrase, "mypassphrase"}, {cipher, blowfish_cfb64}, {hash, sha256}, {iterations, 10000} ]} ]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Clearing Virtual Host Limits DESCRIPTION: Removes all configured limits from a specified virtual host. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_55 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl clear_vhost_limits -p qa_env ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Message Acknowledgement Modes DESCRIPTION: Available acknowledgement modes for AMQP 1.0 Shovel including on-confirm, on-publish, and no-ack. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/shovel-dynamic.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: code CODE: ``` on-confirm on-publish no-ack ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Management Plugin Interface in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Specifies which network interface the RabbitMQ management plugin will bind to. Using 0.0.0.0 makes it listen on all available interfaces. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.tcp.ip = 0.0.0.0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Kubernetes Service Name DESCRIPTION: Configuration for overriding the default Kubernetes service name for RabbitMQ SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = k8s cluster_formation.k8s.host = kubernetes.default.example.local cluster_formation.k8s.token_path = /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/token cluster_formation.k8s.cert_path = /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/ca.crt cluster_formation.k8s.namespace_path = /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/namespace # overrides Kubernetes service name. Default value is "rabbitmq". cluster_formation.k8s.service_name = rmq-qa ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring DLX via Policy using Bash DESCRIPTION: Sets up a dead letter exchange policy named 'DLX' that applies to all queues using rabbitmqctl in bash. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/dlx.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy DLX ".*" '{"dead-letter-exchange":"my-dlx"}' --apply-to queues --priority 7 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Parsing AMQP URLs in Ruby AMQP 0.7 DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates the new AMQP URL parsing feature, which allows users to provide a URL instead of an option hash when connecting to an AMQP server. It shows examples of parsing both SSL and non-SSL URLs. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2011-01-19-ruby-amqp-0-7-released/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: Ruby CODE: ``` AMQP.start("amqps:/") # Will resolve to: {vhost: "/", port: 5671, ssl: true} AMQP.start("amqp://botanicus@localhost:1111/") # Will resolve to: {user: "botanicus", vhost: "/", host: "localhost", port: 1111, ssl: false} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring Dynamic Shovel using rabbitmqctl (Bash) DESCRIPTION: This command uses rabbitmqctl to set up a dynamic shovel named 'my-shovel' that transfers messages from a source queue to a target queue on a remote server using AMQP 0-9-1 protocol. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/shovel-dynamic.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_parameter shovel my-shovel \ '{"src-protocol": "amqp091", "src-uri": "amqp://", "src-queue": "source-queue", "dest-protocol": "amqp091", "dest-uri": "amqp://remote-server", "dest-queue": "target-queue", "dest-queue-args": {"x-queue-type": "quorum"}}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running RabbitMQ RPC Server and Client DESCRIPTION: Command line instructions for running the RPC server and client components. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-six-ruby.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ruby rpc_server.rb # => [x] Awaiting RPC requests ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ruby rpc_client.rb # => [x] Requesting fib(30) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Error Log for Guest User Remote Connection Rejection DESCRIPTION: Example log message showing rejection of remote connection attempt using the default guest user account. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` [error] <0.918.0> PLAIN login refused: user 'guest' can only connect via localhost ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Analyzing Memory Usage in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Displays a breakdown of memory usage by category on the node, with the option to specify the memory unit (bytes, megabytes, gigabytes, terabytes). SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics memory_breakdown --unit gigabytes ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Decoding Encrypted Values with rabbitmqctl on Unix Systems DESCRIPTION: Examples of decoding encrypted values using rabbitmqctl on Unix-based systems with the same passphrase used for encryption. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_54 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl decode '{encrypted, <<"...">>}' mypassphrase # => <<"guest">> rabbitmqctl decode '{encrypted, <<"...">>}' mypassphrase # => "amqp://fred:secret@host1.domain/my_vhost" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring JSON Formatting for File Logging in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets up file logging with 'info' level and JSON formatting in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_20 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.file.level = info log.file.formatter = json ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring AMQP Listener with Specific IP and Port in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to configure the AMQP 0-9-1 and AMQP 1.0 listener to use a specific IP address and the standard port in RabbitMQ configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` listeners.tcp.1 = 192.168.1.99:5672 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring AMQP Listener with Specific IP and Port in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to configure the AMQP 0-9-1 and AMQP 1.0 listener to use a specific IP address and the standard port in RabbitMQ configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` listeners.tcp.1 = 192.168.1.99:5672 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Default Queue Type for a Virtual Host using rabbitmqctl DESCRIPTION: Creates a virtual host with quorum queues as the default queue type along with additional metadata. This affects how queues are created when clients don't specify a queue type explicitly. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl add_vhost qa1 --description "QA environment 1" --default-queue-type quorum --tags qa,project-a ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Clearing User Limits with curl DESCRIPTION: These curl commands demonstrate how to clear maximum channels and connections limits for user1 using the HTTP API.
