SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/user-limits.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -v -u guest:guest -X DELETE http://localhost:15672/api/user-limits/user1/max-channels curl -v -u guest:guest -X DELETE http://localhost:15672/api/user-limits/user1/max-connections ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Channel Negotiation Error Message DESCRIPTION: Displays the error message when a client attempts to negotiate a higher channel limit than the server's configured maximum. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/channels/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` 2019-02-11 16:03:16.543 [error] <0.882.0> closing AMQP connection <0.882.0> (127.0.0.1:49911 -> 127.0.0.1:5672): failed to negotiate connection parameters: negotiated channel_max = 2047 is higher than the maximum allowed value (32) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Basic RabbitMQ Alarms Check Command in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to list resource alarms in a RabbitMQ cluster. This can be used to identify resource-related issues that might affect node or cluster performance. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics alarms ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining the echo field in AMQP 1.0 flow frame DESCRIPTION: XML definition of the echo field in AMQP 1.0 flow frame. The echo field is a boolean that defaults to false and is used by the consumer to request the sender to reply with a flow frame, useful for confirming flow state changes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2024-09-02-amqp-flow-control/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: xml CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Local Alarms in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Health check that fails if there are alarms in effect on the target node. This command is useful for monitoring the health status of a RabbitMQ node. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics check_local_alarms ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Nginx Reverse Proxy Configuration for RabbitMQ API DESCRIPTION: Nginx configuration for proxying requests to RabbitMQ HTTP API with proper URI handling. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: nginxconf CODE: ``` location / { proxy_pass http://rabbitmq-host:15672; } location ~* /rabbitmq/api/(.*?)/(.*) { proxy_pass http://rabbitmq-host:15672/api/$1/%2F/$2?$query_string; } location ~* /rabbitmq/(.*) { rewrite ^/rabbitmq/(.*)$ /$1 break; proxy_pass http://rabbitmq-host:15672; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Connecting to RabbitMQ Stream DESCRIPTION: Code to establish a connection to a RabbitMQ Stream server with authentication details and connection parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-javascript-stream.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const client = await rabbit.connect({ hostname: "localhost", port: 5552, username: "guest", password: "guest", vhost: "/", }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Advertised Host and Port for Stream Protocol in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This configuration specifies the advertised host and port information that a broker node returns when asked about the topology of streams, useful for deployments with proxies or containers. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/stream.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` stream.advertised_host = rabbitmq-1 stream.advertised_port = 12345 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example Output for Successful TLSv1.2 Connection DESCRIPTION: Sample output from OpenSSL showing successful TLSv1.2 connection negotiation with the ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 cipher suite. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_32 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` SSL-Session: Protocol : TLSv1.2 Cipher : ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Certificates in Windows Trust Store DESCRIPTION: PowerShell command to list all certificates in the Windows Root certificate store. This allows verification that certificates were correctly imported. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` certmgr -all -s Root # … snip … Self-signed X.509 v3 Certificate Serial Number: AC3F2B74ECDD9EEA00 Issuer Name: CN=MyTestCA Subject Name: CN=MyTestCA valid From: 25/08/2018 14:03:01 valid Until: 24/09/2018 14:03:01 Unique Hash: 1F04D1D2C20B97BDD5DB70B9EB2013550697A05E ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Pinging RabbitMQ Node DESCRIPTION: Command to check if a RabbitMQ node is up and responsive at a specific hostname. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_42 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl ping -n rabbit@hostname ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Daily Log Rotation at a Specific Hour DESCRIPTION: Configuration example showing how to set up daily log file rotation at 11:00 PM. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # rotate every day at 23:00 (11:00 p.m.) log.file.rotation.date = $D23 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Rebalancing Queue Replicas in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to rebalance queue leader replicas across cluster nodes. Supports different queue types (all, quorum, classic, stream) with vhost and queue pattern matching. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmq-queues.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-queues rebalance "all" --vhost-pattern "a-vhost" --queue-pattern ".*" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Shrinking Quorum Queue Clusters in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to remove queue members (replicas) from a specified node in the cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmq-queues.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-queues shrink "rabbit@decomissioned-node" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Forced Removal of Unknown Nodes in RabbitMQ Cluster DESCRIPTION: Configuration setting to forcefully remove cluster members that are unknown to the peer discovery backend. This setting should be used with great care as removed nodes won't be able to rejoin the cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_47 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # Forcefully remove cluster members unknown to the peer discovery backend. Once removed, # the nodes won't be able to rejoin. Use this mode with great care! # # This setting can only be used if a compatible peer discovery plugin is enabled. cluster_formation.node_cleanup.only_log_warning = false ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying ssl_hash Property in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Shows the SSL hash function (e.g., "sha") used for a secure RabbitMQ connection. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_87 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ssl_hash ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking and Enabling Feature Flags in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to enable all stable feature flags in RabbitMQ. This should be run both before and after upgrades to ensure all features are active. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/rolling-upgrade.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl enable_feature_flag all ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TLS Handshake Timeout in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration for setting the TLS handshake timeout in milliseconds when TLS is enabled. This helps prevent connection failures during TLS negotiation in slower networks. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_33 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` ssl_handshake_timeout = 10000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Mirroring Policy for Two Nodes via HTTP API DESCRIPTION: HTTP API request to set a policy that mirrors queues with names starting with "two." to exactly two nodes in the cluster, with automatic synchronization. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ha/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` PUT /api/policies/%2f/ha-two { "pattern":"^two\.", "definition": { "ha-mode":"exactly", "ha-params":2, "ha-sync-mode":"automatic" } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Hash Functions in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to list all hash functions supported by RabbitMQ encoding commands. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_38 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_hashes ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Testing Authentication with rabbitmqctl in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: This PowerShell command demonstrates how to use rabbitmqctl to test authentication, showing the proper syntax for handling special characters in passwords. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_24 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat authenticate_user 'a-username' '"a/p&assword"' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TCP Keepalives in sysctl for RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows sysctl configuration for TCP keepalives to detect dead or unreachable TCP connections after 70 seconds. It sets the idle time, interval, and number of probes for TCP keepalive checks. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_34 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` net.ipv4.tcp_keepalive_time=30 net.ipv4.tcp_keepalive_intvl=10 net.ipv4.tcp_keepalive_probes=4 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting CLI Aliases File Environment Variable in Bash DESCRIPTION: Sets the RABBITMQ_CLI_ALIASES_FILE environment variable to specify the location of the CLI aliases configuration file. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` export RABBITMQ_CLI_ALIASES_FILE=/path/to/cli_aliases.conf ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TLS-enabled Shovel with Curl in Bash DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use curl to configure a Shovel with TLS-enabled destination URI. It sets up a connection from a non-TLS source to a TLS-enabled destination with peer verification disabled. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/shovel.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Note: this user's access is limited to localhost. # # In the following example, the source URI connects to `localhost` and does not use TLS # while the destination URI is modified to use TLS with peer verification disabled # for simplicity curl -v -u guest:guest -X PUT http://localhost:15672/api/parameters/shovel/%2f/my-shovel \ -H "content-type: application/json" \ -d @- < ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins --offline enable rabbitmq_peer_discovery_k8s ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Peeking Queue Messages in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to view message details at a specific position in a quorum queue. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmq-queues.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-queues peek --vhost "a-vhost" "a-queue" "1" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Debug Logging Level in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration examples for enabling debug logging to file and console output in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.file.level = debug ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.console = true log.console.level = debug ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.file.level = debug log.connection.level = info log.channel.level = info ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Password Hashing Algorithm in Erlang for RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: To add a new password hashing algorithm to RabbitMQ, implement the rabbit_password_hashing.erl behavior. This requires defining a hash/1 function to provide custom password hashing functionality. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2015-12-28-whats-new-in-rabbitmq-3-6-0/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` rabbit_password_hashing.erl ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Default Virtual Host in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to configure the default virtual host in the rabbitmq.conf file. It sets the default_vhost to the root ('/') virtual host. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/amqp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` default_vhost = / ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Classic Format LDAP Configuration DESCRIPTION: Complete LDAP configuration using classic config format combining authentication and authorization settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_37 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [ {rabbit, [{auth_backends, [rabbit_auth_backend_ldap]}]}, {rabbitmq_auth_backend_ldap, [ {servers, ["my-ldap-server"]}, {user_dn_pattern, "cn=${username},ou=People,dc=example,dc=com"}, {use_ssl, false}, {port, 389}, {log, false}, {vhost_access_query, {in_group, "ou=${vhost}-users,ou=vhosts,dc=example,dc=com"}}, {resource_access_query, {for, [{permission, configure, {in_group, "cn=admin,dc=example,dc=com"}}, {permission, write, {for, [{resource, queue, {in_group, "cn=admin,dc=example,dc=com"}}, {resource, exchange, {constant, true}}]}}, {permission, read, {for, [{resource, exchange, {in_group, "cn=admin,dc=example,dc=com"}}, {resource, queue, {constant, true}}]}} ] }}, {topic_access_query, {for, [{permission, write, {match, {string, "${routing_key}"}, {string, "^a"}}}, {permission, read, {constant, true}} ] }}, {tag_queries, [{administrator, {constant, false}}, {management, {constant, true}}]} ] } ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building RabbitMQ Server DESCRIPTION: Command to build the RabbitMQ server and all included plugins using GNU Make after changing to the rabbitmq directory. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/build-server.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cd rabbitmq make ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Topic Permissions in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Sets user topic permissions for a specific exchange in a virtual host. This command allows user 'janeway' to publish and consume messages with routing keys starting with 'janeway-' on the 'amq.topic' exchange in 'my-vhost'. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_31 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_topic_permissions -p my-vhost janeway amq.topic "^janeway-.*" "^janeway-.*" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Server Hostname Verification with Java RabbitMQ Client DESCRIPTION: Java example demonstrating how to enable hostname verification when connecting to RabbitMQ via TLS. This ensures the server certificate was issued for the hostname the client is connecting to, providing an additional layer of security. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` import java.io.*; import java.security.*; import javax.net.ssl.*; import com.rabbitmq.client.*; public class Example2 { public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception { char[] keyPassphrase = "MySecretPassword".toCharArray(); KeyStore ks = KeyStore.getInstance("PKCS12"); ks.load(new FileInputStream("/path/to/client_key.p12"), keyPassphrase); KeyManagerFactory kmf = KeyManagerFactory.getInstance("SunX509"); kmf.init(ks, keyPassphrase); char[] trustPassphrase = "rabbitstore".toCharArray(); KeyStore tks = KeyStore.getInstance("JKS"); tks.load(new FileInputStream("/path/to/trustStore"), trustPassphrase); TrustManagerFactory tmf = TrustManagerFactory.getInstance("SunX509"); tmf.init(tks); SSLContext c = SSLContext.getInstance("TLSv1.2"); c.init(kmf.getKeyManagers(), tmf.getTrustManagers(), null); ConnectionFactory factory = new ConnectionFactory(); factory.setHost("localhost"); factory.setPort(5671); factory.useSslProtocol(c); factory.enableHostnameVerification(); // this connection will both perform peer verification // and server hostname verification Connection conn = factory.newConnection(); // snip ... } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Cross-origin Resource Sharing with Specific Origins in RabbitMQ Management DESCRIPTION: Sets up Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) by whitelisting specific origins that are allowed to access the management UI API from different domains. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_36 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.cors.allow_origins.1 = https://origin1.org management.cors.allow_origins.2 = https://origin2.org ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Applying Federation Policy for All Upstreams in Bash DESCRIPTION: This command sets a policy to apply all federation upstreams to exchanges or queues with names starting with 'federated.' SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/federation-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy federate-me '^federated\.' '{"federation-upstream-set":"all"}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TCP FIN Timeout in Linux DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to set the TCP FIN timeout to 30 seconds in Linux. This can help reduce the amount of time connections spend in the TIME_WAIT state, which is beneficial in high connection churn scenarios. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_31 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` net.ipv4.tcp_fin_timeout = 30 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing RabbitMQ Queue Statistics DESCRIPTION: This command provides detailed statistics about RabbitMQ queues, including their type, message counts, and state. It's useful for monitoring the health and status of queues after operations or troubleshooting. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2022-03-29-at-least-once-dead-lettering/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: zsh CODE: ``` kubectl exec my-rabbit-server-0 -c rabbitmq -- rabbitmqctl list_queues --formatter=pretty_table --quiet \ name type messages messages_ready messages_unacknowledged state ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Activating Console Logging in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This configuration snippet enables logging to the console (standard output) in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.console = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Clean Connection Closure Log Example DESCRIPTION: Example log entry showing a gracefully closed AMQP connection. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_35 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` 2018-06-17 06:23:29.855 [info] <0.634.0> closing AMQP connection <0.634.0> (127.0.0.1:58588 -> 127.0.0.1:5672, vhost: '/', user: 'guest') ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: LDAP as Exclusive Auth Backend in advanced.config Format DESCRIPTION: Erlang format configuration for using LDAP as the only authentication and authorization backend. This is the equivalent of the ini-style configuration but using advanced.config format. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {rabbit, [ {auth_backends, [rabbit_auth_backend_ldap]} ]} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Managing Vhost-Scoped Parameters via RabbitMQ HTTP API DESCRIPTION: HTTP API endpoints for managing vhost-scoped parameters in RabbitMQ. These endpoints allow setting, deleting, and retrieving parameters tied to specific virtual hosts. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/parameters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` PUT /api/parameters/{component_name}/{vhost}/{name} DELETE /api/parameters/{component_name}/{vhost}/{name} GET /api/parameters ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting Durable Subscription in STOMP DESCRIPTION: STOMP frame example demonstrating how to permanently delete a durable subscription. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` UNSUBSCRIBE id:1234 durable:true auto-delete:false ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Certificate to Mono System-Wide Trust Store on Linux DESCRIPTION: Bash command to add a certificate to the Mono system-wide Trust certificate store on Linux. This makes the certificate available to all users on the machine. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_20 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Linux with Mono certmgr -add -c -m Trust /path/to/cacert.cer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Force Resetting Node DESCRIPTION: Deprecated command that forcefully returns a RabbitMQ node to its virgin state, regardless of current database state and cluster configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl force_reset ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Executing cURL Request with JWT Token for RabbitMQ Management API DESCRIPTION: This command launches a browser with the mgt_api_client credentials and a JWT token to access the RabbitMQ management API overview. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make curl-uaa url=http://localhost:15672/api/overview client_id=mgt_api_client secret=mgt_api_client ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: LDAP Other Bind Configuration in INI Format DESCRIPTION: Configuration for LDAP binding credentials used in authorization queries. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_ldap.other_bind.user_dn = a-username auth_ldap.other_bind.password = a-password ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Secure OAuth2 Authentication with TLS in RabbitMQ .NET Client DESCRIPTION: Shows how to configure OAuth2 authentication with TLS support for production environments, including custom HTTP client handler configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/dotnet-api-guide.md#2025-04-09_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` HttpClientHandler httpClientHandler = buildHttpClientHandlerWithTLSEnabled(); var tokenEndpointUri = new Uri("https://somedomain.com/token"); var oAuth2ClientBuilder = new OAuth2ClientBuilder("client_id", "client_secret", tokenEndpointUri) oAuth2ClientBuilder.SetHttpClientHandler(httpClientHandler); var oAuth2Client = await oAuth2ClientBuilder.BuildAsync(); ICredentialsProvider credentialsProvider = new OAuth2ClientCredentialsProvider("prod-uaa-1", oAuth2Client); var connectionFactory = new ConnectionFactory { CredentialsProvider = credentialsProvider }; var connection = await connectionFactory.CreateConnectionAsync(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Queues DESCRIPTION: Shows how to list queues across all virtual hosts or in a specific virtual host. These commands display information about existing queues in the system. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin list queues ``` LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin --vhost "monitoring" list queues ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using RPC Client in Ruby with RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to use a simple RPC client class to request Fibonacci calculations. The client exposes a call method that sends the request and waits for the response. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-six-ruby.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` client = FibonacciClient.new('rpc_queue') puts ' [x] Requesting fib(30)' response = client.call(30) puts " [.] Got #{response}" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Dual Stack IPv4/IPv6 Listeners DESCRIPTION: Sets up RabbitMQ to listen on both IPv4 and IPv6 localhost interfaces. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` listeners.tcp.1 = 127.0.0.1:5672 listeners.tcp.2 = ::1:5672 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Publishing to a Named Exchange in Objective-C DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to publish a message to a named fanout exchange instead of the default exchange. This allows for broadcasting messages to multiple consumers. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-objectivec.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: objectivec CODE: ``` RMQExchange *x = [ch fanout:@"logs"]; [x publish:[msg dataUsingEncoding:NSUTF8StringEncoding]]; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Rebalancing Queue Leaders in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to redistribute queue and stream leader replicas across all cluster nodes. Useful after a rolling upgrade to ensure even distribution of load. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/upgrade.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-queues rebalance all ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Publishing Messages to a Work Queue in Go DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to publish messages to a RabbitMQ work queue with a persistent delivery mode. The message body is obtained from command line arguments, allowing for arbitrary task descriptions. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-go.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: go CODE: ``` ctx, cancel := context.WithTimeout(context.Background(), 5*time.Second) defer cancel() body := bodyFrom(os.Args) err = ch.PublishWithContext(ctx, "", // exchange q.Name, // routing key false, // mandatory false, amqp.Publishing { DeliveryMode: amqp.Persistent, ContentType: "text/plain", Body: []byte(body), }) failOnError(err, "Failed to publish a message") log.Printf(" [x] Sent %s", body) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Log Location in Shell DESCRIPTION: Command to query the current log file location using rabbitmq-diagnostics CLI tool. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics -q log_location ``` LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics.bat -q log_location ``` LANGUAGE: batch CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics.bat -q log_location ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Exchanges in rabbitmqadmin DESCRIPTION: These commands demonstrate how to list exchanges, including listing exchanges in a specific virtual host using rabbitmqadmin v2. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin list exchanges ``` LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin --vhost "events" list exchanges ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Removing Node from RabbitMQ Cluster DESCRIPTION: Series of commands to safely remove a node from a RabbitMQ cluster by stopping the application, resetting the node, and restarting it as a standalone instance. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/metadata-store/clustering.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Stop RabbitMQ without stopping the runtime (its OS process). rabbitmqctl stop_app # Reset it. rabbitmqctl reset # Restart the node as a blank one. rabbitmqctl start_app ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Combined Federation and TTL Policy in RabbitMQ via Bash DESCRIPTION: Uses rabbitmqctl to set a policy that combines federation and message TTL settings for queues with names starting with 'tf.', setting both federation upstreams and a 60-second message TTL with priority 1. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/parameters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy ttl-fed \ "^tf\." '{"federation-upstream-set":"all", "message-ttl":60000}' \ --priority 1 \ --apply-to queues ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting User Limits via HTTP API DESCRIPTION: This HTTP API endpoint is used to set user limits. It requires the username and limit type in the URL, with the limit value in the request body. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/user-limits.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` PUT /api/user-limits/{username}/{limit} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Regular Expression Password Validator in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration example for setting up a credential validator that uses a regular expression to validate passwords. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/passwords.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` credential_validator.validation_backend = rabbit_credential_validator_password_regexp credential_validator.regexp = ^[a-bA-Z0-9$]{20,100} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Binding using POST /api/bindings/{vhost}/e/{exchange}/q/{queue} DESCRIPTION: This JSON payload is used to bind a queue to an exchange. It includes an optional routing key and additional arguments for the binding. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "routing_key": "my_routing_key", "arguments": {"x-optional-arg": "optional-value"} } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining the properties field in AMQP 1.0 flow frame DESCRIPTION: XML definition of the properties field in AMQP 1.0 flow frame. The properties field allows carrying application-specific link state properties, providing extensibility to the flow control mechanism. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2024-09-02-amqp-flow-control/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: xml CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Login Session Timeout Configuration DESCRIPTION: Sets the web UI login session timeout duration in minutes SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_37 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.login_session_timeout = 60 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: AMQP 1.0 SASL Authentication Options DESCRIPTION: Valid SASL authentication options for AMQP 1.0 connections. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/shovel-dynamic.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: code CODE: ``` anon none plain ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running the Producer DESCRIPTION: Command to run the send.exs script using Mix with expected output. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-elixir.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` mix run send.exs # => [x] Sent 'Hello World!' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TCP Listener with Specific IP DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to configure AMQP listener to use a specific IP address and the standard port 5672. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` listeners.tcp.1 = 192.168.1.99:5672 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Certificate to Mono Trust Certificate Store DESCRIPTION: Bash command to add a CA certificate to the Mono Trust certificate store using the certmgr tool on Linux systems. This enables .NET applications on Mono to trust servers presenting certificates signed by this CA. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Linux with Mono certmgr -add -c Trust /path/to/cacert.cer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Viewing RabbitMQ Service Logs DESCRIPTION: Commands for inspecting RabbitMQ service logs using journalctl on systemd-based systems. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_30 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` journalctl --system ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo journalctl --system | grep rabbitmq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting queue-length Delete Mode for AMQP 0-9-1 Shovel Auto-deletion DESCRIPTION: The queue-length delete mode causes the shovel to measure the initial source queue length and delete itself after transferring that exact number of messages. Useful for one-time queue transfers. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/shovel-dynamic.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` queue-length ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Queue Declaration Example with rabbitmqadmin v2 DESCRIPTION: Example of declaring a queue using rabbitmqadmin v2 with its --snake-case argument format. This shows the current syntax for creating a durable quorum queue in a specific virtual host. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_32 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` # Note: --auto-delete rabbitmqadmin --vhost "vh-2" declare queue --name "qq.1" --type "quorum" --durable true --auto-delete false ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Manual Package Installation with Dependencies DESCRIPTION: Script for manually installing RabbitMQ using dpkg, including dependency installation and package download. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # sync package metadata sudo apt-get update # install dependencies manually sudo apt-get -y install logrotate init-system-helpers adduser # download the package sudo apt-get -y install wget wget ${RabbitMQServerPackageURL({packageType: 'debian'})} # install the package with dpkg sudo dpkg -i ${RabbitMQServerPackageFilename({packageType: 'debian'})} rm ${RabbitMQServerPackageFilename({packageType: 'debian'})} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying TLS Certificates in RabbitMQ with Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to display TLS certificates for every listener on the target RabbitMQ node that is configured to use TLS. This helps with troubleshooting SSL/TLS configuration issues. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics certificates ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ TLS Configuration - Classic Erlang Format DESCRIPTION: Example of TLS configuration using the classic Erlang terms format, showing SSL version and certificate settings configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2018-02-05-whats-new-in-rabbitmq-3-7/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [ {ssl, [{versions, ['tlsv1.2', 'tlsv1.1']}]}, {rabbit, [ {ssl_listeners, [5671]}, {ssl_options, [{cacertfile,"/path/to/ca_certificate.pem"}, {certfile, "/path/to/server_certificate.pem"}, {keyfile, "/path/to/server_key.pem"}, {versions, ['tlsv1.2', 'tlsv1.1']} ]} ]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Increasing Initial Frame Size in rabbitmq.conf for OAuth 2.0 JWT Tokens DESCRIPTION: Configuration example that increases the initial frame size limit to 8192 bytes (from the default of 4096 bytes) to accommodate larger JWT tokens in the AMQP connection handshake. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/troubleshooting-oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` initial_frame_max = 8192 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting LDAP Connection Idle Timeout DESCRIPTION: Configuration for setting the idle timeout of LDAP connections in the pool. Connections without activity will be closed after this period to free up resources. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_ldap.servers.1 = ldap.eng.megacorp.local auth_ldap.servers.2 = 192.168.0.100 auth_ldap.connection_pool_size = 256 # 300 seconds in milliseconds auth_ldap.idle_timeout = 300000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Federation Upstream in RabbitMQ (PowerShell) DESCRIPTION: PowerShell version of the federation upstream configuration command with proper escaping for Windows environments. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/federated-exchanges/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat set_parameter federation-upstream origin '"{""uri":""amqp://remote-host.local:5672""}"' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Cipher Suites (New Style Config) DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to configure TLS options including cipher suites in the new style RabbitMQ configuration format. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_36 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` listeners.ssl.1 = 5671 ssl_options.cacertfile = /path/to/ca_certificate.pem ssl_options.certfile = /path/to/server_certificate.pem ssl_options.keyfile = /path/to/server_key.pem ssl_options.versions.1 = tlsv1.2 ssl_options.verify = verify_peer ssl_options.fail_if_no_peer_cert = false ssl_options.ciphers.1 = ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 ssl_options.ciphers.2 = ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 ssl_options.ciphers.3 = ECDH-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 ssl_options.ciphers.4 = ECDH-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 ssl_options.ciphers.5 = DHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 ssl_options.ciphers.6 = DHE-DSS-AES256-GCM-SHA384 ssl_options.ciphers.7 = ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256 ssl_options.ciphers.8 = ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256 ssl_options.ciphers.9 = ECDH-ECDSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256 ssl_options.ciphers.10 = ECDH-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256 ssl_options.ciphers.11 = DHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256 ssl_options.ciphers.12 = DHE-DSS-AES128-GCM-SHA256 # these MUST be disabled if TLSv1.3 is used ssl_options.honor_cipher_order = true ssl_options.honor_ecc_order = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Reconnection Delay DESCRIPTION: Configures the delay duration in seconds before attempting to reconnect after a connection failure. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/shovel-static.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {reconnect_delay, 5} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Raft Segment File Entry Count for Small Messages in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This configuration increases the number of Raft log entries allowed in a segment file, which can be beneficial for workloads with small messages and higher message rates. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/quorum-queues/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # Positive values up to 65535 are allowed, the default is 4096. # This value is reasonable for workloads with small (say, smaller than 8 kiB) messages raft.segment_max_entries = 32768 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Stream Status Check Command Example DESCRIPTION: Example command showing how to check the status of a stream in a specific virtual host using the rabbitmq-streams CLI tool SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmq-streams.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-streams stream_status --vhost "a-vhost" "a-stream" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running MQTT Latency Benchmark for QoS 0 DESCRIPTION: Command to run the mqtt-bm-latency benchmark tool for QoS 0 messages. It simulates 100 publisher-subscriber pairs sending 10,000 messages each with no delivery guarantees. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2023-03-21-native-mqtt/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ./mqtt-bm-latency -clients 100 -count 10000 -pubqos 0 -subqos 0 -size 100 -keepalive 120 -topic t ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running the Consumer Example for RabbitMQ Streams DESCRIPTION: Shell command to run the consumer application using Maven. This will read all messages from the RabbitMQ stream without removing them, allowing for multiple reads of the same data. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2021-07-19-rabbitmq-streams-first-application/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` ./mvnw -q compile exec:java -Dexec.mainClass='com.rabbitmq.stream.FirstApplication$Consume' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Stream Status Check Command Example DESCRIPTION: Example command showing how to check the status of a stream in a specific virtual host using the rabbitmq-streams CLI tool SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmq-streams.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-streams stream_status --vhost "a-vhost" "a-stream" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Stream Status Check Command Example DESCRIPTION: Example command showing how to check the status of a stream in a specific virtual host using the rabbitmq-streams CLI tool SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmq-streams.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-streams stream_status --vhost "a-vhost" "a-stream" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring MacOS Firewall for Erlang CLI Tools DESCRIPTION: Commands to allow Erlang CLI tools and shell to bind to ports and accept inbound connections through the MacOS Application Firewall. These commands add and unblock the Erlang runtime in the firewall rules. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_35 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo /usr/libexec/ApplicationFirewall/socketfilterfw --add /usr/local/Cellar/erlang/{version}/lib/erlang/bin/erl sudo /usr/libexec/ApplicationFirewall/socketfilterfw --unblockapp /usr/local/Cellar/erlang/{version}/lib/erlang/bin/erl ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing RabbitMQ Virtual Host Definitions DESCRIPTION: Command to import modified definitions into a new virtual host. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2023-03-02-quorum-queues-migration/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin import -V NEW_VHOST NEW_VHOST.json ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Prometheus Metrics for Authentication Attempts (Plaintext) DESCRIPTION: Example Prometheus metrics output for authentication attempts in RabbitMQ. This includes total attempts, successful attempts, and failed attempts for the AMQP 0-9-1 protocol. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2021-03-01-auth-attempts-metrics/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` # TYPE rabbitmq_auth_attempts_total counter # HELP rabbitmq_auth_attempts_total Total number of authorization attempts rabbitmq_auth_attempts_total{protocol="amqp091"} 2 # TYPE rabbitmq_auth_attempts_succeeded_total counter # HELP rabbitmq_auth_attempts_succeeded_total Total number of successful authentication attempts rabbitmq_auth_attempts_succeeded_total{protocol="amqp091"} 0 # TYPE rabbitmq_auth_attempts_failed_total counter # HELP rabbitmq_auth_attempts_failed_total Total number of failed authentication attempts rabbitmq_auth_attempts_failed_total{protocol="amqp091"} 2 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Specifying Custom Queue Name for Topic Subscription DESCRIPTION: STOMP frame example showing how to provide a custom queue name when subscribing to a topic destination by using the x-queue-name header. This overrides the default generated queue name. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: stomp CODE: ``` SUBSCRIBE destination:/topic/alarms x-queue-name:my-alarms-queue ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Handshake Timeout Configuration DESCRIPTION: AMQP handshake timeout configuration in milliseconds SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` handshake_timeout = 10000 ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` ssl_handshake_timeout = 5000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Opening a Channel in .NET with RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This code shows how to open a new channel (called 'model' in the .NET client) after establishing a connection to RabbitMQ using the .NET client library. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/channels/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` var cf = new ConnectionFactory(); var conn = cf.newConnection(); // the .NET client calls channels "models" var ch = conn.CreateModel(); // ... use the channel to declare topology, publish, consume ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying RabbitMQ Prometheus Metrics Endpoint DESCRIPTION: cURL command to fetch metrics from the RabbitMQ Prometheus plugin's HTTP endpoint. The plugin serves metrics on port 15692 by default. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/monitoring/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl {hostname}:15692/metrics ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Queue Information in RabbitMQ using list_queues DESCRIPTION: Example command showing how to list messages and consumers for queues in a specific virtual host. The command displays queue metrics for the virtual host 'my-vhost'. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_40 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_queues -p my-vhost messages consumers ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Size-based Log Rotation DESCRIPTION: Configuration settings for log rotation based on file size (10 MiB) with retention of 5 archived files. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # rotate when the file reaches 10 MiB log.file.rotation.size = 10485760 # keep up to 5 archived log files in addition to the current one log.file.rotation.count = 5 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting up a Publishing Loop with Confirmations in RabbitMQ Streams DESCRIPTION: Java code skeleton for publishing messages to a stream in a loop, using a CountDownLatch to wait for publish confirmations before proceeding. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2021-07-19-rabbitmq-streams-first-application/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` int messageCount = 1_000_000; CountDownLatch confirmLatch = new CountDownLatch(messageCount); IntStream.range(0, messageCount).forEach(i -> { // send one message }); boolean done = confirmLatch.await(1, TimeUnit.MINUTES); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Queue Overflow Policy on Windows DESCRIPTION: Windows-specific command to set queue overflow policy using rabbitmqctl.bat with proper escaping. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/maxlength/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat set_policy my-pol "^two-messages$" ^ "{""max-length"":2,""overflow"":""reject-publish""}" ^ --apply-to queues ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TLS for OAuth 2.0 in RabbitMQ (INI) DESCRIPTION: Example of configuring TLS options for OAuth 2.0 connections in RabbitMQ, such as specifying a CA certificate file. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_oauth2.https.cacertfile = /opts/certs/cacert.pem ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting a Federation Policy in RabbitMQ via Bash DESCRIPTION: Uses rabbitmqctl to set a policy named 'federate-me' that applies to exchanges with names starting with 'federated.' and configures them to use all federation upstreams with priority 1. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/parameters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy federate-me \ "^federated\." '{"federation-upstream-set":"all"}' \ --priority 1 \ --apply-to exchanges ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Partial Installation Script for RabbitMQ on Ubuntu 22.04 DESCRIPTION: The beginning of a shell script for installing RabbitMQ on Ubuntu 22.04 (Jammy). This snippet shows the first steps of adding GPG keys but is incomplete in the original content. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` #!/bin/sh sudo apt-get install curl gnupg apt-transport-https -y ## Team RabbitMQ's main signing key curl -1sLf "https://keys.openpgp.org/vks/v1/by-fingerprint/0A9AF2115F4687BD29803A206B73A36E6026DFCA" | sudo gpg --dearmor | sudo tee /usr/share/keyrings/com.rabbitmq.team.gpg > /dev/null ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TCP Acceptors in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Default configuration for the number of Erlang processes that will accept connections for TCP listeners. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` num_acceptors.tcp = 10 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: JSON File Logging Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configures file logging to use JSON format with info level. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_27 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.file.level = info log.file.formatter = json ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Semaphore Access in RabbitMQ with Java DESCRIPTION: This code shows how a process can access a semaphore in RabbitMQ. It sets up a consumer with a prefetch count of 1, consumes messages from the semaphore queue without acknowledging, and implements a mechanism to release the semaphore when needed. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2014-02-19-distributed-semaphores-with-rabbitmq/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` QueueingConsumer consumer = new QueueingConsumer(channel); channel.basicQos(1); channel.basicConsume("resource.semaphore", false, consumer); while (true) { QueueingConsumer.Delivery delivery = consumer.nextDelivery(); // here we access the resource controlled by the semaphore. if(shouldStopProcessing()) { channel.basicReject(delivery.getEnvelope().getDeliveryTag(), true); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Cipher Suites in OpenSSL Format (RabbitMQ CLI) DESCRIPTION: This command uses rabbitmq-diagnostics to list cipher suites supported by the Erlang runtime in OpenSSL format. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_34 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics cipher_suites --format openssl -q ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Clearing Connection Limits for a Virtual Host in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to clear (remove) the maximum number of connections limit for the 'qa_env' virtual host by setting it to -1, which means 'no limit'. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_61 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_vhost_limits -p qa_env '{"max-connections": -1}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting RabbitMQ Configuration File Environment Variables DESCRIPTION: Environment variable declarations to override default configuration file locations for rabbitmq.conf, advanced.config, and rabbitmq-env.conf files. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # overrides primary config file location RABBITMQ_CONFIG_FILE=/path/to/a/custom/location/rabbitmq.conf # overrides advanced config file location RABBITMQ_ADVANCED_CONFIG_FILE=/path/to/a/custom/location/advanced.config # overrides environment variable file location RABBITMQ_CONF_ENV_FILE=/path/to/a/custom/location/rabbitmq-env.conf ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Removing an Unresponsive Node from RabbitMQ Cluster DESCRIPTION: Command to permanently remove an unresponsive node (rabbit2) from a RabbitMQ cluster using the forget_cluster_node command from another node (rabbit1). SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/clustering.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Tell rabbit@rabbit1 to permanently remove rabbit@rabbit2 rabbitmqctl forget_cluster_node -n rabbit@rabbit1 rabbit@rabbit2 # => Removing node rabbit@rabbit1 from cluster ... # => ...done. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling RabbitMQ Stream Plugins DESCRIPTION: Docker exec command to enable the RabbitMQ stream and stream management plugins in a running container. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/src/components/Tutorials/TutorialsStreamHelp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker exec rabbitmq rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_stream rabbitmq_stream_management ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring a Feature Flag in Erlang DESCRIPTION: Example of how to declare a feature flag as a module attribute in Erlang. This declaration includes a description, documentation URL, stability status, and migration function reference. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/feature-flags/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` -rabbit_feature_flag( {quorum_queue, #{desc => "Support queues of type quorum", doc_url => "https://www.rabbitmq.com/docs/quorum-queues", stability => stable, migration_fun => {?MODULE, quorum_queue_migration} }}). ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: HTML Table Structure for AMQP Protocol Requirements DESCRIPTION: HTML table structure documenting AMQP protocol requirements and their implementation status in RabbitMQ server. Includes status indicators, requirement levels (MUST, SHOULD, etc.), and detailed descriptions. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/specification.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` ok MUST server basic / recover-async / 01
The server MUST set the redelivered flag on all messages that are resent.
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Inspecting Shovels via HTTP API DESCRIPTION: cURL commands to interact with RabbitMQ Shovel HTTP API endpoints for listing and inspecting shovels. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/shovel-dynamic.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # Note: this user's access is limited to localhost! curl -v -u guest:guest -X GET http://localhost:15672/api/shovels/ ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # Note: this user's access is limited to localhost! curl -v -u guest:guest -X GET http://localhost:15672/api/shovels/%2f ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # Note: this user's access is limited to localhost! curl -v -u guest:guest -X GET http://localhost:15672/api/shovels/vhost/%2f/my-shovel ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring a Direct Exchange in PHP DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to declare a direct exchange in RabbitMQ using PHP and the php-amqplib library. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-php.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` $channel->exchange_declare('direct_logs', 'direct', false, false, false); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: TCP Buffer Configuration for AMQP DESCRIPTION: TCP listener options configuration for AMQP connections with optimized buffer sizes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` tcp_listen_options.backlog = 128 tcp_listen_options.nodelay = true tcp_listen_options.linger.on = true tcp_listen_options.linger.timeout = 0 tcp_listen_options.sndbuf = 196608 tcp_listen_options.recbuf = 196608 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Specifying Custom Queue Name for Topic Subscription DESCRIPTION: STOMP frame example showing how to provide a custom queue name when subscribing to a topic destination by using the x-queue-name header. This overrides the default generated queue name. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: stomp CODE: ``` SUBSCRIBE destination:/topic/alarms x-queue-name:my-alarms-queue ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TCP Acceptors in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Default configuration for the number of Erlang processes that will accept connections for TCP listeners. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` num_acceptors.tcp = 10 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Enabled Plugins File Content DESCRIPTION: Shows the content of the RabbitMQ enabled_plugins file, which lists the names of currently enabled plugins. This file is typically managed by RabbitMQ or rabbitmq-plugins tool. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/plugins.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [rabbitmq_management,rabbitmq_management_agent,rabbitmq_shovel]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Allowing Basic Auth alongside OAuth 2.0 in Management UI DESCRIPTION: Configuration to allow both basic authentication and OAuth 2.0 authentication methods in the RabbitMQ management UI. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` ... management.oauth_disable_basic_auth = false ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Quorum Queues for MQTT Durable Subscriptions in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: A configuration example for enabling quorum queues to handle MQTT client durable subscriptions. This setting must only be enabled for new clusters before any clients declare durable subscriptions to prevent failures due to queue type mismatches. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/mqtt.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # must ONLY be enabled for new clusters before any clients declare durable subscriptions mqtt.durable_queue_type = quorum ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Security Headers Configuration DESCRIPTION: Sets various security-related HTTP headers including content type options, XSS protection, and frame options SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_36 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.headers.content_type_options = nosniff management.headers.xss_protection = 1; mode=block management.headers.frame_options = DENY ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.hsts.policy = max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains management.csp.policy = default-src 'self'; script-src 'self' 'unsafe-eval' management.headers.content_type_options = nosniff management.headers.xss_protection = 1; mode=block management.headers.frame_options = DENY ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Operator Policy via HTTP API DESCRIPTION: HTTP API request to set an operator policy for queues with names starting with 'amq.' to expire after 1800000 milliseconds. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/parameters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` PUT /api/operator-policies/%2f/transient-queue-ttl {"pattern": "^amq\.", "definition": {"expires": 1800000}, "priority": 1, "apply-to": "queues"} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting User Limits via HTTP API in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This curl command demonstrates how to set a user limit (max-connections) to 20 using the RabbitMQ HTTP API. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/user-limits.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -v -u guest:guest -X PUT http://localhost:15672/api/user-limits/user1/max-connections \ -H "content-type: application/json" \ -d @- < <---------- transfer(...) <---------- transfer(...) flow(link-credit=delta) ---+ +--- transfer(...) \ / x / \ <--+ +--> ... --------------------------------------------------------------------- ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Wildcard Domain Content Security Policy in RabbitMQ Management DESCRIPTION: Sets a Content Security Policy (CSP) header with a wildcard domain pattern, allowing resources from any subdomain within the specified domain. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_33 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.csp.policy = default-src 'self' *.eng.example.local ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running MQTT Latency Benchmark for QoS 1 DESCRIPTION: Command to run the mqtt-bm-latency benchmark tool for QoS 1 messages. It simulates 100 publisher-subscriber pairs sending 10,000 messages each. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2023-03-21-native-mqtt/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ./mqtt-bm-latency -clients 100 -count 10000 -pubqos 1 -subqos 1 -size 100 -keepalive 120 -topic t ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sample Text Log Format for RabbitMQ Tracing DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the human-readable 'text' log format produced by the rabbitmq-tracing plugin. It shows examples of message publishing and receiving events, including details like node, exchange, routing keys, and payload. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2011-09-09-rabbitmq-tracing-a-ui-for-the-firehose/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` ================================================================================ 2011-9-9 10:57:24: Message published Node: rabbit@smacmullen Exchange: direct Routing keys: [<<"5d07bff4-1708-4a5d-87f9-a14177d6681b">>] Properties: [] Payload: Hello world ================================================================================ 2011-9-9 10:57:24: Message received Node: rabbit@smacmullen Exchange: direct Queue: amq.gen-PJfnaKdg7AmsWmYTUeuApw== Routing keys: [<<"5d07bff4-1708-4a5d-87f9-a14177d6681b">>] Properties: [] Payload: Hello world ================================================================================ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Set Federation Policy in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: Command to set a federation policy that matches queues with a specific prefix and configures them to use all declared upstreams in PowerShell. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/federated-queues/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat set_policy queue-federation '^federated\.' ` '"{""federation-upstream-set":""all""}"' ` --priority 10 ` --apply-to queues ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring MQTT Plugin Settings in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This configuration snippet demonstrates various MQTT plugin settings in RabbitMQ, including anonymous access, vhost, exchange, session expiry, prefetch, and retained message store configuration. It uses the DETS (disk-based) store for retained messages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/mqtt.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` mqtt.allow_anonymous = true mqtt.vhost = / mqtt.exchange = amq.topic mqtt.max_session_expiry_interval_seconds = 1800 mqtt.prefetch = 10 ## use DETS (disk-based) store for retained messages mqtt.retained_message_store = rabbit_mqtt_retained_msg_store_dets ## only used by DETS store mqtt.retained_message_store_dets_sync_interval = 2000 mqtt.listeners.ssl = none mqtt.listeners.tcp.default = 1883 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: HTTP API Request Body for Setting User Limits DESCRIPTION: This JSON object represents the request body for setting a user limit via the HTTP API. The 'value' field contains the limit value. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/user-limits.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` {"value": 20} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: AMQP Message Requeue Commands DESCRIPTION: Commands related to message requeuing functionality in AMQP, including basic.recover, basic.reject, and basic.nack. These methods feature a requeue parameter for message handling. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/semantics.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: AMQP CODE: ``` basic.recover basic.reject basic.nack ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing All Deprecated Features in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to list all deprecated features in RabbitMQ, regardless of whether they are in use. This provides a complete view of features that may be removed in future versions. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin deprecated_features list ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Quorum Queues for MQTT Durable Subscriptions in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: A configuration example for enabling quorum queues to handle MQTT client durable subscriptions. This setting must only be enabled for new clusters before any clients declare durable subscriptions to prevent failures due to queue type mismatches. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/mqtt.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # must ONLY be enabled for new clusters before any clients declare durable subscriptions mqtt.durable_queue_type = quorum ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Proxy Protocol for Web STOMP DESCRIPTION: INI configuration to enable the proxy protocol for the Web STOMP plugin. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/web-stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` web_stomp.proxy_protocol = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Match Query in RabbitMQ LDAP Authentication DESCRIPTION: Structure for match query that compares a string with a regular expression. Both the string and regular expression are subqueries that can include variable substitutions. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {match, StringSubQuery, RESubQuery} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Multiple User Limits via CLI DESCRIPTION: This command sets both the maximum connections and maximum channels limits for a user using the rabbitmqctl CLI tool. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/user-limits.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_user_limits guest '{"max-connections": 10, "max-channels": 20}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Memory Usage Analysis for AMQP 1.0 in RabbitMQ 3.13 DESCRIPTION: Erlang shell output showing memory statistics and process count for RabbitMQ 3.13's AMQP 1.0 implementation. Demonstrates higher memory usage of 12GB with approximately 1.48M processes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2024-08-21-amqp-benchmarks/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` 1> erlang:memory(). [{total,12066294144}, {processes,11156497904}, {processes_used,11156461208}, {system,909796240}, {atom,1089809}, {atom_used,1062780}, {binary,192784464}, {code,22068126}, {ets,318872128}] 2> erlang:system_info(process_count). 1480318 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Cloning RabbitMQ Repositories for Java Client Development DESCRIPTION: Commands to clone the RabbitMQ code generation repository and Java client repository. The code generation repository is a dependency required for building the Java client. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/build-java-client.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` git clone https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-codegen.git rabbitmq_codegen git clone https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-java-client.git ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Console Logging with Unix Epoch Timestamps DESCRIPTION: Configures console logging with Unix epoch microseconds timestamp format. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.console = true log.console.level = info log.file = false # use microseconds since UNIX epoch for timestamp format log.console.formatter.time_format = epoch_usecs ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Multiple OAuth 2.0 Providers in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This configuration snippet demonstrates how to set up multiple OAuth 2.0 providers for RabbitMQ authentication. It defines two resource servers (prod and dev) with their respective OAuth providers, including issuer URLs and certificate files. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_oauth2.scope_prefix = rabbitmq. auth_oauth2.resource_servers.1.id = rabbit_prod auth_oauth2.resource_servers.1.oauth_provider_id = prod auth_oauth2.resource_servers.2.id = rabbit_dev auth_oauth2.resource_servers.2.oauth_provider_id = dev auth_oauth2.resource_servers.2.scope_prefix = dev-rabbitmq. auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.prod.issuer = https://rabbit_prod:8080 auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.prod.https.cacertfile = /opts/certs/prod.pem auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.dev.issuer = https://rabbit_dev:8080 auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.dev.https.cacertfile = /opts/certs/dev.pem ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Verifying TLSv1.2 Connection with OpenSSL DESCRIPTION: Command to verify TLSv1.2 connection to a RabbitMQ server using openssl s_client tool with the appropriate TLS version flag. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_30 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # connect using TLSv1.2 openssl s_client -connect 127.0.0.1:5671 -tls1_2 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Console Logging with Unix Epoch Timestamps DESCRIPTION: Configures console logging with Unix epoch microseconds timestamp format. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.console = true log.console.level = info log.file = false # use microseconds since UNIX epoch for timestamp format log.console.formatter.time_format = epoch_usecs ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Secure Renegotiation for RabbitMQ TLS Connections DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to enable secure renegotiation for RabbitMQ TLS connections, which is highly recommended for enhanced security. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/clustering-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS="-pa $ERL_SSL_PATH \ -proto_dist inet_tls \ -ssl_dist_opt server_certfile /path/to/combined_keys.pem \ -ssl_dist_opt server_password password \ -ssl_dist_opt server_secure_renegotiate true client_secure_renegotiate true" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Disk Free Limit in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration for the disk free space limit of the partition on which RabbitMQ is storing data. When available disk space falls below this limit, flow control is triggered. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` disk_free_limit.absolute = 2GB ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Encoding Values with RabbitMQ CLI DESCRIPTION: Basic command for encrypting values with a passphrase SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_64 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl encode '<<"guest">>' mypassphrase ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring a Durable Queue in RabbitMQ with Swift DESCRIPTION: This code shows how to declare a durable queue in RabbitMQ using Swift. The .durable option ensures the queue will survive RabbitMQ node restarts. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-swift.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: swift CODE: ``` let q = ch.queue("hello", options: .durable) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting RabbitMQ Configuration File Path in rabbitmq-env.conf DESCRIPTION: Example configuration that specifies a custom path for the RabbitMQ configuration file. Shows how to set the CONFIG_FILE variable to point to a non-default location. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmq-env.conf.5.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # I am a complete rabbitmq-env.conf file. # Comment lines start with a hash character. # This is a /bin/sh script file - use ordinary envt var syntax CONFIG_FILE=/data/services/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.conf ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting OAuth2 Proxy DESCRIPTION: Command to start the OAuth2 Proxy service that handles authentication flow SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/oauth2-examples-proxy.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make start-oauth2-proxy ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Positive Acknowledgement in .NET RabbitMQ Client DESCRIPTION: Shows how to positively acknowledge a single delivery using the .NET client for RabbitMQ. The message will be discarded after acknowledgement. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/confirms.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` // this example assumes an existing channel (IModel) instance var consumer = new EventingBasicConsumer(channel); consumer.Received += (ch, ea) => { var body = ea.Body.ToArray(); // positively acknowledge a single delivery, the message will // be discarded channel.BasicAck(ea.DeliveryTag, false); }; String consumerTag = channel.BasicConsume(queueName, false, consumer); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Visualizing Connection Architecture for Two Senders Benchmark in ASCII Diagram DESCRIPTION: ASCII diagram illustrating the connection architecture used in the two_senders benchmark program, showing how a single program connects to RabbitMQ using both AMQP 0.9.1 and AMQP 1.0 protocols simultaneously, with publishers sending to both classic and quorum queues. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2024-09-02-amqp-flow-control/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` main.go RabbitMQ +-------------+ +----------------------------------+ | | AMQP 0.9.1 connection | | | |#####################################| | | +---+ |-------------------------------------| +------------------------+ | | | P | | classic-queue-amqp-091 | | | +---+ +------------------------+ | | AMQP 0.9.1 channel | | +---+ +------------------------+ | | | P | | quorum-queue-amqp-091 | | | +---+ |-------------------------------------| +------------------------+ | | |#####################################| | | | | | | | | | | | | | | |#####################################| | | +---+ |-------------------------------------| +-----------------------+ | | | P |O============================================>O| classic-queue-amqp-10 | | | +---+ +-----------------------+ | | AMQP 1.0 session | | +---+ +-----------------------+ | | | P |O======================================+=====>O| quorum-queue-amqp-10 | | | +-+-+ |----------------------------------|--| +-----------------------+ | | | |##################################|##| | | | | AMQP 1.0 connection | | | +------|------+ | +----------------------------------+ | | | | Publisher AMQP 1.0 link goroutine ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TCP TIME_WAIT Timeout in Linux DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to reduce the TCP FIN timeout to 30 seconds to decrease the time connections spend in the TIME_WAIT state. This can help handle high connection churn.
