SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_28 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` net.ipv4.tcp_fin_timeout = 30 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Publishing to Named Exchange DESCRIPTION: Publishes a message to the named 'logs' exchange with an empty routing key. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-dotnet.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` channel.BasicPublish(exchange: "logs", routingKey: "", basicProperties: null, body: body); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Repository Clone and Directory Navigation DESCRIPTION: Commands to clone the RabbitMQ server repository and navigate to the Prometheus docker directory SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/prometheus/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` git clone https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server.git cd rabbitmq-server/deps/rabbitmq_prometheus/docker ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring DLX Using Java Client DESCRIPTION: Java code example showing how to declare a queue with Dead Letter Exchange configuration using queue arguments. Sets up exchange and queue with DLX settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/dlx.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` channel.exchangeDeclare("some.exchange.name", "direct"); // Important: prefer using policies over hardcoded x-arguments Map args = new HashMap(); args.put("x-dead-letter-exchange", "some.exchange.name"); channel.queueDeclare("myqueue", false, false, false, args); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: TLS Versions Check DESCRIPTION: Command to list all supported TLS versions on the target node in quiet mode. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics tls_versions -q ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Clearing Connection Limits for a User in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to clear the maximum connection limit for the user 'limited_user'. This removes the specific connection limit while leaving any other limits intact. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_65 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl clear_user_limits limited_user 'max-connections' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Virtual Host Parameters in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Commands for setting, clearing, and listing virtual host-scoped parameters using rabbitmqctl in Bash. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/parameters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # sets a runtime parameter in a virtual host rabbitmqctl set_parameter [-p vhost] # clears (unsets) a runtime parameter in a virtual host rabbitmqctl clear_parameter [-p vhost] # lists runtime parameters in a virtual host rabbitmqctl list_parameters [-p vhost] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling rabbitmq-top Plugin for Process Monitoring DESCRIPTION: Command to enable the rabbitmq-top plugin, which adds functionality to monitor and identify processes that consume the most memory or CPU time. This plugin is useful for diagnosing performance issues in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/memory-use/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` [sudo] rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_top ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complete Classic Format Config for Network Optimization in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Comprehensive configuration using the classic Erlang term format to optimize both kernel settings and TCP listen options for better network performance. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_28 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [ {kernel, [ {inet_default_connect_options, [{nodelay, true}]}, {inet_default_listen_options, [{nodelay, true}]} ]}, {rabbit, [ {tcp_listen_options, [ {backlog, 4096}, {nodelay, true}, {linger, {true,0}}, {exit_on_close, false} ]} ]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Check TLS Versions in RabbitMQ (Windows) DESCRIPTION: Command to check supported TLS versions in RabbitMQ on Windows systems. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/troubleshooting-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics.bat --silent tls_versions ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Basic RabbitMQ Diagnostics Status Command in Bash DESCRIPTION: Simple example of running the status command with rabbitmq-diagnostics against a default node without specifying target. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics status ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring DNS Reverse Lookup Settings DESCRIPTION: Configuration options for enabling or disabling reverse DNS lookups for client IP addresses in RabbitMQ. This affects how connection information is displayed in management interfaces. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_34 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` reverse_dns_lookups = true reverse_dns_lookups = false ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Cloning and Setting Up the Sample Project DESCRIPTION: These shell commands clone the RabbitMQ Stream Single Active Consumer sample project from GitHub into the /tmp directory and navigate to the project directory for preparation to run the examples. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2022-07-05-rabbitmq-3-11-feature-preview-single-active-consumer-for-streams/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` cd /tmp git clone https://github.com/acogoluegnes/rabbitmq-stream-single-active-consumer.git cd rabbitmq-stream-single-active-consumer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Prometheus TCP Timeouts in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration snippet showing how to modify TCP timeouts for the Prometheus plugin in RabbitMQ. Sets idle, inactivity and request timeouts to 120 seconds. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/prometheus/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` prometheus.tcp.idle_timeout = 120000 prometheus.tcp.inactivity_timeout = 120000 prometheus.tcp.request_timeout = 120000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Changing RabbitMQ Statistics Interval at Runtime DESCRIPTION: This command changes the statistics collection interval to 60 seconds at runtime using rabbitmqctl. This change only affects new stats-emitting entities. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_48 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl eval 'application:set_env(rabbit, collect_statistics_interval, 60000).' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: IPv6 Configuration for RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Environment variables and configuration settings for enabling IPv6 support in RabbitMQ for inter-node communication and CLI tools. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # these flags will be used by RabbitMQ nodes RABBITMQ_SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS="-kernel inetrc '/etc/rabbitmq/erl_inetrc' -proto_dist inet6_tcp" # these flags will be used by CLI tools RABBITMQ_CTL_ERL_ARGS="-proto_dist inet6_tcp" ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` %% Tells DNS client on RabbitMQ nodes and CLI tools to resolve hostnames to IPv6 addresses. %% The trailing dot is not optional. {inet6,true}. ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` RABBITMQ_CTL_ERL_ARGS="-proto_dist inet6_tcp" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Elixir using kiex DESCRIPTION: Commands to install Elixir version 1.12.3 using the kiex tool. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2022-05-31-flame-graphs/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kiex install 1.12.3 kiex use 1.12.3 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting RabbitMQ with Keycloak OAuth Configuration DESCRIPTION: Commands to start RabbitMQ with pre-configured OAuth 2.0 settings pointing to the Keycloak server. The MODE environment variable specifies the configuration to use. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/oauth2-examples-keycloak.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` export MODE=keycloak make start-rabbitmq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Clearing Connection Limits for a User in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to clear the maximum connection limit for the user 'limited_user'. This removes the specific connection limit while leaving any other limits intact. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_65 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl clear_user_limits limited_user 'max-connections' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing a Feature Flag Migration Function in Erlang DESCRIPTION: Example of a migration function for a feature flag in Erlang. This function handles both enabling the feature and checking if it's enabled, performing necessary database schema migrations. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/feature-flags/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` quorum_queue_migration(FeatureName, _FeatureProps, enable) -> Tables = ?quorum_queue_tables, rabbit_table:wait(Tables), Fields = amqqueue:fields(amqqueue_v2), migrate_to_amqqueue_with_type(FeatureName, Tables, Fields); quorum_queue_migration(_FeatureName, _FeatureProps, is_enabled) -> Tables = ?quorum_queue_tables, rabbit_table:wait(Tables), Fields = amqqueue:fields(amqqueue_v2), mnesia:table_info(rabbit_queue, attributes) =:= Fields andalso mnesia:table_info(rabbit_durable_queue, attributes) =:= Fields. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating the AMQP 1.0 Environment in Java DESCRIPTION: Creates an Environment instance to manage connections and shared resources for AMQP 1.0 communication in Java. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/amqp-client-libraries.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` import com.rabbitmq.client.amqp.*; import com.rabbitmq.client.amqp.impl.AmqpEnvironmentBuilder; // ... // create the environment instance Environment environment = new AmqpEnvironmentBuilder() .build(); // ... // close the environment when the application stops environment.close(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Specifying Custom Configuration File Path with Shell Command DESCRIPTION: Command that overrides the default configuration file path and uses a named connection profile to execute a command against a specific RabbitMQ environment. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` # will use the settings from the section called [staging] rabbitmqadmin --config $HOME/.configuration/rabbitmqadmin.conf --node staging show churn ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Visualizing RabbitMQ Message Flow with Mermaid DESCRIPTION: A flowchart representing a RabbitMQ setup with one producer (P) sending messages to a queue named 'hello', which is consumed by two consumers (C1 and C2) each with a prefetch value of 1. The diagram uses Mermaid syntax to define nodes, connections, and styling classes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/src/components/Tutorials/T2DiagramPrefetch.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: mermaid CODE: ``` flowchart LR P((P)) --> Q[[hello]] Q -- prefetch=1 --> C1((C1)) Q -- prefetch=1 --> C2((C2)) class P mermaid-producer class Q mermaid-queue class C1 mermaid-consumer class C2 mermaid-consumer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Offset Tracking in RabbitMQ Stream Consumer DESCRIPTION: C# implementation of a RabbitMQ Stream consumer with offset tracking. The consumer stores its progress every 10 messages and before closing, allowing it to resume from the last processed message when restarted. It includes offset lookup, consumer configuration, and message handling logic. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-dotnet-stream.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` var consumerName = "offset-tracking-tutorial"; // name of the consumer IOffsetType offsetSpecification; try { // get last stored offset ulong storedOffset = await streamSystem.QueryOffset(consumerName, stream).ConfigureAwait(false); // start just after the last stored offset offsetSpecification = new OffsetTypeOffset(storedOffset + 1); } catch (OffsetNotFoundException) { // start consuming at the beginning of the stream if no stored offset offsetSpecification = new OffsetTypeFirst(); } ulong initialValue = UInt64.MaxValue; ulong firstOffset = initialValue; int messageCount = 0; // number of received messages ulong lastOffset = initialValue; var consumedCde = new CountdownEvent(1); var consumer = await Consumer.Create(new ConsumerConfig(streamSystem, stream) { OffsetSpec = offsetSpecification, Reference = consumerName, // the consumer must a have name MessageHandler = async (_, consumer, context, message) => { if (Interlocked.CompareExchange(ref firstOffset, context.Offset, initialValue) == initialValue) { Console.WriteLine("First message received."); } if (Interlocked.Increment(ref messageCount) % 10 == 0) { // store offset every 10 messages await consumer.StoreOffset(context.Offset).ConfigureAwait(false); } if ("marker".Equals(Encoding.UTF8.GetString(message.Data.Contents))) { Interlocked.Exchange(ref lastOffset, context.Offset); // store the offset on consumer closing await consumer.StoreOffset(context.Offset).ConfigureAwait(false); await consumer.Close(); consumedCde.Signal(); } await Task.CompletedTask; } }); Console.WriteLine("Started consuming..."); consumedCde.Wait(); Console.WriteLine("Done consuming, first offset {0}, last offset {1}.", firstOffset, lastOffset); await streamSystem.Close(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring an Alternate Exchange Using Java Client Arguments DESCRIPTION: Java code example showing how to create a direct exchange with an alternate exchange using client-provided arguments. This approach is discouraged in favor of using policies. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ae.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` Map args = new HashMap(); args.put("alternate-exchange", "my-ae"); channel.exchangeDeclare("my-direct", "direct", false, false, args); channel.exchangeDeclare("my-ae", "fanout"); channel.queueDeclare("routed"); channel.queueBind("routed", "my-direct", "key1"); channel.queueDeclare("unrouted"); channel.queueBind("unrouted", "my-ae", ""); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Python Virtual Environment for Pika DESCRIPTION: Optional commands to create and activate a Python virtual environment if pip is not directly available in the system. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples-keycloak.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` python3 -m venv venv source venv/bin/activate ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Auto-named Queues in Ruby AMQP 0.7 DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates the new support for auto-named queues in AMQP 0.7. When a queue is declared with an empty name, the broker generates a random name. The callback provides access to the generated queue name. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2011-01-19-ruby-amqp-0-7-released/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Ruby CODE: ``` channel = MQ.new channel.queue("") do |queue| puts "Queue with name #{queue.name} declared!" end # OUTPUT: Queue with name amq.gen-PfCGdyBA4Sr4rkZg3IN3Kw== declared! ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Troubleshooting Plugin Not Found Error with RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates a common error when trying to enable a plugin with a typo in its name. The error message shows the plugin not being found due to the misspelling. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/plugins.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # note the typo rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_managemenr # => Error: # => {:plugins_not_found, [:rabbitmq_managemenr]} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Signing the RabbitMQ Key (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Signs the RabbitMQ key using your own GPG key to avoid trust warnings. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/signatures.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` gpg --sign-key 0x0A9AF2115F4687BD29803A206B73A36E6026DFCA ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying RabbitMQ Node TLS Certificates DESCRIPTION: Runs the rabbitmq-diagnostics command to display TLS certificates for all listeners on the target node configured to use TLS. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics certificates ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting AMQP 1.0 Publisher with OAuth (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Command to start an AMQP 1.0 publisher application that authenticates using an OAuth token obtained from UAA. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make start-amqp1_0-publisher ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking RabbitMQ Cluster Status on Independent Nodes DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the rabbitmqctl cluster_status command to verify the status of each independent node before clustering. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/clustering.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # on rabbit1 rabbitmqctl cluster_status # => Cluster status of node rabbit@rabbit1 ... # => [{nodes,[{disc,[rabbit@rabbit1]}]},{running_nodes,[rabbit@rabbit1]}] # => ...done. # on rabbit2 rabbitmqctl cluster_status # => Cluster status of node rabbit@rabbit2 ... # => [{nodes,[{disc,[rabbit@rabbit2]}]},{running_nodes,[rabbit@rabbit2]}] # => ...done. # on rabbit3 rabbitmqctl cluster_status # => Cluster status of node rabbit@rabbit3 ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Consul Service Address and Node Names for RabbitMQ Clustering DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to configure Consul-based peer discovery for RabbitMQ, including settings for service address computation and node naming. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_24 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = consul cluster_formation.consul.host = consul.eng.example.local cluster_formation.consul.svc = rabbitmq # do compute service address cluster_formation.consul.svc_addr_auto = true # compute service address using the IP address of a NIC, en0 cluster_formation.consul.svc_addr_nic = en0 cluster_formation.consul.svc_addr_use_nodename = false # use long RabbitMQ node names? cluster_formation.consul.use_longname = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Default Permissions in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Default configuration for the permissions assigned to the default user, allowing full access to all resources by default. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_33 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` default_permissions.configure = .* default_permissions.read = .* default_permissions.write = .* ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Multiple Routing Keys in AMQP 0.9.1 DESCRIPTION: To use multiple routing keys in AMQP 0.9.1, the publisher sets the 'CC' and 'BCC' header keys. The value for 'CC' and 'BCC' must be an array of strings (longstr values). The message will be routed using both the routing key supplied as a parameter to the basic.publish method and the routing keys provided in the 'CC' and 'BCC' headers. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/sender-selected.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: AMQP CODE: ``` headers: CC: ["routing_key_1", "routing_key_2"] BCC: ["routing_key_3", "routing_key_4"] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Stopping RabbitMQ Service on Linux DESCRIPTION: This command stops the RabbitMQ server service on a Linux system. It's used before performing symlink operations for storage configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ec2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo service rabbitmq-server stop ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Bulk Message Rejection in RabbitMQ using Java DESCRIPTION: Shows how to reject multiple messages with a single basicNack call by setting the multiple flag to true. This will reject all unacknowledged messages up to and including the specified delivery tag. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/nack.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` GetResponse gr1 = channel.basicGet("some.queue", false); GetResponse gr2 = channel.basicGet("some.queue", false); channel.basicNack(gr2.getEnvelope().getDeliveryTag(), true, true); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Check Cipher Suites (Windows) DESCRIPTION: Command to list available cipher suites in OpenSSL format on Windows SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/troubleshooting-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics.bat cipher_suites --format openssl --silent ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ to Allow Remote Connections for All Users DESCRIPTION: This configuration disables the loopback users restriction, allowing all users (including ones with generated secure credentials) to connect from any host, not just localhost. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_28 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # user with secure generated credentials! loopback_users = none ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Stopping RabbitMQ Application with rabbitmqctl DESCRIPTION: This command stops the RabbitMQ application while leaving the Erlang VM running. It's typically used before performing other management actions that require the RabbitMQ application to be stopped. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl stop_app ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Non-TLS Listeners for STOMP DESCRIPTION: Configuration to disable standard TCP listeners and only enable TLS-secured STOMP connections on port 61614, providing enhanced security. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` stomp.listeners.tcp = none stomp.listeners.ssl.1 = 61614 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Illustrating Message Flow in RabbitMQ Erlang Processes DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates the chain of message passing between Erlang processes within RabbitMQ when publishing messages. It shows how messages flow from the reader process through the channel and queue processes to the message store. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2015-10-06-new-credit-flow-settings-on-rabbitmq-3-5-5/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` reader -> channel -> queue process -> message store. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Clearing Parameter in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Clears the parameter 'node01' for the 'federation-upstream' component in the default virtual host using the rabbitmqctl command. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_46 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl clear_parameter federation-upstream node01 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring APT Preferences for Erlang Packages (Launchpad) DESCRIPTION: Sets up APT preferences to prioritize Erlang packages from the Launchpad repository. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # /etc/apt/preferences.d/erlang Package: erlang* Pin: origin ppa.launchpad.net # Note: priority of 1001 (greater than 1000) allows for downgrading. # To make package downgrading impossible, use a value of 999 Pin-Priority: 1001 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Classic Queue Default Version in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This configuration setting in rabbitmq.conf sets the default version for new classic queues to version 2. Classic queues v2 are recommended for improved performance and functionality. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2024-03-11-rabbitmq-3.13.0-announcement/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` classic_queue.default_version = 2 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Peer Discovery Plugin Using RabbitMQ CLI DESCRIPTION: Commands demonstrating how to enable a peer discovery plugin in offline mode before first node boot using rabbitmq-plugins tool. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins --offline enable ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins --offline enable rabbitmq_peer_discovery_k8s ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying Help for RabbitMQ CLI Tools in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the help command to get information about available commands for rabbitmqctl and rabbitmq-diagnostics in PowerShell. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat help rabbitmq-diagnostics.bat help ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing RabbitMQ Plugin Directories DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the rabbitmq-plugins command to list plugin directories, including the archives directory, expansion directory, and enabled plugins file location. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/plugins.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins directories -s # => Plugin archives directory: /path/to/rabbitmq/plugins # => Plugin expansion directory: /path/to/node/node-plugins-expand # => Enabled plugins file: /path/to/enabled_plugins ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Clearing User Limits via HTTP API in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: These curl commands demonstrate how to clear user limits (max-channels and max-connections) using the RabbitMQ HTTP API. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/user-limits.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -v -u guest:guest -X DELETE http://localhost:15672/api/user-limits/user1/max-channels curl -v -u guest:guest -X DELETE http://localhost:15672/api/user-limits/user1/max-connections ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Managing RabbitMQ Service with Homebrew DESCRIPTION: Commands to start and stop the RabbitMQ service using Homebrew services. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/install-homebrew.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # starts a local RabbitMQ node brew services start rabbitmq # stops the locally running RabbitMQ node brew services stop rabbitmq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Cache Refusals Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration to enable caching of negative authentication/authorization decisions. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/auth-cache-backend.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_cache.cache_refusals = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Testing TCP Connection to RabbitMQ with Telnet (Successful Attempt) DESCRIPTION: Example of using telnet to test TCP connectivity to a RabbitMQ server on the standard AMQP port 5672. The connection succeeds, but the server closes it after receiving invalid protocol data. This demonstrates how to verify basic port accessibility. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/troubleshooting-networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` telnet localhost 5672 # => Trying ::1... # => Connected to localhost. # => Escape character is '^]'. 12345 # enter this and hit Enter to send # => AMQP Connection closed by foreign host. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing RabbitMQ Client with Mix (Elixir) DESCRIPTION: Dependency declaration for installing the rabbit_common package using Mix package manager in Elixir projects. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/erlang-client.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: elixir CODE: ``` {:rabbit_common, "~> 3.11"} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Firehose Tracing in RabbitMQ with CLI DESCRIPTION: Command to enable the Firehose tracing feature for a specified virtual host in RabbitMQ. This allows tracking of all published and delivered messages, which is useful for debugging and development. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/firehose.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl trace_on -p [virtual host] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TLS Options in RabbitMQ 3.7 (INI-like Format) DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to configure TLS options using the new format. It sets paths for CA certificate, server certificate, and key file, as well as verification options. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2018-02-22-new-configuration-format-in-rabbitmq-3-7/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` ssl_options.cacertfile = /path/to/testca/cacert.pem ssl_options.certfile = /path/to/server/cert.pem ssl_options.keyfile = /path/to/server/key.pem ssl_options.verify = verify_peer ssl_options.fail_if_no_peer_cert = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Identifying TLS Bad Record MAC Errors in Erlang DESCRIPTION: This error occurs when the server fails to verify the integrity of received data. It can be caused by network issues, unintentional socket sharing in the client, or bugs in the client's TLS implementation. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/troubleshooting-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {tls_alert,"bad record mac"} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling RabbitMQ Web STOMP Examples Plugin DESCRIPTION: Command to enable the rabbitmq_web_stomp_examples plugin which provides demonstration applications. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/web-stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_web_stomp_examples ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Stopping Keycloak OAuth Server DESCRIPTION: Command to stop the running Keycloak server after completing the OAuth authentication testing. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/oauth2-examples-keycloak.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make stop-keycloak ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Emitting an Error Log Message in Objective-C DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to call the emitLogDirect function to send an error log message using the RabbitMQ Objective-C client. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-objectivec.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: objectivec CODE: ``` [self emitLogDirect:@"Hi there!" severity:@"error"]; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using pprof Tool to Analyze Memory Allocations DESCRIPTION: Command demonstrating how to use the go tool pprof to capture and analyze memory heap profile data from the operator. This fetches the profile over HTTP and saves it for visualization and analysis. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/debug-operator.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ go tool pprof "localhost:9782/debug/pprof/heap" Fetching profile over HTTP from http://localhost:9782/debug/pprof/heap Saved profile in /home/pprof/pprof.manager.alloc_objects.alloc_space.inuse_objects.inuse_space.001.pb.gz ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: systemd epmd Socket Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration for epmd socket service in systemd to use IPv6. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` ListenStream=[::1]:4369 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Reconnection Delay Configuration DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to configure the reconnection delay for a shovel after connection failures. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/shovel-static.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {reconnect_delay, 5} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Port Forwarding for Monitoring Tools DESCRIPTION: Commands to set up port forwarding for accessing Prometheus and Alertmanager UIs. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2021-05-03-alerting/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl -n kube-prometheus port-forward svc/prom-kube-prometheus-stack-prometheus 9090 kubectl -n kube-prometheus port-forward svc/prom-kube-prometheus-stack-alertmanager 9093 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Federation Policy in RabbitMQ (PowerShell) DESCRIPTION: PowerShell version of the federation policy configuration with proper Windows-specific syntax. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/federated-exchanges/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat set_policy exchange-federation ` "^federated\." ` '"{""federation-upstream-set":""all""}"' ` --priority 10 ` --apply-to exchanges ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Statistics Collection Interval in RabbitMQ (INI) DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to set the statistics collection interval in RabbitMQ. The default configuration sets the interval to 5000 milliseconds. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_37 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` collect_statistics_interval = 5000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying RabbitMQ Command Line Arguments (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Displays the target node's command-line arguments and flags as reported by the runtime. Helpful for debugging and configuration verification. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics command_line_arguments -n rabbit@hostname ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Runtime Thread Statistics DESCRIPTION: Command to sample and report runtime thread activity statistics over a specified interval. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_24 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics runtime_thread_stats --sample-interval 15 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Server Version Check DESCRIPTION: Command to display the RabbitMQ server version information in quiet mode. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics server_version -q ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking if Node is Quorum Critical in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: This command checks if a node is quorum critical in the RabbitMQ cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_32 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` check_if_node_is_quorum_critical ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing feature flags in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Command to list feature flags in RabbitMQ. It allows specifying columns to display and setting a timeout. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_29 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` list_feature_flags [column ...] [--timeout milliseconds] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Cipher Suites in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Lists cipher suites enabled by default or all available cipher suites. Useful for security audits and configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics cipher_suites --format openssl --all ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TCP Options for AMQP Connections in INI DESCRIPTION: INI configuration that optimizes TCP settings for AMQP 0-9-1 connections to maximize throughput. This increases TCP buffer sizes to 192 KiB and configures important TCP socket options. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` tcp_listen_options.backlog = 128 tcp_listen_options.nodelay = true tcp_listen_options.linger.on = true tcp_listen_options.linger.timeout = 0 tcp_listen_options.sndbuf = 196608 tcp_listen_options.recbuf = 196608 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Erlang Process Limit DESCRIPTION: Commands to configure the maximum number of Erlang processes using environment variable or VM flag. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/runtime.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` RABBITMQ_MAX_NUMBER_OF_PROCESSES=2000000 ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` RABBITMQ_SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS="+P 2000000" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ TLS Handshake Timeout DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to set the TLS handshake timeout for RabbitMQ to 10 seconds (10000 milliseconds). This may be necessary when TLS is enabled and the default timeout is insufficient. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_36 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` ssl_handshake_timeout = 10000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Cloning the RabbitMQ Streams Sample Project DESCRIPTION: Shell commands to clone the GitHub repository containing the RabbitMQ Streams example code and navigate to the project directory. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2021-10-07-rabbitmq-streams-interoperability/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` git clone https://github.com/acogoluegnes/rabbitmq-streams-blog-posts.git cd rabbitmq-streams-blog-posts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: TCP Listen Options Configuration DESCRIPTION: Network socket configuration options including backlog, nodelay, linger settings, and keepalive flags. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_49 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` tcp_listen_options.backlog = 128 tcp_listen_options.nodelay = true tcp_listen_options.linger.on = true tcp_listen_options.linger.timeout = 0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Queue Declaration Response with Message Count DESCRIPTION: Shows the AMQP 0-9-1 response to queue.declare which includes the message_count field that indicates the current queue length. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/queues.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` queue.declare-ok ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Config File Based Peer Discovery DESCRIPTION: Configuration example for the classic config file peer discovery backend, showing how to specify the peer discovery mechanism and list cluster member nodes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = classic_config # the backend can also be specified using its module name # cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = rabbit_peer_discovery_classic_config cluster_formation.classic_config.nodes.1 = rabbit@hostname1.eng.example.local cluster_formation.classic_config.nodes.2 = rabbit@hostname2.eng.example.local ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Config File Based Peer Discovery DESCRIPTION: Configuration example for the classic config file peer discovery backend, showing how to specify the peer discovery mechanism and list cluster member nodes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = classic_config # the backend can also be specified using its module name # cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = rabbit_peer_discovery_classic_config cluster_formation.classic_config.nodes.1 = rabbit@hostname1.eng.example.local cluster_formation.classic_config.nodes.2 = rabbit@hostname2.eng.example.local ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring a Queue via HTTP API in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This JSON payload is used to declare a queue using the PUT /api/queues/{vhost}/{name} endpoint. It specifies queue properties such as durability and node placement. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "auto_delete": false, "durable": true, "arguments": {}, "node": "rabbit@node.hostname" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Topic Permissions with Variable Expansion in RabbitMQ with Bash DESCRIPTION: Sets user topic permissions using variable expansion in RabbitMQ. This command uses the {username} variable to create a more generic permission pattern that adapts to the specific user. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_33 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_topic_permissions -p my-vhost janeway amq.topic "^{username}-.*" "^{username}-.*" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Stopping RabbitMQ Server Using CLI DESCRIPTION: Command to stop a running RabbitMQ node using the rabbitmqctl CLI tool. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-homebrew.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` /opt/homebrew/sbin/rabbitmqctl shutdown ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Virtual Host in rabbitmqadmin DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to create a virtual host with specific settings using rabbitmqadmin v2. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin declare vhost --name "vh-789" --default-queue-type "quorum" --description "Used to reproduce issue #789" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Empty Permission Regular Expression DESCRIPTION: Regular expression pattern that matches nothing but the empty string, effectively stopping the user from performing any operation. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: regex CODE: ``` ^$ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Concatenating CA Certificates for RabbitMQ TLS Configuration DESCRIPTION: This bash command demonstrates how to concatenate multiple CA certificates into a single Certificate Authority bundle file. This is useful when configuring RabbitMQ to trust multiple CA certificates for TLS peer verification. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cat rootca/ca_certificate.pem otherca/ca_certificate.pem > all_cacerts.pem ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring IPv6 for Inter-node Communication DESCRIPTION: Environment variable settings to configure RabbitMQ nodes and CLI tools to use IPv6 for inter-node communication and management operations. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # these flags will be used by RabbitMQ nodes RABBITMQ_SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS="-kernel inetrc '/etc/rabbitmq/erl_inetrc' -proto_dist inet6_tcp" # these flags will be used by CLI tools RABBITMQ_CTL_ERL_ARGS="-proto_dist inet6_tcp" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: JWT Token with Custom Scope Field in JSON DESCRIPTION: Example JWT token with an empty standard scope field and permissions defined in a custom 'extra_scope' field for RabbitMQ management access. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "scope": [ ], "extra_scope": [ "rabbitmq.tag:management" ], "aud": [ "rabbitmq" ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Receiving Kernel Logs with Topic Exchange in Bash DESCRIPTION: This command runs the receive_logs_topic.js script to receive all logs from the 'kern' facility by using the 'kern.*' routing key pattern. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-five-javascript.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ./receive_logs_topic.js "kern.*" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Consul Service with NIC-based Address DESCRIPTION: Configuration for Consul service using a specific network interface (en0) for service address computation. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = consul cluster_formation.consul.host = consul.eng.example.local cluster_formation.consul.svc = rabbitmq # do compute service address cluster_formation.consul.svc_addr_auto = true # compute service address using the IP address of a NIC, en0 cluster_formation.consul.svc_addr_nic = en0 cluster_formation.consul.svc_addr_use_nodename = false # use long RabbitMQ node names? cluster_formation.consul.use_longname = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Stream Publishers with RabbitMQ Streams CLI DESCRIPTION: Command example for listing stream publishers with specific fields. This command displays the connection PID, publisher ID and stream for each producer. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmq-streams.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-streams list_stream_publishers connection_pid publisher_id stream ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Consumer Limit Per Channel in RabbitMQ INI DESCRIPTION: Configuration example for setting maximum number of consumers per channel in rabbitmq.conf to prevent consumer leaks. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/consumers.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` consumer_max_per_channel = 100 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting AMQP 1.0 Publisher with OAuth 2.0 Authentication DESCRIPTION: This command starts an AMQP 1.0 publisher application that uses OAuth 2.0 for authentication with RabbitMQ, using the jms_producer client ID. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make start-amqp1_0-publisher ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running RabbitMQ Workers and Task Publisher DESCRIPTION: Shell commands demonstrating how to run multiple workers and publish tasks to test the work queue system. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-javascript.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # shell 1 ./worker.js ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # shell 2 ./worker.js ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # shell 3 ./new_task.js First message. ./new_task.js Second message.. ./new_task.js Third message... ./new_task.js Fourth message.... ./new_task.js Fifth message..... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Multiple Plugin Directories in Linux/Unix DESCRIPTION: Example of configuring multiple plugin directories in rabbitmq-env.conf file using colon-separated paths on Linux/Unix systems. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/plugins.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Example rabbitmq-env.conf file that features a colon-separated list of plugin directories PLUGINS_DIR="/usr/lib/rabbitmq/plugins:/usr/lib/rabbitmq/lib/rabbitmq_server-3.11.6/plugins" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Multiple etcd Endpoints for RabbitMQ Cluster Formation DESCRIPTION: Configuration for etcd-based peer discovery with multiple endpoints. The plugin will randomly choose one of the available endpoints that it can successfully connect to. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_37 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = etcd cluster_formation.etcd.endpoints.1 = one.etcd.eng.example.local:2379 cluster_formation.etcd.endpoints.2 = two.etcd.eng.example.local:2479 cluster_formation.etcd.endpoints.3 = three.etcd.eng.example.local:2579 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Certificate Chain Verification Depth (INI Format) DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to configure certificate chain verification depth in RabbitMQ using INI-style format. Includes SSL options and depth settings for intermediate CA certificates. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` listeners.ssl.default = 5671 ssl_options.cacertfile = /path/to/ca_certificate.pem ssl_options.certfile = /path/to/server_certificate.pem ssl_options.keyfile = /path/to/server_key.pem ssl_options.verify = verify_peer ssl_options.depth = 2 ssl_options.fail_if_no_peer_cert = false ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Maven Dependency Configuration for HOP Client DESCRIPTION: Shows how to include the HOP HTTP client dependency in a Maven project configuration file. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2017-10-18-new-reactive-client-for-rabbitmq-http-api/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: xml CODE: ``` com.rabbitmq http-client 2.0.0.RELEASE ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Reverse DNS Lookups in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This configuration snippet demonstrates how to explicitly enable reverse DNS lookups for client IP addresses in RabbitMQ. This can be useful for listing hostnames in connection information. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_37 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` reverse_dns_lookups = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Delivering Messages with Delivery Tags in AMQP 0-9-1 DESCRIPTION: When a consumer is registered, RabbitMQ delivers messages using the basic.deliver method, which includes a delivery tag to uniquely identify the delivery on a channel. Delivery tags are scoped per channel and are monotonically growing positive integers. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/confirms.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: AMQP CODE: ``` basic.deliver ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling HTTP Request Logging for RabbitMQ Management DESCRIPTION: Configures HTTP request logging for the management plugin by specifying a directory where access logs will be stored. Requires plugin or node restart to take effect. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_30 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.http_log_dir = /path/to/a/writeable/directory ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: JWT Token with Topic Permissions and Variable Expansion DESCRIPTION: Example JWT token demonstrating variable expansion for topic permissions, where {vhost} and {sub} claims are interpolated into the permission patterns. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_31 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "sub" : "bob", "scope" : [ "rabbitmq.write:*/q-{vhost}-*/u-{sub}-*" ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling HTTP Basic Authentication for Web STOMP DESCRIPTION: Erlang configuration to enable HTTP Basic Authentication for the Web STOMP plugin. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/web-stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [ {rabbitmq_web_stomp, [{use_http_auth, true}]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Memory Calculation Strategy in RabbitMQ using INI Format DESCRIPTION: Configuration examples for setting the vm_memory_calculation_strategy in RabbitMQ to either 'rss' or 'allocated' strategies. The 'rss' strategy is more precise and used by default on Linux, MacOS, BSD and Solaris. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/memory-use/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` vm_memory_calculation_strategy = rss ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` vm_memory_calculation_strategy = allocated ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying RabbitMQ Log Locations with rabbitmq-diagnostics DESCRIPTION: Example command that shows how to use the log_location command with the -a (--all) flag to display all log file locations on the target RabbitMQ node. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_28 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics log_location -a ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TLS Options in RabbitMQ (Classic Erlang Format) DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the same TLS configuration as above, but using the classic Erlang term format for comparison. It demonstrates the increased complexity and nesting in the old format. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2018-02-22-new-configuration-format-in-rabbitmq-3-7/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [ {rabbit, [{ssl_options, [{cacertfile, "/path/to/testca/cacert.pem"}, {certfile, "/path/to/server/cert.pem"}, {keyfile, "/path/to/server/key.pem"}, {verify, verify_peer}, {fail_if_no_peer_cert, true}]}]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Message TTL Policy Using rabbitmqctl (Linux/Unix) DESCRIPTION: This command uses rabbitmqctl to set a policy that applies a 60-second message TTL to all queues. The policy is defined with the key 'message-ttl' and applies to any queue matching the '.*' pattern. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ttl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy TTL ".*" '{"message-ttl":60000}' --apply-to queues ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Plugin Tests DESCRIPTION: Command to execute the Common Test test suites for the plugin. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/src/pages/plugin-development.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make tests ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Relocating RabbitMQ Cluster Operator image to private registry DESCRIPTION: Commands to pull the Cluster Operator image from Docker Hub, tag it for a private registry, and push it to the private registry for environments that can't directly access Docker Hub. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/install-operator.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker pull rabbitmqoperator/cluster-operator:{some-version} docker tag rabbitmqoperator/cluster-operator:{some-version} {someregistry}/cluster-operator:{some-version} docker push {someregistry}/cluster-operator:{some-version} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining STOMP Protocol Versions in Erlang DESCRIPTION: This code snippet defines the available STOMP protocol versions for RabbitMQ connections. It includes three tuple representations for different STOMP versions. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_74 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {'STOMP', 0} {'STOMP', 1} {'STOMP', 2} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Combining Federation and TTL Policies in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to set a policy named 'ttl-fed' that applies to queues with names starting with 'tf.'. The policy combines federation settings with a message TTL of 60000 milliseconds and has a priority of 1. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/parameters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy ttl-fed \ "^tf\." '{"federation-upstream-set":"all", "message-ttl":60000}' \ --priority 1 \ --apply-to queues ``` LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy ttl-fed ^ "^tf\." "{""federation-upstream-set"":""all"", ""message-ttl"":60000}" ^ --priority 1 ^ --apply-to queues ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` PUT /api/policies/%2f/ttl-fed {"pattern": "^tf\.", "definition": {"federation-upstream-set":"all", "message-ttl":60000}, "priority": 1, "apply-to": "queues"} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing RabbitMQ Signing Key via Direct Download (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Downloads the RabbitMQ release signing key from GitHub and imports it using GPG. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/signatures.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -L https://github.com/rabbitmq/signing-keys/releases/download/3.0/rabbitmq-release-signing-key.asc --output rabbitmq-release-signing-key.asc gpg --import rabbitmq-release-signing-key.asc ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling STOMP Proxy Protocol DESCRIPTION: INI configuration to enable proxy protocol support for STOMP connections. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` stomp.proxy_protocol = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Queue Declaration with No Wait Option in RabbitMQ Java Client DESCRIPTION: Declares a queue using the 'no wait' version which doesn't wait for a server response. This is more efficient for high-churn scenarios but offers lower safety guarantees as it depends more on the heartbeat mechanism. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/java-api-guide.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` channel.queueDeclareNoWait(queueName, true, false, false, null); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting LDAP Activity Logging Level in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration example for setting the LDAP activity logging level to 'network' in RabbitMQ, which enables logging of LDAP network traffic with credentials scrubbed. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_ldap.log = network ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Cloudsmith Signing Key for RabbitMQ Repositories DESCRIPTION: Downloads and imports the Cloudsmith signing key used for RabbitMQ repositories. Cloudsmith is a hosted package distribution service used by RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/signatures.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # import the Cloudsmith key curl -1sLf https://github.com/rabbitmq/signing-keys/releases/download/3.0/cloudsmith.rabbitmq-server.9F4587F226208342.key -o cloudsmith-rabbitmq-key.asc gpg --import cloudsmith-rabbitmq-key.asc ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Nested Cuts in Erlang DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates that cuts can be applied to the results of previous cuts, as they produce standard fun expressions. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2011-05-17-can-you-hear-the-drums-erlando/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` test() -> Equals12 = assert_sum_3(_, _, _, 12), Equals5 = Equals12(_, _, 7), ok = Equals5(2, 3). ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Authentication Mechanisms Basic Config DESCRIPTION: Basic configuration for authentication mechanisms in RabbitMQ using anonymous auth. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_47 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_mechanisms.3 = ANONYMOUS ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TLS in RabbitMQ Erlang Client DESCRIPTION: Example code showing how to configure TLS options for a secure connection using the RabbitMQ Erlang client. Demonstrates setting up certificate files, verification options, and server name indication (SNI) for proper TLS handshaking. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_48 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` SslOpts = [{cacertfile, "/path/to/ca_certificate.pem"}, {certfile, "/path/to/client/certificate.pem"}, {keyfile, "/path/to/client/private_key.pem"}, %% only necessary with intermediate CAs %% {depth, 2}, %% Note: it is recommended to set 'verify' to %% to 'verify_peer' to ensure that X509 %% certificate chain validation is enabled %% %% Do not set 'verify' or set it to verify_none %% if x509 certificate chain validation is %% not desired {verify, verify_peer}, %% If Server Name Indication validation is desired, %% set the following option to the host name to which %% the connection is made. If necessary, this option %% may be set to another host name to match the server %% certificate's CN= value. %% Do not set this option or set it to the atom 'disable' %% to disable SNI validation {server_name_indication, "my.rmq-server.net"}], Params = #amqp_params_network{host = "my.rmq-server.net", port = 5671, ssl_options = SslOpts} {ok, Conn} = amqp_connection:start(Params), ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: HTTP GET Endpoints: Feature and Deprecation Management DESCRIPTION: Endpoints for checking feature flags and deprecated features status SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` GET /api/feature-flags ``` LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` GET /api/deprecated-features ``` LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` GET /api/deprecated-features/used ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Python Virtual Environment for Pika OAuth Testing DESCRIPTION: Alternative commands for setting up a Python virtual environment before installing the required packages for the Pika OAuth testing example. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/oauth2-examples-keycloak.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` python3 -m venv venv source venv/bin/activate ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Computing Password Hash using rabbitmqctl DESCRIPTION: Shows how to compute a password hash using the rabbitmqctl command-line tool. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/passwords.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl hash_password foobarbaz ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Benchmarking Classic Queues with Fixed Rate Throughput DESCRIPTION: Shell command for perf-test configured to benchmark classic queues at a fixed rate of 10,000 messages per second. This configuration focuses on measuring latency rather than maximum throughput. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2022-05-16-rabbitmq-3.10-performance-improvements/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` # classic queues (with an exactly=3 mirroring policy where applicable) perf-test --rate 10000 --confirm 3000 --multi-ack-every 3000 --qos 3000 \ --variable-size 10:900 --variable-size 100:900 --variable-size 1000:900 --variable-size 5000:900 \ --auto-delete false --flag persistent --queue cq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ to Listen on Specific IPv4 Interfaces DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to configure RabbitMQ to listen on specific IPv4 interfaces for both plain AMQP and TLS connections. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` listeners.tcp.1 = 192.168.1.99:5672 # Plain AMQP listeners.ssl.1 = 192.168.1.99:5671 # TLS (AMQPS) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining a Federation Policy in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to set a policy named 'federate-me' that applies to exchanges with names starting with 'federated.'. The policy sets the federation-upstream-set to 'all' with a priority of 1. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/parameters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy federate-me \ "^federated\." '{"federation-upstream-set":"all"}' \ --priority 1 \ --apply-to exchanges ``` LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat set_policy federate-me ^ "^federated\." "{""federation-upstream-set"":""all""}" ^ --priority 1 ^ --apply-to exchanges ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` PUT /api/policies/%2f/federate-me {"pattern": "^federated\.", "definition": {"federation-upstream-set":"all"}, "priority": 1, "apply-to": "exchanges"} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Linux Kernel Parameters with sysctl DESCRIPTION: This bash command demonstrates how to set the maximum number of file handles the kernel will allocate using sysctl. This is important for systems handling many concurrent connections. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_30 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sysctl -w fs.file-max 200000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Queue TTL Using RabbitMQ Policy (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Sets a policy that makes all queues expire after 30 minutes (1,800,000 milliseconds) of inactivity using rabbitmqctl command in bash. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ttl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy expiry ".*" '{"expires":1800000}' --apply-to queues ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Certificate to Windows User Root Certificate Store DESCRIPTION: PowerShell command to add a CA certificate to the Windows user Root certificate store using the certmgr tool. This enables client applications to trust servers presenting certificates signed by this CA. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` # Windows certmgr -add -all \path\to\cacert.cer -s Root ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting RabbitMQ Cluster Name DESCRIPTION: Command to set a custom cluster name for RabbitMQ federation identification. The cluster name is important for distinguishing between different nodes in the federation graph, especially when DNS names might not be distinct. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/federation-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_cluster_name "east1-production" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: OAuth 2.0 End Session Endpoint Configuration in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This configuration example shows how to set up an end session endpoint for Single Logout functionality, which enables users logging out of the management UI to also log out from the OAuth provider. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_oauth2.resource_server_id = rabbitmq-prod auth_oauth2.scope_prefix = rabbitmq. auth_oauth2.issuer = https://prodkeycloak:8080/realm/prod auth_oauth2.end_session_endpoint = https://prodkeycloak:8080/realm/prod/logout ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Prometheus TCP Port in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Sets the TCP port for the Prometheus plugin API endpoint in RabbitMQ configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/prometheus/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` prometheus.tcp.port = 15692 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using no-ack Mode for AMQP 0-9-1 Shovel Acknowledgments DESCRIPTION: The no-ack acknowledgment mode uses automatic message acknowledgments for highest throughput, but is not safe as it will lose messages during network or broker failures. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/shovel-dynamic.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` no-ack ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting RabbitMQ with Make DESCRIPTION: Alternative command using Make to start the RabbitMQ cluster with metrics SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/prometheus/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make metrics overview ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking RabbitMQ Listeners with rabbitmq-diagnostics DESCRIPTION: Uses the rabbitmq-diagnostics command to check what interface and port is being used by a running RabbitMQ node for Prometheus metrics. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/prometheus/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics -s listeners ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Minimal RabbitMQ Configuration Example (Classic Format) DESCRIPTION: The same port configuration as above but using the classic Erlang terms format, demonstrating the difference in complexity between the two formats. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` %% this is a comment [ {rabbit, [ {tcp_listeners, [5673]} ] } ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing RabbitMQ on Ubuntu 24.04 using Cloudsmith mirror repositories DESCRIPTION: A shell script for installing RabbitMQ on Ubuntu 24.04 (Noble) using Cloudsmith mirror repositories. The script adds necessary apt repositories, imports GPG keys, installs required Erlang packages, and then installs the RabbitMQ server package. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` #!/bin/sh sudo apt-get install curl gnupg apt-transport-https -y ## Team RabbitMQ's main signing key curl -1sLf "https://keys.openpgp.org/vks/v1/by-fingerprint/0A9AF2115F4687BD29803A206B73A36E6026DFCA" | sudo gpg --dearmor | sudo tee /usr/share/keyrings/com.rabbitmq.team.gpg > /dev/null ## Community mirror of Cloudsmith: modern Erlang repository curl -1sLf https://github.com/rabbitmq/signing-keys/releases/download/3.0/cloudsmith.rabbitmq-erlang.E495BB49CC4BBE5B.key | sudo gpg --dearmor | sudo tee /usr/share/keyrings/rabbitmq.E495BB49CC4BBE5B.gpg > /dev/null ## Community mirror of Cloudsmith: RabbitMQ repository curl -1sLf https://github.com/rabbitmq/signing-keys/releases/download/3.0/cloudsmith.rabbitmq-server.9F4587F226208342.key | sudo gpg --dearmor | sudo tee /usr/share/keyrings/rabbitmq.9F4587F226208342.gpg > /dev/null ## Add apt repositories maintained by Team RabbitMQ sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/rabbitmq.list < Listing permissions for vhost "/" ... # => user configure write read # => user2 .* .* .* # => guest .* .* .* # => temp-user .* .* .* rabbitmqctl list_permissions --vhost gw1 # => Listing permissions for vhost "gw1" ... # => user configure write read # => guest .* .* .* # => user2 ^user2 ^user2 ^user2 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Publishing Message with TTL in C# DESCRIPTION: This C# code example publishes a message with a 60-second TTL using the expiration property. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ttl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` byte[] messageBodyBytes = System.Text.Encoding.UTF8.GetBytes("Hello, world!"); IBasicProperties props = model.CreateBasicProperties(); props.ContentType = "text/plain"; props.DeliveryMode = 2; props.Expiration = "60000"; model.BasicPublish(exchangeName, routingKey, props, messageBodyBytes); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Managing RabbitMQ Server with systemctl Commands DESCRIPTION: Basic systemctl commands for starting, checking status, and stopping the RabbitMQ server. These commands should be run with administrator privileges. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-rpm.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` systemctl start rabbitmq-server systemctl status rabbitmq-server systemctl stop rabbitmq-server ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Debug Logging Level in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration settings for enabling debug level logging to file and console output in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_28 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.file.level = debug ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.console = true log.console.level = debug ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Logging Authorization Failure for Insufficient Permissions in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This log entry shows an authorization failure where a user has permissions but they are insufficient for the specific operation being attempted (in this case, queue declaration). SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_29 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` 2019-03-25 12:30:05.209 [error] <0.1627.0> Channel error on connection <0.1618.0> (127.0.0.1:63881 -> 127.0.0.1:5672, vhost: 'gw1', user: 'user2'), channel 1: operation queue.declare caused a channel exception access_refused: access to queue 'user3.q1' in vhost 'gw1' refused for user 'user2' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing All RabbitMQ Users DESCRIPTION: This command lists all users in the RabbitMQ broker, including their tags. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_20 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_users ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting RabbitMQ with UAA OAuth 2.0 Configuration DESCRIPTION: This command starts RabbitMQ configured to use UAA as its OAuth 2.0 authorization server. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make start-rabbitmq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building and Running the Topic Exchange Example DESCRIPTION: Command-line instructions for building and running the topic exchange example using Maven and Java. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-five-spring-amqp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ./mvnw clean package # shell 1 java -jar target/rabbitmq-tutorials.jar \ --spring.profiles.active=topics,receiver \ --tutorial.client.duration=60000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Prometheus TCP Port in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Sets the TCP port for the Prometheus plugin API endpoint in RabbitMQ configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/prometheus/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` prometheus.tcp.port = 15692 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing RabbitMQ Messaging Topology Operator with cert-manager DESCRIPTION: Command to install the latest version of RabbitMQ Messaging Topology Operator using cert-manager for certificate management. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/install-topology-operator.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl apply -f https://github.com/rabbitmq/messaging-topology-operator/releases/latest/download/messaging-topology-operator-with-certmanager.yaml ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Header-based Routing Configuration DESCRIPTION: Explains how CC and BCC headers can be used to route messages to additional destinations beyond the routing key. CC values are preserved in delivered messages while BCC values are removed before delivery. Headers must contain arrays of strings (longstr values) and are case-sensitive. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/sender-selected.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` The values associated with the "CC" and "BCC" header keys will\nbe added to the routing key if they are present.
