The message\nwill be routed to all destinations matching the routing key\nsupplied as a parameter to the `basic.publish`\nmethod, as well as the routes supplied in the "CC" and "BCC"\nheaders. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Combined Per-Consumer and Channel-Wide Prefetch Limits in Java DESCRIPTION: This example sets both a per-consumer limit (10) and a channel-wide limit (15) that applies across all consumers on the channel. Both limits must be satisfied for message delivery. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/consumer-prefetch.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` Channel channel = ...; Consumer consumer1 = ...; Consumer consumer2 = ...; channel.basicQos(10, false); // Per consumer limit channel.basicQos(15, true); // Per channel limit channel.basicConsume("my-queue1", false, consumer1); channel.basicConsume("my-queue2", false, consumer2); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing RabbitMQ Bindings Using diagnostics CLI DESCRIPTION: Command to list all bindings in a specific virtual host using rabbitmq-diagnostics. Note that implicit default exchange bindings are not listed in RabbitMQ 3.8 and later versions. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/publishers/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # note that the implicit default exchange bindings won't # be listed as of RabbitMQ 3.8 rabbitmq-diagnostics list_bindings --vhost "/" => Listing bindings for vhost /... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Lock Key Prefix for Consul Peer Discovery in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration for customizing the prefix used for lock keys in Consul when using it for peer discovery in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_34 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = consul cluster_formation.consul.host = consul.eng.example.local cluster_formation.consul.lock_timeout = 60 # should the Consul key used for locking be prefixed with something # other than "rabbitmq"? cluster_formation.consul.lock_prefix = environments-qa ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Distribution Listener Interface in RabbitMQ (INI) DESCRIPTION: Default network interface configuration used for communication with other cluster members and CLI tools. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` distribution.listener.interface = 0.0.0.0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: MQTT WebSocket Client Setup in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code showing how to initialize and configure a Paho MQTT client for WebSocket connections. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/web-mqtt.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` var wsbroker = location.hostname; // mqtt websocket enabled broker var wsport = 15675; // port for above var client = new Paho.MQTT.Client(wsbroker, wsport, "/ws", "myclientid_" + parseInt(Math.random() * 100, 10)); client.onConnectionLost = function (responseObject) { debug("CONNECTION LOST - " + responseObject.errorMessage); }; client.onMessageArrived = function (message) { debug("RECEIVE ON " + message.destinationName + " PAYLOAD " + message.payloadString); print_first(message.payloadString); }; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Lock Key Prefix for Consul Peer Discovery in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration for customizing the prefix used for lock keys in Consul when using it for peer discovery in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_34 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = consul cluster_formation.consul.host = consul.eng.example.local cluster_formation.consul.lock_timeout = 60 # should the Consul key used for locking be prefixed with something # other than "rabbitmq"? cluster_formation.consul.lock_prefix = environments-qa ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Distribution Port Range Minimum in RabbitMQ (INI) DESCRIPTION: Default setting for the lower bound of a server port range used for communication with other cluster members and CLI tools. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_20 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` distribution.listener.port_range.min = 25672 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Decrypting Values in RabbitMQ with decode Command DESCRIPTION: The decode command decrypts values that were previously encrypted with the encode command. It requires the encrypted value and the passphrase used for encryption, with optional parameters to specify cipher, hash algorithm, and iteration count. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_63 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl decode '{encrypted, <<"...">>}' mypassphrase ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl decode --cipher blowfish_cfb64 --hash sha256 --iterations 10000 '{encrypted,<<"...">>} mypassphrase ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Plugin Directory Configuration DESCRIPTION: Examples of configuring plugin directories in both bash and PowerShell environments using environment variables. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/plugins.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` PLUGINS_DIR="/usr/lib/rabbitmq/plugins:/usr/lib/rabbitmq/lib/rabbitmq_server-3.11.6/plugins" ``` LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` PLUGINS_DIR="C:\Example\RabbitMQ\plugins;C:\Example\RabbitMQ\rabbitmq_server-3.11.6\plugins" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Statistics Collection Interval in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to set the statistics collection interval in RabbitMQ to 60 seconds. Increasing this interval can reduce CPU footprint and peak memory consumption, especially useful for systems with a large number of connections. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/connections/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # sets the interval to 60 seconds collect_statistics_interval = 60000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Node Log Entry for TLS Connection DESCRIPTION: Example log entries showing a successful TLS connection and authentication to a RabbitMQ node. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/troubleshooting-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` 2018-09-27 15:46:20 [info] <0.1082.0> accepting AMQP connection <0.1082.0> (127.0.0.1:50915 -> 127.0.0.1:5671) 2018-09-27 15:46:20 [info] <0.1082.0> connection <0.1082.0> (127.0.0.1:50915 -> 127.0.0.1:5671): user 'user' authenticated and granted access to vhost 'virtual_host' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Exchange Bindings Using RabbitMQ Diagnostics CLI DESCRIPTION: This command shows how to use rabbitmq-diagnostics to list all bindings for a specific virtual host, which can help diagnose routing issues when messages aren't being delivered to any queues. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/publishers/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # note that the implicit default exchange bindings won't # be listed as of RabbitMQ 3.8 rabbitmq-diagnostics list_bindings --vhost "/" => Listing bindings for vhost /... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Consuming RabbitMQ Stream from Timestamp Offset in Java DESCRIPTION: Java code example demonstrating how to consume messages from a stream starting from a specific timestamp (in this case, one hour ago). The stream will start delivering messages from the closest offset to the specified time. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/streams.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` // an hour ago Date timestamp = new Date(System.currentTimeMillis() - 60 * 60 * 1_000) channel.basicQos(100); // QoS must be specified channel.basicConsume( "my-stream", false, Collections.singletonMap("x-stream-offset", timestamp), // timestamp offset (consumerTag, message) -> { // message processing // ... channel.basicAck(message.getEnvelope().getDeliveryTag(), false); // ack is required }, consumerTag -> { }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Essential Dependencies for RabbitMQ Erlang Repository DESCRIPTION: These bash commands update the package lists and install essential dependencies needed to download signing keys and packages over HTTPS for the RabbitMQ Erlang repository. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo apt-get update -y sudo apt-get install curl gnupg -y ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling RabbitMQ Prometheus Plugin in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to enable the rabbitmq_prometheus plugin on all RabbitMQ nodes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/prometheus/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_prometheus ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ Java Client with JMX Metrics using Micrometer DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to set up the RabbitMQ Java client with Micrometer to collect metrics and expose them through JMX. It includes creating a connection, channel, and simulating message publishing. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2018-04-10-rabbitmq-java-client-metrics-with-micrometer-and-datadog/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` MeterRegistry jmxRegistry = new JmxMeterRegistry(JmxConfig.DEFAULT, Clock.SYSTEM); ConnectionFactory connectionFactory = new ConnectionFactory(); MicrometerMetricsCollector metricsCollector = new MicrometerMetricsCollector( jmxRegistry, "rabbitmq.client" ); connectionFactory.setMetricsCollector(metricsCollector); Connection connection = connectionFactory.newConnection(); Channel channel = connection.createChannel(); String queue = channel.queueDeclare().getQueue(); channel.basicConsume(queue, true, (ctag, msg) -> { }, (ctag) -> { }); executor.submit(() -> { Random random = new Random(); while (true) { Thread.sleep(random.nextInt(100)); channel.basicPublish("", queue, null, "".getBytes()); } }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Pinging a RabbitMQ Node for Health Check DESCRIPTION: Command to verify that a specific RabbitMQ node is running, registered with EPMD, and accessible for CLI authentication. Useful for basic node health verification. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_41 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl ping -n rabbit@hostname ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Clearing Topic Permissions in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to remove topic permissions for a specific user and exchange in a virtual host. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl clear_topic_permissions -p my-vhost janeway amq.topic ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Testing Port Connectivity with Telnet - Success Case DESCRIPTION: Example of using telnet to test connectivity to RabbitMQ's AMQP port 5672, showing a successful connection attempt and subsequent closure due to invalid protocol data. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/troubleshooting-networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` telnet localhost 5672 # => Trying ::1... # => Connected to localhost. # => Escape character is '^]'. 12345 # enter this and hit Enter to send # => AMQP Connection closed by foreign host. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Runtime Parameter in RabbitMQ (JSON) DESCRIPTION: JSON payload for the PUT /api/parameters/{component}/{vhost}/{name} endpoint to create or update a runtime parameter. This example sets a policy for queues with names starting with 'cq'. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "vhost": "vh-2", "name": "policies.1", "pattern": "^cq", "apply-to": "queues", "definition": { "max-length": 1000000 } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Virtual Host Management Commands DESCRIPTION: Commands for creating and deleting virtual hosts with various options SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin declare vhost --name "vh-789" --default-queue-type "quorum" --description "Used to reproduce issue #789" ``` LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin delete vhost --name "vh-789" ``` LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin delete vhost --name "vh-789" --idempotently ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing RabbitMQ Vhost Parameters DESCRIPTION: Shows all parameters for a specific virtual host in RabbitMQ. This example lists parameters for the default virtual host using the 'list_parameters' action. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_49 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_parameters ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting up Kubernetes Namespace and RBAC Rules for RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Commands to apply the namespace and RBAC (Role-Based Access Control) configurations for RabbitMQ deployment, creating a dedicated namespace called 'test-rabbitmq' with appropriate permissions. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2020-08-10-deploying-rabbitmq-to-kubernetes-whats-involved/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl apply -f namespace.yaml kubectl apply -f rbac.yaml ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building and Running the RabbitMQ Tutorial Application DESCRIPTION: Commands for building the Java application with Maven and running both the consumer and producer components using Spring profiles. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-spring-amqp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ./mvnw clean package ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # consumer java -jar target/rabbitmq-tutorials.jar --spring.profiles.active=hello-world,receiver ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting OpenSSL Server for TLS Testing DESCRIPTION: Command to start an OpenSSL s_server instance with specified certificates and keys on port 8443 for TLS connection testing. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/troubleshooting-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` openssl s_server -accept 8443 \ -cert server_certificate.pem -key server_key.pem -CAfile ca_certificate.pem ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Virtual Host Management Commands DESCRIPTION: Commands for creating and deleting virtual hosts with various options SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin declare vhost --name "vh-789" --default-queue-type "quorum" --description "Used to reproduce issue #789" ``` LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin delete vhost --name "vh-789" ``` LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin delete vhost --name "vh-789" --idempotently ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting RabbitMQ Plugins with rabbitmq-plugins DESCRIPTION: This command enables the 'rabbitmq_management' plugin and its dependencies while disabling all other plugins. The 'set' command differs from 'enable' as it overwrites any existing enabled plugins configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmq-plugins.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins set rabbitmq_management ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Memory High Watermark (Absolute) in RabbitMQ (INI) DESCRIPTION: Sets an absolute value for the memory threshold at which flow control is triggered, specified in bytes or units like GB. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` vm_memory_high_watermark.absolute = 2GB ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Receiving Logs with Topic Exchange in RabbitMQ using Objective-C DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to receive logs using a topic exchange in RabbitMQ. It creates a connection, declares a topic exchange, creates an exclusive queue, binds the queue to the exchange with specified routing keys, and sets up a message consumer. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-five-objectivec.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Objective-C CODE: ``` - (void)receiveLogsTopic:(NSArray *)routingKeys { RMQConnection *conn = [[RMQConnection alloc] initWithDelegate:[RMQConnectionDelegateLogger new]]; [conn start]; id ch = [conn createChannel]; RMQExchange *x = [ch topic:@"topic_logs"]; RMQQueue *q = [ch queue:@"" options:RMQQueueDeclareExclusive]; for (NSString *routingKey in routingKeys) { [q bind:x routingKey:routingKey]; } NSLog(@"Waiting for logs."); [q subscribe:^(RMQMessage * _Nonnull message) { NSLog(@"%@:%@", message.routingKey, [[NSString alloc] initWithData:message.body encoding:NSUTF8StringEncoding]); }]; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Federation Status API Call DESCRIPTION: HTTP API request to configure federation policy SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/federation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` PUT /api/policies/%2f/federate-me {"pattern":"^amq\.", "definition":{"federation-upstream-set":"all"}, "apply-to":"exchanges"} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running RabbitMQ Sender with Spring AMQP DESCRIPTION: Command to execute the RabbitMQ sender application using Spring profiles. This command runs the sender part of the hello-world example from the compiled jar file. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-spring-amqp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` java -jar target/rabbitmq-tutorials.jar --spring.profiles.active=hello-world,sender ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Users in RabbitMQ using PowerShell DESCRIPTION: Shows how to add users in RabbitMQ using the rabbitmqctl.bat command in PowerShell. It includes examples of adding users with regular passwords and passwords containing special characters. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` # password is provided as a command line argument rabbitmqctl.bat add_user 'username' '9a55f70a841f18b97c3a7db939b7adc9e34a0f1d' # passwords with special characters must be quoted correctly rabbitmqctl.bat add_user 'username' '"w63pnZ&LnYMO(t"' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Custom Discovery Endpoint Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration for custom OpenID discovery endpoint path and additional parameters SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_oauth2.discovery_endpoint_path = my/custom/path auth_oauth2.discovery_endpoint_params.appid = some-app-id ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing RabbitMQ Management API with OAuth 2.0 Token DESCRIPTION: Bash command to access the RabbitMQ Management API using OAuth 2.0 authentication with Keycloak. Uses a specific client ID and secret to obtain an access token. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples-forward-proxy.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make curl-keycloak url=https://localhost:15671/api/overview client_id=mgt_api_client secret=LWOuYqJ8gjKg3D2U8CJZDuID3KiRZVDa realm=test ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Failed Cluster Join Example - PowerShell DESCRIPTION: PowerShell version of the failed cluster join example, showing the same error when attempting to join a cluster lacking quorum. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/metadata-store/clustering.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat -n rabbit@host-5 join_cluster rabbit@host-4 # => Error: # => Khepri has timed out on node rabbit@host-5. # => Khepri cluster could be in minority. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: LDAP Other Bind Configuration in INI Format DESCRIPTION: Configuration for specifying binding credentials for authorization queries SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_29 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_ldap.other_bind.user_dn = a-username auth_ldap.other_bind.password = a-password ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating the RabbitMQ Cluster Operator Manifest with kubectl DESCRIPTION: This command applies the latest version of the RabbitMQ Cluster Operator manifest from the GitHub repository. It updates the Custom Resource Definitions and the Operator Pod to use the newest version of the operator container image. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/upgrade-operator.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl apply -f "https://github.com/rabbitmq/cluster-operator/releases/latest/download/cluster-operator.yml" # namespace/rabbitmq-system unchanged # customresourcedefinition.apiextensions.k8s.io/rabbitmqclusters.rabbitmq.com configured # serviceaccount/rabbitmq-cluster-operator unchanged # role.rbac.authorization.k8s.io/rabbitmq-cluster-leader-election-role unchanged # clusterrole.rbac.authorization.k8s.io/rabbitmq-cluster-operator-role unchanged # rolebinding.rbac.authorization.k8s.io/rabbitmq-cluster-leader-election-rolebinding unchanged # clusterrolebinding.rbac.authorization.k8s.io/rabbitmq-cluster-operator-rolebinding unchanged # deployment.apps/rabbitmq-cluster-operator configured ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Inspecting TCP Listeners on Port 5672 using lsof (IPv6) DESCRIPTION: Similar to the previous command, but for IPv6. This helps verify RabbitMQ's listening status on IPv6 interfaces. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/troubleshooting-networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` sudo lsof -n -i6TCP:5672 | grep LISTEN ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Mirroring Policy for Specific Nodes in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: PowerShell command to set a policy that mirrors queues with names starting with "nodes." to specific nodes (nodeA and nodeB) in the cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ha/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat set_policy ha-nodes "^nodes\." ^ "{""ha-mode"":""nodes"",""ha-params"":[""rabbit@nodeA"", ""rabbit@nodeB""]}" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: TCP Buffer Configuration for STOMP DESCRIPTION: TCP listener options configuration for STOMP connections with optimized buffer sizes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` stomp.tcp_listen_options.backlog = 128 stomp.tcp_listen_options.nodelay = true stomp.tcp_listen_options.linger.on = true stomp.tcp_listen_options.linger.timeout = 0 stomp.tcp_listen_options.sndbuf = 196608 stomp.tcp_listen_options.recbuf = 196608 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Plugins with rabbitmq-plugins Command DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to enable a plugin using the rabbitmq-plugins CLI tool. The example shows enabling the Kubernetes peer discovery plugin. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/plugins.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins enable ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_peer_discovery_k8s ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Service Address for RabbitMQ Cluster Formation with Consul DESCRIPTION: Sets a hardcoded service address for RabbitMQ nodes in Consul. This address will be used by other nodes to connect to this RabbitMQ instance. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = consul cluster_formation.consul.host = consul.eng.example.local cluster_formation.consul.svc = rabbitmq # do not compute service address, it will be specified below cluster_formation.consul.svc_addr_auto = false # service address, will be communicated to other nodes cluster_formation.consul.svc_addr = hostname1.rmq.eng.example.local # use long RabbitMQ node names? cluster_formation.consul.use_longname = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Debug Log Level for Console Output in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets the logging level to 'debug' for console output in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.console.level = debug ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Locating RabbitMQ Plugin Directories (Bash) DESCRIPTION: This command shows how to use rabbitmq-plugins to locate the plugin directories and enabled plugins file. It's useful for troubleshooting plugin installation and activation issues. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/plugins.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins directories -s # => Plugin archives directory: /path/to/rabbitmq/plugins # => Plugin expansion directory: /path/to/node/node-plugins-expand # => Enabled plugins file: /path/to/enabled_plugins ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Minimal RabbitMQ Configuration Example (Modern Format) DESCRIPTION: A simple example showing how to change the default TCP listener port from 5672 to 5673 using the modern configuration format in rabbitmq.conf. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # this is a comment listeners.tcp.default = 5673 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Receiving Logs from Specific Facility with Topic Exchange in RabbitMQ using Objective-C DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to receive logs from a specific facility (in this case, 'kern') using a topic exchange in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-five-objectivec.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: Objective-C CODE: ``` [self receiveLogsTopic:@[@"kern.*"]]; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Forcing RabbitMQ Node to Boot DESCRIPTION: This command ensures that a node will start the next time, even if it was not the last to shut down. Used in situations where all nodes lost power simultaneously and normal startup order cannot be determined. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl force_boot ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ Shovel Between AMQP 0.9.1 Endpoints DESCRIPTION: Complete static shovel configuration for transferring messages between AMQP 0.9.1 endpoints. Includes source and destination broker configurations, exchange declarations, queue bindings, and message handling parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/shovel-static.md#2025-04-09_snippet_20 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {rabbitmq_shovel, [ {shovels, [ {my_first_shovel, [ {source, [ {protocol, amqp091}, {uris, [ "amqp://fred:secret@host1.domain/my_vhost", "amqp://john:secret@host2.domain/my_vhost" ]}, {declarations, [ {'exchange.declare', [ {exchange, <<"my_fanout">>}, {type, <<"fanout">>}, durable ]}, {'queue.declare', [{arguments, [{<<"x-message-ttl">>, long, 60000}]}]}, {'queue.bind', [ {exchange, <<"my_fanout">>}, {queue, <<>>} ]} ]}, {queue, <<>>}, {prefetch_count, 10} ]}, {destination, [ {protocol, amqp091}, {uris, ["amqp://"]}, {declarations, [ {'exchange.declare', [ {exchange, <<"my_direct">>}, {type, <<"direct">>}, durable ]} ]}, {publish_properties, [ {delivery_mode, 2} ]}, {add_forward_headers, true}, {publish_fields, [ {exchange, <<"my_direct">>}, {routing_key, <<"from_shovel">>} ]} ]}, {ack_mode, on_confirm}, {reconnect_delay, 5} ]} ]} ]} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling RabbitMQ LDAP Plugin DESCRIPTION: Use rabbitmq-plugins to enable the LDAP authentication backend plugin. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_auth_backend_ldap ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Secure Renegotiation for Inter-node TLS in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Extends the previous configuration to enable secure renegotiation for inter-node TLS connections, which is highly recommended for security. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/clustering-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS="-pa $ERL_SSL_PATH \ -proto_dist inet_tls \ -ssl_dist_opt server_certfile /path/to/combined_keys.pem \ -ssl_dist_opt server_password password \ -ssl_dist_opt server_secure_renegotiate true client_secure_renegotiate true" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing RabbitMQ Client in Swift DESCRIPTION: Imports the RabbitMQ Objective-C client library as a module in Swift, which is required to use RabbitMQ messaging functionality in an iOS application. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-swift.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Swift CODE: ``` import RMQClient ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Increasing Inter-node Communication Buffer Size via VM Flag DESCRIPTION: Alternative approach to increase the inter-node communication buffer size to 192MB using the direct Erlang VM flag for heavy inter-node traffic. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/runtime.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` RABBITMQ_SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS="+zdbbl 192000" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing User Permissions in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Displays all virtual hosts to which a specific user has been granted access, along with their permissions for operations on resources in these virtual hosts. This command is useful for auditing a user's access across the RabbitMQ cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_27 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_user_permissions janeway ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Inspecting TCP Listeners on Port 5672 using lsof (IPv6) DESCRIPTION: Similar to the previous command, but for IPv6. This helps verify RabbitMQ's listening status on IPv6 interfaces. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/troubleshooting-networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` sudo lsof -n -i6TCP:5672 | grep LISTEN ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating apt Sources DESCRIPTION: Updates the list of apt sources after adding the new Erlang repository. This step is necessary before installing packages from the newly added repository. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_27 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo apt-get update -y ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Key Prefix and Cluster Name for RabbitMQ etcd Peer Discovery DESCRIPTION: Configuration for customizing the key prefix and cluster name in RabbitMQ's etcd-based peer discovery. This allows for multiple RabbitMQ clusters to share an etcd installation. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_41 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = etcd cluster_formation.etcd.endpoints.1 = one.etcd.eng.example.local:2379 cluster_formation.etcd.endpoints.2 = two.etcd.eng.example.local:2479 cluster_formation.etcd.endpoints.3 = three.etcd.eng.example.local:2579 # rabbitmq is used by default cluster_formation.etcd.key_prefix = rabbitmq_discovery # default name: "default" cluster_formation.etcd.cluster_name = staging ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example TOML Configuration File for RabbitMQ Admin DESCRIPTION: TOML-formatted configuration file for rabbitmqadmin v2 that stores connection settings for different environments (local, staging, production) under named aliases. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_20 LANGUAGE: toml CODE: ``` [local] hostname = "localhost" port = 15672 username = "lolz" password = "lolz" vhost = '/' [staging] hostname = "192.168.20.31" port = 15672 username = "staging-2387a72329" password = "staging-1d20cfbd9d" [production] hostname = "(redacted)" port = 15671 username = "user-2ca6bae15ff6b79e92" password = "user-92ee4c479ae604cc72" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Virtual Hosts in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to list virtual hosts with specific information items (name and tracing status). SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_28 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_vhosts name tracing ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Removing Virtual Host Protection from Deletion Using HTTP API DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to remove deletion protection from a RabbitMQ virtual host using the HTTP API with curl, allowing it to be deleted again. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -u userename:pa$sw0rD -X POST http://rabbitmq.local:15672/api/vhosts/vh1/deletion/protection ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Federation Policy for Queue Migration in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Creates a policy that applies federation to all queues, enabling messages from the 'blue' cluster to be consumed by clients connected to the 'green' cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/blue-green-upgrade.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy --apply-to queues blue-green-migration ".*" \ '{"federation-upstream":"blue"}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Overriding RabbitMQ Cluster Resource Properties DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration showing how to customize StatefulSet and Service properties with additional ports. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-operator/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiVersion: rabbitmq.com/v1beta1 kind: RabbitmqCluster metadata: name: additional-port spec: replicas: 1 override: service: spec: ports: - name: additional-port # adds an additional port on the service protocol: TCP port: 12345 statefulSet: spec: template: spec: containers: - name: rabbitmq ports: - containerPort: 12345 # opens an additional port on the rabbitmq server container name: additional-port protocol: TCP ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Certificates in Mono Trust Store DESCRIPTION: Bash command to list all certificates in the Mono Trust certificate store. This allows verification that certificates were correctly imported. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` certmgr -list -c Trust # … snip … Self-signed X.509 v3 Certificate Serial Number: AC3F2B74ECDD9EEA00 Issuer Name: CN=MyTestCA Subject Name: CN=MyTestCA valid From: 25/08/2018 14:03:01 valid Until: 24/09/2018 14:03:01 Unique Hash: 1F04D1D2C20B97BDD5DB70B9EB2013550697A05E ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Certificate Chain Verification Depth (New Format) DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to configure certificate chain verification depth in RabbitMQ using the new style configuration format. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` listeners.ssl.default = 5671 ssl_options.cacertfile = /path/to/ca_certificate.pem ssl_options.certfile = /path/to/server_certificate.pem ssl_options.keyfile = /path/to/server_key.pem ssl_options.verify = verify_peer ssl_options.depth = 2 ssl_options.fail_if_no_peer_cert = false ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting RabbitMQ Server in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to start a new RabbitMQ node using the rabbitmq-server command in bash shell. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/metadata-store/how-to-enable-khepri.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-server ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Consul ACL Token DESCRIPTION: Settings for specifying the Consul ACL token for authentication SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_20 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = consul cluster_formation.consul.host = consul.eng.example.local cluster_formation.consul.acl_token = acl-token-value ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Stream Flow Control Settings in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to adjust the flow control settings for stream connections, including the initial credits and credits required for unblocking. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/stream.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` stream.initial_credits = 100000 stream.credits_required_for_unblocking = 25000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Computing Password Hash using rabbitmqctl DESCRIPTION: Command to compute a password hash using the rabbitmqctl utility. This is useful for updating passwords via the HTTP API or generating definitions files. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/passwords.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl hash_password foobarbaz ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Filtering RabbitMQ Plugins by Name Pattern DESCRIPTION: Lists plugins whose names contain the specified pattern (e.g., "management") with verbose output. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmq-plugins.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins list -v management ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Verifying Node.js Installation with PowerShell DESCRIPTION: Command to verify that the Node.js toolchain is properly installed and available in PATH by displaying the npm help message. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-javascript-stream.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` npm --help ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Preferred Username Claims in RabbitMQ OAuth2 DESCRIPTION: Configuration snippet showing how to set up preferred username claims in RabbitMQ. It configures the resource server ID and defines a sequence of claims to check for usernames. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_32 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` ... auth_oauth2.resource_server_id = rabbitmq auth_oauth2.preferred_username_claims.1 = user_name auth_oauth2.preferred_username_claims.2 = email ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring OAuth 2.0 Signing Keys in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration example showing how to set up multiple signing keys, preferred username claims, and supported algorithms for OAuth 2.0 authentication. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_oauth2.resource_server_id = new_resource_server_id auth_oauth2.additional_scopes_key = my_custom_scope_key auth_oauth2.preferred_username_claims.1 = username auth_oauth2.preferred_username_claims.2 = user_name auth_oauth2.default_key = id1 auth_oauth2.signing_keys.id1 = test/config_schema_SUITE_data/certs/key.pem auth_oauth2.signing_keys.id2 = test/config_schema_SUITE_data/certs/cert.pem auth_oauth2.algorithms.1 = HS256 auth_oauth2.algorithms.2 = RS256 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Binding a Queue with a Routing Key in Elixir DESCRIPTION: Code showing how to bind a queue to an exchange with a specific routing key. The routing key (called binding key here) determines which messages the queue will receive. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-elixir.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: elixir CODE: ``` AMQP.Queue.bind(channel, queue_name, exchange_name, routing_key: "black") ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking RabbitMQ Server Version DESCRIPTION: Reports the target node's version with quiet mode enabled using the -q flag to display only the version information. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics server_version -q ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Launching Erlang Crash Dump Viewer DESCRIPTION: Command to launch the Erlang Crash Dump Viewer (cdv) tool for visualizing and analyzing crash dump files. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/troubleshooting/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` /usr/local/lib/erlang/lib/observer-2.9.1/priv/bin/cdv ./erl_crash.dump ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Virtual Hosts in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: This command lists all virtual hosts in RabbitMQ. It can include additional information items such as name and tracing status. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_29 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_vhosts name tracing ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Alternate Exchange Using Policy in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to set a policy for an Alternate Exchange using the rabbitmqctl command in PowerShell. It applies an AE named 'my-ae' to an exchange called 'my-direct'. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ae.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat set_policy AE '^my-direct$' '"{""alternate-exchange":""my-ae""}"' --apply-to exchanges ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Sample Retention Policies in RabbitMQ Management Plugin DESCRIPTION: Sets the retention periods for different types of monitoring data in the management plugin. Global data is retained at varying resolutions up to a day, basic data for up to an hour, and detailed data for only 10 seconds. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_28 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.sample_retention_policies.global.minute = 5 management.sample_retention_policies.global.hour = 60 management.sample_retention_policies.global.day = 1200 management.sample_retention_policies.basic.minute = 5 management.sample_retention_policies.basic.hour = 60 management.sample_retention_policies.detailed.10 = 5 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Inspecting All TCP Connections using netstat DESCRIPTION: This command uses netstat to list all TCP connection sockets, displaying IP addresses as numbers and showing program names. It's useful for a comprehensive view of all TCP connections on the system. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/troubleshooting-networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo netstat --all --numeric --tcp --programs ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TLS for RabbitMQ Inter-node Communication Using Command Line Arguments (Linux) DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to configure TLS encryption for RabbitMQ inter-node communication by specifying Erlang runtime parameters directly in rabbitmq-env.conf. It sets the SSL path, enables TLS protocol, specifies certificate locations, and configures secure renegotiation. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/clustering-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # change depending on the Erlang version, distribution, # and installation method used). Please double check it before proceeding! ERL_SSL_PATH="/usr/lib64/erlang/lib/ssl-9.4/ebin" # -pa $ERL_SSL_PATH prepends the directory ERL_SSL_PATH points at to the code path # -proto_dist inet_tls tells the runtime to encrypt inter-node communication # -ssl_dist_opt server_certfile /path/to/combined_keys.pem tells the runtime # where to find the combined certificate/key file # -ssl_dist_opt server_password password required if the private key is encrypted # -ssl_dist_opt server_secure_renegotiate true client_secure_renegotiate true enables an additional TLS setting: secure renegotiation SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS="-pa $ERL_SSL_PATH \ -proto_dist inet_tls \ -ssl_dist_opt server_certfile /path/to/combined_keys.pem \ -ssl_dist_opt server_password password \ -ssl_dist_opt server_secure_renegotiate true client_secure_renegotiate true" # Same settings as above but for CLI tools RABBITMQ_CTL_ERL_ARGS="-pa $ERL_SSL_PATH \ -proto_dist inet_tls \ -ssl_dist_opt server_certfile /path/to/combined_keys.pem \ -ssl_dist_opt server_password password \ -ssl_dist_opt server_secure_renegotiate true client_secure_renegotiate true" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running RabbitMQ Receiver in Terminal DESCRIPTION: Command to run the receive_logs.go program to display incoming log messages on the console. This is used to monitor messages in real-time. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-go.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` go run receive_logs.go ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Syslog Identity and Facility DESCRIPTION: Configuration for custom Syslog identity and facility values. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_24 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.syslog = true log.syslog.identity = my_rabbitmq log.syslog.facility = user ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Hostname Suffix for RabbitMQ Cluster Formation in Kubernetes DESCRIPTION: Adds a suffix to peer hostnames returned by Kubernetes. This can be useful for domain name completeness or to distinguish between different environments. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = k8s cluster_formation.k8s.host = kubernetes.default.example.local cluster_formation.k8s.token_path = /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/token cluster_formation.k8s.cert_path = /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/ca.crt cluster_formation.k8s.namespace_path = /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/namespace # no suffix is appended by default cluster_formation.k8s.hostname_suffix = rmq.eng.example.local ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Used Deprecated Features with Shell Command DESCRIPTION: Command to list all deprecated features that are currently in use within the RabbitMQ cluster using rabbitmqadmin CLI tool. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin deprecated_features list_used ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Exchanges with RabbitMQ CLI DESCRIPTION: Command-line instruction to list all exchanges currently defined on the RabbitMQ server. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-ruby.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo rabbitmqctl list_exchanges ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building RabbitMQ Server and Plugins DESCRIPTION: Commands to change into the rabbitmq directory and build the server along with all plugins using GNU Make. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/build-server.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cd rabbitmq make ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Resource Exposure in Management UI DESCRIPTION: Configuration to disable a resource from being exposed in the management UI interface. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.oauth_resource_servers.4.id = rabbit_internal management.oauth_resource_servers.4.disabled = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Channel for RabbitMQ Operations DESCRIPTION: Creates a channel from the RabbitMQ connection, which is the primary interface for API operations. Includes error handling and channel cleanup. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-go.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: go CODE: ``` ch, err := conn.Channel() failOnError(err, "Failed to open a channel") defer ch.Close() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Global TLS Options in RabbitMQ Erlang Client DESCRIPTION: Example of setting global TLS options in the advanced.config file for the RabbitMQ Erlang client. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/uri-query-parameters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {amqp_client, [ {ssl_options, [ {cacertfile, "path-to-ca-certificate"}, {certfile, "path-to-certificate"}, {keyfile, "path-to-keyfile"}, {verify, verify_peer} ]} ]}. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Forcing Garbage Collection and Analyzing Binary Heap in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: These commands force garbage collection and report the top processes that released the most binary heap references in RabbitMQ. This can be useful for managing memory usage, especially for binaries. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/memory-use/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl eval 'recon:bin_leak(10).' rabbitmqctl force_gc ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Resource Name Match Example DESCRIPTION: Example of matching resource names against username patterns. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_32 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {resource_access_query, {match, {string, "${name}"}, {string, "^${username}-"}}} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TCP Buffer Size for AMQP Connections DESCRIPTION: Configuration settings for optimizing TCP buffer size for AMQP 0-9-1 connections, setting buffers to 32 KiB. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_20 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` tcp_listen_options.backlog = 128 tcp_listen_options.nodelay = true tcp_listen_options.linger.on = true tcp_listen_options.linger.timeout = 0 tcp_listen_options.sndbuf = 32768 tcp_listen_options.recbuf = 32768 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Tail Plugin DESCRIPTION: Command to install the tail plugin for log viewing functionality. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/kubectl-plugin.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl krew install tail ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Firehose Tracing in RabbitMQ with CLI DESCRIPTION: Command to turn off the Firehose tracing feature for a specified virtual host in RabbitMQ. This should be done after debugging is complete to restore normal performance. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/firehose.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl trace_off -p [virtual host] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TCP Buffer Size for STOMP Connections DESCRIPTION: Configuration settings for optimizing TCP buffer size for STOMP connections, setting buffers to 32 KiB. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` stomp.tcp_listen_options.backlog = 128 stomp.tcp_listen_options.nodelay = true stomp.tcp_listen_options.linger.on = true stomp.tcp_listen_options.linger.timeout = 0 stomp.tcp_listen_options.sndbuf = 32768 stomp.tcp_listen_options.recbuf = 32768 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Maximum Connections and Channels Limits with rabbitmqctl DESCRIPTION: This command sets both maximum connections (10) and maximum channels (20) limits for the guest user using rabbitmqctl. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/user-limits.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_user_limits guest '{"max-connections": 10, "max-channels": 20}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Per-User Limit in RabbitMQ (Shell) DESCRIPTION: cURL command to set a per-user limit using the RabbitMQ Management API. This example sets the max-connections limit for the 'guest' user to 100. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` curl -4u 'guest:guest' -H 'content-type:application/json' -X PUT localhost:15672/api/user-limits/guest/max-connections -d '{"value": 100}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Topic Exchange Permissions in RabbitMQ (JSON) DESCRIPTION: JSON payload for the PUT /api/topic-permissions/{vhost}/{user} endpoint to grant or update a user's topic exchange permissions. This example sets permissions for the 'amq.topic' exchange. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "exchange": "amq.topic", "write": "^a", "read":".*", "configure":".*" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ Node Restart Settings DESCRIPTION: Configuration settings to adjust the timeout and retry parameters for RabbitMQ nodes when rejoining a cluster after restart. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/clustering.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # wait for 60 seconds instead of 30 mnesia_table_loading_retry_timeout = 60000 # retry 15 times instead of 10 mnesia_table_loading_retry_limit = 15 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Proxy Protocol Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration to enable proxy protocol support for AMQP connections. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` proxy_protocol = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Package Indices DESCRIPTION: Updates the local package index after adding new repository sources. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo apt-get update -y ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Default Disk Free Limit in RabbitMQ (INI) DESCRIPTION: Default disk free space threshold (50MB) below which flow control is triggered. This should be increased for production environments. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_29 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` disk_free_limit.absolute = 50MB ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Analyzing RabbitMQ Dead Letter Confirmed Metrics DESCRIPTION: Sample metrics showing confirmed dead-lettered messages in RabbitMQ. These metrics represent messages that were successfully acknowledged by dead letter consumers, confirming proper routing and delivery. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2022-03-29-at-least-once-dead-lettering/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: zsh CODE: ``` rabbitmq_global_messages_dead_lettered_confirmed_total{queue_type="rabbit_quorum_queue",dead_letter_strategy="at_least_once"} 1 rabbitmq_global_messages_dead_lettered_expired_total{queue_type="rabbit_quorum_queue",dead_letter_strategy="at_least_once"} 1 rabbitmq_global_messages_dead_lettered_expired_total{queue_type="rabbit_quorum_queue",dead_letter_strategy="at_most_once"} 1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting RabbitMQ Server as a Detached Application in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: This command starts the RabbitMQ server as a detached application, running in the background. It assumes the RabbitMQ sbin directory is in the system PATH. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/install-windows-manual.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` rabbitmq-server.bat -detached ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using curl with JWT Token for RabbitMQ API DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to use curl to hit a RabbitMQ management endpoint with a JWT token. It uses a make target that calls a Python script to build and sign the token. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make curl-with-token URL=http://localhost:15672/api/overview TOKEN=$(bin/jwt_token scope-and-extra-scope.json legacy-token-key private.pem public.pem) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Inter-node Communication Buffer Size in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: These examples show how to increase the inter-node communication buffer size to 192MB using either an environment variable or a VM flag. This can help with heavy inter-node traffic or large message transfers. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/runtime.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` RABBITMQ_DISTRIBUTION_BUFFER_SIZE=192000 ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` RABBITMQ_SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS="+zdbbl 192000" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Feature Flags in Advanced Config DESCRIPTION: Example of setting specific feature flags in the RabbitMQ advanced.config file using the forced_feature_flags_on_init setting. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/feature-flags/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {rabbit, [ {forced_feature_flags_on_init, [ maintenance_mode_status, direct_exchange_routing_v2, user_limits, transient_nonexcl_queues, amqp_address_v1,stream_filtering, implicit_default_bindings, quorum_queue_non_voters, 'rabbitmq_4.0.0', tracking_records_in_ets, delete_ra_cluster_mqtt_node, classic_queue_type_delivery_support, restart_streams, message_containers_deaths_v2, feature_flags_v2,empty_basic_get_metric, classic_queue_mirroring, rabbit_exchange_type_local_random, detailed_queues_endpoint, stream_queue, classic_mirrored_queue_version, quorum_queue, management_metrics_collection, message_containers, ram_node_type, stream_sac_coordinator_unblock_group, drop_unroutable_metric, stream_single_active_consumer, virtual_host_metadata, listener_records_in_ets, stream_update_config_command, global_qos, queue_master_locator, rabbit_mqtt_qos0_queue,mqtt_v5 ]} ]} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Failed Cluster Join Operation with Khepri in Minority State DESCRIPTION: Example of an error when attempting to join a node to a RabbitMQ cluster where Khepri can't establish a quorum. Shows both Bash and PowerShell variants of the command and resulting error message. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/metadata-store/clustering.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl -n rabbit@host-5 join_cluster rabbit@host-4 # => Error: # => Khepri has timed out on node rabbit@host-5. # => Khepri cluster could be in minority. ``` LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat -n rabbit@host-5 join_cluster rabbit@host-4 # => Error: # => Khepri has timed out on node rabbit@host-5. # => Khepri cluster could be in minority. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running RabbitMQ Consumer in Ruby DESCRIPTION: Command to run the Ruby script that acts as a consumer, receiving messages from RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-ruby.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ruby receive.rb ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Web STOMP Examples Plugin DESCRIPTION: Command to enable the RabbitMQ Web STOMP examples plugin. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/web-stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_web_stomp_examples ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Heartbeat Timeout in .NET RabbitMQ Client DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to set the heartbeat timeout to 60 seconds using the ConnectionFactory in .NET client before creating a connection. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/heartbeats.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` var cf = new ConnectionFactory(); // set the heartbeat timeout to 60 seconds cf.RequestedHeartbeat = TimeSpan.FromSeconds(60); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: TLS Data Integrity Check Failure in RabbitMQ Connections DESCRIPTION: Error pattern indicating that the TLS server detected a data integrity issue. This can be caused by network equipment problems, socket sharing in clients, or bugs in TLS client implementations. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/troubleshooting-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_20 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {tls_alert,"bad record mac"} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Operator Policy Changes in RabbitMQ Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration setting to disable modification of operator policies via the HTTP API and Web UI, making them read-only for all users through these interfaces. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/parameters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.restrictions.operator_policy_changes.disabled = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: AWS IAM Policy DESCRIPTION: IAM policy for allowing EC2 instances to use metadata service and autoscaling group member discovery SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "Version": "2012-10-17", "Statement": [ { "Effect": "Allow", "Action": [ "autoscaling:DescribeAutoScalingInstances", "ec2:DescribeInstances" ], "Resource": [ "*" ] } ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Decoding Encrypted Values with RabbitMQ CLI DESCRIPTION: Command for decrypting values using specified cipher, hash algorithm and iteration count SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_63 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl decode --cipher blowfish_cfb64 --hash sha256 --iterations 10000 '{encrypted,<<"...">>} mypassphrase' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting RabbitMQ Server with MQTT Plugin DESCRIPTION: Command to start the RabbitMQ server with the MQTT plugin and 4 scheduler threads. This is used for running latency benchmarks on a single node. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2023-03-21-native-mqtt/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make run-broker PLUGINS="rabbitmq_mqtt" RABBITMQ_CONFIG_FILE="rabbitmq.conf" RABBITMQ_SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS="+S 4" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Global Parameter in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Sets the global runtime parameter 'mqtt_default_vhosts' with a JSON value using the rabbitmqctl command. Global parameters are not tied to a specific virtual host. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_49 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_global_parameter mqtt_default_vhosts '{"O=client,CN=guest":"/"}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Cross-origin Resource Sharing with Custom Cache Timeout in RabbitMQ Management DESCRIPTION: Sets up Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) with specific origins and a custom pre-flight request cache timeout of 1 hour (3600 seconds). SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_38 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.cors.allow_origins.1 = https://origin1.org management.cors.allow_origins.2 = https://origin2.org management.cors.max_age = 3600 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Management Plugin in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: Command to enable the RabbitMQ management plugin using PowerShell. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/metadata-store/how-to-enable-khepri.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins.bat enable rabbitmq_management ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Managing RabbitMQ Reconciliation in Kubernetes DESCRIPTION: Commands to pause and resume reconciliation for a RabbitMQ cluster instance using Kubernetes labels. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-operator/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_41 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl label rabbitmqclusters INSTANCE-NAME rabbitmq.com/pauseReconciliation=true ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl label rabbitmqclusters INSTANCE-NAME rabbitmq.com/pauseReconciliation- ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Shovel Status with HTTP API DESCRIPTION: Example curl command for checking status of all shovels using the RabbitMQ HTTP API. Requires the shovel management plugin to be enabled. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/shovel-dynamic.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # Note: this user's access is limited to localhost! curl -v -u guest:guest -X GET http://localhost:15672/api/shovels/ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Virtual Host with Metadata Using CLI DESCRIPTION: Creates a virtual host with description, default queue type and tags using rabbitmqctl. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl add_vhost qa1 --description "QA env 1" --default-queue-type quorum ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Virtual Host with Metadata Using CLI DESCRIPTION: Creates a virtual host with description, default queue type and tags using rabbitmqctl. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl add_vhost qa1 --description "QA env 1" --default-queue-type quorum ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Configuration Files with RabbitMQ CLI DESCRIPTION: These commands demonstrate how to use configuration files with the rabbitmqadmin CLI tool, including specifying a custom configuration file path. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` # will use the settings from the section called [staging] rabbitmqadmin --node staging show churn ``` LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` # will use the settings from the section called [staging] rabbitmqadmin --config $HOME/.configuration/rabbitmqadmin.conf --node staging show churn ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ Node Restart Settings DESCRIPTION: Configuration settings to adjust the timeout and retry parameters for RabbitMQ nodes when rejoining a cluster after restart. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/clustering.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # wait for 60 seconds instead of 30 mnesia_table_loading_retry_timeout = 60000 # retry 15 times instead of 10 mnesia_table_loading_retry_limit = 15 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Inter-node Communication Buffer Size in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: These examples show how to increase the inter-node communication buffer size to 192MB using either an environment variable or a VM flag. This can help with heavy inter-node traffic or large message transfers. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/runtime.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` RABBITMQ_DISTRIBUTION_BUFFER_SIZE=192000 ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` RABBITMQ_SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS="+zdbbl 192000" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Certificate to Mono System-wide Trust Store on Linux DESCRIPTION: Bash command for adding a certificate to the system-wide Trust store on Linux systems using Mono. This makes the certificate trusted by all users on the system. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Linux with Mono certmgr -add -c -m Trust /path/to/cacert.cer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling RabbitMQ Web MQTT Plugin DESCRIPTION: Command to enable the RabbitMQ Web MQTT plugin using rabbitmq-plugins tool SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/web-mqtt.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_web_mqtt ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Consuming Messages from RabbitMQ Queue in Go DESCRIPTION: Sets up asynchronous message consumption from the queue using a goroutine. Messages are printed to the log as they arrive. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-go.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: go CODE: ``` msgs, err := ch.Consume( q.Name, // queue "", // consumer true, // auto-ack false, // exclusive false, // no-local false, // no-wait nil, // args ) failOnError(err, "Failed to register a consumer") var forever chan struct{} go func() { for d := range msgs { log.Printf("Received a message: %s", d.Body) } }() log.Printf(" [*] Waiting for messages. To exit press CTRL+C") <-forever ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing RabbitMQ Message Sender with Spring AMQP DESCRIPTION: Message sender class that uses Spring AMQP's RabbitTemplate to send "Hello World!" messages to a RabbitMQ queue at scheduled intervals using Spring's scheduling capabilities. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-spring-amqp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` // Sender package org.springframework.amqp.tutorials.tut1; import org.springframework.amqp.core.Queue; import org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.core.RabbitTemplate; import org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Autowired; import org.springframework.scheduling.annotation.Scheduled; public class Tut1Sender { @Autowired private RabbitTemplate template; @Autowired private Queue queue; @Scheduled(fixedDelay = 1000, initialDelay = 500) public void send() { String message = "Hello World!"; this.template.convertAndSend(queue.getName(), message); System.out.println(" [x] Sent '" + message + "'"); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding a RabbitMQ User with Basic Command Structure DESCRIPTION: Example showing the basic structure of the rabbitmqctl add_user command, which requires username and password as positional arguments. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl add_user ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting a Virtual Host with rabbitmqctl DESCRIPTION: Deletes a virtual host named 'qa1' using the rabbitmqctl command-line tool. This permanently removes the virtual host and all entities it contains. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl delete_vhost qa1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding a New User to RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This command creates a new non-administrative user named 'janeway' with the initial password 'changeit' in the RabbitMQ broker. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl add_user janeway changeit ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Default User Definition Example DESCRIPTION: JSON example showing how to define a default administrator user in the definitions file. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/definitions.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` "users": [ { "name": "guest", "password_hash": "9/1i+jKFRpbTRV1PtRnzFFYibT3cEpP92JeZ8YKGtflf4e/u", "tags": ["administrator"] } ], "permissions":[ { "user":"guest", "vhost":"/", "configure":".*", "read":".*", "write":".*"} ] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting Stunnel for Client Connection Validation DESCRIPTION: Commands to prepare the certificate file and start stunnel for validating TLS-enabled client connections. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/troubleshooting-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cat client_key.pem client_certificate.pem > client/key-cert.pem stunnel stunnel.conf ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Connection Properties in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to display specific connection properties (send queue size and server port) for all connections in RabbitMQ SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_37 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_connections send_pend port ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring STOMP Default User Credentials DESCRIPTION: Configuration to set default login and passcode for STOMP connections. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` stomp.default_user = guest stomp.default_pass = guest ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating CA Secret for Mutual TLS in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to create a Kubernetes secret containing the Certificate Authority (CA) certificate used to sign client certificates for mutual TLS authentication in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-operator/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_29 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl create secret generic ca-secret --from-file=ca.crt=ca.pem ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Visualizing RabbitMQ Message Flow with Mermaid Flowchart DESCRIPTION: This Mermaid flowchart illustrates the basic structure of a RabbitMQ messaging system. It shows a producer (P) sending messages to an exchange (X), which then routes the messages to two queues (Q₁ and Q₂) based on bindings. The diagram uses custom CSS classes to distinguish between different components. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/src/components/Tutorials/T3DiagramBinding.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: mermaid CODE: ``` flowchart LR P((P)) X{{X}} Q1[[Q₁]] Q2[[Q₂]] P --> X -- binding --> Q1 & Q2 class P mermaid-producer class X mermaid-exchange class Q1 mermaid-queue class Q2 mermaid-queue ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Mirroring Policy for All Nodes in Bash DESCRIPTION: Bash command to set a policy that mirrors queues with names starting with "ha." to all nodes in the cluster. This approach is generally not recommended for larger clusters due to resource waste. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ha/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy ha-all "^ha\." '{"ha-mode":"all"}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring etcd Authentication for RabbitMQ Cluster Formation DESCRIPTION: Configuration for using authentication with etcd in RabbitMQ's cluster formation. This snippet demonstrates how to set up username and password for etcd access. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_39 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = etcd cluster_formation.etcd.endpoints.1 = one.etcd.eng.example.local:2379 cluster_formation.etcd.endpoints.2 = two.etcd.eng.example.local:2479 cluster_formation.etcd.endpoints.3 = three.etcd.eng.example.local:2579 cluster_formation.etcd.username = rabbitmq cluster_formation.etcd.password = s3kR37 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Link-Credit Field in AMQP 1.0 Flow Frame DESCRIPTION: XML definition of the link-credit field in AMQP 1.0 flow frames. This field is used to grant credits to the sender, allowing it to send a specific number of messages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2024-09-02-amqp-flow-control/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: xml CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Referencing Exchange-to-Exchange Bindings in Markdown DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to reference exchange-to-exchange bindings (E2E) in Markdown.
