It's used to introduce the concept of binding one exchange to another in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/exchanges.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ## Exchange-to-Exchange Bindings {#e2e} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting OpenID Discovery Endpoint Path in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This commented configuration line shows how to specify a custom discovery endpoint path for OAuth2 in RabbitMQ. By default, RabbitMQ uses the standard .well-known/openid-configuration path, but this can be changed to the Okta-specific path if needed. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples-okta.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` #auth_oauth2.discovery_endpoint_path = .well-known/oauth-authorization-server ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling RabbitMQ Peer Discovery Plugin (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Commands demonstrating how to enable a peer discovery plugin in offline mode before first node boot. Uses rabbitmq-plugins CLI tool. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins --offline enable ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins --offline enable rabbitmq_peer_discovery_k8s ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Location Format Pattern in Bash DESCRIPTION: Defines the format pattern for location fields in RabbitMQ OAuth 2.0 configuration. Shows the structure for cluster, vhost, queue/exchange, and routing-key patterns. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_20 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cluster:[/vhost:][/queue:|/exchange:][/routing-key:] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Publishing a Message to RabbitMQ Queue DESCRIPTION: Code to publish a 'Hello World!' message to the 'hello' queue through the default exchange. In RabbitMQ, messages are always sent through an exchange, which then routes them to queues. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-python.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` channel.basic_publish(exchange='', routing_key='hello', body='Hello World!') print(" [x] Sent 'Hello World!") ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic OAuth2 Authentication Setup in RabbitMQ .NET Client DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to set up OAuth2 authentication using the Client Credentials flow with the RabbitMQ .NET client. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/dotnet-api-guide.md#2025-04-09_snippet_24 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` using RabbitMQ.Client.OAuth2; var tokenEndpointUri = new Uri("http://somedomain.com/token"); var oAuth2Client = new OAuth2ClientBuilder("client_id", "client_secret", tokenEndpointUri).Build(); ICredentialsProvider credentialProvider = new OAuth2ClientCredentialsProvider("prod-uaa-1", oAuth2Client); var connectionFactory = new ConnectionFactory { CredentialsProvider = credentialsProvider }; var connection = await connectionFactory.CreateConnectionAsync(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Verifying Erlang Distribution Port Configuration DESCRIPTION: Command to verify which port is being used for inter-node and CLI tool communication after configuring a custom distribution port. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/windows-configuration.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` epmd -names ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking RabbitMQ Service Status DESCRIPTION: Command to check the status of the RabbitMQ service as reported by the system service manager. This shows detailed information about the running process. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-rpm.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # check on service status as observed by service manager sudo service rabbitmq-server status ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Set Federation Policy in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to set a federation policy that matches queues with a specific prefix and configures them to use all declared upstreams. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/federated-queues/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy queue-federation "^federated\." \ '{"federation-upstream-set":"all"}' \ --priority 10 \ --apply-to queues ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring LDAP Connection Pool DESCRIPTION: Configure the LDAP connection pool size and idle timeout for RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_ldap.servers.1 = ldap.eng.megacorp.local auth_ldap.servers.2 = 192.168.0.100 auth_ldap.connection_pool_size = 256 # 300 seconds in milliseconds auth_ldap.idle_timeout = 300000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating RabbitMQ Cluster DESCRIPTION: Command to create a new RabbitMQ cluster instance with basic configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/kubectl-plugin.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl rabbitmq create INSTANCE ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Rotating RabbitMQ Log Files DESCRIPTION: Command to trigger internal log rotation for RabbitMQ logs. The rotation is performed asynchronously based on logging settings in the configuration file. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl rotate_logs ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complete RabbitMQ Producer Implementation in PHP DESCRIPTION: This is the full implementation of a RabbitMQ producer in PHP. It declares a durable queue, creates a persistent message, and publishes it to the queue. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-php.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` channel(); $channel->queue_declare('task_queue', false, true, false, false); $data = implode(' ', array_slice($argv, 1)); if (empty($data)) { $data = "Hello World!"; } $msg = new AMQPMessage( $data, array('delivery_mode' => AMQPMessage::DELIVERY_MODE_PERSISTENT) ); $channel->basic_publish($msg, '', 'task_queue'); echo ' [x] Sent ', $data, "\n"; $channel->close(); $connection->close(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Inspecting Messaging Topology Operator Logs in Kubernetes DESCRIPTION: This command retrieves the logs of the Messaging Topology Operator pods in the rabbitmq-system namespace, which can provide valuable information for troubleshooting. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/troubleshooting-topology-operator.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl -n rabbitmq-system logs -l app.kubernetes.io/name=messaging-topology-operator ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting User Limits via HTTP API DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the HTTP API endpoint and request body format for setting user limits. It sets a limit of 20 for the specified limit type. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/user-limits.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` PUT /api/user-limits/{username}/{limit} ``` LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` {"value": 20} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TCP Connection Settings in rabbitmq.conf DESCRIPTION: Basic TCP connection settings including backlog and nodelay options in the new style configuration format. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` tcp_listen_options.backlog = 4096 tcp_listen_options.nodelay = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Stream and Publishing a Message DESCRIPTION: Java code for creating a RabbitMQ stream with a 5GB size limit and publishing a 'Hello, World!' message to it. This is the core functionality of the producer application. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-java-stream.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` String stream = "hello-java-stream"; environment.streamCreator().stream(stream).maxLengthBytes(ByteCapacity.GB(5)).create(); Producer producer = environment.producerBuilder().stream(stream).build(); producer.send(producer.messageBuilder().addData("Hello, World!".getBytes()).build(), null); System.out.println(" [x] 'Hello, World!' message sent"); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Metric Tables in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Collection of markdown tables documenting RabbitMQ metrics across different categories including queue metrics, exchange metrics, connection metrics, and channel metrics. Each table contains metric names and their descriptions. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/prometheus/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Metric | Description | |-----------------------------------|----------------------| | rabbitmq_detailed_queue_consumers | Consumers on a queue | ``` LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Metric | Description | |---------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------| ``` LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Metric | Description | |---------------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| ``` LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Metric | Description | |-------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------| ``` LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Metric | Description | |-----------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------| ``` LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Metric | Description | |------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------| ``` LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Metric | Description | |----------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Memory Usage Analysis for AMQP 1.0 in RabbitMQ 4.0 DESCRIPTION: Erlang shell output showing memory statistics and process count for RabbitMQ 4.0's AMQP 1.0 implementation. Shows total memory usage of 5.3GB with approximately 360K processes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2024-08-21-amqp-benchmarks/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_20 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` 1> erlang:memory(). [{total,5330809208}, {processes,4788022888}, {processes_used,4787945960}, {system,542786320}, {atom,999681}, {atom_used,974364}, {binary,194810368}, {code,19328950}, {ets,94161808}] 2> erlang:system_info(process_count). 360312 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TCP Buffer Size for MQTT Connections in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration settings to optimize TCP buffers for MQTT connections to 32 KiB, reducing per-connection memory usage at the cost of throughput. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` mqtt.tcp_listen_options.backlog = 128 mqtt.tcp_listen_options.nodelay = true mqtt.tcp_listen_options.linger.on = true mqtt.tcp_listen_options.linger.timeout = 0 mqtt.tcp_listen_options.sndbuf = 32768 mqtt.tcp_listen_options.recbuf = 32768 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling a Specific Feature Flag with Shell Command DESCRIPTION: Command to enable a specific feature flag (rabbitmq_4.0.0) in a RabbitMQ cluster using rabbitmqadmin CLI tool. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin feature_flags enable rabbitmq_4.0.0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Overflow Behavior Policy with rabbitmqctl (Windows PowerShell) DESCRIPTION: This command sets a policy named 'my-pol' that limits the 'two-messages' queue to 2 messages and sets the overflow behavior to reject new publishes using rabbitmqctl in Windows PowerShell. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/maxlength/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat set_policy my-pol "^two-messages$" ^ "{""max-length"":2,""overflow"":""reject-publish""}" ^ --apply-to queues ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Federation Upstream Parameter in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to define a federation upstream connection parameter using rabbitmqctl. This configures a connection to a remote node with a one-hour message buffer expiration time. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/federation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # target.hostname is just an example, replace it with a URI # of the target node (usually a member of a remote node/cluster, # or a URI that connects to a different virtual host within the same cluster) rabbitmqctl set_parameter federation-upstream my-upstream \ '{"uri":"amqp://target.hostname","expires":3600000}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TCP Transport and RFC 5424 Protocol for Syslog Logging in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet configures Syslog logging to use TCP transport and the RFC 5424 protocol in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.syslog = true log.syslog.transport = tcp log.syslog.protocol = rfc5424 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Resulting Effective Allocator Settings After Override DESCRIPTION: The combined allocator settings that result from applying a specific override to the default allocator settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/runtime.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` "+MBas ageffcbf +MHas ageffcbf +MBlmbcs 512 +MHlmbcs 8192 +MMmcs 30" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding amqp_client Dependency with Rebar 3 for Erlang DESCRIPTION: Specifies how to add the rabbit_common dependency to an Erlang project using Rebar 3. This is required for using the Erlang RabbitMQ client. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/erlang-client-user-guide.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {rabbit_common, "&version-erlang-client;"} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Authentication Configuration DESCRIPTION: Default authentication backend configuration for RabbitMQ SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_40 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_backends.1 = internal ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TCP Keepalives for RabbitMQ in sysctl DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows an example sysctl configuration for TCP keepalives. It sets up TCP connections to be considered dead or unreachable after 70 seconds (4 attempts every 10 seconds after connection idle for 30 seconds). SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_34 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` net.ipv4.tcp_keepalive_time=30 net.ipv4.tcp_keepalive_intvl=10 net.ipv4.tcp_keepalive_probes=4 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing RabbitMQ Signing Key for apt (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Downloads and imports the RabbitMQ signing key for Debian-based systems using apt. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/signatures.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -1sLf https://github.com/rabbitmq/signing-keys/releases/download/3.0/rabbitmq-release-signing-key.asc | sudo gpg --dearmor > /usr/share/keyrings/com.rabbitmq.team.gpg ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Analyzing Channel Memory Usage with RabbitMQ Diagnostics DESCRIPTION: Uses the rabbitmq-diagnostics command to display memory breakdown, focusing on the memory used by connection channels. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/channels/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics memory_breakdown -q --unit mb # => [elided for brevity] # ... # => connection_channels: 3.596 mb (2.27%) # ... # => [elided for brevity] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Removing a Node from a RabbitMQ Cluster using CLI DESCRIPTION: Series of commands to remove the current node from a RabbitMQ cluster. This process stops the application without terminating the Erlang runtime, resets the node configuration, and starts it again as a standalone node. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/metadata-store/clustering.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Stop RabbitMQ without stopping the runtime (its OS process). rabbitmqctl stop_app # Reset it. rabbitmqctl reset # Restart the node as a blank one. rabbitmqctl start_app ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Boolean Query Patterns in Erlang DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the basic boolean query patterns (not, and, or) used in LDAP authorization queries. These patterns can be combined to create complex authorization rules. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_27 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {'not', SubQuery} ``` LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {'and', [SubQuery1, SubQuery2, SubQuery3, ...]} ``` LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {'or', [SubQuery1, SubQuery2, SubQuery3, ...]} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Feature Flags in RabbitMQ advanced.config DESCRIPTION: Erlang configuration snippet for the advanced.config file that specifies which feature flags should be enabled when a new RabbitMQ node initializes for the first time. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/feature-flags/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` %% ... {rabbit, [ %% this is just an example, in practice this list will be much longer {forced_feature_flags_on_init, [quorum_queue, implicit_default_bindings]} ]}, %% ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Query Parameters Example DESCRIPTION: Examples of supported query parameters for sorting and filtering API responses SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` sort sort_reverse columns disable_stats ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Logging Graceful AMQP Connection Closure in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Example log entry for a gracefully closed AMQP connection. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_33 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` 2018-06-17 06:23:29.855 [info] <0.634.0> closing AMQP connection <0.634.0> (127.0.0.1:58588 -> 127.0.0.1:5672, vhost: '/', user: 'guest') ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Federation Policy in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: Configures a federation policy for exchanges with name pattern '^amq\.' using PowerShell. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/federation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat set_policy --apply-to exchanges federate-me "^amq\." ` '"{""federation-upstream-set"":""all""}"' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Environment Variables to RabbitMQ Cluster Operator Deployment DESCRIPTION: YAML snippet showing how to modify the RabbitMQ Cluster Operator deployment manifest to add the OPERATOR_SCOPE_NAMESPACE environment variable. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/configure-operator-defaults.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiVersion: apps/v1 kind: Deployment metadata: labels: app.kubernetes.io/component: rabbitmq-operator app.kubernetes.io/name: rabbitmq-cluster-operator app.kubernetes.io/part-of: rabbitmq name: rabbitmq-cluster-operator namespace: rabbitmq-system spec: template: spec: containers: - command: - /manager env: - name: OPERATOR_NAMESPACE valueFrom: fieldRef: fieldPath: metadata.namespace - name: OPERATOR_SCOPE_NAMESPACE value: "custom-namespace,my-namespace" # ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Log Exchange Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration settings to enable and configure the system log exchange feature. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_39 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # activate log forwarding to amq.rabbitmq.log, a topic exchange\nlog.exchange = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Heartbeat Timeout in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Default configuration for the heartbeat timeout suggested by the server during connection parameter negotiation. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_28 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` heartbeat = 60 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Stopping the RabbitMQ Node DESCRIPTION: This command stops the Erlang node on which RabbitMQ is running. It can optionally wait for a specified process to terminate if a pid_file is provided. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl stop ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Local File Import on Boot DESCRIPTION: Configuration that enables automatic import of definitions from a local file during node startup. This doesn't require the management plugin to be enabled. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/definitions.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # Does not require management plugin to be enabled. definitions.import_backend = local_filesystem definitions.local.path = /path/to/definitions/defs.json ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: JWT Token with Custom Scopes DESCRIPTION: Example JWT token structure using custom scopes in the scope field. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_24 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` { "sub": "producer", "scope": [ "api://rabbitmq:producer", "api://rabbitmq:Administrator" ], "aud": [ "rabbitmq" ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Default Log Message Format Configuration in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration showing the default log message format pattern. This controls how log entries are structured, including timestamp, level, process ID, and message. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_43 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # '$time [$level] $pid $msg' is the default format log.console.formatter.plaintext.format = $time [$level] $pid $msg ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: TLS Configuration for Web MQTT DESCRIPTION: INI configuration showing TLS/SSL settings for secure WebSocket connections. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/web-mqtt.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` web_mqtt.ssl.port = 15676 web_mqtt.ssl.backlog = 1024 web_mqtt.ssl.cacertfile = /path/to/ca_certificate.pem web_mqtt.ssl.certfile = /path/to/server_certificate.pem web_mqtt.ssl.keyfile = /path/to/server_key.pem # needed when private key has a passphrase # web_mqtt.ssl.password = changeme ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a New Durable Queue in RabbitMQ with Python DESCRIPTION: Creating a new durable queue with a different name to avoid conflicts with existing queues that have different parameters. This approach ensures queue durability without causing errors. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-python.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` channel.queue_declare(queue='task_queue', durable=True) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Purging a Queue DESCRIPTION: Shows how to purge all messages from a queue in a specific virtual host. This removes all messages without deleting the queue itself. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin --vhost "events" purge queue --name "target.queue.name" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Prometheus Plugin Network Interface in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to set the network interface for the Prometheus plugin API endpoint using the prometheus.tcp.ip key. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/prometheus/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` prometheus.tcp.ip = 0.0.0.0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Logging Node Unavailability in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows a log message generated when a RabbitMQ node detects that another node has gone down due to a net tick timeout. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/nettick.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` 2018-11-22 10:44:33.654 [info] node rabbit@peer-hostname down: net_tick_timeout ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enable Virtual Host Deletion Protection DESCRIPTION: Command to enable deletion protection for a RabbitMQ virtual host using rabbitmqctl SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl enable_vhost_protection_from_deletion "vhost-name" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Default Category Log Level DESCRIPTION: Configures the default category to only log error or higher severity messages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_32 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.default.level = error ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Logging Node Unavailability in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows a log message generated when a RabbitMQ node detects that another node has gone down due to a net tick timeout. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/nettick.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` 2018-11-22 10:44:33.654 [info] node rabbit@peer-hostname down: net_tick_timeout ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Testing Authentication with rabbitmqctl in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: This command uses rabbitmqctl to test authentication for a username and password pair in a PowerShell environment. It shows how to handle special characters in the password. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_20 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` # note that double quotes are required due to the & character rabbitmqctl.bat authenticate_user 'a-username' '"a/p&assword"' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Pod Address Type for RabbitMQ Kubernetes Peer Discovery DESCRIPTION: Controls whether to use hostnames or IP addresses when discovering peer nodes through Kubernetes. Using hostnames requires stateful sets and headless services. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = k8s cluster_formation.k8s.host = kubernetes.default.example.local cluster_formation.k8s.token_path = /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/token cluster_formation.k8s.cert_path = /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/ca.crt cluster_formation.k8s.namespace_path = /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/namespace # should result set use hostnames or IP addresses # of Kubernetes API-reported containers? # supported values are "hostname" and "ip" cluster_formation.k8s.address_type = hostname ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Removing RabbitMQ Data Directory for Clean Test Environment DESCRIPTION: This command recursively removes the test-rabbit directory which contains RabbitMQ data. This is done to prepare for testing a different version of RabbitMQ with the same test scenario. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2022-05-31-flame-graphs/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rm -rf test-rabbit ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Mirroring Policy for All Nodes in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: PowerShell command to set a policy that mirrors queues with names starting with "ha." to all nodes in the cluster. This approach is generally not recommended for larger clusters due to resource waste. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ha/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat set_policy ha-all "^ha\." "{""ha-mode"":""all""}" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Clearing DNF Package Cache DESCRIPTION: Commands for cleaning local DNF package manager cache to force metadata refresh from repositories. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/install-rpm.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` dnf clean metadata dnf clean dbcache dnf clean all ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Visualizing RabbitMQ Message Flow with Mermaid DESCRIPTION: This Mermaid flowchart diagram illustrates a basic RabbitMQ messaging pattern. It shows a producer (P) sending messages to a central queue (Q), which are then received by two consumers (C₁ and C₂). Custom CSS classes are used to style each component in the visualization. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/src/components/Tutorials/T2DiagramToC.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: mermaid CODE: ``` flowchart LR P((P)) Q[[Queue]] C1((C₁)) C2((C₂)) P --> Q --> C1 & C2 class P mermaid-producer class Q mermaid-queue class C1 mermaid-consumer class C2 mermaid-consumer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Cluster Port Configuration DESCRIPTION: Lists the essential ports used for RabbitMQ cluster communication, including epmd (4369), stream replication (6000-6500), inter-node communication (25672), and CLI tools (35672-35682). SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/clustering.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` 4369: epmd 6000-6500: stream replication 25672: inter-node communication 35672-35682: CLI tools ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing RabbitMQ Workers and Tasks in Objective-C DESCRIPTION: This viewDidLoad implementation demonstrates how to start workers and send multiple tasks to a RabbitMQ queue. It shows how the round-robin dispatching works by starting two workers and sending five tasks with different processing times. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-objectivec.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Objective-C CODE: ``` - (void)viewDidLoad { [super viewDidLoad]; [self workerNamed:@"Jack"]; [self workerNamed:@"Jill"]; [self newTask:@"Hello World..."]; [self newTask:@"Just one this time."]; [self newTask:@"Five....."]; [self newTask:@"None"]; [self newTask:@"Two..dots"]; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Erlang Repository for Ubuntu 20.04 DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the configuration for adding the Launchpad PPA repository for Erlang packages on Ubuntu 20.04 (Focal). It specifies the repository URL, architecture, and signing key location. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_20 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # This Launchpad PPA repository provides Erlang packages produced by the RabbitMQ team # # Replace $distribution with the name of the Ubuntu release used deb [arch=amd64 signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/net.launchpad.ppa.rabbitmq.erlang.gpg] http://ppa.launchpad.net/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-erlang/ubuntu focal main deb-src [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/net.launchpad.ppa.rabbitmq.erlang.gpg] http://ppa.launchpad.net/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-erlang/ubuntu focal main ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Operator Policy in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: PowerShell command to set an operator policy named 'transient-queue-ttl' that applies an 1800000ms expiration to queues matching the pattern '^amq\.'. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/parameters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat set_operator_policy transient-queue-ttl ^ "^amq\." "{"" pires"": 1800000}" ^ --priority 1 ^ --apply-to queues ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Referencing RabbitMQ Web STOMP Examples Plugin DESCRIPTION: Code reference showing how to mention the rabbitmq_web_stomp_examples plugin that provides examples for the Web STOMP functionality. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/plugins.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` rabbitmq_web_stomp_examples ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Fair Dispatch with Prefetch Count in RabbitMQ with Python DESCRIPTION: Setting the prefetch count to 1 ensures that RabbitMQ doesn't dispatch more than one message to a worker at a time, enabling fair distribution of workload among multiple workers. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-python.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` channel.basic_qos(prefetch_count=1) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Temporary Queue DESCRIPTION: Creates a temporary queue with a server-generated name that will be deleted when the connection closes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-python.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` result = channel.queue_declare(queue='', exclusive=True) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining a For Query in RabbitMQ LDAP Authentication DESCRIPTION: A complex query that allows different subqueries to be executed based on variable values. Enables conditional authorization logic depending on resource type, permission type, or other variables. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {for, [{Name, Value, SubQuery}, ...]} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking RabbitMQ Node Status using PowerShell DESCRIPTION: Command to perform basic node health check and display information about the running RabbitMQ node. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/install-windows-manual.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat status ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying Process Limits DESCRIPTION: Command to show the effective limits of the RabbitMQ process. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_28 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cat /proc/$RABBITMQ_BEAM_PROCESS_PID/limits ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Publishing a Message to an Exchange via HTTP API in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This JSON payload is used to publish a message to an exchange using the PUT /api/exchanges/{vhost}/{name}/publish endpoint. It includes message properties, routing key, payload, and encoding. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "properties": {}, "routing_key": "my key", "payload": "my body", "payload_encoding": "string" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Erlang Repository for Ubuntu 20.04 (Focal) DESCRIPTION: Adds the Launchpad PPA repository for Erlang packages produced by the RabbitMQ team to /etc/apt/sources.list.d/erlang.list for Ubuntu 20.04 (Focal). This repository is specifically for amd64 architecture and uses GPG key verification. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # This Launchpad PPA repository provides Erlang packages produced by the RabbitMQ team # # Replace $distribution with the name of the Ubuntu release used deb [arch=amd64 signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/net.launchpad.ppa.rabbitmq.erlang.gpg] http://ppa.launchpad.net/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-erlang/ubuntu focal main deb-src [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/net.launchpad.ppa.rabbitmq.erlang.gpg] http://ppa.launchpad.net/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-erlang/ubuntu focal main ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Changing Cluster Node Type DESCRIPTION: Changes a node's type between disc and ram while the node is stopped. Cannot convert the only disc node to a RAM node. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl change_cluster_node_type disc ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting a Queue Only if Empty in RabbitMQ Java Client DESCRIPTION: Deletes a queue only if it has no messages. The operation will fail if the queue contains messages, leaving it intact. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/java-api-guide.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` channel.queueDelete("queue-name", false, true) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Advanced TLS Configuration for RabbitMQ etcd Peer Discovery DESCRIPTION: Advanced TLS configuration for RabbitMQ's etcd-based peer discovery. This snippet demonstrates how to set up secure renegotiation and specify cipher suites. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_45 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = etcd cluster_formation.etcd.endpoints.1 = one.etcd.eng.example.local:2379 cluster_formation.etcd.endpoints.2 = two.etcd.eng.example.local:2479 # trusted CA certificate file path cluster_formation.etcd.ssl_options.cacertfile = /path/to/ca_certificate.pem # client certificate (public key) file path cluster_formation.etcd.ssl_options.certfile = /path/to/client_certificate.pem # client private key file path cluster_formation.etcd.ssl_options.keyfile = /path/to/client_key.pem # use TLSv1.2 for connections cluster_formation.etcd.ssl_options.versions.1 = tlsv1.2 # enables peer verification (the plugin will verify the certificate chain of the server) cluster_formation.etcd.ssl_options.verify = verify_peer cluster_formation.etcd.ssl_options.fail_if_no_peer_cert = true # use secure session renegotiation cluster_formation.etcd.ssl_options.secure_renegotiate = true # Explicitly list enabled cipher suites. This can break connectivity # and is not necessary most of the time. cluster_formation.etcd.ssl_options.ciphers.1 = ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 cluster_formation.etcd.ssl_options.ciphers.2 = ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 cluster_formation.etcd.ssl_options.ciphers.3 = ECDH-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 cluster_formation.etcd.ssl_options.ciphers.4 = ECDH-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 cluster_formation.etcd.ssl_options.ciphers.5 = DHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 cluster_formation.etcd.ssl_options.ciphers.6 = DHE-DSS-AES256-GCM-SHA384 cluster_formation.etcd.ssl_options.ciphers.7 = ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256 cluster_formation.etcd.ssl_options.ciphers.8 = ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256 cluster_formation.etcd.ssl_options.ciphers.9 = ECDH-ECDSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256 cluster_formation.etcd.ssl_options.ciphers.10 = ECDH-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256 cluster_formation.etcd.ssl_options.ciphers.11 = DHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256 cluster_formation.etcd.ssl_options.ciphers.12 = DHE-DSS-AES128-GCM-SHA256 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting up RabbitMQ Stream Client Dependency with Maven DESCRIPTION: Maven dependency configuration for including the RabbitMQ Stream Java client in a project. This XML snippet should be added to the project's pom.xml file. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-java-stream.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: xml CODE: ``` com.rabbitmq stream-client 0.16.0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Executing RabbitMQ Stream Programs via Maven DESCRIPTION: Shell commands to run the sender and receiver programs using Maven. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-java-stream.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` ./mvnw -q compile exec:java '-Dexec.mainClass=OffsetTrackingSend' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Overriding Memory Allocator Settings DESCRIPTION: Example of overriding specific memory allocator settings using RABBITMQ_SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/runtime.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` RABBITMQ_SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS="+MHlmbcs 8192" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TLS Peer Verification in RabbitMQ (New Format) DESCRIPTION: Configuration example for enabling TLS peer verification in RabbitMQ using the new style configuration format. Sets up the SSL listener, certificate paths, and peer verification options. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` listeners.ssl.default = 5671 ssl_options.cacertfile = /path/to/ca_certificate.pem ssl_options.certfile = /path/to/server_certificate.pem ssl_options.keyfile = /path/to/server_key.pem ssl_options.verify = verify_peer ssl_options.fail_if_no_peer_cert = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: List Mirrored Queue Policies in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Bash script to list all policies that apply ha-mode (mirroring) across all virtual hosts in RabbitMQ. Outputs vhost, policy name, pattern, apply_to, definition and priority. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2023-03-02-quorum-queues-migration/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` #!/bin/sh printf "%s\t%s\t%s\t%s\t%s\t%s\n" vhost policy_name pattern apply_to definition priority for vhost in $(rabbitmqctl -q list_vhosts | tail -n +2) ; do rabbitmqctl -q list_policies -p "$vhost" | grep 'ha-mode' done ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Feature Flags in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This command lists all feature flags in RabbitMQ, showing their names and current states. It's useful for understanding which features are enabled or disabled in the cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/feature-flags/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_feature_flags ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Cookie Value in RabbitMQ CLI Tool DESCRIPTION: Example of passing an Erlang cookie value directly to a RabbitMQ CLI command. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics status --erlang-cookie "cookie-value" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Federation Upstream Parameters in Bash DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to set parameters for a federation upstream using rabbitmqctl. The 'name' placeholder should be replaced with the actual upstream name, and 'json-object' with the upstream configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/federation-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_parameter federation-upstream 'name' 'json-object' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Visualizing RabbitMQ Message Routing with Topic Exchange in Mermaid DESCRIPTION: This Mermaid flowchart depicts a RabbitMQ messaging topology with a producer (P), exchange (X), two queues (Q₁, Q₂), and two consumers (C₁, C₂). It shows different routing patterns using topic-style binding keys including '#42;.orange.#42;', '#42;.#42;.rabbit', and 'lazy.#' to demonstrate message routing flexibility. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/src/components/Tutorials/T5DiagramTopicX.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: mermaid CODE: ``` flowchart LR P((P)) X{{X}} Q1[[Q₁]] Q2[[Q₂]] C1((C₁)) C2((C₂)) P --> X X -- #42;.orange.#42; --> Q1 X -- #42;.#42;.rabbit --> Q2 X -- lazy.# --> Q2 Q1 --> C1 Q2 --> C2 class P mermaid-producer class X mermaid-exchange class Q1 mermaid-queue class Q2 mermaid-queue class C1 mermaid-consumer class C2 mermaid-consumer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Channel Details DESCRIPTION: Uses rabbitmqctl to list individual channel details including user, consumer count, and unacknowledged messages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/channels/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_channels -q # => pid user consumer_count messages_unacknowledged # => guest 0 0 # => guest 0 0 # => guest 0 0 # => guest 0 0 # => guest 0 0 # => guest 0 0 # => guest 0 0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting RabbitMQ Cluster Name in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to set a new name for the RabbitMQ cluster using rabbitmqctl. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/prometheus/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl -q set_cluster_name testing-prometheus ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: JWT Token with Custom Scopes in Roles Field DESCRIPTION: This JWT token example shows custom scopes in the 'roles' field instead of the standard 'scope' field. This format would be used when RabbitMQ is configured with 'additional_scopes_key = roles'. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_24 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` { "sub": "rabbitmq-client-code", "roles": "api://rabbitmq:Administrator.All", "aud": [ "rabbitmq" ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring LDAP DN Lookup Bindings in INI Format DESCRIPTION: Configuration example for LDAP DN lookup binding settings, including user DN, password, lookup attribute and base DN. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_ldap.dn_lookup_bind.user_dn = CN=myuser,OU=users,DC=gopivotal,DC=com auth_ldap.dn_lookup_bind.password = test1234 auth_ldap.dn_lookup_attribute = userPrincipalName auth_ldap.dn_lookup_base = DC=gopivotal,DC=com ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling OAuth 2.0 Plugin in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to enable the OAuth 2.0 authentication backend plugin in RabbitMQ. This must be done before the plugin can be used for authentication and authorization. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_auth_backend_oauth2 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring EPMD Interface and Port DESCRIPTION: These environment variable settings configure the EPMD (Erlang Port Mapping Daemon) to listen on specific interfaces and ports. This affects how RabbitMQ nodes discover each other in a cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # makes epmd listen on loopback IPv6 and IPv4 interfaces export ERL_EPMD_ADDRESS="::1" ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Stops local epmd process. # Use after shutting down RabbitMQ. epmd -kill ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # makes epmd bind to port 4369 export ERL_EPMD_PORT="4369" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing RabbitMQ Signing Key via Key Server DESCRIPTION: Imports the RabbitMQ signing key from various key servers using GPG. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/signatures.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` gpg --keyserver "hkps://keys.openpgp.org" --recv-keys "0x0A9AF2115F4687BD29803A206B73A36E6026DFCA" ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` gpg --keyserver "keyserver.ubuntu.com" --recv-keys "0x0A9AF2115F4687BD29803A206B73A36E6026DFCA" ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` gpg --keyserver "pgp.surfnet.nl" --recv-keys "0x0A9AF2115F4687BD29803A206B73A36E6026DFCA" ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` gpg --keyserver "pgp.mit.edu" --recv-keys "0x0A9AF2115F4687BD29803A206B73A36E6026DFCA" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Unix Epoch Timestamp Format DESCRIPTION: Configuration to use Unix epoch microseconds for timestamp formatting in console output. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.console = true log.console.level = info log.file = false # use microseconds since UNIX epoch for timestamp format log.console.formatter.time_format = epoch_usecs ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring an Exchange via HTTP API in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This JSON payload is used to declare an exchange using the PUT /api/exchanges/{vhost}/{name} endpoint. It specifies the exchange type, durability, and other properties. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "type": "direct", "auto_delete": false, "durable": true, "internal": false, "arguments": {} } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: HTTP API Authentication with OAuth 2.0 Token DESCRIPTION: Example of using an OAuth token with HTTP basic authentication syntax against the RabbitMQ HTTP API. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # swap for an actual token curl -i -u ignored: http://localhost:15672/api/vhosts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Unlimited Prefetch in Java DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to set an unlimited prefetch by passing 0 to the basicQos method, allowing any number of unacknowledged messages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/consumer-prefetch.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` Channel channel = ...; Consumer consumer = ...; channel.basicQos(0); // No limit for this consumer channel.basicConsume("my-queue", false, consumer); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Log File Name in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration setting to override the default log file name in rabbitmq.conf. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.file = rabbit.log ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Federation Plugin in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Commands to enable the RabbitMQ federation plugin and its management UI extension using rabbitmq-plugins. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/federation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_federation ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_federation_management ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Testing TCP Connection to RabbitMQ with Telnet (Failed Attempt) DESCRIPTION: Example of a failed telnet connection attempt to port 5673, which is not in use by RabbitMQ. This demonstrates how connection failures appear when a port is not accessible or not bound by any service. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/troubleshooting-networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` telnet localhost 5673 # => Trying ::1... # => telnet: connect to address ::1: Connection refused # => Trying 127.0.0.1... # => telnet: connect to address 127.0.0.1: Connection refused ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Plugin Broker Version Requirements DESCRIPTION: Example of specifying RabbitMQ broker version requirements in a plugin's application environment configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/src/pages/plugin-development.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {application, my_plugin,[ %% ... {broker_version_requirements, ["3.11.15", "3.10.22"]} ]} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling HTTPS Transport for apt DESCRIPTION: This command installs the apt-transport-https package, which is necessary for apt to download RabbitMQ and Erlang packages from Cloudsmith.io mirror or Launchpad. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo apt-get install apt-transport-https ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Overriding Specific Allocator Settings in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Example of overriding a specific memory allocator setting (high-level carrier size) while keeping other defaults intact. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/runtime.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` RABBITMQ_SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS="+MHlmbcs 8192" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Default Virtual Host in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Default configuration for the virtual host created when RabbitMQ initializes a new database from scratch. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_29 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` default_vhost = / ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring MacOS Application Firewall for Erlang CLI Tools DESCRIPTION: Commands to allow Erlang CLI tools to bind to ports and accept inbound connections through the MacOS Application Firewall. These commands add the Erlang runtime to the firewall's allowed applications. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_39 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # allow CLI tools and shell to bind to ports and accept inbound connections sudo /usr/libexec/ApplicationFirewall/socketfilterfw --add /usr/local/Cellar/erlang/{version}/lib/erlang/bin/erl sudo /usr/libexec/ApplicationFirewall/socketfilterfw --unblockapp /usr/local/Cellar/erlang/{version}/lib/erlang/bin/erl ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Cut Example with Mathematical Function in Erlang DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how cuts are applied to the shallowest enclosing expression, in this case creating a fun for the pow function call. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2011-05-17-can-you-hear-the-drums-erlando/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` list_to_binary([1, 2, math:pow(2, _)]). ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TLS for STOMP Connections DESCRIPTION: Configuration to enable TLS for STOMP connections, including certificate paths and verification options. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` ssl_options.cacertfile = /path/to/tls/ca_certificate.pem ssl_options.certfile = /path/to/tls/server_certificate.pem ssl_options.keyfile = /path/to/tls/server_key.pem ssl_options.verify = verify_peer ssl_options.fail_if_no_peer_cert = true stomp.listeners.tcp.1 = 61613 # default TLS-enabled port for STOMP connections stomp.listeners.ssl.1 = 61614 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complete Log Emitter Implementation DESCRIPTION: Full implementation of a program that emits logs with different severity levels using RabbitMQ direct exchange. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-python.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` #!/usr/bin/env python import pika import sys connection = pika.BlockingConnection( pika.ConnectionParameters(host='localhost')) channel = connection.channel() channel.exchange_declare(exchange='direct_logs', exchange_type='direct') severity = sys.argv[1] if len(sys.argv) > 1 else 'info' message = ' '.join(sys.argv[2:]) or 'Hello World!' channel.basic_publish( exchange='direct_logs', routing_key=severity, body=message) print(f" [x] Sent {severity}:{message}") connection.close() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing RabbitMQ Bindings with rabbitmqctl DESCRIPTION: Command to list all bindings in the RabbitMQ server and its sample output. This shows how the 'logs' exchange is connected to multiple queues with server-generated names, confirming the publish/subscribe setup. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-go.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo rabbitmqctl list_bindings # => Listing bindings ... # => logs exchange amq.gen-JzTY20BRgKO-HjmUJj0wLg queue [] # => logs exchange amq.gen-vso0PVvyiRIL2WoV3i48Yg queue [] # => ...done. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Absolute Memory Threshold in Bytes DESCRIPTION: Configures an absolute memory limit of 1024 MiB (1073741824 bytes) for the RabbitMQ node. When memory usage exceeds this limit, a resource alarm will be triggered and publishers will be blocked. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/memory.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` vm_memory_high_watermark.absolute = 1073741824 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: AMQP 0-9-1 Operation Permissions Table in Markdown DESCRIPTION: This table shows the required permissions (configure, write, read) for various AMQP 0-9-1 operations on different resource types in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ```
AMQP 0-9-1 Operation configure write read
exchange.declare(passive=false)exchange
exchange.declare(passive=true)
exchange.declare(with AE)exchangeexchange (AE)exchange
exchange.deleteexchange
queue.declare(passive=false)queue
queue.declare(passive=true)
queue.declare(with DLX)queueexchange (DLX)queue
queue.deletequeue
exchange.bindexchange (destination)exchange (source)
exchange.unbindexchange (destination)exchange (source)
queue.bindqueueexchange
queue.unbindqueueexchange
basic.publishexchange
basic.getqueue
basic.consumequeue
queue.purgequeue
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Consumers in a Specific Stream Group using CLI DESCRIPTION: This command lists all consumers in a specific stream group, providing details such as subscription ID, connection name, and state of each consumer. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2022-07-05-rabbitmq-3-11-feature-preview-single-active-consumer-for-streams/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` docker exec rabbitmq rabbitmqctl list_stream_group_consumers --stream single-active-consumer --reference my-app ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a RabbitMQ User with Auto-generated Credentials DESCRIPTION: Kubernetes manifest for creating a RabbitMQ user with auto-generated username and password using the Messaging Topology Operator. The user is assigned the 'policymaker' tag and is associated with a RabbitMQ cluster named 'example-rabbitmq'. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-topology-operator.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiVersion: rabbitmq.com/v1beta1 kind: User metadata: name: user-example namespace: rabbitmq-system spec: tags: - policymaker rabbitmqClusterReference: name: example-rabbitmq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Queue Statistics DESCRIPTION: This command lists the statistics of the queues, including their names, types, and message counts. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2022-03-29-at-least-once-dead-lettering/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: zsh CODE: ``` kubectl exec my-rabbit-server-0 -c rabbitmq -- rabbitmqctl list_queues --formatter=pretty_table --quiet \ name type messages messages_ready messages_unacknowledged ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Verifying Package Signatures (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to verify the signature of a downloaded RabbitMQ package using GPG. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/signatures.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` gpg --verify [filename].asc [filename] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ Java Client with Micrometer for JMX and Datadog DESCRIPTION: This code snippet showcases how to configure the RabbitMQ Java client to send metrics to both JMX and Datadog using Micrometer. It uses a CompositeMeterRegistry to combine JMX and Datadog registries, and simulates instances across different data centers. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2018-04-10-rabbitmq-java-client-metrics-with-micrometer-and-datadog/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` for (String dc : new String[] {"us", "europe", "asia"}) { CompositeMeterRegistry compositeMeterRegistry = new CompositeMeterRegistry(); MeterRegistry datadogRegistry = new DatadogMeterRegistry(config, Clock.SYSTEM); MeterRegistry jmxRegistry = new JmxMeterRegistry(JmxConfig.DEFAULT, Clock.SYSTEM); Tags tags = Tags.of("host", hostname, "dc", dc); new ClassLoaderMetrics(tags).bindTo(compositeMeterRegistry); new JvmMemoryMetrics(tags).bindTo(compositeMeterRegistry); new JvmGcMetrics(tags).bindTo(compositeMeterRegistry); new ProcessorMetrics(tags).bindTo(compositeMeterRegistry); new JvmThreadMetrics(tags).bindTo(compositeMeterRegistry); compositeMeterRegistry.add(datadogRegistry); compositeMeterRegistry.add(jmxRegistry); ConnectionFactory connectionFactory = new ConnectionFactory(); MicrometerMetricsCollector metricsCollector = new MicrometerMetricsCollector( compositeMeterRegistry, "rabbitmq.client", tags ); connectionFactory.setMetricsCollector(metricsCollector); Connection connection = connectionFactory.newConnection(); Channel channel = connection.createChannel(); String queue = channel.queueDeclare().getQueue(); channel.basicConsume(queue, true, (ctag, msg) -> { }, (ctag) -> { }); executor.submit(() -> { Random random = new Random(); int offset = dc.length() * 10; while (true) { Thread.sleep(random.nextInt(100) + offset); channel.basicPublish("", queue, null, "".getBytes()); } }); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: CORS Policy Error Message DESCRIPTION: Browser console error message indicating that the OpenID endpoint access is blocked by CORS policy. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/troubleshooting-oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` Access to fetch at 'https://>/.well-known/openid-configuration' from origin '' has been blocked by CORS policy ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Operator Policy in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to set an operator policy for queues with names starting with 'amq.' to expire after 1800000 milliseconds using rabbitmqctl in Bash. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/parameters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_operator_policy transient-queue-ttl \ "^amq\." '{"expires":1800000}' \ --priority 1 \ --apply-to queues ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Asserting Fanout Exchange in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Creates a fanout exchange named 'logs' that broadcasts all messages to connected queues. The exchange is not durable, meaning it won't survive broker restarts. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-javascript.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` ch.assertExchange('logs', 'fanout', {durable: false}) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Binding a Queue to an Exchange in Objective-C DESCRIPTION: Binds a queue to an exchange, establishing the relationship for message routing. In this case, it's binding to a fanout exchange for broadcast messaging. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-objectivec.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: objectivec CODE: ``` [q bind:x]; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Classic Queue Mirroring Policy in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Health check command to verify if any policies enable classic queue mirroring, which has been deprecated. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmq-queues.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-queues check_if_cluster_has_classic_queue_mirroring_policy ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Feature Flags Environment Variable in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to start RabbitMQ with Khepri enabled via environment variable in bash shell. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/metadata-store/how-to-enable-khepri.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` env RABBITMQ_FEATURE_FLAGS="khepri_db,..." rabbitmq-server ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing RabbitMQ Signing Key for RPM-based Systems DESCRIPTION: Downloads and imports the RabbitMQ signing key for RPM-based systems (RHEL, Fedora, CentOS) using the rpm command. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/signatures.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rpm --import https://github.com/rabbitmq/signing-keys/releases/download/3.0/rabbitmq-release-signing-key.asc ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: TLS Versions Output Example DESCRIPTION: Sample output showing supported TLS versions SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/troubleshooting-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` tlsv1.2 tlsv1.1 tlsv1 sslv3 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing a Log Receiver with Direct Exchange in PHP DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides a complete implementation of a log receiver using a direct exchange in RabbitMQ with PHP and the php-amqplib library. It allows subscribing to specific log severities. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-php.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` channel(); $channel->exchange_declare('direct_logs', 'direct', false, false, false); list($queue_name, ,) = $channel->queue_declare("", false, false, true, false); $severities = array_slice($argv, 1); if (empty($severities)) { file_put_contents('php://stderr', "Usage: $argv[0] [info] [warning] [error]\n"); exit(1); } foreach ($severities as $severity) { $channel->queue_bind($queue_name, 'direct_logs', $severity); } echo " [*] Waiting for logs. To exit press CTRL+C\n"; $callback = function ($msg) { echo ' [x] ', $msg->getRoutingKey(), ':', $msg->getBody(), "\n"; }; $channel->basic_consume($queue_name, '', false, true, false, false, $callback); try { $channel->consume(); } catch (\Throwable $exception) { echo $exception->getMessage(); } $channel->close(); $connection->close(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Pull-Based Message Retrieval in C# DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to retrieve individual messages on demand using the BasicGetAsync method. It includes error handling for when no message is available and manual acknowledgement of received messages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/dotnet-api-guide.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` bool autoAck = false; BasicGetResult result = await channel.BasicGetAsync(queueName, autoAck); if (result == null) { // No message available at this time. } else { var props = result.BasicProperties; ReadOnlyMemory body = result.Body; ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Exporting RabbitMQ Definitions for a Specific Virtual Host DESCRIPTION: This command exports the definitions of a specific virtual host in RabbitMQ to a JSON file. It's used to capture the current configuration before migration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/migrate-mcq-to-qq.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat export_definitions --vhost='{original_vhost}' \path\to\original_vhost.json ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining an Exists Query in RabbitMQ LDAP Authentication DESCRIPTION: An exists query that checks if an object with a specified DN pattern exists in LDAP. Returns true if such an object exists. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {exists, Pattern} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Maximum Channels in RabbitMQ (INI) DESCRIPTION: Default maximum number of channels allowed per connection (excluding channel 0), setting it to 0 means unlimited which can be dangerous. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_31 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` channel_max = 2047 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Publishing Messages with Severity DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates publishing messages to a direct exchange with severity routing key SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-ruby.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` exchange = channel.direct('logs') exchange.publish(message, routing_key: severity) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Default Event Exchange Configuration DESCRIPTION: Default configuration for the rabbitmq_event_exchange plugin, which publishes events to the default virtual host using AMQP 0.9.1 protocol. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/event-exchange.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` event_exchange.vhost = / event_exchange.protocol = amqp_0_9_1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sample systemd Status Output for RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows a sample output of the systemd status command for the RabbitMQ service. It includes details about the service state, process information, and recent log entries. Aug 26 10:21:32 localhost.localdomain rabbitmq-server[957]: completed with 6 plugins. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Shutting Down a RabbitMQ Node DESCRIPTION: Example of the rabbitmqctl shutdown command which can only be run on the same host as the target node. This command gracefully shuts down the RabbitMQ service. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl shutdown ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Alternative Option Value Format with Equals Sign DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating an alternative way to provide option values using the equals sign format (--option=value) which is useful when the value itself begins with a hyphen. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl add_user --node=rabbit@host1.messaging.eng.coolcorporation.banana -- "a-user" "a-pa$$w0rd" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Authenticating with OAuth 2.0 Token in RabbitMQ HTTP API (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Example of using an OAuth 2.0 token to authenticate against the RabbitMQ HTTP API using curl. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # swap for an actual token curl -i -u ignored: http://localhost:15672/api/vhosts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Internal Authentication Backend in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration example for setting up RabbitMQ to use only the internal authentication backend, which is the default configuration. The example uses the 'internal' alias for 'rabbit_auth_backend_internal'. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # rabbitmq.conf # # 1 here is a backend name. It can be anything. # Since we only really care about backend # ordering, we use numbers throughout this guide. # # "internal" is an alias for rabbit_auth_backend_internal auth_backends.1 = internal ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Producer with Filter Value in Java Stream Client DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to create a producer that associates messages with filter values extracted from message application properties. The filter value logic is provided during producer creation. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2023-10-16-stream-filtering/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` Producer producer = environment.producerBuilder() .stream("invoices") .filterValue(msg -> msg.getApplicationProperties().get("region").toString()) .build(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Stream Consumer with Filtering in Java DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating how to set up a RabbitMQ stream consumer with both broker-side filter values and client-side post-filtering logic using the stream Java client. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2023-10-24-stream-filtering-internals/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` Consumer consumer = environment.consumerBuilder() .stream("invoices") .filter() .values("AMER") .postFilter(msg -> "AMER".equals(msg.getApplicationProperties().get("region"))) .builder() .messageHandler((ctx, msg) -> { // message processing code }) .build(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Increasing Atom Limit via VM Flag DESCRIPTION: Setting a higher limit (9 million) for the maximum number of atoms using the VM flag approach for environments with large numbers of quorum queues. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/runtime.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` RABBITMQ_SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS="+t 9000000" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating RabbitMQ Stream Queue Flow Diagram in Mermaid DESCRIPTION: Mermaid flowchart demonstrating a basic RabbitMQ stream queue topology. Shows message flow from producer (P) through a stream queue (Q) to a consumer (C), with appropriate styling classes applied. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/src/components/Tutorials/T1DiagramStreamToC.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: mermaid CODE: ``` flowchart LR P((P)) Q[[Stream-Queue]] C((C)) P --> Q --> C class P mermaid-producer class Q mermaid-queue class C mermaid-consumer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ Inter-node Communication for IPv6 DESCRIPTION: This configuration snippet demonstrates how to set up RabbitMQ's inter-node communication listener to use only a local IPv6 interface. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # Instructs the node to only listen for inter-node communication connections on a local interface. # This affects both connections from cluster peers and CLI tools. # # This particular configuration only makes sense for single-node clusters. # For multi-node clusters, nodes must listen on an "internal network-local" interface # that would allow cluster peers to connect but not be exposed to the public Internet distribution.listener.interface = ::1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting RabbitMQ Clusters DESCRIPTION: Commands to delete one or multiple RabbitMQ cluster instances. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/kubectl-plugin.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl rabbitmq delete INSTANCE ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl rabbitmq delete rmq1 rmq2 rmq3 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Channel Maximum Limit DESCRIPTION: Configuration to limit the maximum number of channels per connection to optimize RAM usage. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_24 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` channel_max = 16 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling AWS Peer Discovery Plugin DESCRIPTION: Command to enable the AWS peer discovery plugin before first node boot. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins --offline enable rabbitmq_peer_discovery_aws ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Authenticating a RabbitMQ User DESCRIPTION: Command to verify a user's credentials against the RabbitMQ broker authentication system. This can be used to test if a username and password combination is valid. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl authenticate_user janeway verifyit ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Stopping RabbitMQ Service on Windows DESCRIPTION: Command to stop the RabbitMQ service using the CLI tool. Must be run with administrator privileges. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/install-windows.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat stop ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Alternative Option Value Format with Equals Sign DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating an alternative way to provide option values using the equals sign format (--option=value) which is useful when the value itself begins with a hyphen.
