SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl add_user --node=rabbit@host1.messaging.eng.coolcorporation.banana -- "a-user" "a-pa$$w0rd" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting ERL_SSL_PATH in RabbitMQ Environment Configuration DESCRIPTION: Infers the Erlang TLS library path and sets it as ERL_SSL_PATH in the RabbitMQ environment configuration file. This is necessary for loading the inet_tls_dist module for encrypted inter-node communication. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/clustering-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` erl -noinput -eval 'io:format("ERL_SSL_PATH=~s~n", [filename:dirname(code:which(inet_tls_dist))])' -s init stop > /tmp/ssl-path.txt cat /tmp/ssl-path.txt /etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-env.conf > /tmp/new-rabbitmq-env.conf mv -f /tmp/new-rabbitmq-env.conf /etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-env.conf ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Handling Empty Queue Response in Polling with Erlang DESCRIPTION: Shows how to handle the case when polling a queue that is empty. The server returns a basic.get_empty response when no messages are available. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/erlang-client-user-guide.md#2025-04-09_snippet_27 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` #'basic.get_empty'{} = amqp_channel:call(Channel, Get) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Clearing User Limits via HTTP API DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the HTTP API endpoint for clearing user limits. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/user-limits.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` DELETE /api/user-limits/{username}/{limit} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Opening an AMQP 1.0 Connection in Python DESCRIPTION: Establishes a connection to an AMQP 1.0 broker using the Environment instance in Python. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/amqp-client-libraries.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` # open a connection from the environment setting connection = environment.connection() # close the connection when it is no longer necessary connection.close() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Overriding Default OAuth Logon Type for Specific Resource DESCRIPTION: Configuration showing how to override the default OAuth logon type for a specific resource. This example configures a QA environment resource to use idp_initiated logon instead of the default sp_initiated type. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.oauth_resource_servers.3.id = rabbit_qa management.oauth_resource_servers.3.label = RabbitMQ QA management.oauth_resource_servers.3.oauth_initiated_logon_type = idp_initiated management.oauth_resource_servers.3.oauth_provider_url = http://qa_url ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Offset Tracking in RabbitMQ Streams Consumer in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to implement server-side offset tracking in a RabbitMQ Streams consumer. It uses queryOffset to retrieve previously stored offsets and storeOffset to save the current position periodically and before closing. The consumer can resume from its last position after restart. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-javascript-stream.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // start consuming at the beginning of the stream const consumerRef = "offset-tracking-tutorial"; // the consumer must a have name let firstOffset = undefined; let offsetSpecification = rabbit.Offset.first(); try { const offset = await client.queryOffset({ reference: consumerRef, stream: streamName }); // take the offset stored on the server if it exists offsetSpecification = rabbit.Offset.offset(offset + 1n); // start from the message after 'marker' } catch (e) {} let lastOffset = offsetSpecification.value; let messageCount = 0; const consumer = await client.declareConsumer( { stream: streamName, offset: offsetSpecification, consumerRef }, async (message) => { messageCount++; if (!firstOffset && messageCount === 1) { firstOffset = message.offset; console.log("First message received"); } if (messageCount % 10 === 0) { await consumer.storeOffset(message.offset); // store offset every 10 messages } if (message.content.toString() === "marker") { console.log("Marker found"); lastOffset = message.offset; await consumer.storeOffset(message.offset); // store the offset on consumer closing await consumer.close(true); } } ); console.log(`Start consuming...`); await sleep(2000); console.log(`Done consuming, first offset was ${firstOffset}, last offset was ${lastOffset}`); process.exit(0); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using OAuth Token with HTTP API via Basic Auth Format DESCRIPTION: Example of accessing the RabbitMQ HTTP API using a token in the basic authentication format. This uses the 'ignored:token' format where the username is ignored. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # swap for an actual token curl -i -u ignored: http://localhost:15672/api/vhosts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting a PerfTest Pod in Kubernetes DESCRIPTION: Command to delete a RabbitMQ performance test instance pod from Kubernetes cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-operator/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_39 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl delete pod perf-test ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Forcing Single Line Log Messages in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration for forcing multi-line log messages to be truncated to a single line. This should only be used when required by log collection tools, as it can lead to incomplete log messages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_46 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # Accepted values are 'on' and 'off'. # The default is 'off'. log.console.formatter.single_line = on ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing User Topic Permissions in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Shows all virtual hosts to which a specific user has been granted access, along with their topic permissions in these virtual hosts. This command helps in reviewing a user's topic-based access control settings across the RabbitMQ cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_28 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_user_topic_permissions janeway ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring URIs for Shovel Connections DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to specify multiple URIs for shovel connections, allowing for fallback options. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/shovel-static.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {uris, [ "amqp://fred:secret@host1.domain/my_vhost", "amqp://john:secret@host2.domain/my_vhost" ]} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Testing TLS Connection to RabbitMQ Node DESCRIPTION: Command to test TLS connection establishment to a RabbitMQ node using OpenSSL s_client. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/troubleshooting-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` openssl s_client -connect localhost:5671 -cert client_certificate.pem -key client_key.pem -CAfile ca_certificate.pem ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Resource Access Query Example DESCRIPTION: Example of a complex resource access query combining boolean operators to control access based on username and resource name. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_28 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {resource_access_query, {'or', [{'and', [{equals, "${name}", "test1"}, {equals, "${username}", "user1"}]}, {'and', [{equals, "${name}", "test2"}, {'not', {equals, "${username}", "user1"}}]} ]}} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Virtual Hosts with Metadata using rabbitmqctl DESCRIPTION: Lists all virtual hosts along with their metadata including name, description, tags, and default queue type. The formatter option makes the output more readable. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl -q --formatter=pretty_table list_vhosts name description tags default_queue_type ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Cluster with Custom Default User Configuration DESCRIPTION: This YAML defines a RabbitMQ cluster with custom default user credentials. It demonstrates how setting default_user and default_pass can lead to authentication issues with the Topology Operator. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/troubleshooting-topology-operator.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiVersion: rabbitmq.com/v1beta1 kind: RabbitmqCluster metadata: name: custom-configuration spec: replicas: 1 rabbitmq: additionalConfig: | default_user = some-user default_pass = some-pass ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Classic Configuration Format Example (advanced.config) DESCRIPTION: An example of the classic Erlang terms configuration format used in advanced.config files. This shows the same SSL configuration as the previous example but in the more complex Erlang format. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` %% A classic format snippet, now used by advanced.config files. [ {rabbit, [{ssl_options, [{cacertfile, "/path/to/ca_certificate.pem"}, {certfile, "/path/to/server_certificate.pem"}, {keyfile, "/path/to/server_key.pem"}, {verify, verify_peer}, {fail_if_no_peer_cert, true}]}]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining RabbitMQ Log File Path in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Specifies the default path for the RabbitMQ log file in a generic binary build. The path includes the node name. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/relocate.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` `$RABBITMQ_LOG_BASE/$RABBITMQ_NODENAME.log` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Erlang Scheduler Count in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Sets the number of Erlang runtime schedulers to 4 using the +S flag, overriding automatic core detection. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/runtime.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` RABBITMQ_SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS="+S 4:4" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Conditional Definition Import Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration options for skipping definition import when content hasn't changed, with examples for local and HTTPS sources. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/definitions.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # when set to true, definition import will only happen # if definition file contents change definitions.skip_if_unchanged = true definitions.import_backend = local_filesystem definitions.local.path = /path/to/definitions/defs.json # when set to true, definition import will only happen # if definition file contents change definitions.skip_if_unchanged = true definitions.import_backend = https definitions.https.url = https://some.endpoint/path/to/rabbitmq.definitions.json definitions.tls.verify = verify_peer definitions.tls.fail_if_no_peer_cert = true definitions.tls.cacertfile = /path/to/ca_certificate.pem definitions.tls.certfile = /path/to/client_certificate.pem definitions.tls.keyfile = /path/to/client_key.pem ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Multiple Bindings for Different Severities in PHP DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to create multiple bindings for different log severities in PHP using the php-amqplib library. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-php.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` foreach ($severities as $severity) { $channel->queue_bind($queue_name, 'direct_logs', $severity); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Policy in RabbitMQ API DESCRIPTION: JSON payload for declaring or updating a policy. This example creates a federation policy that applies to queues with names starting with 'amq.'. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` {"pattern":"^amq.", "definition": {"federation-upstream-set":"all"}, "priority": 10, "apply-to": "queues"} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running PerfTest Producer with RAR Token (Bash) DESCRIPTION: This command starts a PerfTest producer application using a Rich Authorization Request token for authentication and authorization. It demonstrates how to use OAuth 2.0 tokens with the AMQP protocol. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_38 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make start-perftest-producer-with-token PRODUCER=producer_with_roles TOKEN=$(bin/jwt_token rar-token.json legacy-token-key private.pem public.pem) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Authentication Mechanisms in RabbitMQ Server DESCRIPTION: This configuration specifies which authentication mechanisms are offered to connecting clients by the RabbitMQ server. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_mechanisms.1 = PLAIN auth_mechanisms.2 = AMQPLAIN auth_mechanisms.3 = ANONYMOUS ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Max Length Policy with rabbitmqctl DESCRIPTION: Sets a policy to limit queue size to 1MiB using rabbitmqctl command line tool. When the limit is reached, oldest messages are discarded. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/maxlength/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy my-pol "^one-meg$" \ '{"max-length-bytes":1048576}' \ --apply-to queues ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting Virtual Host Using CLI DESCRIPTION: Deletes a virtual host and all its resources using rabbitmqctl. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl delete_vhost qa1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Referencing RabbitMQ Web MQTT Plugin DESCRIPTION: Code reference showing how to mention the rabbitmq_web_mqtt plugin in documentation context. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/plugins.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` rabbitmq_web_mqtt ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting At-Least-Once Dead Letter Strategy DESCRIPTION: This command sets a policy to enable at-least-once dead letter strategy for the source queue, ensuring messages are not lost when the target queue is unavailable. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2022-03-29-at-least-once-dead-lettering/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: zsh CODE: ``` kubectl exec my-rabbit-server-1 -c rabbitmq -- rabbitmqctl set_policy --apply-to queues \ my-policy my-source-queue '{"dead-letter-strategy" : "at-least-once"}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Exiting maintenance mode in rabbitmq-upgrade DESCRIPTION: Command to return a node to regular operating mode after maintenance, allowing it to serve client traffic and host queue leader replicas again. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmq-upgrade.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` revive ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Resource Access with String Comparison in RabbitMQ LDAP DESCRIPTION: Example of a resource access query using string comparison. It grants permissions to declare and delete exchanges and queues based on specific strings in the user's description field. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {resource_access_query, {for, [{permission, configure, {equals, {attribute, "${user_dn}", "description"}, {string, "can-declare-${resource}s"} } }, {permission, write, {constant, true}}, {permission, read, {constant, true}} ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Module Attributes in Elixir for RabbitMQ Boot Steps DESCRIPTION: Code snippet demonstrating how to declare module attributes in Elixir, which is necessary for RabbitMQ's boot steps functionality that enables the server to automatically pick up plugins at startup. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2013-06-03-using-elixir-to-write-rabbitmq-plugins/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: elixir CODE: ``` defmodule RabbitExchangeTypeRecentHistory do Module.register_attribute __MODULE__, :rabbit_boot_step, accumulate: true, persist: true @rabbit_boot_step { __MODULE__, [{:description, "exchange type x-recent-history"}, {:mfa, {:rabbit_registry, :register, [:exchange, <<"x-recent-history">>, __MODULE__]}}, {:requires, :rabbit_registry}, {:enables, :kernel_ready}] end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Federation Upstream in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to set up a federation upstream parameter using rabbitmqctl in Bash shell. Defines connection details and message expiration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/federation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_parameter federation-upstream my-upstream \ '{"uri":"amqp://target.hostname","expires":3600000}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Advanced Configuration in Erlang DESCRIPTION: Erlang configuration that disables loopback users and metrics collection for benchmark testing. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2024-08-21-amqp-benchmarks/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [ {rabbit, [ {loopback_users, []} ]}, {rabbitmq_management_agent, [ {disable_metrics_collector, true} ]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Queue-Exchange Metrics Table DESCRIPTION: Metrics for monitoring message flow between queues and exchanges SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/prometheus/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Metric | Description | |---------------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|\n| rabbitmq_detailed_queue_exchange_messages_published_total | Total number of messages published into a queue through an exchange | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Publishing Delayed Messages in Java DESCRIPTION: Java code demonstrating how to publish a message with the x-delay header, which specifies how many milliseconds the message should be delayed before being routed. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2015-04-16-scheduling-messages-with-rabbitmq/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` // ... elided code ... byte[] messageBodyBytes = "delayed payload".getBytes(); AMQP.BasicProperties.Builder props = new AMQP.BasicProperties.Builder(); headers = new HashMap(); headers.put("x-delay", 5000); props.headers(headers); channel.basicPublish("my-exchange", "", props.build(), messageBodyBytes); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Cuts with Case Expressions in Erlang DESCRIPTION: Shows how cuts can be applied to case expressions in Erlang, creating functions that perform pattern matching. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2011-05-17-can-you-hear-the-drums-erlando/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` F = case _ of N when is_integer(N) -> N + N; N -> N end, 10 = F(5), ok = F(ok). ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Sequential Erlang Code Example DESCRIPTION: A simple example of sequential code in Erlang with three consecutive statements, which will be used to demonstrate how monads can control execution flow between statements. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2011-05-17-can-you-hear-the-drums-erlando/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` A = foo(), B = bar(A, dog), ok. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Resetting a RabbitMQ Node to Virgin State DESCRIPTION: This command returns a RabbitMQ node to its initial state by removing it from any cluster, clearing management database data, and deleting persistent messages. The RabbitMQ application must be stopped before running this command. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl reset ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Resetting a RabbitMQ Node to Virgin State DESCRIPTION: This command returns a RabbitMQ node to its initial state by removing it from any cluster, clearing management database data, and deleting persistent messages. The RabbitMQ application must be stopped before running this command. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl reset ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing Web STOMP Client in HTML DESCRIPTION: HTML script tag to include the STOMP client library. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/web-stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Topic Message Receiver DESCRIPTION: Message receiver class that handles messages from multiple topic queues using @RabbitListener annotations. Includes processing logic and timing measurements. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-five-spring-amqp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` import org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.annotation.RabbitListener; import org.springframework.util.StopWatch; public class Tut5Receiver { @RabbitListener(queues = "#{autoDeleteQueue1.name}") public void receive1(String in) throws InterruptedException { receive(in, 1); } @RabbitListener(queues = "#{autoDeleteQueue2.name}") public void receive2(String in) throws InterruptedException { receive(in, 2); } public void receive(String in, int receiver) throws InterruptedException { StopWatch watch = new StopWatch(); watch.start(); System.out.println("instance " + receiver + " [x] Received '" + in + "'"); doWork(in); watch.stop(); System.out.println("instance " + receiver + " [x] Done in " + watch.getTotalTimeSeconds() + "s"); } private void doWork(String in) throws InterruptedException { for (char ch : in.toCharArray()) { if (ch == '.') { Thread.sleep(1000); } } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Stopping RabbitMQ Service DESCRIPTION: Commands to stop a running RabbitMQ node using either brew services or direct shutdown. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/install-homebrew.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` brew services stop rabbitmq /opt/homebrew/sbin/rabbitmqctl shutdown ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting LDAP Activity Logging in RabbitMQ with Classic Config Format DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to set LDAP logging level using RabbitMQ's classic configuration format, which uses Erlang terms. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` [ {rabbitmq_auth_backend_ldap, [ %% ... {log, network} ]} ] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Publishing a Persistent Message in Erlang DESCRIPTION: Shows how to publish a persistent message by setting the delivery_mode to 2 in the #'P_basic'{} properties record. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/erlang-client-user-guide.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` Payload = <<"foobar">>, Publish = #'basic.publish'{exchange = X, routing_key = Key}, Props = #'P_basic'{delivery_mode = 2}, %% persistent message Msg = #amqp_msg{props = Props, payload = Payload}, amqp_channel:cast(Channel, Publish, Msg) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Waiting for RabbitMQ Application to Start DESCRIPTION: This command waits for the RabbitMQ application to start using a specified PID file. It will wait for the PID file to be created, then for the process to start, and finally for the RabbitMQ application to start in that process. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl wait /var/run/rabbitmq/pid ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding RabbitMQ Java Client Dependency with Gradle DESCRIPTION: Groovy snippet for adding the RabbitMQ Java client library dependency to a Gradle project. It adds the compile dependency for com.rabbitmq:amqp-client version 5.24.0. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/java-client.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: groovy CODE: ``` dependencies { compile 'com.rabbitmq:amqp-client:5.24.0' } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TLS 1.3 for RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows a RabbitMQ configuration that accepts TLSv1.3 connections. It includes settings for SSL listeners, certificate files, and cipher suites. This configuration passes key testssl.sh tests on Erlang 26. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_42 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` listeners.ssl.1 = 5671 ssl_options.cacertfile = /path/to/ca_certificate.pem ssl_options.certfile = /path/to/server_certificate.pem ssl_options.keyfile = /path/to/server_key.pem ssl_options.versions.1 = tlsv1.3 ssl_options.verify = verify_peer ssl_options.fail_if_no_peer_cert = true ssl_options.ciphers.1 = TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384 ssl_options.ciphers.2 = TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256 ssl_options.ciphers.3 = TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256 ssl_options.ciphers.4 = TLS_AES_128_CCM_SHA256 ssl_options.ciphers.5 = TLS_AES_128_CCM_8_SHA256 ssl_options.honor_cipher_order = true ssl_options.honor_ecc_order = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Decoding Encrypted Values with RabbitMQ CLI DESCRIPTION: Example of using rabbitmqctl decode command with custom cipher, hash and iteration settings for decryption. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_70 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl decode --cipher blowfish_cfb64 --hash sha256 --iterations 10000 '{encrypted,<<"...">>}' mypassphrase ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Granting User Permissions in RabbitMQ (JSON) DESCRIPTION: JSON payload for the PUT /api/permissions/{vhost}/{user} endpoint to grant or update user permissions in a given virtual host. This example grants full permissions for configure, write, and read operations. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` {"configure":".*","write":".*","read":".*"} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Identity-Provider Initiated OAuth 2.0 Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration entries in rabbitmq.conf for enabling Identity-Provider initiated OAuth 2.0 authentication in the RabbitMQ Management UI SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # ... management.oauth_enabled = true management.oauth_initiated_logon_type = idp_initiated management.oauth_provider_url = http://localhost:8080 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Consul Service Tags for RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to add tags to the RabbitMQ service when registering with Consul. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = consul cluster_formation.consul.host = consul.eng.example.local # Define tags for the RabbitMQ service: "qa" and "3.8" cluster_formation.consul.svc_tags.1 = qa cluster_formation.consul.svc_tags.2 = 3.8 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Kubernetes API CA Certificate for RabbitMQ Cluster Formation DESCRIPTION: Specifies the path to the Kubernetes API CA certificate bundle. This certificate is used for secure communication with the Kubernetes API over HTTPS. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = k8s cluster_formation.k8s.host = kubernetes.default.example.local # Where to load the K8S API access token from. # Default value: /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/token cluster_formation.k8s.token_path = /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/token # Where to load K8S API CA bundle file from. It will be used when issuing requests # to the K8S API using HTTPS. # # Default value: /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/ca.crt cluster_formation.k8s.cert_path = /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/ca.crt ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ for IPv6 Inter-node Communication DESCRIPTION: These environment variable settings and configuration file contents demonstrate how to configure RabbitMQ nodes and CLI tools to use IPv6 for inter-node communication and related tasks. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # these flags will be used by RabbitMQ nodes RABBITMQ_SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS="-kernel inetrc '/etc/rabbitmq/erl_inetrc' -proto_dist inet6_tcp" # these flags will be used by CLI tools RABBITMQ_CTL_ERL_ARGS="-proto_dist inet6_tcp" ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` %% Tells DNS client on RabbitMQ nodes and CLI tools to resolve hostnames to IPv6 addresses. %% The trailing dot is not optional. {inet6,true}. ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` RABBITMQ_CTL_ERL_ARGS="-proto_dist inet6_tcp" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting RabbitMQ PerfTest Pod from Kubernetes DESCRIPTION: This bash command shows how to remove the RabbitMQ PerfTest pod from a Kubernetes cluster after testing is complete. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2020-08-10-deploying-rabbitmq-to-kubernetes-whats-involved/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_20 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl delete pod perf-test ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Messages from RabbitMQ Queue DESCRIPTION: This command fetches messages from a specific RabbitMQ queue using the rabbitmqadmin tool. It's used to verify the contents of queues and confirm successful message routing. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2022-03-29-at-least-once-dead-lettering/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: zsh CODE: ``` kubectl exec my-rabbit-server-0 -c rabbitmq -- rabbitmqadmin get queue=my-target-queue count=2 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Decommissioning MQTT Node in RabbitMQ using rabbitmqctl DESCRIPTION: This command decommissions an MQTT node in RabbitMQ using the rabbitmqctl CLI tool. It should be used before disabling the plugin on a node or removing a node from the cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/mqtt.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl decommission_mqtt_node ; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Make Deployment Alternative DESCRIPTION: Alternative command using make to deploy the monitoring stack SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/prometheus/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make metrics overview ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining a RabbitMQ Queue Resource in Kubernetes DESCRIPTION: An example of a Queue Custom Resource that defines a quorum queue named 'my-queue' on vhost 'my-vhost' connected to the RabbitMQ cluster 'my-rabbit-cluster'. This demonstrates the declarative management of RabbitMQ resources in Kubernetes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2022-02-21-gatekeeper-validation/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` --- apiVersion: rabbitmq.com/v1beta1 kind: Queue metadata: name: my-queue spec: name: my-queue vhost: my-vhost type: quorum rabbitmqClusterReference: name: my-rabbit-cluster ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Compiling RabbitMQ Java Client Applications DESCRIPTION: Command-line instructions for compiling Java applications that use the RabbitMQ client library. The classpath parameter is required to include the necessary dependencies. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-five-java.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` javac -cp $CP ReceiveLogsTopic.java EmitLogTopic.java ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Restarting epmd Service After Configuration Changes in Bash DESCRIPTION: Commands to reload systemd configuration and restart the epmd socket and service after updating its unit file. This is necessary to apply the new network configuration settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` systemctl daemon-reload systemctl restart epmd.socket epmd.service ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting RabbitMQ Application DESCRIPTION: Command to start the RabbitMQ application on a node. Typically used after performing management actions that required the application to be stopped. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl start_app ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ Shovel from AMQP 0.9.1 to AMQP 1.0 DESCRIPTION: Configuration for a shovel that transfers messages from an AMQP 0.9.1 source to an AMQP 1.0 destination. Includes detailed source broker configuration and AMQP 1.0 specific destination settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/shovel-static.md#2025-04-09_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {rabbitmq_shovel, [{shovels, [{my_first_shovel, {source, [{protocol, amqp091}, {uris, ["amqp://fred:secret@host1.domain/my_vhost", "amqp://john:secret@host2.domain/my_vhost"]}, {declarations, [{'exchange.declare', [{exchange, <<"my_fanout">>}, {type, <<"fanout">>}, durable]}, {'queue.declare', [{arguments, [{<<"x-message-ttl">>, long, 60000}]}]}, {'queue.bind', [{exchange, <<"my_fanout">>}, {queue, <<>>} ]} ]}, {queue, <<>>}, {prefetch_count, 10} ]}, {destination, [{protocol, amqp10}, {uris, ["amqp://host:5672"]}, {properties, [{user_id, <<"my-user">>}]}, {application_properties, [{<<"my-prop">>, <<"my-prop-value">>}]}, {add_forward_headers, true}, {target_address, <<"destination-queue">>} ]}, {ack_mode, on_confirm}, {reconnect_delay, 5} }]} ]} } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: OpenSSL Configuration for CA DESCRIPTION: Configuration file for setting up a test Certificate Authority, including policies and extensions for client and server certificates. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_45 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` [ ca ] default_ca = testca [ testca ] dir = . certificate = $dir/ca_certificate.pem database = $dir/index.txt new_certs_dir = $dir/certs private_key = $dir/private/ca_private_key.pem serial = $dir/serial default_crl_days = 7 default_days = 365 default_md = sha256 policy = testca_policy x509_extensions = certificate_extensions [ testca_policy ] commonName = supplied stateOrProvinceName = optional countryName = optional emailAddress = optional organizationName = optional organizationalUnitName = optional domainComponent = optional [ certificate_extensions ] basicConstraints = CA:false [ req ] default_bits = 2048 default_keyfile = ./private/ca_private_key.pem default_md = sha256 prompt = yes distinguished_name = root_ca_distinguished_name x509_extensions = root_ca_extensions [ root_ca_distinguished_name ] commonName = hostname [ root_ca_extensions ] basicConstraints = CA:true keyUsage = keyCertSign, cRLSign [ client_ca_extensions ] basicConstraints = CA:false keyUsage = digitalSignature,keyEncipherment extendedKeyUsage = 1.3.6.1.5.5.7.3.2 [ server_ca_extensions ] basicConstraints = CA:false keyUsage = digitalSignature,keyEncipherment extendedKeyUsage = 1.3.6.1.5.5.7.3.1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Virtual Host using HTTP API with curl DESCRIPTION: Creates a virtual host named 'vh1' using the RabbitMQ HTTP API with curl. This demonstrates how to perform the same operation via the REST API instead of the CLI. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -u userename:pa$sw0rD -X PUT http://rabbitmq.local:15672/api/vhosts/vh1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Advanced Config Backing Queue Module DESCRIPTION: Setting the implementation module for queue contents in the advanced config file. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_50 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {rabbit, [ {backing_queue_module, rabbit_variable_queue} ]} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting RabbitMQ Application DESCRIPTION: Command to start the RabbitMQ application on a node. Typically used after performing management actions that required the application to be stopped. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl start_app ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Binding a Queue with a Routing Key in Swift RabbitMQ Client DESCRIPTION: Creating a binding between a queue and an exchange with a specific routing key. This allows messages to be filtered based on the routing key. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-swift.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: swift CODE: ``` q.bind(exchange, routingKey: "black") ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Clearing User Limits via HTTP API using curl DESCRIPTION: These curl commands demonstrate how to clear the maximum channels and connections limits for a user using the RabbitMQ HTTP API. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/user-limits.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -v -u guest:guest -X DELETE http://localhost:15672/api/user-limits/user1/max-channels curl -v -u guest:guest -X DELETE http://localhost:15672/api/user-limits/user1/max-connections ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Kubernetes Operator Configuration DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for deploying RabbitMQ cluster using Kubernetes Operator with specific resource allocations and advanced settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2023-05-17-rabbitmq-3.12-performance-improvements/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiVersion: rabbitmq.com/v1beta1 kind: RabbitmqCluster metadata: name: ... spec: replicas: 1 # or 3 for mirrored and quorum queues image: rabbitmq:3.11.7-management # or rabbitmq:3.12.0-rc.2-management resources: requests: cpu: 14 memory: 12Gi limits: cpu: 14 memory: 12Gi persistence: storageClassName: premium-rwo storage: "150Gi" rabbitmq: advancedConfig: | [ {rabbit, [ {credit_flow_default_credit,{0,0}} ]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building RabbitMQ Management Plugin from Source DESCRIPTION: Shell commands to build the RabbitMQ management plugin from source code by cloning the appropriate repositories. This process requires specific version checkouts to ensure compatibility between components. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2010-09-07-management-plugin-preview-release/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` hg clone http://hg.rabbitmq.com/rabbitmq-public-umbrella cd rabbitmq-public-umbrella make checkout hg update -r rabbitmq_v2_0_0 -R rabbitmq-server hg update -r rabbitmq_v2_0_0 -R rabbitmq-codegen hg update -r rabbitmq_v2_0_0 -R rabbitmq-erlang-client hg clone http://hg.rabbitmq.com/rabbitmq-management make cd rabbitmq-management make ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Protocol Requirements HTML Structure DESCRIPTION: HTML table structure containing protocol requirements for RabbitMQ implementation including connection handling, channel management, and exchange configuration. Contains specifications for both server and client behaviors. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/specification.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` ok MUST exchange / required-types
The server MUST implement these standard exchange types: fanout, direct.
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Field Array in AMQP 0-9-1 Grammar DESCRIPTION: Shows the production rule for field-array in the AMQP 0-9-1 protocol grammar, highlighting the ambiguity in the long-int value representation. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/src/pages/amqp-0-9-1-errata.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` field-array = long-int *field-value ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Predeclared Topology for All Shovels in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration setting that makes all shovels started on a node use pre-declared topology instead of declaring it themselves. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/shovel-dynamic.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # all shovels started on this node will use pre-declared topology shovel.topology.predeclared = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Verification Success Output Example DESCRIPTION: Example output showing successful TLS certificate verification. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/troubleshooting-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` Verify return code: 0 (ok) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Node Cleanup Warning Logging in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to configure RabbitMQ to log warnings for unknown nodes in the cluster without removing them. It sets the cluster_formation.node_cleanup.only_log_warning option to true. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_45 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.node_cleanup.only_log_warning = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Default Topic Exchange in RabbitMQ STOMP Adapter DESCRIPTION: Configuration setting to specify a different default exchange than amq.topic for STOMP topic destinations. This allows customization of the routing behavior for STOMP topic messages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` stomp.default_topic_exchange = some.exchange ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Message Requeuing in Java DESCRIPTION: Shows how to requeue messages using RabbitMQ Java client. Uses Channel#basicReject with requeue flag set to true. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/confirms.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` boolean autoAck = false; channel.basicConsume(queueName, autoAck, "a-consumer-tag", new DefaultConsumer(channel) { @Override public void handleDelivery(String consumerTag, Envelope envelope, AMQP.BasicProperties properties, byte[] body) throws IOException { long deliveryTag = envelope.getDeliveryTag(); // requeue the delivery channel.basicReject(deliveryTag, true); } }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Advanced Config Backing Queue Module DESCRIPTION: Setting the implementation module for queue contents in the advanced config file. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_50 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {rabbit, [ {backing_queue_module, rabbit_variable_queue} ]} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Syslog Hostname DESCRIPTION: Specifies Syslog server using hostname instead of IP address. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_24 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.syslog = true log.syslog.host = my.syslog-server.local log.syslog.port = 1514 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Log File Rotation Compression DESCRIPTION: Enables compression for archived log files. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.file.rotation.compress = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Upgrade Logs DESCRIPTION: Deactivates logging for upgrade-related events. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_31 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.upgrade.level = none ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Callback Queue for RPC Response in RabbitMQ with Python DESCRIPTION: Implementation of how to create a callback queue for receiving RPC responses. The client creates an exclusive queue, sends a request with the callback queue specified in the reply_to property, and then waits for a response on that queue. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-six-python.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` result = channel.queue_declare(queue='', exclusive=True) callback_queue = result.method.queue channel.basic_publish(exchange='', routing_key='rpc_queue', properties=pika.BasicProperties( reply_to = callback_queue, ), body=request) # ... and some code to read a response message from the callback_queue ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing React Components for RabbitMQ Website DESCRIPTION: This code imports necessary React components for the RabbitMQ website documentation, including a component for displaying RabbitMQ server version tags and Docusaurus tab components. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import { RabbitMQServerGitTag, } from '@site/src/components/RabbitMQServer'; import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs'; import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem'; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example Entra ID Access Token for RabbitMQ Authentication DESCRIPTION: This JavaScript object represents an example of an access token issued by Entra ID for RabbitMQ authentication. It includes claims such as audience, issuer, roles, and user information. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples-entra-id/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` { "aud": "30b61ef8-72d7-4e40-88f2-6e16c8d3fd88", "iss": "https://sts.windows.net/1ffc6121-590e-4aa5-bf47-c348674069cb/", "iat": 1655740039, "nbf": 1655740039, "exp": 1655744211, "acr": "1", "aio": "AUQAu/8TAAAAjvwucwL4nZe83vNZvg6A7sAPscI9zsGvRs8EuT7aVhubpmhRnxJ+X7nbkISoP5eBBMxoi2yiCclnH2Ocjjzsqw==", "amr": [ "wia" ], "appid": "30b61ef8-72d7-4e40-88f2-6e16c8d3fd88", "appidacr": "1", "email": "baptiste.daroit@company.com", "idp": "https://sts.windows.net/b3f4f7c2-72ce-4192-aba4-d6c7719b5766/", "in_corp": "true", "ipaddr": "xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx", "name": "Baptiste DA ROIT", "oid": "cf2df3b4-03df-4e1e-b5c0-f232932aaead", "rh": "0.AR8AgCG80x7L90C1mhVBBXQzQjgoklctsdBMtgYVWFwc4tgfAMQ.", "roles": [ "30b61ef8-72d7-4e40-88f2-6e16c8d3fd88.tag:monitoring", "30b61ef8-72d7-4e40-88f2-6e16c8d3fd88.configure:*/*" ], "scp": "User.Read", "sub": "6aBzW3a1FOTTrnlZEuC1SmwG0sRjVgQU49DvrYK6Rqg", "tid": "1ffc6121-590e-4aa5-bf47-c348674069cb", "unique_name": "baptiste.daroit@company.com", "uti": "QHqwThTqQEK9iMdnRuD_AA", "ver": "1.0" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Logging Default User Connection Refusal in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the server log output when a default user attempts to connect from a remote host, which is refused for security reasons. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` 2024-08-24 17:28:32.153698-04:00 [error] <0.1567.0> PLAIN login refused: user 'guest' can only connect via localhost ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling TCP keepalives in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration to enable TCP keepalives for connections. When set to true, TCP keepalives will be enabled. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_42 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` tcp_listen_options.keepalive = false ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Virtual Host Definition with Protection DESCRIPTION: JSON definition for creating a protected virtual host via definition file import SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "name": "protected", "description": "", "metadata": { "description": "This virtual host is protected from deletion with a special metadata key", "tags": [], "default_queue_type": "classic", "protected_from_deletion": true }, "tags": [], "default_queue_type": "classic" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling VT/ANSI Escape Sequences in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: PowerShell command to enable VT/ANSI escape sequences globally, fixing issues with RabbitMQ CLI tools displaying ANSI character sequences improperly. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/windows-configuration.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` Set-ItemProperty HKCU:\Console VirtualTerminalLevel -Type DWORD 1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Port Forwarding RabbitMQ Prometheus Metrics DESCRIPTION: This command sets up port forwarding for RabbitMQ's Prometheus metrics port. It's necessary for accessing the metrics from outside the Kubernetes cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2022-03-29-at-least-once-dead-lettering/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: zsh CODE: ``` kubectl port-forward pod/my-rabbit-server-1 15692 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing RabbitMQ Signing Key via Direct Download DESCRIPTION: Downloads and imports the RabbitMQ release signing key directly from GitHub using curl and GPG. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/signatures.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -L https://github.com/rabbitmq/signing-keys/releases/download/3.0/rabbitmq-release-signing-key.asc --output rabbitmq-release-signing-key.asc gpg --import rabbitmq-release-signing-key.asc ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Consuming RabbitMQ Stream from First Offset in Java DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to consume messages from a stream starting from the first available message using the 'first' offset specification. Includes QoS settings and required message acknowledgment. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/streams.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` channel.basicQos(100); // QoS must be specified channel.basicConsume( "my-stream", false, Collections.singletonMap("x-stream-offset", "first"), // "first" offset specification (consumerTag, message) -> { // message processing // ... channel.basicAck(message.getEnvelope().getDeliveryTag(), false); // ack is required }, consumerTag -> { }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Custom Node Name in RabbitMQ Environment Configuration DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to set a custom node name prefix in the rabbitmq-env.conf file. It changes the default prefix from "rabbit" to "hare". SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmq-env.conf.5.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # I am a complete rabbitmq-env.conf file. # Comment lines start with a hash character. # This is a /bin/sh script file - use ordinary envt var syntax NODENAME=hare ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing RabbitMQ API with OAuth Client DESCRIPTION: Command to access the RabbitMQ management API using OAuth client credentials authentication. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make curl url=http://localhost:15672/api/overview client_id=producer_with_roles secret=producer_with_roles_secret ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Clearing User Permissions in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to remove user access permissions from a specific virtual host. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl clear_permissions -p my-vhost janeway ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Logging RPC Request Example DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates logging output format for a RPC request to calculate Fibonacci number SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-six-javascript.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` # => [x] Requesting fib(30) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TCP Listener Port in RabbitMQ using Erlang Terms Format DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to change the default TCP listener port for AMQP 0-9-1 and AMQP 1.0 client connections from 5672 to 5673 using the classic Erlang terms format, which was used in older versions of RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` %% this is a comment [ {rabbit, [ {tcp_listeners, [5673]} ] } ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Multiple Signing Keys with curl DESCRIPTION: Command to access RabbitMQ API with a token signed by a secondary signing key, demonstrating multiple key support. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make curl-with-token URL=http://localhost:15672/api/overview TOKEN=$(bin/jwt_token scope-and-extra-scope.json legacy-token-2-key private-2.pem public-2.pem) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling File Logging with Console Output DESCRIPTION: Configuration to enable console logging while disabling file output. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.console = true log.console.level = info log.file = false ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running the RPC Client in Go with RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to run the RPC client implementation with a specific input. This sends a request to calculate the 30th Fibonacci number to the RPC server. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-six-go.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` go run rpc_client.go 30 # => [x] Requesting fib(30) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting RabbitMQ with OAuth 2.0 Configuration DESCRIPTION: Commands to set environment variables and start RabbitMQ configured for OAuth 2.0 authentication with UAA in portal mode. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/oauth2-examples-idp-initiated.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` export MODE=portal OAUTH_PROVIDER=uaa make start-rabbitmq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting OAuth Client ID and Label for a Resource DESCRIPTION: Configuration example showing how to set the OAuth client ID and display label for a specific resource. This is required for resources using sp_initiated logon type to properly authenticate with the OAuth provider. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.oauth_resource_servers.1.id = rabbit_prod management.oauth_resource_servers.1.oauth_client_id = rabbit_prod_mgt_ui management.oauth_resource_servers.1.label = RabbitMQ Production ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Custom Key Prefix and Cluster Name for RabbitMQ etcd Discovery DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to configure a custom key prefix and cluster name for RabbitMQ etcd-based peer discovery. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_39 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = etcd cluster_formation.etcd.endpoints.1 = one.etcd.eng.example.local:2379 cluster_formation.etcd.endpoints.2 = two.etcd.eng.example.local:2479 cluster_formation.etcd.endpoints.3 = three.etcd.eng.example.local:2579 # rabbitmq is used by default cluster_formation.etcd.key_prefix = rabbitmq_discovery # default name: "default" cluster_formation.etcd.cluster_name = staging ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running PerfTest with Default Flow Control for AMQP 0.9.1 Quorum Queue Benchmark DESCRIPTION: Java command for benchmarking a quorum queue with AMQP 0.9.1 protocol using default flow control settings (confirm count of 192). The benchmark shows lower throughput compared to the high confirm count test due to flow control limitations. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2024-08-21-amqp-benchmarks/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ java -jar target/perf-test.jar \ --predeclared --exchange amq.default \ --routing-key my-quorum-queue --queue my-quorum-queue \ --flag persistent --flag mandatory \ --pmessages 1000000 --size 12 --confirm 192 --qos 5000 --multi-ack-every 5000 id: test-084359-441, sending rate avg: 9931 msg/s id: test-084359-441, receiving rate avg: 9931 msg/s id: test-084359-441, consumer latency min/median/75th/95th/99th 7512/17054/26256/34249/38641 µs id: test-084359-441, confirm latency min/median/75th/95th/99th 9432/16586/23918/32636/36858 µs ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Receiving All Logs with Topic Exchange in RabbitMQ using Objective-C DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to receive all logs using a topic exchange in RabbitMQ by using the '#' wildcard as the routing key. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-five-objectivec.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Objective-C CODE: ``` [self receiveLogsTopic:@[@"#"]]; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling RabbitMQ Feature Flags DESCRIPTION: Command to enable specific feature flags or all feature flags in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_75 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl enable_feature_flag restart_streams ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl enable_feature_flag all ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example of messages_details JSON Object DESCRIPTION: JSON structure showing a message count with additional time-series details including rate, average, and historical samples. This structure is returned when querying queue metrics with time period parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_30 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "messages": 123619, "messages_details": { "avg": 41206.333333333336, "avg_rate": 1030.1583333333333, "rate": 24723.8, "samples": [ { "sample": 123619, "timestamp": 1400680560000 }, { "sample": 0, "timestamp": 1400680500000 }, { "sample": 0, "timestamp": 1400680440000 } ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Collecting Runtime Thread Statistics in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Samples and reports runtime (kernel) threads' activity for the specified interval. Requires Erlang/OTP with microstate accounting support and the runtime_tools package. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics runtime_thread_stats --sample-interval 15 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring JSON Format Logging in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration setting to output logs in JSON format rather than plain text. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.file.formatter = json ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Syslog Hostname in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This configuration sets a custom hostname and port for Syslog logging in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.syslog = true log.syslog.host = my.syslog-server.local log.syslog.port = 1514 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Syslog Identity and Facility DESCRIPTION: Sets custom identity and facility values for Syslog messages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.syslog = true log.syslog.identity = my_rabbitmq log.syslog.facility = user ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Syslog IP and Port DESCRIPTION: Specifies custom IP address and port for Syslog server. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.syslog = true log.syslog.ip = 10.10.10.10 log.syslog.port = 1514 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Unacknowledged Messages in RabbitMQ on Windows DESCRIPTION: Windows-specific command to check unacknowledged messages in RabbitMQ queues for debugging purposes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-python.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat list_queues name messages_ready messages_unacknowledged ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring epmd to Listen on Local Interface in Bash DESCRIPTION: Sets the ERL_EPMD_ADDRESS environment variable to configure the epmd daemon to only listen on a local IPv6 interface, which improves security by limiting network exposure. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # instructs epmd to only listen on a local interface export ERL_EPMD_ADDRESS="::1" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Viewing PerfTest Logs to Verify RabbitMQ Messaging DESCRIPTION: Command to view the logs from the PerfTest pod to verify that it's successfully sending and receiving messages through the RabbitMQ cluster, confirming that the instance is operational. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-operator/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_38 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl logs -f perf-test ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Advanced TLS Options for RabbitMQ Web STOMP DESCRIPTION: Comprehensive configuration for TLS settings including cipher suites, TLS versions, and security parameters for the Web STOMP plugin. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/web-stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` web_stomp.ssl.port = 15673 web_stomp.ssl.backlog = 1024 web_stomp.ssl.certfile = /path/to/server_certificate.pem web_stomp.ssl.keyfile = /path/to/server_key.pem web_stomp.ssl.cacertfile = /path/to/ca_certificate_bundle.pem web_stomp.ssl.password = changeme web_stomp.ssl.honor_cipher_order = true web_stomp.ssl.honor_ecc_order = true web_stomp.ssl.client_renegotiation = false web_stomp.ssl.secure_renegotiate = true web_stomp.ssl.versions.1 = tlsv1.2 web_stomp.ssl.versions.2 = tlsv1.1 web_stomp.ssl.ciphers.1 = ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 web_stomp.ssl.ciphers.2 = ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 web_stomp.ssl.ciphers.3 = ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-SHA384 web_stomp.ssl.ciphers.4 = ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA384 web_stomp.ssl.ciphers.5 = ECDH-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 web_stomp.ssl.ciphers.6 = ECDH-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 web_stomp.ssl.ciphers.7 = ECDH-ECDSA-AES256-SHA384 web_stomp.ssl.ciphers.8 = ECDH-RSA-AES256-SHA384 web_stomp.ssl.ciphers.9 = DHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Default Permissions in RabbitMQ (INI) DESCRIPTION: Default permissions assigned to the default user, granting full configure, read, and write permissions using regex patterns. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_38 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` default_permissions.configure = .* default_permissions.read = .* default_permissions.write = .* ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Log Tail Command DESCRIPTION: Command to print the last N lines of the node's log file with configurable timeout SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics log_tail --number 100 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RPC Method Signatures in RabbitMQ Java Client DESCRIPTION: Available RPC method signatures for sending requests, including primitive, string and map-based calls. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/java-api-guide.md#2025-04-09_snippet_46 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` byte[] primitiveCall(byte[] message); String stringCall(String message) Map mapCall(Map message) Map mapCall(Object[] keyValuePairs) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Shrinking Quorum Queue Clusters in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Removes quorum queue replicas (members) from a specified node, typically used when decommissioning a node from the cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmq-queues.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-queues shrink "rabbit@decomissioned-node" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Publishing Messages to Topic Exchange with Specific Routing Key DESCRIPTION: Command-line example demonstrating how to run the publisher application with a specific routing key pattern. This shows how to target messages to specific subscribers based on the routing pattern. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-five-java.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` java -cp $CP EmitLogTopic "kern.critical" "A critical kernel error" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Daily Log Rotation at Midnight DESCRIPTION: Configuration example showing how to set up daily log file rotation at midnight with compression and retention settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # rotate every night at midnight log.file.rotation.date = $D0 # keep up to 5 archived log files in addition to the current one log.file.rotation.count = 5 # archived log files will be compressed log.file.rotation.compress = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Daily Log Rotation at Midnight DESCRIPTION: Configuration example showing how to set up daily log file rotation at midnight with compression and retention settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # rotate every night at midnight log.file.rotation.date = $D0 # keep up to 5 archived log files in addition to the current one log.file.rotation.count = 5 # archived log files will be compressed log.file.rotation.compress = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting AMQP Producers with OAuth Tokens DESCRIPTION: These commands start AMQP producers for both dev and prod realms, using OAuth tokens obtained from Keycloak. The producers are configured with specific client IDs and permissions. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples-multiresource.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make start-perftest-producer-with-token PRODUCER=prod_producer TOKEN=$(bin/keycloak/token prod_producer sIqZ5flmSz3r6uKXMSz8CWGeScdTpqq0 prod) make start-perftest-producer-with-token PRODUCER=dev_producer TOKEN=$(bin/keycloak/token dev_producer SBuw1L5a7Y2aQfWfbsgXlEKGTNaEHxO8 dev) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Maintenance Mode in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: PowerShell command to bring a RabbitMQ node out of maintenance mode without restarting it. This is only needed if the node won't be restarted as planned, as a restart automatically disables maintenance mode. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/upgrade.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` rabbitmq-upgrade.bat revive ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Stunnel Configuration Example DESCRIPTION: Configuration file for stunnel to proxy TLS connections to RabbitMQ's non-TLS port. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/troubleshooting-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` foreground = yes [rabbit-amqp] connect = localhost:5672 accept = 5679 cert = client/key-cert.pem debug = 7 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Log Publisher DESCRIPTION: Command to run the log emitter script that publishes messages to the fanout exchange. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-ruby.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ruby emit_log.rb ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Bindings in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Lists bindings for a specific virtual host. This command displays the exchange name and queue name of all bindings in the 'my-vhost' virtual host. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_33 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_bindings -p my-vhost exchange_name queue_name ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Connection Limits for a Virtual Host in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to limit the maximum number of concurrent connections in the 'qa_env' virtual host to 64. Virtual host limits help control resource usage. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_59 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_vhost_limits -p qa_env '{"max-connections": 64}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring LDAP with HTTP Fallback in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This configuration sets up RabbitMQ to use LDAP for primary authentication, with a fallback to the HTTP backend. It includes the necessary HTTP backend configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # rabbitmq.conf # auth_backends.1 = ldap # uses module name instead of a short alias, "http" auth_backends.2 = rabbit_auth_backend_http # See HTTP backend docs for details auth_http.user_path = http://my-authenticator-app/auth/user auth_http.vhost_path = http://my-authenticator-app/auth/vhost auth_http.resource_path = http://my-authenticator-app/auth/resource auth_http.topic_path = http://my-authenticator-app/auth/topic ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Stream Consumer Groups in RabbitMQ using CLI DESCRIPTION: This command provides a concise view of stream consumer groups, showing the stream name, reference, and number of consumers for each group. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2022-07-05-rabbitmq-3-11-feature-preview-single-active-consumer-for-streams/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` docker exec rabbitmq rabbitmqctl list_stream_consumer_groups stream,reference,consumers ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Clearing Certificate Cache in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Command to clear the PEM cache for SSL certificates in RabbitMQ using rabbitmqctl in a Bash environment. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_46 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl eval -n [target-node@hostname] 'ssl:clear_pem_cache().' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Federation Upstream in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Sets a federation upstream named 'origin' using rabbitmqctl. This defines a remote endpoint that can be used in federation policies. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/federated-queues/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_parameter federation-upstream origin '{"uri":"amqp://remote-host.local:5672"}' ``` LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat set_parameter federation-upstream origin '"{""uri":""amqp://remote-host.local:5672""}"' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting up a Semaphore Queue in RabbitMQ using Java DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to declare a durable queue for a semaphore and publish a message to it using the default exchange in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2014-02-19-distributed-semaphores-with-rabbitmq/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` channel.queueDeclare("resource.semaphore", true, false, false, null); String message = "resource"; channel.basicPublish("", "resource.semaphore", null, message.getBytes()); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Server Certificate with keytool in Java DESCRIPTION: Command to import a server certificate into a Java trust store using the keytool utility. This creates a JKS format trust store that will be used for server certificate verification. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` keytool -import -alias server1 -file /path/to/server_certificate.pem -keystore /path/to/rabbitstore ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing RabbitMQ Client Framework in Objective-C DESCRIPTION: Imports the RabbitMQ client framework as a module in the Objective-C file. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-objectivec.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Objective-C CODE: ``` @import RMQClient; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Stream PerfTest with Load Balancer (Java) DESCRIPTION: This command shows how to run the RabbitMQ stream performance test tool using Java, configured to always use a load balancer as the entry point. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2021-07-23-connecting-to-streams/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` java -jar stream-perf-test.jar --uris rabbitmq-stream://my-load-balancer:5552 --load-balancer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Cluster Status DESCRIPTION: Displays all nodes in the cluster grouped by node type, along with currently running nodes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl cluster_status ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Default Permissions in RabbitMQ (INI) DESCRIPTION: Default permissions assigned to the default user, granting full configure, read, and write permissions using regex patterns. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_38 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` default_permissions.configure = .* default_permissions.read = .* default_permissions.write = .* ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Erlang SSL Versions Output DESCRIPTION: Detailed output showing SSL/TLS version support information from Erlang runtime SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/troubleshooting-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [{ssl_app,"9.1"}, {supported,['tlsv1.2','tlsv1.1',tlsv1]}, {supported_dtls,['dtlsv1.2',dtlsv1]}, {available,['tlsv1.2','tlsv1.1',tlsv1,sslv3]}, {available_dtls,['dtlsv1.2',dtlsv1]}] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring Queue with Snake-Case Arguments in RabbitMQ v2 DESCRIPTION: Example of using the v2 command format with snake-case arguments (--auto-delete instead of auto_delete) to declare a quorum queue in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` # Note: --auto-delete rabbitmqadmin --vhost "vh-2" declare queue --name "qq.1" --type "quorum" --durable true --auto-delete false ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Category-Specific Log Levels DESCRIPTION: Example of setting different log levels for specific categories while maintaining debug logging globally.
