SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_30 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.file.level = debug log.connection.level = info log.channel.level = info ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Log Receiver Commands DESCRIPTION: Command line examples for running the log receiver with different severity levels SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-ruby.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ruby receive_logs_direct.rb warning error > logs_from_rabbit.log ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ruby receive_logs_direct.rb info warning error # => [*] Waiting for logs. To exit press CTRL+C ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Cache Module with Advanced Arguments in advanced.config DESCRIPTION: Advanced configuration for specifying cache module start arguments using the advanced.config file. This example configures the segmented ETS cache with a custom argument (10000) passed to its start_link function. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/auth-cache-backend.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [ {rabbit, [ %% ... ]}, {rabbitmq_auth_backend_cache, [ {cache_module, rabbit_auth_backend_ets_segmented}, {cache_module_args, [10000]} ]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Multiple LDAP Servers in classic config Format DESCRIPTION: Erlang format configuration for connecting to multiple LDAP servers. This is the equivalent classic config format for specifying multiple LDAP servers. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [ {rabbitmq_auth_backend_ldap, [ {servers, ["ldap.eng.megacorp.local", "192.168.0.100"]} ]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring LDAP DN Lookup Base in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration example showing how to set up the DN lookup attribute and base in RabbitMQ's LDAP plugin. This allows authentication using email addresses with Active Directory. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_ldap.dn_lookup_attribute = userPrincipalName auth_ldap.dn_lookup_base = DC=gopivotal,DC=com ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing RabbitMQ and Erlang Signing Keys DESCRIPTION: Commands to import the signing keys for RabbitMQ and Erlang repositories. These keys are used to verify the authenticity of the packages during installation. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/install-rpm.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ## primary RabbitMQ signing key rpm --import 'https://github.com/rabbitmq/signing-keys/releases/download/3.0/rabbitmq-release-signing-key.asc' ## modern Erlang repository rpm --import 'https://github.com/rabbitmq/signing-keys/releases/download/3.0/cloudsmith.rabbitmq-erlang.E495BB49CC4BBE5B.key' ## RabbitMQ server repository rpm --import 'https://github.com/rabbitmq/signing-keys/releases/download/3.0/cloudsmith.rabbitmq-server.9F4587F226208342.key' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Virtual Hosts with Metadata DESCRIPTION: Lists virtual hosts with their metadata using formatted table output. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl -q --formatter=pretty_table list_vhosts name description tags default_queue_type ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Shrinking Quorum Queue Clusters in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Removes quorum queue replicas (members) from a specified node, typically used when decommissioning a node from the cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmq-queues.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-queues shrink "rabbit@decomissioned-node" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitmqCluster with Labels and Annotations DESCRIPTION: This YAML example shows how to add labels and annotations to a RabbitmqCluster resource, which will be propagated to resources created by the Operator. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-operator/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiVersion: rabbitmq.com/v1beta1 kind: RabbitmqCluster metadata: labels: app: rabbitmq annotations: some: annotation name: rabbitmqcluster-sample ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Management UI OAuth Resource Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration for OAuth resources in the RabbitMQ management UI, including client IDs and scopes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples-multiresource.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.oauth_resource_servers.1.id = rabbit_prod management.oauth_resource_servers.1.client_id = rabbit_prod_mgt_ui management.oauth_resource_servers.1.label = RabbitMQ Production management.oauth_resource_servers.1.scopes = openid profile rabbitmq.tag:administrator management.oauth_resource_servers.2.id = rabbit_dev management.oauth_resource_servers.2.client_id = rabbit_dev_mgt_ui management.oauth_resource_servers.2.label = RabbitMQ Development management.oauth_resource_servers.2.scopes = openid profile rabbitmq.tag:management ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Modifying Default Directory Locations in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Code snippet showing how to modify the rabbitmq-defaults script to use system directories instead of directories under the installation path. This changes RabbitMQ to use operating system convention locations for configuration, logs, and data. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/install-generic-unix.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` PREFIX=${RABBITMQ_HOME} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: HTML Version Compatibility Table DESCRIPTION: A structured HTML table displaying RabbitMQ version compatibility information with Erlang/OTP versions, including version ranges, requirements, and important notes about security vulnerabilities and support status. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/which-erlang.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: HTML CODE: ```
Unsupported RabbitMQ Series Minimum required Erlang/OTP Maximum supported Erlang/OTP Notes
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Clearing User Limits with rabbitmqctl DESCRIPTION: These commands demonstrate how to clear specific or all limits for a user using rabbitmqctl. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/user-limits.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl clear_user_limits user1 'max-connections' rabbitmqctl clear_user_limits user1 'max-channels' rabbitmqctl clear_user_limits user1 all ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking RabbitMQ Cluster Status DESCRIPTION: Commands to verify the status of the RabbitMQ cluster from different nodes, showing node membership and running status. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/clustering.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # on rabbit1 rabbitmqctl cluster_status # => Cluster status of node rabbit@rabbit1 ... # => [{nodes,[{disc,[rabbit@rabbit1,rabbit@rabbit2]}]}, # => {running_nodes,[rabbit@rabbit2,rabbit@rabbit1]}] # => ...done. # on rabbit2 rabbitmqctl cluster_status # => Cluster status of node rabbit@rabbit2 ... # => [{nodes,[{disc,[rabbit@rabbit1,rabbit@rabbit2]}]}, # => {running_nodes,[rabbit@rabbit1,rabbit@rabbit2]}] # => ...done. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting Exchanges with RabbitMQ CLI DESCRIPTION: These commands show how to delete exchanges using the rabbitmqadmin CLI tool. The second command uses the --idempotently flag to ignore 404 Not Found responses. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin --vhost "events" delete exchange --name "target.exchange.name" ``` LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` # --idempotently means that 404 Not Found responses will not be considered errors rabbitmqadmin --vhost "events" delete exchange --name "target.exchange.name" --idempotently ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Port Configuration for Web MQTT DESCRIPTION: INI configuration example showing how to change the default Web MQTT listener port. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/web-mqtt.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` web_mqtt.tcp.port = 9001 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Resetting RabbitMQ Node to Initial State DESCRIPTION: Command to reset a RabbitMQ node to its virgin state, removing cluster configuration, management database data, and persistent messages. Requires the RabbitMQ application to be stopped first. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl reset ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Message Acknowledgment in RabbitMQ Consumer with Objective-C DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to implement message acknowledgment in a RabbitMQ consumer using Objective-C. It subscribes to a queue with manual acknowledgment enabled, processes messages, and explicitly acknowledges them after processing is complete. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-objectivec.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: objectivec CODE: ``` RMQBasicConsumeOptions manualAck = RMQBasicConsumeNoOptions; [q subscribe:manualAck handler:^(RMQMessage * _Nonnull message) { NSString *messageText = [[NSString alloc] initWithData:message.body encoding:NSUTF8StringEncoding]; NSLog(@"%@: Received %@", name, messageText); // imitate some work unsigned int sleepTime = (unsigned int)[messageText componentsSeparatedByString:@"."].count - 1; NSLog(@"%@: Sleeping for %u seconds", name, sleepTime); sleep(sleepTime); [ch ack:message.deliveryTag]; }]; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Debugging enabled plugins file mismatch DESCRIPTION: Shows an error that occurs when the rabbitmq-plugins tool and server node use different enabled plugins files, often occurring in development environments with multiple installations. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/plugins.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_top Enabling plugins on node rabbit@warp10: # => rabbitmq_top # => The following plugins have been configured: # => rabbitmq_management # => rabbitmq_management_agent # => rabbitmq_shovel # => rabbitmq_shovel_management # => rabbitmq_top # => rabbitmq_web_dispatch # => Applying plugin configuration to rabbit@warp10... # => Error: # => {:enabled_plugins_mismatch, '/path/to/installation1/etc/rabbitmq/enabled_plugins', '/path/to/installation2/etc/rabbitmq/enabled_plugins'} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling RabbitMQ Management Plugin via CLI DESCRIPTION: Command to enable the RabbitMQ management plugin using the rabbitmq-plugins CLI tool, which activates the web UI and HTTP API without requiring a node restart. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_management ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Channel Limit in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Sets the maximum number of channels that can be opened on a connection simultaneously to 100. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/channels/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # no more 100 channels can be opened on a connection at the same time channel_max = 100 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Logging Default User Remote Connection Refusal in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This log snippet shows the error message when the default 'guest' user attempts to connect from a remote host, which is not allowed by default for security reasons. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` 2024-08-24 17:28:32.153698-04:00 [error] <0.1567.0> PLAIN login refused: user 'guest' can only connect via localhost ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Classic Queues Version 2 in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration setting to enable Classic Queues Version 2 (CQv2) as the default queue version in RabbitMQ. This setting can be added to the RabbitMQ configuration file to globally enable CQv2. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2023-05-17-rabbitmq-3.12-performance-improvements/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: config CODE: ``` classic_queue.default_version = 2 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Acknowledging Multiple Deliveries in Java RabbitMQ Client DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to acknowledge multiple deliveries at once using the Java client for RabbitMQ. This method reduces network traffic by batching acknowledgements. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/confirms.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` // this example assumes an existing channel instance boolean autoAck = false; channel.basicConsume(queueName, autoAck, "a-consumer-tag", new DefaultConsumer(channel) { @Override public void handleDelivery(String consumerTag, Envelope envelope, AMQP.BasicProperties properties, byte[] body) throws IOException { long deliveryTag = envelope.getDeliveryTag(); // positively acknowledge all deliveries up to // this delivery tag channel.basicAck(deliveryTag, true); } }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Topic Permissions in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to list all topic permissions for users in a specific virtual host. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_topic_permissions -p my-vhost ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Filtering Queues for a Specific Virtual Host in RabbitMQ API (HTTP) DESCRIPTION: This HTTP GET request retrieves the first page of queues for the 'my-vhost' virtual host. It uses pagination parameters and additional filtering options like 'name' and 'use_regex' to customize the query results. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_30 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` http://localhost:15672/api/queues/my-vhost?page=1&page_size=100&name=&use_regex=false&pagination=true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Overriding OAuth2 Resource Settings DESCRIPTION: Example of overriding default settings for a specific resource including custom label and logon type. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.oauth_resource_servers.3.id = rabbit_qa management.oauth_resource_servers.3.label = RabbitMQ QA management.oauth_resource_servers.3.oauth_initiated_logon_type = idp_initiated management.oauth_resource_servers.3.oauth_provider_url = http://qa_url ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Firehose Tracing in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to turn on Firehose tracing for a specific virtual host in RabbitMQ. This allows administrators to capture all published and delivered messages for debugging purposes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/firehose.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl trace_on -p [virtual host] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying Help for Specific Commands in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to get usage information for particular commands (add_vhost and status) using rabbitmqctl and rabbitmq-diagnostics in PowerShell. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat help add_vhost rabbitmq-diagnostics.bat help status ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Reverse DNS Lookups in RabbitMQ Configuration DESCRIPTION: This configuration snippet demonstrates how to explicitly disable reverse DNS lookups in RabbitMQ. When set to false, RabbitMQ will not perform reverse DNS lookups for client IP addresses. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_38 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` reverse_dns_lookups = false ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Managing RabbitMQ Service and Feature Flags DESCRIPTION: Commands for starting RabbitMQ as a service and enabling all feature flags. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/install-homebrew.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` brew services start rabbitmq /opt/homebrew/sbin/rabbitmqctl enable_feature_flag all ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring EPMD Port DESCRIPTION: Environment variable setting to specify which port EPMD should bind to. All hosts in a cluster must use the same port. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # makes epmd bind to port 4369 export ERL_EPMD_PORT="4369" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Federation Policy with Single Upstream in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to apply a single federation upstream to resources matching a pattern using RabbitMQ policy. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/federation-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy federate-me '^federated\.' '{"federation-upstream":"up-1"}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Feature Flag Migration Function in Erlang DESCRIPTION: Implementation of a migration function for feature flags that handles both enabling the feature and checking if it's enabled, including table and field verification. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/feature-flags/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` quorum_queue_migration(FeatureName, _FeatureProps, enable) -> Tables = ?quorum_queue_tables, rabbit_table:wait(Tables), Fields = amqqueue:fields(amqqueue_v2), migrate_to_amqqueue_with_type(FeatureName, Tables, Fields); quorum_queue_migration(_FeatureName, _FeatureProps, is_enabled) -> Tables = ?quorum_queue_tables, rabbit_table:wait(Tables), Fields = amqqueue:fields(amqqueue_v2), mnesia:table_info(rabbit_queue, attributes) =:= Fields andalso mnesia:table_info(rabbit_durable_queue, attributes) =:= Fields. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Publishing Messages with Severity Routing Key in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to publish messages to a direct exchange with severity as the routing key using the amqp.node client. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-javascript.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` var exchange = 'direct_logs'; channel.assertExchange(exchange, 'direct', { durable: false }); channel.publish(exchange, severity, Buffer.from(msg)); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Peer Discovery Command - Bash DESCRIPTION: Executes peer discovery and displays discovered nodes SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics discover_peers --timeout 60 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Re-enabling a Denied Deprecated Feature in RabbitMQ Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration example showing how to re-enable a deprecated feature that is denied by default, allowing applications more time to adapt while still upgrading RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/deprecated-features/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # Permit a deprecated feature that is denied by default. deprecated_features.permit.some_deprecated_feature = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Maven Package Build Command DESCRIPTION: Maven wrapper command to clean and package the Spring AMQP tutorial application. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-spring-amqp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ./mvnw clean package ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Static Shovels in RabbitMQ Configuration DESCRIPTION: Example of how to define static shovels in the RabbitMQ advanced configuration file. Shows the overall structure with a shovel named 'shovel_one'. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/shovel-static.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {rabbit, [ %% ... ]}, {rabbitmq_shovel, [ {shovels, [ {shovel_one, [ %% shovel_one properties ... ]}, %% ... ]} ]} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: All-nodes Flag for reset_stats_db Command DESCRIPTION: Flag that resets the RabbitMQ management statistics database for all nodes in the cluster instead of just the local node. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_89 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` --all ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Feature Flags in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: The enable_feature_flag command activates specific feature flags on the target RabbitMQ node. It can enable individual flags by name or all available feature flags at once. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_69 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl enable_feature_flag restart_streams ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl enable_feature_flag all ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Spring Boot Metrics Endpoint JSON Response DESCRIPTION: Example JSON output from Spring Boot's metrics endpoint showing various RabbitMQ metrics including acknowledged, consumed, published, and rejected message counts and rates. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2016-11-30-metrics-support-in-rabbitmq-java-client-4-0/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "rabbitmq.acknowledged.count": 5445, "rabbitmq.acknowledged.fifteenMinuteRate": 7.789880284345983, "rabbitmq.acknowledged.fiveMinuteRate": 9.311935481093306, "rabbitmq.acknowledged.meanRate": 9.930420428656602, "rabbitmq.acknowledged.oneMinuteRate": 9.972266275538352, "rabbitmq.channels": 2, "rabbitmq.connections": 1, "rabbitmq.consumed.count": 5445, "rabbitmq.consumed.fifteenMinuteRate": 7.789875530041546, "rabbitmq.consumed.fiveMinuteRate": 9.311910098253794, "rabbitmq.consumed.meanRate": 9.930418948751754, "rabbitmq.consumed.oneMinuteRate": 9.972238610447798, "rabbitmq.published.count": 5445, "rabbitmq.published.fifteenMinuteRate": 7.789875530041546, "rabbitmq.published.fiveMinuteRate": 9.311910098253794, "rabbitmq.published.meanRate": 9.930419905146142, "rabbitmq.published.oneMinuteRate": 9.972238610447798, "rabbitmq.rejected.count": 0, "rabbitmq.rejected.fifteenMinuteRate": 0, "rabbitmq.rejected.fiveMinuteRate": 0, "rabbitmq.rejected.meanRate": 0, "rabbitmq.rejected.oneMinuteRate": 0 } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting JMS Subscriber with OAuth Token (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Command to start a JMS subscriber application that authenticates using an OAuth token. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make start-jms-subscriber ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Maven Dependency Configuration for RabbitMQ Java Client 5.0 DESCRIPTION: XML configuration for adding the RabbitMQ Java Client 5.0 dependency to a Maven project. This specifies the Maven coordinates required to use the library in a project. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2017-09-29-rabbitmq-java-client-5-0-is-released/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: xml CODE: ``` com.rabbitmq amqp-client 5.0.0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Feature Flags Status in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to display the current status of all feature flags in a formatted table using rabbitmqctl. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/feature-flags/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl -q --formatter pretty_table list_feature_flags ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ OAuth2 Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration setting in rabbitmq.conf that disables audience claim validation due to Keycloak limitations SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/oauth2-examples-proxy.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_oauth2.verify_aud = false ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking RabbitMQ Listeners with rabbitmq-diagnostics DESCRIPTION: This bash command uses rabbitmq-diagnostics to check the interface and port used by the Prometheus plugin in a running RabbitMQ node. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/prometheus/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics -s listeners ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Getting and Compiling Dependencies DESCRIPTION: Commands to fetch and compile the AMQP dependency using Mix. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-elixir.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` mix deps.get mix deps.compile ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting OAuth 2.0 Authenticated AMQP Producers DESCRIPTION: Commands to launch AMQP producers with OAuth 2.0 tokens for different resources (prod and dev). SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/oauth2-examples-multiresource.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make start-perftest-producer-with-token PRODUCER=prod_producer TOKEN=$(bin/keycloak/token prod_producer PdLHb1w8RH1oD5bpppgy8OF9G6QeRpL9) make start-perftest-producer-with-token PRODUCER=dev_producer TOKEN=$(bin/keycloak/token dev_producer z1PNm47wfWyulTnAaDOf1AggTy3MxX2H) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring JMX Metrics Reporting in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to set up JMX reporting for RabbitMQ metrics using Dropwizard Metrics' JmxReporter with a shared MetricRegistry. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2016-11-30-metrics-support-in-rabbitmq-java-client-4-0/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` MetricRegistry registry = new MetricRegistry(); StandardMetricsCollector metrics = new StandardMetricsCollector(registry); ConnectionFactory connectionFactory = new ConnectionFactory(); connectionFactory.setMetricsCollector(metrics); JmxReporter reporter = JmxReporter .forRegistry(registry) .inDomain("com.rabbitmq.client.jmx") .build(); reporter.start(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Managing Global Parameters in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Commands for setting, clearing, and listing global parameters using rabbitmqctl in a Bash environment. Global parameters are not tied to a specific virtual host and consist of a name and value. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/parameters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # sets a global (virtual-host-independent) runtime parameter rabbitmqctl set_global_parameter # clears (unsets) a global (virtual-host-independent) runtime parameter rabbitmqctl clear_global_parameter # lists global (virtual-host-independent) runtime parameters rabbitmqctl list_global_parameters ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Rotating RabbitMQ Log Files DESCRIPTION: This command instructs the RabbitMQ node to perform internal log rotation based on the logging settings specified in the configuration file. The operation is asynchronous. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl rotate_logs ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Default Disk Free Limit in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Default configuration for the disk free space limit, which is set to 50MB by default but should be revised for production environments. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_24 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` disk_free_limit.absolute = 50MB ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Back-off Reconnect Interval in Python DESCRIPTION: Shows how to set a back-off reconnect interval for automatic connection recovery in Python. This example sets a 2-second interval between reconnection attempts. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/amqp-client-libraries.md#2025-04-09_snippet_73 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` environment = Environment( "amqp://guest:guest@localhost:5672/", recovery_configuration=RecoveryConfiguration(back_off_reconnect_interval=timedelta(seconds=2)), ) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Virtual Host Metadata Using CLI DESCRIPTION: Updates virtual host metadata including description, queue type and tags. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl update_vhost_metadata qa1 --description "QA environment for issue 1662" --default-queue-type quorum --tags qa,project-a,qa-1662 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: JSON Structure of Detailed Message Stats in RabbitMQ API DESCRIPTION: Example JSON response showing detailed message statistics for a queue, including breakdown of incoming messages from different exchanges. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_28 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "incoming": [ { "stats": { "publish": 352593, "publish_details": { "rate": 100.2 } }, "exchange": { "name": "my-exchange", "vhost": "/" } } { "stats": { "publish": 543784, "publish_details": { "rate": 54.6 } }, "exchange": { "name": "amq.topic", "vhost": "/" } } ], ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing RabbitMQ Bindings via Command Line DESCRIPTION: Uses rabbitmqctl to list all bindings on the RabbitMQ server, showing the relationships between exchanges and queues. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-elixir.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_bindings ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Identity-Provider Initiated Logon DESCRIPTION: Configuration for enabling identity-provider initiated logon flow, which allows users to be redirected to RabbitMQ with a token obtained under the covers from a web portal. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.oauth_enabled = true management.oauth_initiated_logon_type = idp_initiated management.oauth_provider_url = https://my-web-portal ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Preferred Username Claims for OAuth 2.0 in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration to specify which JWT claims should be used to extract the username displayed in the Management UI. This allows for using more user-friendly identifiers than the default sub claim. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # ... auth_oauth2.resource_server_id = rabbitmq auth_oauth2.preferred_username_claims.1 = user_name auth_oauth2.preferred_username_claims.2 = email # ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Wildcard Certificate Support for Multiple OAuth2 Providers DESCRIPTION: Configuration setting to enable wildcard certificate support when multiple OAuth2 identity providers are used. This allows specifying the setting for a specific provider instead of globally. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/troubleshooting-oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` auth_oauth2.oauth_providers..https.hostname_verification = wildcard ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Default Guest User Loopback Configuration DESCRIPTION: Default configuration for the guest user that restricts it to localhost-only connections for security purposes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_41 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # guest uses well known # credentials and can only # log in from localhost # by default loopback_users.guest = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Getting Virtual Host Metadata Using HTTP API DESCRIPTION: Retrieves virtual host metadata using the HTTP API. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -u userename:pa$sw0rD -X GET http://rabbitmq.local:15672/api/vhosts/qa1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Resource Requirements for RabbitmqCluster in YAML DESCRIPTION: Specifies resource requests and limits for RabbitmqCluster Pods. The example sets both requests and limits to 1000m CPU and 2Gi memory. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-operator/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiVersion: rabbitmq.com/v1beta1 kind: RabbitmqCluster metadata: name: rabbitmqcluster-sample spec: resources: requests: cpu: 1000m memory: 2Gi limits: cpu: 1000m memory: 2Gi ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting RabbitMQ with Specific Version DESCRIPTION: Command to start a specific version of RabbitMQ with OAuth configuration using Docker image tags. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples-idp-initiated.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` MODE=portal OAUTH_PROVIDER=uaa IMAGE=rabbitmq IMAGE_TAG= make start-rabbitmq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Topic Exchange Routing Pattern Examples DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the pattern matching behavior of Topic exchanges using routing key examples with wildcards. Shows how * matches exactly one segment and # matches zero or more segments. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/exchanges.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` "regions.na.cities.*" -> matches "regions.na.cities.toronto", "regions.na.cities.newyork" "audit.events.#" -> matches "audit.events.users.signup", "audit.events.orders.placed" "#" -> matches any routing key ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Inspecting Page Cache Size in Containerized Environments with Bash DESCRIPTION: Commands to check both RSS (resident set size) and page cache footprint in containerized environments like Kubernetes. These paths provide metrics for monitoring memory consumption in container-based deployments. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/memory-use/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cat /sys/fs/cgroup/memory/memory.stat cat /sys/fs/cgroup/memory/memory.usage_in_bytes ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Preferred Username Claims in RabbitMQ (INI) DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to configure RabbitMQ to use specific claims for username extraction from OAuth 2.0 tokens. It sets up a fallback mechanism to look for 'user_name' and 'email' claims before defaulting to 'sub' or 'client_id'. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_34 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` ... auth_oauth2.resource_server_id = rabbitmq auth_oauth2.preferred_username_claims.1 = user_name auth_oauth2.preferred_username_claims.2 = email ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Message Routing Protocol Documentation DESCRIPTION: Documentation that explains how message routing works across different protocols (AMQP 0-9-1, AMQP 1.0, MQTT, STOMP) in RabbitMQ, including error handling and message acknowledgment mechanisms. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/publishers/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ### MQTT In MQTT, messages are published on a connection to a topic. The server side MQTT connection process routes messages via the [topic exchange](/tutorials/amqp-concepts#exchange-topic) to [queues](./queues). When publisher chooses to use QoS 1, published messages are acknowledged by RabbitMQ using a [PUBACK packet](https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901121). Publishers can provide a hint to the server that the published message on the topic must be [retained](https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901104) (stored for future delivery to new subscribers). Only the latest published message for each topic can be retained. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting RabbitMQ Users DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to delete a RabbitMQ user in both Bash and PowerShell environments using the rabbitmqctl command. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl delete_user 'username' ``` LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat delete_user 'username' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: HTTP API Federation Configuration DESCRIPTION: Defines federation policy via HTTP API endpoint with pattern matching and upstream configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/federation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` PUT /api/policies/%2f/federate-me {"pattern":"^amq\.", "definition":{"federation-upstream-set":"all"}, "apply-to":"exchanges"} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Filtering RabbitMQ-Specific Log Entries DESCRIPTION: Command to filter system logs to show only RabbitMQ-related entries using journalctl and grep SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/install-rpm.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo journalctl --system | grep rabbitmq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring STOMP Default User Credentials DESCRIPTION: INI configuration to set default login and passcode for STOMP connections. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` stomp.default_user = guest stomp.default_pass = guest ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Receive.cs Connection Setup DESCRIPTION: Code to establish connection and declare queue for message consumption. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-dotnet.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` var factory = new ConnectionFactory { HostName = "localhost" }; using var connection = factory.CreateConnection(); using var channel = connection.CreateModel(); channel.QueueDeclare(queue: "hello", durable: false, exclusive: false, autoDelete: false, arguments: null); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring a Queue with NoWait Option in RabbitMQ .NET Client DESCRIPTION: Shows how to declare a queue with the noWait option set to true, which instructs the server not to send a response. This is more efficient but offers lower safety guarantees and depends more on the heartbeat mechanism. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/dotnet-api-guide.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` await channel.QueueDeclareAsync(queueName, true, false, false, null, noWait: true); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting PerfTest Consumer with OAuth 2.0 Authentication DESCRIPTION: This command starts a PerfTest consumer application that uses OAuth 2.0 for authentication with RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make start-perftest-consumer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Receiving Logs with Multiple Bindings using Topic Exchange in RabbitMQ with Objective-C DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to create multiple bindings to receive logs from different sources or with different severities using a topic exchange in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-five-objectivec.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: Objective-C CODE: ``` [self receiveLogsTopic:@[@"kern.*", @"*.critical"]]; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Publishing Task Messages to RabbitMQ Queue DESCRIPTION: Commands to publish multiple messages with varying complexity (indicated by the number of dots) to the work queue using new_task.py. Each dot represents one second of processing time in the worker. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-python.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # shell 3 python new_task.py First message. python new_task.py Second message.. python new_task.py Third message... python new_task.py Fourth message.... python new_task.py Fifth message..... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling RabbitMQ-Web-Stomp Plugins DESCRIPTION: These shell commands enable the RabbitMQ-Web-Stomp and RabbitMQ-Web-Stomp-Examples plugins using the rabbitmq-plugins tool. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2012-05-14-introducing-rabbitmq-web-stomp/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` sudo rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_web_stomp sudo rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_web_stomp_examples ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding JVM and System Metrics to RabbitMQ Java Client with Micrometer DESCRIPTION: This code snippet expands on the previous example by adding JVM and system metrics to the JMX meter registry. It includes metrics for class loader, JVM memory, garbage collection, processor, and threads. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2018-04-10-rabbitmq-java-client-metrics-with-micrometer-and-datadog/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` MeterRegistry jmxRegistry = new JmxMeterRegistry(JmxConfig.DEFAULT, Clock.SYSTEM); // JVM and system metrics: new ClassLoaderMetrics().bindTo(jmxRegistry); new JvmMemoryMetrics().bindTo(jmxRegistry); new JvmGcMetrics().bindTo(jmxRegistry); new ProcessorMetrics().bindTo(jmxRegistry); new JvmThreadMetrics().bindTo(jmxRegistry); ConnectionFactory connectionFactory = new ConnectionFactory(); MicrometerMetricsCollector metricsCollector = new MicrometerMetricsCollector( jmxRegistry, "rabbitmq.client" ); connectionFactory.setMetricsCollector(metricsCollector); Connection connection = connectionFactory.newConnection(); Channel channel = connection.createChannel(); String queue = channel.queueDeclare().getQueue(); channel.basicConsume(queue, true, (ctag, msg) -> { }, (ctag) -> { }); executor.submit(() -> { Random random = new Random(); while (true) { Thread.sleep(random.nextInt(100)); channel.basicPublish("", queue, null, "".getBytes()); } }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Users in rabbitmqadmin DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to list users using rabbitmqadmin v2. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin list users ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Verifying RabbitMQ Instance with PerfTest DESCRIPTION: Bash commands to deploy and run the RabbitMQ PerfTest tool to verify that a RabbitMQ instance is running correctly by testing message sending and receiving functionality. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-operator/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_37 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` instance=INSTANCE-NAME username=$(kubectl get secret ${instance}-default-user -o jsonpath="{.data.username}" | base64 --decode) password=$(kubectl get secret ${instance}-default-user -o jsonpath="{.data.password}" | base64 --decode) service=${instance} kubectl run perf-test --image=pivotalrabbitmq/perf-test -- --uri "amqp://${username}:${password}@${service}" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Virtual Host Metadata via HTTP API DESCRIPTION: Updates the metadata for an existing virtual host using the HTTP API. This example modifies the description, tags, and default queue type. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -u userename:pa$sw0rD -X PUT http://rabbitmq.local:15672/api/vhosts/qa1 \ -H "content-type: application/json" \ --data-raw '{"description": "QA environment for issue 1662", "tags": "qa,project-a,qa-1662", "default_queue_type": "quorum"}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Unlimited Prefetch in Java DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to set an unlimited prefetch by passing 0 to the basicQos method, allowing any number of unacknowledged messages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/consumer-prefetch.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` Channel channel = ...; Consumer consumer = ...; channel.basicQos(0); // No limit for this consumer channel.basicConsume("my-queue", false, consumer); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Consumer Timeout in RabbitMQ Erlang Config DESCRIPTION: Advanced configuration example showing how to disable consumer timeout using advanced.config in Erlang format. This approach is not recommended for production use. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/consumers.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` %% advanced.config [ {rabbit, [ {consumer_timeout, undefined} ]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Users in Windows Command Prompt DESCRIPTION: Shows how to add RabbitMQ users using Windows Command Prompt (cmd), including proper quoting for passwords with special characters. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: batch CODE: ``` rem password is provided as a command line argument rabbitmqctl.bat add_user "username" "9a55f70a841f18b97c3a7db939b7adc9e34a0f1d" rem passwords with special characters must be quoted correctly rabbitmqctl.bat add_user "username" "w63pnZ&LnYMO(t" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring EPMD Interface and Port DESCRIPTION: Commands for configuring EPMD interface binding and port settings, including how to stop the EPMD process. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # makes epmd listen on loopback IPv6 and IPv4 interfaces export ERL_EPMD_ADDRESS="::1" ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Stops local epmd process. # Use after shutting down RabbitMQ. epmd -kill ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # makes epmd bind to port 4369 export ERL_EPMD_PORT="4369" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Manual Package Installation with RPM DESCRIPTION: Commands for manually installing RabbitMQ using RPM after importing signing keys and installing dependencies. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/install-rpm.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rpm --import https://github.com/rabbitmq/signing-keys/releases/download/3.0/rabbitmq-release-signing-key.asc ## install these dependencies from standard OS repositories dnf install -y logrotate # The RabbitMQ RPM package is suitable for both RHEL 9 (modern) and RHEL 8-based (older) distributions dnf install -y rabbitmq-server-${RabbitMQServerPackageFilename} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TLS Handshake Timeout in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This configuration snippet demonstrates how to set the TLS handshake timeout in RabbitMQ to 10 seconds (10000 milliseconds). This may be necessary when TLS is enabled and the default timeout is insufficient. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_36 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` ssl_handshake_timeout = 10000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting RabbitMQ with Specific Version and OAuth 2.0 Configuration DESCRIPTION: Command to start a specific version of RabbitMQ with OAuth 2.0 authentication, allowing version selection through environment variables. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/oauth2-examples-idp-initiated.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` MODE=portal OAUTH_PROVIDER=uaa IMAGE=rabbitmq IMAGE_TAG= make start-rabbitmq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using --help Option for RabbitMQ CLI Tools in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the --help option to get general help information for rabbitmqctl and rabbitmq-diagnostics in PowerShell. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat --help rabbitmq-diagnostics.bat --help ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Topic Permissions in RabbitMQ Virtual Host (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Shows all users who have been granted topic permissions in a specific virtual host. This command helps in managing and reviewing fine-grained access control for publish/subscribe patterns in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_topic_permissions -p my-vhost ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Federation Upstream in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: PowerShell version of adding a federation upstream named 'origin' that points to a remote RabbitMQ host. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/federated-exchanges/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat set_parameter federation-upstream origin '"{""uri":""amqp://remote-host.local:5672""}"' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring OAuth2 Scope Aliases in RabbitMQ.conf DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to map Okta roles to RabbitMQ scope aliases in the rabbitmq.conf file. It defines admin and monitoring roles with their respective permissions using the auth_oauth2.scope_aliases configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples-okta.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` #... auth_oauth2.scope_aliases.admin = okta.read:*/* okta.write:*/* okta.configure:*/* okta.tag:administrator auth_oauth2.scope_aliases.monitoring = okta.tag:management okta.read:*/ #... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Clearing Certificate Cache in RabbitMQ (CMD) DESCRIPTION: Command to clear the PEM cache for SSL certificates in RabbitMQ using rabbitmqctl in a CMD environment. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_48 LANGUAGE: batch CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat eval -n [target-node@hostname] "ssl:clear_pem_cache()." ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Receiving Log Messages with Topic Exchange in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: This script connects to RabbitMQ, creates a topic exchange, and binds a queue to the exchange with specified routing keys. It then consumes messages from the queue, demonstrating how to receive messages based on topic patterns. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-five-javascript.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` #!/usr/bin/env node var amqp = require('amqplib/callback_api'); var args = process.argv.slice(2); if (args.length == 0) { console.log("Usage: receive_logs_topic.js ."); process.exit(1); } amqp.connect('amqp://localhost', function(error0, connection) { if (error0) { throw error0; } connection.createChannel(function(error1, channel) { if (error1) { throw error1; } var exchange = 'topic_logs'; channel.assertExchange(exchange, 'topic', { durable: false }); channel.assertQueue('', { exclusive: true }, function(error2, q) { if (error2) { throw error2; } console.log(' [*] Waiting for logs. To exit press CTRL+C'); args.forEach(function(key) { channel.bindQueue(q.queue, exchange, key); }); channel.consume(q.queue, function(msg) { console.log(" [x] %s:'%s'", msg.fields.routingKey, msg.content.toString()); }, { noAck: true }); }); }); }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Dead Lettering Messages with Custom Reason in AMQP 1.0 DESCRIPTION: Shows how to dead letter a message with a custom reason annotation using the RabbitMQ AMQP 1.0 Java Client. The code demonstrates adding a dead letter reason to message annotations before discarding the message. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2024-10-11-modified-outcome/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` Consumer consumer = connection.consumerBuilder() .queue(ordersQueue) .messageHandler((context, message) -> { Map annotations = new HashMap<>(); annotations.put("x-opt-dead-letter-reason", "Incompatible Message Format"); context.discard(annotations); }).build(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting PerfTest Producer with Custom Token DESCRIPTION: This command starts a PerfTest producer application using a custom JWT token with roles in the extra scope field. It generates the token using the JWT token script with producer-specific claims. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_31 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make start-perftest-producer-with-token PRODUCER=producer_with_roles TOKEN=$(bin/jwt_token producer-role-in-extra-scope.json legacy-token-key private.pem public.pem) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ MQTT Listener Log Entry DESCRIPTION: Example log entry showing successful MQTT listener initialization on port 1883. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2012-09-12-mqtt-adapter/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` =INFO REPORT==== 12-Sep-2012::14:21:26 === started MQTT TCP Listener on [::]:1883 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating APT Package Sources DESCRIPTION: Commands to update apt package sources to include RabbitMQ repositories and install required packages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo apt-get update -y ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling the RabbitMQ Web MQTT Plugin with rabbitmq-plugins DESCRIPTION: Command to enable the Web MQTT plugin using the rabbitmq-plugins tool. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/web-mqtt.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_web_mqtt ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking If Quorum Queue Replicas Have Finished Initial Sync (Bash) DESCRIPTION: A health check command that exits with a non-zero status if there are any ongoing initial quorum queue replica synchronization operations, ensuring safe node operations. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/grow-then-shrink-upgrade.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # exits with a non-zero status if there are any ongoing initial quorum queue # replica sync operations rabbitmq-diagnostics check_if_new_quorum_queue_replicas_have_finished_initial_sync ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabled Plugins File Format in Erlang DESCRIPTION: Shows the format of the enabled_plugins file which contains a list of enabled plugins. The example shows management and shovel plugins enabled. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/plugins.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [rabbitmq_management,rabbitmq_management_agent,rabbitmq_shovel]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: MQTT Scopes Configuration JSON DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for the scopes required to publish a message to a MQTT topic, including write, configure, and read permissions on all virtual hosts, exchanges, and topics. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` { "scope": [ "rabbitmq.write:*/*/*", "rabbitmq.configure:*/*/*", "rabbitmq.read:*/*/*" ], "extra_scope": "rabbitmq.tag:management", "aud": [ "rabbitmq" ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting File Limits Without Systemd DESCRIPTION: Command to set file handle limits on traditional Linux systems SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/install-rpm.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ulimit -S -n 64000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring OAuth 2.0 Scope Prefix in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to configure a custom scope prefix for OAuth 2.0 token permissions. Shows both setting a custom prefix and an empty prefix. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` ... auth_oauth2.scope_prefix = api:// ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring HTTP and HTTPS Together for RabbitMQ Management Plugin DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to configure both HTTP and HTTPS listeners on different ports for the RabbitMQ Management plugin using the INI configuration format. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.tcp.port = 15672 management.ssl.port = 15671 management.ssl.cacertfile = /path/to/ca_certificate.pem management.ssl.certfile = /path/to/server_certificate.pem management.ssl.keyfile = /path/to/server_key.pem ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Log File Level in RabbitMQ (INI) DESCRIPTION: Default logging level configuration, set to 'info' which logs errors, warnings, and informational messages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_30 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.file.level = info ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Receive.cs Namespace Declarations DESCRIPTION: Required namespace imports for the message receiver implementation. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-dotnet.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` using System; using RabbitMQ.Client; using RabbitMQ.Client.Events; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: TLS Versions Output Format DESCRIPTION: Example output showing supported TLS versions. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/troubleshooting-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` tlsv1.2 tlsv1.1 tlsv1 sslv3 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Emitting an Error Log Message in Swift RabbitMQ Client DESCRIPTION: Example of calling the emitLogDirect function to send an error log message. This demonstrates how to specify the severity when publishing a message. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-swift.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: swift CODE: ``` self.emitLogDirect("Hi there!", severity: "error") ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Connection with Client-Provided Name in RabbitMQ .NET Client DESCRIPTION: Sets up a connection to RabbitMQ with a client-provided connection name, which helps identify the application in server logs and management UI. The factory is configured with credentials, virtual host, hostname, and a descriptive client name. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/dotnet-api-guide.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` ConnectionFactory factory = new ConnectionFactory(); // "guest"/"guest" by default, limited to localhost connections factory.UserName = user; factory.Password = pass; factory.VirtualHost = vhost; factory.HostName = hostName; // this name will be shared by all connections instantiated by // this factory factory.ClientProvidedName = "app:audit component:event-consumer"; IConnection conn = await factory.CreateConnectionAsync(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Detecting Classic Queue Mirroring Policies in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Commands to check for and list policies that enable classic queue mirroring in the cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ha/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics check_if_cluster_has_classic_queue_mirroring_policy rabbitmq-diagnostics list_policies_with_classic_queue_mirroring -s --formatter=pretty_table ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Queue Overflow Policy Using rabbitmqctl DESCRIPTION: Configures a policy to limit queue to 2 messages and reject new publishes when full using rabbitmqctl. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/maxlength/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy my-pol "^two-messages$" \ '{"max-length":2,"overflow":"reject-publish"}' \ --apply-to queues ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting UAA for OAuth 2.0 Authentication with RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This command starts the UAA (User Account and Authentication) server for OAuth 2.0 authentication with RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make start-uaa ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Decoding Encrypted Values with rabbitmqctl on Windows DESCRIPTION: Examples of decoding encrypted values using rabbitmqctl on Windows PowerShell with the same passphrase used for encryption. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_55 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl decode "{encrypted, <<\"...\">>}" mypassphrase # => <<"guest">> rabbitmqctl decode "{encrypted, <<\"...\">>}" mypassphrase # => "amqp://fred:secret@host1.domain/my_vhost" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding RabbitMQ Repository Signing Keys DESCRIPTION: These bash commands add the RabbitMQ signing key and Launchpad PPA signing key to the system, enabling apt to trust packages signed by these keys. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # primary RabbitMQ signing key curl -1sLf "https://github.com/rabbitmq/signing-keys/releases/download/3.0/rabbitmq-release-signing-key.asc" | sudo gpg --dearmor | sudo tee /usr/share/keyrings/com.github.rabbitmq.signing.gpg > /dev/null # Launchpad PPA signing key for apt curl -1sLf "https://keyserver.ubuntu.com/pks/lookup?op=get&search=0xf77f1eda57ebb1cc" | sudo gpg --dearmor | sudo tee /usr/share/keyrings/net.launchpad.ppa.rabbitmq.erlang.gpg > /dev/null ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding RabbitMQ Signing Keys DESCRIPTION: These commands add the RabbitMQ signing key and Launchpad PPA signing key to the system, enabling apt to trust packages signed by these keys. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_36 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # primary RabbitMQ signing key curl -1sLf "https://github.com/rabbitmq/signing-keys/releases/download/3.0/rabbitmq-release-signing-key.asc" | sudo gpg --dearmor | sudo tee /usr/share/keyrings/com.github.rabbitmq.signing.gpg > /dev/null # Launchpad PPA signing key for apt curl -1sLf "https://keyserver.ubuntu.com/pks/lookup?op=get&search=0xf77f1eda57ebb1cc" | sudo gpg --dearmor | sudo tee /usr/share/keyrings/net.launchpad.ppa.rabbitmq.erlang.gpg > /dev/null ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Operator Policy in RabbitMQ API DESCRIPTION: JSON payload for declaring or updating an operator policy. The structure is the same as for regular policies, including pattern, definition, priority, and apply-to fields. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_24 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` {"pattern":"^amq.", "definition": {"federation-upstream-set":"all"}, "priority": 10, "apply-to": "queues"} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitmqCluster for Openshift's Arbitrary User IDs DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration to override the default SecurityContext in a RabbitmqCluster deployment. This configuration resets the securityContext to default values, ensuring that RabbitMQ Pods use Openshift's arbitrary user ID assignment instead of the fixed non-root UIDs normally used by the operator. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-on-openshift.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiVersion: rabbitmq.com/v1beta1 kind: RabbitmqCluster metadata: ... spec: ... override: statefulSet: spec: template: spec: containers: [] securityContext: {} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running PerfTest Producer with OAuth Token DESCRIPTION: Command to run RabbitMQ PerfTest tool with OAuth 2.0 authentication. Obtains a token first and passes it as a parameter to the producer. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples-keycloak.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make start-perftest-producer-with-token PRODUCER=producer TOKEN=$(bin/keycloak/token producer kbOFBXI9tANgKUq8vXHLhT6YhbivgXxn test) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Check Cipher Suites (Windows) DESCRIPTION: Command to list available cipher suites in OpenSSL format on Windows systems. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/troubleshooting-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics.bat cipher_suites --format openssl --silent ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example TOML Configuration File for RabbitMQ Admin v2 DESCRIPTION: Another example of a TOML-formatted configuration file for rabbitmqadmin v2, showing connection settings for different environments with credentials. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: toml CODE: ``` [local] hostname = "localhost" port = 15672 username = "lolz" password = "lolz" vhost = '/' [staging] hostname = "192.168.20.31" port = 15672 username = "staging-2387a72329" password = "staging-1d20cfbd9d" [production] hostname = "(redacted)" port = 15671 username = "user-efe1f4d763f6" password = "(redacted)" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Empty Scope Prefix in RabbitMQ OAuth 2.0 DESCRIPTION: Configuration example showing how to set an empty string as the scope prefix for OAuth 2.0 authentication, removing any prefix from the scopes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` ... auth_oauth2.scope_prefix = '' ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ Shovel from AMQP 0.9.1 to AMQP 1.0 DESCRIPTION: Detailed configuration for transferring messages from an AMQP 0.9.1 source to an AMQP 1.0 destination. Includes source exchange and queue declarations, destination properties, and SASL authentication options. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/shovel-static.md#2025-04-09_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {rabbitmq_shovel, [{shovels, [{my_first_shovel, {source, [{protocol, amqp091}, {uris, ["amqp://fred:secret@host1.domain/my_vhost", "amqp://john:secret@host2.domain/my_vhost"]}, {declarations, [{'exchange.declare', [{exchange, <<"my_fanout">>}, {type, <<"fanout">>}, durable]}, {'queue.declare', [{arguments, [{<<"x-message-ttl">>, long, 60000}]}]}, {'queue.bind', [{exchange, <<"my_fanout">>}, {queue, <<>>} ]} ]}, {queue, <<>>}, {prefetch_count, 10} ]}, {destination, [{protocol, amqp10}, {uris, ["amqp://host:5672"]}, {properties, [{user_id, <<"my-user">>}]}, {application_properties, [{<<"my-prop">>, <<"my-prop-value">>}]}, {add_forward_headers, true}, {target_address, <<"destination-queue">>} ]}, {ack_mode, on_confirm}, {reconnect_delay, 5} }]} ]} } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking RabbitMQ Status DESCRIPTION: This command uses the rabbitmq-diagnostics tool to check the status of the RabbitMQ server, including available file descriptors. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-generic-unix.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics status ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting a Global Runtime Parameter in RabbitMQ (JSON) DESCRIPTION: JSON payload for the PUT /api/global-parameters/{name} endpoint to set a global runtime parameter. This example sets the cluster name. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "name": "cluster_name", "value": "prod-456" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting RabbitMQ with OAuth2 Proxy Integration DESCRIPTION: Command to start RabbitMQ configured to work with OAuth2 Proxy. The MODE environment variable is set to 'oauth2-proxy' to enable the appropriate configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples-proxy.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` MODE=oauth2-proxy make start-rabbitmq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling RabbitMQ Plugins via Command Line DESCRIPTION: Commands for listing and enabling RabbitMQ plugins. After copying plugin files to the appropriate plugins directory, these commands can be used to activate them. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/installing-plugins.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins list ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins enable ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Establishing MQTT Connection DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code showing how to establish an MQTT connection with configurable options including SSL support SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/web-mqtt.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` var options = { timeout: 3, keepAliveInterval: 30, onSuccess: function () { debug("CONNECTION SUCCESS"); client.subscribe('/topic/test', {qos: 1}); }, onFailure: function (message) { debug("CONNECTION FAILURE - " + message.errorMessage); } }; if (location.protocol == "https:") { options.useSSL = true; } debug("CONNECT TO " + wsbroker + ":" + wsport); client.connect(options); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Publishing Messages with Properties in RabbitMQ .NET Client DESCRIPTION: Shows how to publish a message with specific properties such as content type and delivery mode. The mandatory flag is set to true, and the message is marked as persistent (delivery mode 2). SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/dotnet-api-guide.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` byte[] messageBodyBytes = System.Text.Encoding.UTF8.GetBytes("Hello, world!"); var props = new BasicProperties(); props.ContentType = "text/plain"; props.DeliveryMode = 2; await channel.BasicPublishAsync(exchangeName, routingKey, mandatory: true, basicProperties: props, body: messageBodyBytes); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting User Limits with curl in RabbitMQ API DESCRIPTION: Shell command example that uses curl to set a per-user connection limit. The command sends a PUT request to the user-limits endpoint with a JSON payload. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` curl -4u 'guest:guest' -H 'content-type:application/json' -X PUT localhost:15672/api/user-limits/guest/max-connections -d '{"value": 100}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ and Erlang Repositories for RHEL 9 DESCRIPTION: Repository configuration file for setting up RabbitMQ and Erlang package repositories on RHEL 9 and derivative distributions. Includes GPG keys, mirror URLs, and security settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/install-rpm.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` baseurl=https://yum1.rabbitmq.com/erlang/el/9/noarch https://yum2.rabbitmq.com/erlang/el/9/noarch repo_gpgcheck=1 enabled=1 gpgkey=https://github.com/rabbitmq/signing-keys/releases/download/3.0/cloudsmith.rabbitmq-erlang.E495BB49CC4BBE5B.key https://github.com/rabbitmq/signing-keys/releases/download/3.0/rabbitmq-release-signing-key.asc gpgcheck=1 sslverify=1 sslcacert=/etc/pki/tls/certs/ca-bundle.crt metadata_expire=300 pkg_gpgcheck=1 autorefresh=1 type=rpm-md ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Error Monad Implementation DESCRIPTION: Implementation of the Error monad in Erlang, which follows Erlang's convention of representing errors as {error, Reason} tuples and short-circuits execution when an error is encountered. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2011-05-17-can-you-hear-the-drums-erlando/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` -module(error_m). -behaviour(monad). -export(['>>='/2, return/1, fail/1]). '>>='({error, _Err} = Error, _Fun) -> Error; '>>='(Result, Fun) -> Fun(Result). return(X) -> {ok, X}. fail(X) -> {error, X}. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring LDAP as Auth Backend in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configure RabbitMQ to use LDAP exclusively for authentication and authorization. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # use LDAP exclusively for authentication and authorisation auth_backends.1 = ldap ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting a Virtual Host DESCRIPTION: Shows how to delete a virtual host, with an option for idempotent deletion. The idempotent flag prevents errors when deleting resources that don't exist. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin delete vhost --name "vh-789" ``` LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin delete vhost --name "vh-789" --idempotently ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Queue Memory Information via RabbitMQ HTTP API with JSON Response DESCRIPTION: Command to query the RabbitMQ HTTP API for memory usage details of a specific queue. The response includes 'memory' (used by queue process for metadata) and 'message_bytes_ram' (used by message payloads) metrics. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/memory-use/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -s -u guest:guest http://127.0.0.1:15672/api/queues/%2f/queue-name | python -m json.tool ``` LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { .. "memory": 97921904, ... "message_bytes_ram": 2153429941, ... } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring a Policy in RabbitMQ (JSON) DESCRIPTION: JSON payload for the PUT /api/policies/{vhost}/{name} endpoint to declare or update a policy. This example sets a federation upstream for queues with names starting with 'amq.'. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` {"pattern":"^amq.", "definition": {"federation-upstream-set":"all"}, "priority": 10, "apply-to": "queues"} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating ServiceAccount with imagePullSecrets DESCRIPTION: Command to patch the RabbitMQ Cluster Operator ServiceAccount with the image pull secret, allowing it to access images from the private registry. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/install-operator.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl -n rabbitmq-system patch serviceaccount \ rabbitmq-cluster-operator -p '{"imagePullSecrets": [{"name": "rabbitmq-cluster-registry-access"}]}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Additional RabbitMQ Settings in YAML DESCRIPTION: Specifies additional RabbitMQ configuration options. The example sets the channel_max parameter to 1050. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-operator/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiVersion: rabbitmq.com/v1beta1 kind: RabbitmqCluster metadata: name: rabbitmqcluster-sample spec: rabbitmq: additionalConfig: | channel_max = 1050 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring Queue Resource Targeting RabbitmqCluster in YAML DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet declares a Queue resource in the 'my-app' namespace, targeting the previously defined RabbitmqCluster in the 'rabbitmq-service' namespace. It specifies the queue name and references the cluster.
