SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-topology-operator.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiVersion: rabbitmq.com/v1beta1 kind: Queue metadata: name: test # name of this custom resource; does not have to the same as the actual queue name namespace: my-app spec: name: test-queue # name of the queue rabbitmqClusterReference: name: example-rabbit namespace: rabbitmq-service ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving RabbitMQ Cluster Operator Logs in Kubernetes DESCRIPTION: Command to view the logs of the RabbitMQ Cluster Operator, useful for troubleshooting when the ReconcileSuccess status condition is false. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/troubleshooting-operator.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl -n rabbitmq-system logs -l app.kubernetes.io/name=rabbitmq-cluster-operator ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling a Specific Feature Flag in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command for enabling a specific feature flag by name in RabbitMQ using rabbitmqctl. This is used after upgrading a node or cluster to enable individual new features. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/feature-flags/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl enable_feature_flag ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ and Erlang Apt Repositories for Debian Bullseye DESCRIPTION: This snippet creates the apt source list file containing RabbitMQ server repositories for Debian Bullseye. It includes both primary and redundant mirror URLs with appropriate GPG key configurations. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` deb [arch=amd64 signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/rabbitmq.9F4587F226208342.gpg] https://ppa1.rabbitmq.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/deb/debian bullseye main deb-src [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/rabbitmq.9F4587F226208342.gpg] https://ppa1.rabbitmq.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/deb/debian bullseye main # another mirror for redundancy deb [arch=amd64 signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/rabbitmq.9F4587F226208342.gpg] https://ppa2.rabbitmq.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/deb/debian bullseye main deb-src [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/rabbitmq.9F4587F226208342.gpg] https://ppa2.rabbitmq.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/deb/debian bullseye main EOF ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Closing All Global Connections in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to close all connections across the entire RabbitMQ node SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_71 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl close_all_connections --global ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: AWS Autoscaling Group Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration for using AWS autoscaling group membership for peer discovery SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = aws cluster_formation.aws.region = us-east-1 cluster_formation.aws.access_key_id = ANIDEXAMPLE cluster_formation.aws.secret_key = WjalrxuTnFEMI/K7MDENG+bPxRfiCYEXAMPLEKEY cluster_formation.aws.use_autoscaling_group = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Cluster Formation in RabbitMQ 3.7 (INI-like Format) DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to configure cluster formation using the new format. It specifies the peer discovery backend and lists the nodes for classic config-based clustering. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2018-02-22-new-configuration-format-in-rabbitmq-3-7/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = rabbit_peer_discovery_classic_config cluster_formation.classic_config.nodes.1 = rabbit1@hostname cluster_formation.classic_config.nodes.2 = rabbit2@hostname cluster_formation.classic_config.nodes.3 = rabbit3@hostname cluster_formation.classic_config.nodes.4 = rabbit4@hostname ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Proxy Protocol for AMQP Connections in INI DESCRIPTION: INI configuration to enable Proxy protocol support for AMQP 0-9-1 and AMQP 1.0 clients. When enabled, this allows RabbitMQ to see the actual client IP addresses when connections go through proxies or load balancers. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` proxy_protocol = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ with Additional Scopes Key DESCRIPTION: This configuration sets up RabbitMQ to look for custom scopes in a field named 'roles' instead of the standard 'scope' field. It also sets the resource server ID to 'rabbitmq'. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # ... auth_oauth2.resource_server_id = rabbitmq auth_oauth2.additional_scopes_key = roles # ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Cookie Value in RabbitMQ Environment DESCRIPTION: Example of setting the Erlang cookie value using RABBITMQ_SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS environment variable. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` RABBITMQ_SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS="-setcookie cookie-value" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Removing Certificate from Mono Trust Certificate Store DESCRIPTION: Bash command to remove a specific certificate from the Mono Trust certificate store on Linux using its unique hash identifier. This is useful for removing expired or unwanted certificates from the trust store. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Linux with Mono certmgr -del -c Trust 1F04D1D2C20B97BDD5DB70B9EB2013550697A05E # … snip … Certificate removed from store. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Removing Connection Limits in RabbitMQ Virtual Host DESCRIPTION: Command to lift the connection limit on a specific virtual host by setting max-connections to a negative value. Uses rabbitmqctl with a JSON configuration parameter. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_vhost_limits -p vhost_name '{"max-connections": -1}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Node Cleanup Interval in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to set the interval for node cleanup checks in RabbitMQ. The default is 60 seconds, but it can be adjusted as needed. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_49 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.node_cleanup.interval = 90 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Basic Authentication alongside OAuth in Management UI DESCRIPTION: Configuration to allow both OAuth 2.0 and Basic Authentication methods in the RabbitMQ management UI. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` ... management.oauth_disable_basic_auth = false ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using --help option with RabbitMQ CLI tools in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates an alternative way to get help for RabbitMQ CLI tools using the --help flag in Windows PowerShell. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat --help rabbitmq-diagnostics.bat --help ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing RabbitMQ Packages with DNF DESCRIPTION: Commands for installing RabbitMQ and its dependencies using the DNF package manager. Updates package metadata and installs required packages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-rpm.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` dnf update -y ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` dnf install -y logrotate ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` dnf install -y erlang rabbitmq-server ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring OAuth Providers in RabbitMQ for Separate Keycloak Instances DESCRIPTION: This configuration snippet shows how to set up RabbitMQ with two separate Keycloak instances (dev and prod) as OAuth providers. Each provider has its own hostname and port. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples-multiresource.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.devkeycloak.issuer = https://devkeycloak:8443/realms/dev auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.devkeycloak.https.cacertfile = /etc/rabbitmq/keycloak-ca_certificate.pem auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.devkeycloak.https.verify = verify_peer auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.devkeycloak.https.hostname_verification = wildcard auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.prodkeycloak.issuer = https://prodkeycloak:8442/realms/prod auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.prodkeycloak.https.cacertfile = /etc/rabbitmq/keycloak-ca_certificate.pem auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.prodkeycloak.https.verify = verify_peer auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.prodkeycloak.https.hostname_verification = wildcard ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Handling Incompatible Options in Ruby AMQP 0.7 DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates the new behavior of failing when an entity is re-declared with different options. It provides a more descriptive error message to help users identify and resolve conflicts in queue declarations. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2011-01-19-ruby-amqp-0-7-released/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: Ruby CODE: ``` channel = MQ.new channel.queue(:tasks, auto_delete: true) channel.queue(:tasks, auto_delete: false) # Exception: There is already an instance called tasks with options {:queue => :tasks, :nowait => true, :auto_delete => true}, you can't define the same instance with different options ({:queue => :tasks, :nowait => true, :auto_delete => false})! (MQ::IncompatibleOptionsError) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ with Additional Scopes Key DESCRIPTION: This configuration sets up RabbitMQ to look for custom scopes in a field named 'roles' instead of the standard 'scope' field. It also sets the resource server ID to 'rabbitmq'. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # ... auth_oauth2.resource_server_id = rabbitmq auth_oauth2.additional_scopes_key = roles # ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Structuring RabbitMQ Version Compatibility Table in HTML DESCRIPTION: This HTML snippet creates a table structure to display RabbitMQ version compatibility information. It includes columns for RabbitMQ versions, minimum required Erlang/OTP version, maximum supported Erlang/OTP version, and additional notes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/which-erlang.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: HTML CODE: ```
  • 3.7.27
  • 3.7.26
  • 3.7.25
  • 3.7.24
  • 3.7.23
  • 3.7.22
  • 3.7.21
  • 3.7.20
  • 3.7.19
  • 21.3
  • 22.x
  • RabbitMQ 3.7 was released on 2017-11-28, and reached end of life on 2020-09-30, we strongly discourage its use
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a ytt Overlay for Automatic Environment Variable Configuration DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for a ytt overlay that can be used to automatically add environment variables to the RabbitMQ Cluster Operator during upgrades. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/configure-operator-defaults.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` #@ load("@ytt:overlay", "overlay") #@ deployment = overlay.subset({"kind": "Deployment"}) #@ cluster_operator = overlay.subset({"metadata": {"name": "rabbitmq-cluster-operator"}}) #@overlay/match by=overlay.and_op(deployment, cluster_operator),expects="1+" --- spec: template: spec: containers: #@overlay/match by=overlay.subset({"name": "operator"}),expects="1+" - #@overlay/match missing_ok=True env: - name: OPERATOR_SCOPE_NAMESPACE value: custom-namespace ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Patching RabbitMQ Stream Queue to Use 'first' Offset by Default DESCRIPTION: Git diff showing a modification to the RabbitMQ stream queue implementation to use 'first' as the default offset spec instead of 'next'. This patch enables the receiver to start consuming from the beginning of the stream by default. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2024-08-21-amqp-benchmarks/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: diff CODE: ``` diff --git a/deps/rabbit/src/rabbit_stream_queue.erl b/deps/rabbit/src/rabbit_stream_queue.erl index e36ad708eb..acd193d76f 100644 --- a/deps/rabbit/src/rabbit_stream_queue.erl +++ b/deps/rabbit/src/rabbit_stream_queue.erl @@ -344,7 +344,7 @@ consume(Q, Spec, #stream_client{} = QState0) {term(), non_neg_integer()}) -> {ok, osiris:offset_spec()} | {error, term()}. parse_offset_arg(undefined) -> - {ok, next}; + {ok, first}; parse_offset_arg({_, <<"first">>}) -> {ok, first}; parse_offset_arg({_, <<"last">>}) -> ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ Management UI with OAuth 2.0 Identity Provider Initiated Login DESCRIPTION: Configuration settings in rabbitmq.conf to enable OAuth 2.0 authentication for the Management UI with identity provider initiated login flow. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.oauth_enabled = true management.oauth_initiated_logon_type = idp_initiated management.oauth_provider_url = http://localhost:8080 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sample OAuth Access Token DESCRIPTION: Example of an OAuth access token generated for the prod_producer client. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples-multiresource.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "exp": 1690974839, "iat": 1690974539, "jti": "c8edec50-5f29-4bd0-b25b-d7a46dc3474e", "iss": "http://localhost:8081/realms/test", "aud": "rabbit_prod", "sub": "826065e7-bb58-4b65-bbf7-8982d6cca6c8", "typ": "Bearer", "azp": "prod_producer", "acr": "1", "realm_access": { "roles": [ "default-roles-test", "offline_access", "producer", "uma_authorization" ] }, "resource_access": { "account": { "roles": [ "manage-account", "manage-account-links", "view-profile" ] } }, "scope": "profile email rabbitmq.read:*/* rabbitmq.write:*/* rabbitmq.configure:*/*", "clientId": "prod_producer", "clientHost": "172.18.0.1", "email_verified": false, "preferred_username": "service-account-prod_producer", "clientAddress": "172.18.0.1" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting Producer with Custom JWT Token DESCRIPTION: Command to start a producer application using a custom-generated JWT token with roles defined in the extra_scope field. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_28 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make start-perftest-producer-with-token PRODUCER=producer_with_roles TOKEN=$(bin/jwt_token producer-role-in-extra-scope.json legacy-token-key private.pem public.pem) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Positive Message Acknowledgement in Java DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to positively acknowledge a single message delivery using RabbitMQ Java client. Uses Channel#basicAck method with autoAck disabled and handles individual message acknowledgement. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/confirms.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` boolean autoAck = false; channel.basicConsume(queueName, autoAck, "a-consumer-tag", new DefaultConsumer(channel) { @Override public void handleDelivery(String consumerTag, Envelope envelope, AMQP.BasicProperties properties, byte[] body) throws IOException { long deliveryTag = envelope.getDeliveryTag(); // positively acknowledge a single delivery, the message will // be discarded channel.basicAck(deliveryTag, false); } }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Behaviours in Elixir for RabbitMQ Plugins DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to implement Erlang behaviours in Elixir using the @behaviour attribute, which is necessary for implementing the rabbit_exchange_type behaviour in RabbitMQ plugins. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2013-06-03-using-elixir-to-write-rabbitmq-plugins/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: elixir CODE: ``` @behaviour :rabbit_exchange_type ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Positive Message Acknowledgement in Java DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to positively acknowledge a single message delivery using RabbitMQ Java client. Uses Channel#basicAck method with autoAck disabled and handles individual message acknowledgement. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/confirms.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` boolean autoAck = false; channel.basicConsume(queueName, autoAck, "a-consumer-tag", new DefaultConsumer(channel) { @Override public void handleDelivery(String consumerTag, Envelope envelope, AMQP.BasicProperties properties, byte[] body) throws IOException { long deliveryTag = envelope.getDeliveryTag(); // positively acknowledge a single delivery, the message will // be discarded channel.basicAck(deliveryTag, false); } }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Dead Letter Worker Consumer Prefetch DESCRIPTION: Advanced configuration setting for adjusting the prefetch size of the dead letter worker consumer when high dead-lettering throughput is required. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/quorum-queues/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: configuration CODE: ``` dead_letter_worker_consumer_prefetch=32 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Connecting to STOMP Broker DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code to establish a STOMP connection with the broker using credentials. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/web-stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` var on_connect = function() { console.log('connected'); }; var on_error = function() { console.log('error'); }; client.connect('guest', 'guest', on_connect, on_error, '/'); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example OAuth 2.0 Token with Variable Expansion (JSON) DESCRIPTION: Sample JSON representation of an OAuth 2.0 token that demonstrates variable expansion for topic permissions. This token grants write permissions on exchanges and routing keys based on the vhost and subject claims. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "sub" : "bob", "scope" : [ "rabbitmq.write:*/x-{vhost}-*/u-{sub}-*" ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Emitting Error Log Message DESCRIPTION: Example of emitting an error log message using the direct exchange SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-ruby.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ruby emit_log_direct.rb error "Run. Run. Or it will explode." # => [x] Sent 'error':'Run. Run. Or it will explode.' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Message Targets in Python DESCRIPTION: Example of creating a publisher without a target in Python, then defining a target for a message using the AddressHelper utility class. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/amqp-client-libraries.md#2025-04-09_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: Python CODE: ``` # no target defined on publisher creation publisher = connection.publisher() # publish to an exchange with a routing key # You can use the AddressHelper.message_to_address_helper # utility class to set the destination in the message message = Message(body="Hello!") exchange_address = AddressHelper.exchange_address("foo", "bar") message = AddressHelper.message_to_address_helper(message, exchange_address) publisher.publish(message) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Alternative Syntax for Listing Feature Flags in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Alternative command syntax for listing feature flags in a RabbitMQ cluster. This command is functionally equivalent to 'feature_flags list'. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` # same command as above rabbitmqadmin list feature_flags ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Status Check Command - Bash DESCRIPTION: Verifies if RabbitMQ application is fully booted and running SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics is_running ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting Producer with Custom JWT Token DESCRIPTION: Command to start a producer application using a custom-generated JWT token with roles defined in the extra_scope field. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_28 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make start-perftest-producer-with-token PRODUCER=producer_with_roles TOKEN=$(bin/jwt_token producer-role-in-extra-scope.json legacy-token-key private.pem public.pem) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring HTTP Proxy for RabbitMQ Peer Discovery DESCRIPTION: Configuration for setting HTTP and HTTPS proxy servers for peer discovery mechanisms in RabbitMQ that use HTTP to interact with dependencies like AWS, Consul, and etcd. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_50 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # example HTTP and HTTPS proxy servers, values in your environment # will vary cluster_formation.proxy.http_proxy = 192.168.0.98 cluster_formation.proxy.https_proxy = 192.168.0.98 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ Repository Sources for Debian Bullseye DESCRIPTION: Apt repository source configuration for installing RabbitMQ packages. Configures two mirror repositories with their signing keys for redundancy. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` deb [arch=amd64 signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/rabbitmq.9F4587F226208342.gpg] https://ppa1.rabbitmq.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/deb/debian bullseye main deb-src [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/rabbitmq.9F4587F226208342.gpg] https://ppa1.rabbitmq.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/deb/debian bullseye main # another mirror for redundancy deb [arch=amd64 signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/rabbitmq.9F4587F226208342.gpg] https://ppa2.rabbitmq.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/deb/debian bullseye main deb-src [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/rabbitmq.9F4587F226208342.gpg] https://ppa2.rabbitmq.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/deb/debian bullseye main ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Federation Policy in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to create a policy that controls exchange federation. The policy matches exchanges with names starting with 'federated.' and applies federation to all configured upstreams. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/federated-exchanges/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy exchange-federation \ "^federated\." \ '{"federation-upstream-set":"all"}' \ --priority 10 \ --apply-to exchanges ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying RabbitMQ Stateful Set on Kubernetes DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the command to deploy a RabbitMQ Stateful Set on Kubernetes. It applies the configuration defined in the 'statefulset.yaml' file to create the RabbitMQ cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2020-08-10-deploying-rabbitmq-to-kubernetes-whats-involved/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl apply -f statefulset.yaml ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Check Cipher Suites (Unix) DESCRIPTION: Command to list available cipher suites in OpenSSL format on Unix-like systems. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/troubleshooting-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics cipher_suites --format openssl --silent ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Multiple Bindings for Different Severities in RabbitMQ with Java DESCRIPTION: This code creates multiple bindings for a queue, each with a different severity level as the routing key. This allows the consumer to receive messages of specific severities. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-java.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` String queueName = channel.queueDeclare().getQueue(); for(String severity : argv){ channel.queueBind(queueName, EXCHANGE_NAME, severity); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Putting a Remote Node into Maintenance Mode in RabbitMQ (PowerShell) DESCRIPTION: PowerShell equivalent for putting a specific remote RabbitMQ node into maintenance mode. Allows administrators to prepare a targeted node for maintenance from any other node in the cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/upgrade.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` # puts node rabbit@node2.cluster.rabbitmq.svc into maintenance mode rabbitmq-upgrade.bat drain -n rabbit@node2.cluster.rabbitmq.svc ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Launching Keycloak for OAuth 2.0 Authentication DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Keycloak server for OAuth 2.0 authentication with RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples-multiresource.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make start-keycloak ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting Separate Keycloak Instances and RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: These commands start two separate Keycloak instances (dev and prod) and a RabbitMQ instance configured to use both as OAuth providers. It uses Make commands for simplified deployment. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples-multiresource.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make start-dev-keycloak make start-prod-keycloak MODE=multi-keycloak CONF=rabbitmq.scenario3.conf make start-rabbitmq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Queue Status in YAML Format DESCRIPTION: This command fetches the status of a RabbitMQ queue named 'my-queue' in YAML format, providing detailed information about its current state and configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/troubleshooting-topology-operator.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl get queues.rabbitmq.com my-queue -oyaml ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Publishing a Message with Validated User-ID in Java DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to set the user-id property when publishing a message using RabbitMQ in Java. The message will only be published successfully if the user is "guest". SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/validated-user-id.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` AMQP.BasicProperties properties = new AMQP.BasicProperties(); properties.setUserId("guest"); channel.basicPublish("amq.fanout", "", properties, "test".getBytes()); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Unfiltered Stream Metrics Output Example DESCRIPTION: This shows the example output of the metrics query when consuming the entire stream without filtering. The counter shows approximately 10MB of data read. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2023-10-16-stream-filtering/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: properties CODE: ``` # HELP rabbitmq_stream_read_bytes_total # TYPE rabbitmq_stream_read_bytes_total counter rabbitmq_stream_read_bytes_total 1.0046894E7 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Publishing a Message with Validated User-ID in Java DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to set the user-id property when publishing a message using RabbitMQ in Java. The message will only be published successfully if the user is "guest". SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/validated-user-id.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` AMQP.BasicProperties properties = new AMQP.BasicProperties(); properties.setUserId("guest"); channel.basicPublish("amq.fanout", "", properties, "test".getBytes()); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Plugins with rabbitmq-plugins Command DESCRIPTION: Shows how to disable a plugin using the rabbitmq-plugins CLI tool. The example demonstrates disabling the rabbitmq_top plugin. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/plugins.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins disable ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins disable rabbitmq_top ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Binding a Queue to an Exchange in Elixir DESCRIPTION: Basic code showing how to bind a queue to an exchange in RabbitMQ using Elixir. This creates a relationship indicating that the queue is interested in messages from the specified exchange. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-elixir.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: elixir CODE: ``` AMQP.Queue.bind(channel, queue_name, exchange_name) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Tutorial Components in Markdown DESCRIPTION: This snippet imports various components used in the tutorial, including help text and diagrams related to direct exchanges and multiple bindings in RabbitMQ routing. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-spring-amqp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` import TutorialsHelp from '@site/src/components/Tutorials/TutorialsHelp.md'; import T4DiagramDirectX from '@site/src/components/Tutorials/T4DiagramDirectX.md'; import T4DiagramMultipleBindings from '@site/src/components/Tutorials/T4DiagramMultipleBindings.md'; import T4DiagramFull from '@site/src/components/Tutorials/T4DiagramFull.md'; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Visualizing One Sender One Receiver Benchmark in ASCII Diagram (Partial) DESCRIPTION: ASCII diagram fragment showing the connection architecture for the one_sender_one_receiver benchmark program that demonstrates how AMQP 1.0 allows simultaneous consuming and publishing on a single connection without throttling consumption when publishing is under backpressure. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2024-09-02-amqp-flow-control/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` main.go RabbitMQ +-------------+ +----------------------------------+ | | AMQP 0.9.1 connection | | | |#####################################| | | +---+ |-------------------------------------| +------------------------+ | | | C | | classic-queue-amqp-091 | | | +---+ +------------------------+ | | AMQP 0.9.1 channel | | +---+ +------------------------+ | | | P | | quorum-queue-amqp-091 | | | +---+ |-------------------------------------| +------------------------+ | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Linking to RabbitMQ Command-line Tools Documentation DESCRIPTION: Markdown link to the RabbitMQ command-line tools documentation, specifically the rabbitmqctl man page. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2010-10-18-rabbitmq0mq-bridge/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` [command-line tools](/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using --help Option for RabbitMQ CLI Tools in Bash DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to use the --help option to get general help information for rabbitmqctl and rabbitmq-diagnostics in Bash. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl --help rabbitmq-diagnostics --help ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Erlang Cookie with RabbitMQ CLI Tool in Bash DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to specify the Erlang cookie value when using a RabbitMQ CLI tool like rabbitmq-diagnostics. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/clustering.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics status --erlang-cookie "cookie-value" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Opening an AMQP 1.0 Connection in Java DESCRIPTION: Establishes a connection to an AMQP 1.0 broker using the Environment instance in Java. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/amqp-client-libraries.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` // open a connection from the environment Connection connection = environment.connectionBuilder() .uri("amqp://admin:admin@localhost:5672/%2f") .build(); // ... // close the connection when it is no longer necessary connection.close(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running RabbitMQ Log Receiver to Display All Logs in Go DESCRIPTION: Command to run a Go program that receives logs with all severity levels (info, warning, error) from RabbitMQ and displays them on the terminal. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-go.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` go run receive_logs_direct.go info warning error # => [*] Waiting for logs. To exit press CTRL+C ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Publishing a Message in Erlang DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to publish a message to an exchange with a routing key using the #'basic.publish'{} method and #amqp_msg{} record. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/erlang-client-user-guide.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` Payload = <<"foobar">>, Publish = #'basic.publish'{exchange = X, routing_key = Key}, amqp_channel:cast(Channel, Publish, #amqp_msg{payload = Payload}) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring max-hops Parameter for Ring Topology in RabbitMQ Federation DESCRIPTION: Configuration parameter for a ring topology of federated exchanges where each exchange links to just one other in the ring. The value is set to the total number of exchanges minus one to ensure messages propagate exactly once to each exchange. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/federated-exchanges/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` "max-hops" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding RabbitMQ Repository for Debian Bullseye DESCRIPTION: This bash script adds the RabbitMQ and Erlang package repositories to the apt sources list for Debian Bullseye. It includes both primary and redundant mirror URLs for improved availability. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/rabbitmq.list < server_report.txt ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Keycloak Authorization Server DESCRIPTION: Bash command to deploy Keycloak on its own network for OAuth 2.0 authentication. Uses make to start Keycloak with the specified provider network. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples-forward-proxy.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` PROVIDER_NETWORK=keycloak_net make start-keycloak ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing RabbitMQ using Chocolatey on Windows DESCRIPTION: Command to install RabbitMQ using the Chocolatey package manager. This is the recommended installation method for many use cases as it handles dependencies automatically. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-windows.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` choco install rabbitmq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking RabbitMQ Service Status with systemd DESCRIPTION: This command checks the status of the RabbitMQ service using systemd. It provides information about the service state, process IDs, and recent log entries. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_30 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo systemctl status rabbitmq-server ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing For Query for Complex LDAP Authorization in Erlang DESCRIPTION: A for query that splits up authorization logic to handle different cases with different subqueries. The example allows members of the 'wheel' group to declare and delete exchanges while allowing all users to perform all other operations. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {for, [{Name, Value, SubQuery}, ...]} ``` LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {resource_access_query, {for, [{resource, exchange, {for, [{permission, configure, {in_group, "cn=wheel,dc=example,dc=com"} }, {permission, write, {constant, true}}, {permission, read, {constant, true}} ]}}, {resource, queue, {constant, true}}]}} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: YAML Structure for RabbitMQ Administrator Credentials Secret DESCRIPTION: YAML structure for a Kubernetes Secret that stores administrator username and password. These credentials will replace the default 'guest' user which has restricted access. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2020-08-10-deploying-rabbitmq-to-kubernetes-whats-involved/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` user: {username} pass: {password} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Stopping RabbitMQ Service for Storage Configuration on EC2 DESCRIPTION: Command to stop the RabbitMQ server before performing storage configuration tasks such as symlinking directories to EBS volumes. This is a necessary step when preparing dedicated storage for RabbitMQ data and log directories. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ec2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo service rabbitmq-server stop ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: AWS Basic Configuration DESCRIPTION: Basic AWS configuration for RabbitMQ cluster formation including region and credentials SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.aws.region = us-east-1 cluster_formation.aws.access_key_id = ANIDEXAMPLE cluster_formation.aws.secret_key = WjalrxuTnFEMI/K7MDENG+bPxRfiCYEXAMPLEKEY ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Visualizing RPC Pattern with Mermaid Flowchart in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: A Mermaid flowchart diagram demonstrating the Remote Procedure Call (RPC) pattern implementation in RabbitMQ. The diagram shows a client sending requests to a server through an RPC queue, and the server responding through a reply queue, with appropriate CSS classes applied to style each component. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/src/components/Tutorials/T6DiagramToC.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: mermaid CODE: ``` flowchart LR C((Client)) S((Server)) Q1[[RPC]] Q2[[Reply]] C -- request --> Q1 --> S --> Q2 -- reply --> C class C mermaid-producer class Q1 mermaid-queue class Q2 mermaid-queue class S mermaid-consumer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Reviving a Remote Node from Maintenance Mode in RabbitMQ (PowerShell) DESCRIPTION: PowerShell equivalent for reviving a specific remote RabbitMQ node from maintenance mode. Used to return a node to normal operation if maintenance was canceled before node restart. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/upgrade.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` # revives node rabbit@node2.cluster.rabbitmq.svc from maintenance rabbitmq-upgrade.bat revive -n rabbit@node2.cluster.rabbitmq.svc ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TLS-Enabled RabbitMQ Connection without Peer Verification DESCRIPTION: Example URI for a secure AMQPS connection with TLS peer verification disabled. Specifies paths to CA certificate, client certificate, and client key files with verify_none setting, which disables certificate chain validation. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/uri-query-parameters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` amqps://myhost?cacertfile=/path/to/ca_certificate.pem &certfile=/path/to/client_certificate.pem &keyfile=/path/to/client_key.pem &verify=verify_none &server_name_indication=myhost ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating RabbitMQ Cluster DESCRIPTION: Commands to set up the kubectl-rabbitmq plugin and create a RabbitMQ cluster with three replicas. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2021-05-03-alerting/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Add kubectl-rabbitmq plugin to PATH so that it can be used directly export PATH="$PWD/cluster-operator/bin:$PATH" # Use kubectl-rabbitmq plugin to create RabbitmqClusters via kubectl kubectl rabbitmq create myrabbit --replicas 3 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TCP Listener and Heartbeat in RabbitMQ 3.7 (INI-like Format) DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to configure both the heartbeat and a TCP listener using the new format. It sets the heartbeat to 30 seconds and configures a TCP listener on port 5672 for all interfaces. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2018-02-22-new-configuration-format-in-rabbitmq-3-7/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` heartbeat = 30 listeners.tcp.default = 5672 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Quorum Queue WAL Size in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration setting to control the write-ahead log segment size limit for quorum queues. This determines how much message data can be kept in memory under steady load before being moved to disk. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/persistence-conf.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # Flush current WAL file to a segment file on disk once it reaches 32 MiB in size raft.wal_max_size_bytes = 32000000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Callback for MQ::Queue#bind in Ruby AMQP 0.7 DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use the new callback feature for MQ::Queue#bind. It allows you to execute code after a queue has been successfully bound to an exchange. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2011-01-19-ruby-amqp-0-7-released/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Ruby CODE: ``` channel = MQ.new fanout = channel.fanout(:task_fanout) channel.queue(:tasks).bind(fanout) do |queue| puts "Queue #{queue.name} was bound!" end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Virtual Host Metadata via HTTP API in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This JSON payload is used to create or update a virtual host's metadata using the PUT /api/vhosts/{name} endpoint. It includes description, tags, default queue type, and deletion protection settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "description": "virtual host description", "tags": "accounts,production", "default_queue_type": "quorum", "protected_from_deletion": false } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting JMS Publisher with OAuth 2.0 Authentication DESCRIPTION: This command starts a JMS publisher application that uses OAuth 2.0 for authentication with RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make start-jms-publisher ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing a Log Message Publisher in Objective-C DESCRIPTION: Complete implementation of a publisher that emits log messages to a fanout exchange. It establishes a connection, creates a channel, declares the exchange, and publishes a message. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-objectivec.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: objectivec CODE: ``` RMQConnection *conn = [[RMQConnection alloc] initWithDelegate:[RMQConnectionDelegateLogger new]]; [conn start]; id ch = [conn createChannel]; RMQExchange *x = [ch fanout:@"logs"]; NSString *msg = @"Hello World!"; [x publish:[msg dataUsingEncoding:NSUTF8StringEncoding]]; NSLog(@"Sent %@", msg); [conn close]; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Queue Binding with Routing Key DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates binding a queue to an exchange with a specific routing key SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-ruby.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` queue.bind(exchange_name, routing_key: 'black') ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Resetting RabbitMQ Statistics Database via Command Line DESCRIPTION: Commands for resetting the statistics database on a single node or across all nodes using rabbitmqctl. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_42 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl eval 'rabbit_mgmt_storage:reset().' rabbitmqctl eval 'rabbit_mgmt_storage:reset_all().' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Consul Service Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configures basic Consul service settings including node name and service address computation. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # compute service address using host name and not node name cluster_formation.consul.svc_addr_use_nodename = false # use long RabbitMQ node names? cluster_formation.consul.use_longname = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Hello World Example in Erlang DESCRIPTION: A simple Hello World program implementation in Erlang showing the traditional syntax with module declaration, compilation directive, and a function that prints to standard output. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2013-06-03-using-elixir-to-write-rabbitmq-plugins/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` -module(module_name). -compile(export_all). hello() -> io:format("~s~n", ["Hello world!"]). ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting an Exchange in C# DESCRIPTION: Shows how to delete an exchange using the C# client library's management API. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/amqp-client-libraries.md#2025-04-09_snippet_53 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` await management.Exchange("my-exchange").DeleteAsync(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Removing a Reachable RabbitMQ Node from Cluster DESCRIPTION: Steps to remove a reachable node from a RabbitMQ cluster, including stopping the app and using forget_cluster_node command. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/clustering.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # on rabbit3 rabbitmqctl stop_app # => Stopping node rabbit@rabbit3 ...done. # on rabbit2 rabbitmqctl forget_cluster_node rabbit@rabbit3 # => Removing node rabbit@rabbit3 from cluster ... # on rabbit1 rabbitmqctl cluster_status # => Cluster status of node rabbit@rabbit1 ... # => [{nodes,[{disc,[rabbit@rabbit1,rabbit@rabbit2]}]}, # => {running_nodes,[rabbit@rabbit2,rabbit@rabbit1]}] # => ...done. # on rabbit2 rabbitmqctl cluster_status # => Cluster status of node rabbit@rabbit2 ... # => [{nodes,[{disc,[rabbit@rabbit1,rabbit@rabbit2]}]}, # => {running_nodes,[rabbit@rabbit1,rabbit@rabbit2]}] # => ...done. # on rabbit3 rabbitmqctl reset rabbitmqctl start_app # => Starting node rabbit@rabbit3 ... rabbitmqctl cluster_status # => Cluster status of node rabbit@rabbit3 ... # => [{nodes,[{disc,[rabbit@rabbit3]}]},{running_nodes,[rabbit@rabbit3]}] # => ...done. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Connecting to RabbitMQ Server in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: Establishes a connection to a local RabbitMQ server using the amqp.node client. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-javascript.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` amqp.connect('amqp://localhost', function(error0, connection) {}); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling apt HTTPS Transport DESCRIPTION: This command installs the apt-transport-https package, which is necessary for apt to download packages over HTTPS. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_37 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo apt-get install apt-transport-https ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Channel Limit in RabbitMQ .NET Client DESCRIPTION: Shows how to set the requested channel maximum to 32 using the RabbitMQ .NET client's ConnectionFactory. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/channels/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` var cf = new ConnectionFactory(); // Ask for up to 32 channels per connection. Will have an effect as long as the server is configured // to use a higher limit, otherwise the server's limit will be used. cf.RequestedChannelMax = 32; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Channel Details with RabbitMQ CLI DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use rabbitmqctl to list detailed information about individual channels, including consumer count and unacknowledged messages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/channels/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_channels -q # => pid user consumer_count messages_unacknowledged # => guest 0 0 # => guest 0 0 # => guest 0 0 # => guest 0 0 # => guest 0 0 # => guest 0 0 # => guest 0 0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TCP Options for STOMP Connections in INI DESCRIPTION: INI configuration that optimizes TCP settings for STOMP connections to maximize throughput. This increases TCP buffer sizes to 192 KiB and configures important TCP socket options. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` stomp.tcp_listen_options.backlog = 128 stomp.tcp_listen_options.nodelay = true stomp.tcp_listen_options.linger.on = true stomp.tcp_listen_options.linger.timeout = 0 stomp.tcp_listen_options.sndbuf = 196608 stomp.tcp_listen_options.recbuf = 196608 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running RabbitMQ Workers - Bash Commands DESCRIPTION: Shell commands demonstrating how to run the worker and task publisher scripts for testing the work queue system. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-php.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # shell 1 php worker.php ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # shell 2 php new_task.php "A very hard task which takes two seconds.." ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking quorum status of a queue in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Command to check the quorum status of a specific queue in RabbitMQ. It requires the queue name and optionally allows specifying the vhost. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_30 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` quorum_status queue [--vhost vhost] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Error Handling in Puka with Queue Declaration DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates Puka's error handling capabilities. It shows how to catch a PreconditionFailed exception when trying to redeclare a queue with different parameters, and then handle the error by adjusting the declaration parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2011-07-08-puka-rethinking-amqp-clients/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` try: promise = client.queue_declare(queue='test') client.wait(promise) except puka.PreconditionFailed: # Oh, sorry. Forgot it was durable. promise = client.queue_declare(queue='test', durable=True) client.wait(promise) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Message Property Code Examples in AMQP 0-9-1 DESCRIPTION: Code examples showing how to set delivery mode and priority properties in AMQP 0-9-1 protocol SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/queues.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: AMQP CODE: ``` delivery_mode ``` LANGUAGE: AMQP CODE: ``` priority ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Virtual Host Limit in RabbitMQ (Shell) DESCRIPTION: cURL command to set a per-vhost limit using the RabbitMQ Management API. This example sets the max-connections limit for 'my-vhost' to 50. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` curl -4u 'guest:guest' -H 'content-type:application/json' -X PUT localhost:15672/api/vhost-limits/my-vhost/max-connections -d '{"value": 50}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Topic-based Log Emission in Ruby with RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to publish messages to a topic exchange in RabbitMQ using Ruby. It creates a connection, declares a topic exchange, and publishes a message with a specified routing key. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-five-ruby.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` #!/usr/bin/env ruby require 'bunny' connection = Bunny.new connection.start channel = connection.create_channel exchange = channel.topic('topic_logs') severity = ARGV.shift || 'anonymous.info' message = ARGV.empty? ? 'Hello World!' : ARGV.join(' ') exchange.publish(message, routing_key: severity) puts " [x] Sent #{severity}:#{message}" connection.close ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Feature Flags via Environment Variable DESCRIPTION: Example of setting specific feature flags during initial startup using the RABBITMQ_FEATURE_FLAGS environment variable. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/feature-flags/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` RABBITMQ_FEATURE_FLAGS="delete_ra_cluster_mqtt_node,virtual_host_metadata,stream_single_active_consumer,quorum_queue,classic_mirrored_queue_version,rabbit_mqtt_qos0_queue,implicit_default_bindings,empty_basic_get_metric,'rabbitmq_4.0.0',message_containers,user_limits,queue_master_locator,detailed_queues_endpoint,stream_sac_coordinator_unblock_group,stream_update_config_command,stream_queue,stream_filtering,rabbit_exchange_type_local_random,quorum_queue_non_voters,tracking_records_in_ets,direct_exchange_routing_v2,amqp_address_v1,transient_nonexcl_queues,message_containers_deaths_v2,classic_queue_mirroring,management_metrics_collection,maintenance_mode_status,listener_records_in_ets,feature_flags_v2,global_qos,classic_queue_type_delivery_support,mqtt_v5,ram_node_type,drop_unroutable_metric,restart_streams" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example of Correct Global Argument Placement in Shell Command DESCRIPTION: Example showing the correct placement of global arguments (such as --vhost) which must come before the command category and specific command in rabbitmqadmin v2. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_24 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin --vhost "events" declare queue --name "target.quorum.queue.name" --type "quorum" --durable true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Host Entry for Keycloak and RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Adds necessary host entries to /etc/hosts file for local development, mapping localhost to keycloak and rabbitmq hostnames. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples-keycloak.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` localhost keycloak rabbitmq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing RabbitMQ Messaging Topology Operator with Generated Certificates DESCRIPTION: Command to apply the manually edited YAML manifest for installing the RabbitMQ Messaging Topology Operator with self-generated certificates. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/install-topology-operator.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl apply -f messaging-topology-operator.yaml ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting never Delete Mode for AMQP 0-9-1 Shovel Persistence DESCRIPTION: The never delete mode configures the shovel to run indefinitely without deleting itself, making it suitable for continuous message transfer operations. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/shovel-dynamic.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` never ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting RabbitMQ Server in Foreground DESCRIPTION: Command to start a RabbitMQ node in the foreground with configuration file specification. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/install-homebrew.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` CONF_ENV_FILE="/opt/homebrew/etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-env.conf" /opt/homebrew/opt/rabbitmq/sbin/rabbitmq-server ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Khepri Experimental Feature in RabbitMQ 3.13 DESCRIPTION: This command enables the experimental Khepri feature, which is a new storage backend for RabbitMQ metadata. It's important to note that this feature is non-reversible and should not be used in production without thorough testing. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2024-03-11-rabbitmq-3.13.0-announcement/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl enable_feature_flag khepri_db ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting RabbitMQ with RAR Token Configuration DESCRIPTION: Bash command to set up and start RabbitMQ with a configuration file that supports Rich Authorization Request tokens. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_34 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` export CONFIG=rabbitmq-for-rar-tokens.config make start-rabbitmq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting JMS Publisher with OAuth 2.0 DESCRIPTION: Command to start a JMS publisher application that authenticates using OAuth 2.0 and sends a message to a queue called q-test-queue. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make start-jms-publisher ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing RabbitMQ Go Client Library DESCRIPTION: Commands to initialize a Go module and install the RabbitMQ AMQP client library required for connecting to RabbitMQ servers. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-go.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: go CODE: ``` go mod init go get github.com/rabbitmq/amqp091-go ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Statistics with Queue Totals in RabbitMQ Management DESCRIPTION: Configuration that disables statistics aggregation but retains queue totals in the queues endpoint. Useful when using external monitoring but still needing individual queue metrics. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_35 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.disable_stats = true management.enable_queue_totals = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Consumer Cancel Notification Handling in Java DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to set up a consumer that can handle unexpected cancellations using the RabbitMQ Java client. It overrides the handleCancel method of the DefaultConsumer class to handle asynchronous cancel notifications from the broker. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/consumer-cancel.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` channel.queueDeclare(queue, false, true, false, null); Consumer consumer = new DefaultConsumer(channel) { @Override public void handleCancel(String consumerTag) throws IOException { // consumer has been cancelled unexpectedly } }; channel.basicConsume(queue, consumer); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying MQTT QoS 0 Messages Drop Metric in Prometheus DESCRIPTION: A Prometheus query example to retrieve metrics about QoS 0 messages that were dropped due to overload protection in RabbitMQ. This metric shows the total count across all queues of type rabbit_mqtt_qos0_queue during the node's lifetime. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/mqtt.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq_global_messages_dead_lettered_maxlen_total{queue_type="rabbit_mqtt_qos0_queue",dead_letter_strategy="disabled"} 0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Resource in Erlang without Cuts DESCRIPTION: Shows a common pattern in Erlang where a simple abstraction is used to handle a resource, demonstrating the verbose nature of using funs. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2011-05-17-can-you-hear-the-drums-erlando/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` with_resource(Resource, Fun) -> case lookup_resource(Resource) of {ok, R} -> Fun(R); {error, _} = Err -> Err end. my_fun(A, B, C) -> with_resource(A, fun (Resource) -> my_resource_modification(Resource, B, C) end). ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Rebalancing Quorum Queue Replicas via CLI DESCRIPTION: Commands for rebalancing quorum queue leaders across the cluster, with options to filter by queue name patterns and virtual hosts. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/quorum-queues/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-queues rebalance quorum ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-queues rebalance quorum --queue-pattern "orders.*" ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-queues rebalance quorum --vhost-pattern "production.*" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing RabbitMQ Queues on Windows DESCRIPTION: Command to list all the queues in RabbitMQ and see how many messages they contain on Windows systems. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-javascript.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat list_queues ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Failed Virtual Host Deletion Example DESCRIPTION: Example showing the error message when attempting to delete a protected virtual host SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl delete_vhost "vhost-name" # ... # => Error: # => Cannot delete this virtual host: it is protected from deletion. To lift the protection, inspect and update its metadata ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running RabbitMQ 4.0 with Management Plugin in Docker DESCRIPTION: This command runs the latest RabbitMQ 4.0.x version with the management plugin enabled in a Docker container. It exposes ports 5672 for AMQP and 15672 for the management UI. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/download.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker run -it --rm --name rabbitmq -p 5672:5672 -p 15672:15672 rabbitmq:4.0-management ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing RabbitMQ Go Client Library DESCRIPTION: Commands to initialize a Go module and install the RabbitMQ AMQP client library required for connecting to RabbitMQ servers. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-go.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: go CODE: ``` go mod init go get github.com/rabbitmq/amqp091-go ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Shovel Status with RabbitMQ CLI DESCRIPTION: Command for checking status of all shovels using the RabbitMQ CLI tool. The example formats output as a pretty table. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/shovel-dynamic.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl shovel_status --formatter=pretty_table ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring AMQP Handshake Timeout in RabbitMQ (INI) DESCRIPTION: Default maximum time (in milliseconds) allowed for AMQP 0-9-1 handshake after socket connection and TLS handshake. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` handshake_timeout = 10000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configure Federation Upstream in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to configure a federation upstream named 'origin' with a connection URI using rabbitmqctl in Bash. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/federated-queues/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_parameter federation-upstream origin '{"uri":"amqp://remote-host.local:5672"}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Clear Federation Policy DESCRIPTION: Command to remove a federation policy by its name. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/federated-queues/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl clear_policy queue-federation ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Worker Consumer in Swift with RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Message consumer implementation that simulates work by sleeping based on the number of dots in the message. Demonstrates message processing in a worker pattern. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-swift.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: swift CODE: ``` q.subscribe({(_ message: RMQMessage) -> Void in let messageText = String(data: message.body, encoding: .utf8) print("\(name): Received \(messageText)") // imitate some work let sleepTime = UInt(messageText.components(separatedBy: ".").count) - 1 print("\(name): Sleeping for \(sleepTime) seconds") sleep(sleepTime) }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Viewing perf-test logs in Kubernetes DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to view the logs of the perf-test pod in Kubernetes. It uses the kubectl logs command with the --follow option to stream the logs in real-time, showing the performance metrics of the RabbitMQ cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/quickstart-operator.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl logs --follow perf-test ... id: test-141948-895, time: 16.001s, sent: 25651 msg/s, received: 25733 msg/s, min/median/75th/95th/99th consumer latency: 1346110/1457130/1495463/1529703/1542172 µs id: test-141948-895, time: 17.001s, sent: 26933 msg/s, received: 26310 msg/s, min/median/75th/95th/99th consumer latency: 1333807/1411182/1442417/1467869/1483273 µs id: test-141948-895, time: 18.001s, sent: 26292 msg/s, received: 25505 msg/s, min/median/75th/95th/99th consumer latency: 1329488/1428657/1455482/1502191/1518218 µs id: test-141948-895, time: 19.001s, sent: 23727 msg/s, received: 26055 msg/s, min/median/75th/95th/99th consumer latency: 1355788/1450757/1480030/1514469/1531624 µs id: test-141948-895, time: 20.001s, sent: 25009 msg/s, received: 25202 msg/s, min/median/75th/95th/99th consumer latency: 1327462/1447157/1474394/1509857/1521303 µs id: test-141948-895, time: 21.001s, sent: 28487 msg/s, received: 25942 msg/s, min/median/75th/95th/99th consumer latency: 1350527/1454599/1490094/1519461/1531042 µs ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Removing Quorum Queue Members in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to remove a quorum queue member (replica) from a specified node. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmq-queues.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-queues delete_member --vhost "a-vhost" "a-queue" "rabbit@decomissioned-node" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Maximum Delivery Tag Value DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the maximum possible value for a delivery tag in RabbitMQ, which is a 64-bit integer. Since delivery tags are scoped per channel, reaching this limit in practice is highly unlikely. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/confirms.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` 9223372036854775807 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Verifying .NET Core Installation DESCRIPTION: Command to verify that .NET Core toolchain is properly installed and accessible in the PATH. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-dotnet.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` dotnet --help ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Quorum Status Before Node Shutdown in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to check if shutting down the node would cause any quorum loss for internal components, quorum queues or stream queues. Exits with a non-zero code if shutting down the node would be problematic. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/upgrade.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # exits with a non-zero code if any of the internal components, quorum queues or stream queues # will lose online quorum should the target node be shut down; # additionally, it will print which components and/or queues are affected rabbitmq-diagnostics check_if_node_is_quorum_critical ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Package.json Configuration for RabbitMQ Stream Tutorial DESCRIPTION: Configuration file for the Node.js project with dependencies and npm scripts to run the producer and consumer examples. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-javascript-stream.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "name": "rabbitmq-stream-node-tutorial", "version": "1.0.0", "description": "Tutorial for the nodejs RabbitMQ stream client", "scripts": { "send": "node send.js", "receive": "node receive.js" }, "dependencies": { "rabbitmq-stream-js-client": "^0.3.1" } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Client Secret for OAuth 2.0 Authentication DESCRIPTION: Configuration for OAuth 2.0 with a client secret, which might be required by some OAuth providers for token refresh requests. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.oauth_enabled = true management.oauth_client_id = rabbit_user_client management.oauth_client_secret = rabbit_user_client management.oauth_scopes = openid profile rabbitmq.* ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Compiling Erlang Files with Erlando Parse Transformers DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to compile Erlang files using erlc while ensuring the Erlando parse transformer modules can be located. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2011-05-17-can-you-hear-the-drums-erlando/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` erlc -Wall +debug_info -I ./include -pa ebin -o ebin src/cut.erl erlc -Wall +debug_info -I ./include -pa ebin -o ebin src/do.erl erlc -Wall +debug_info -I ./include -pa test/ebin -pa ./ebin -o test/ebin test/src/test.erl ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting trace VHosts in RabbitMQ (advanced) DESCRIPTION: Advanced configuration used internally by the tracer. This setting should not be changed by users. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_54 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {rabbit, [ {trace_vhosts, []} ]} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Simulating Work in RabbitMQ Consumer using Java DESCRIPTION: This method simulates work by sleeping for one second for each dot in the received message. It's used to demonstrate how long-running tasks are handled in a work queue system. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-java.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Java CODE: ``` private static void doWork(String task) throws InterruptedException { for (char ch: task.toCharArray()) { if (ch == '.') Thread.sleep(1000); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring a Task Queue in C# RabbitMQ Producer DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to declare a task queue named 'task_queue' in a RabbitMQ producer using C#. It's used to avoid conflicts with existing non-durable queues. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-dotnet.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` await channel.QueueDeclareAsync(queue: "task_queue", durable: true, exclusive: false, autoDelete: false, arguments: null); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking RabbitMQ Unacknowledged Messages with rabbitmqctl DESCRIPTION: Commands to check for unacknowledged messages in RabbitMQ queues, which helps debug issues with forgotten acknowledgments. Shows both Unix and Windows versions of the command. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-elixir.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo rabbitmqctl list_queues name messages_ready messages_unacknowledged ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat list_queues name messages_ready messages_unacknowledged ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ Work Queues with Spring AMQP DESCRIPTION: This code snippet sets up the configuration for the Work Queues tutorial using Spring AMQP. It defines the queue, receiver, and sender beans, along with their respective profiles. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-spring-amqp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` import org.springframework.amqp.core.Queue; import org.springframework.context.annotation.Bean; import org.springframework.context.annotation.Configuration; import org.springframework.context.annotation.Profile; @Profile({"tut2", "work-queues"}) @Configuration public class Tut2Config { @Bean public Queue hello() { return new Queue("hello"); } @Profile("receiver") private static class ReceiverConfig { @Bean public Tut2Receiver receiver1() { return new Tut2Receiver(1); } @Bean public Tut2Receiver receiver2() { return new Tut2Receiver(2); } } @Profile("sender") @Bean public Tut2Sender sender() { return new Tut2Sender(); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring LDAP Backend for Authentication and Authorisation DESCRIPTION: Configuration example for setting up RabbitMQ to use the LDAP backend for both authentication and authorisation. With this configuration, the internal database will not be consulted. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_backends.1 = ldap ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Attaching an Event to ChangeState for Consumer in C# DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to attach an event listener to the ChangeState event of a RabbitMQ consumer in C#. The listener can react to state changes of the consumer. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/amqp-client-libraries.md#2025-04-09_snippet_70 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` consumer.ChangeState += (sender, fromState, toState, e) => { } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Client Secret for OAuth 2.0 in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration for OAuth client secret when required by the OAuth provider for authentication or token refresh requests. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.oauth_enabled = true management.oauth_client_id = rabbit_user_client management.oauth_client_secret = rabbit_user_client management.oauth_scopes = openid profile rabbitmq.* ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Default Content Security Policy in RabbitMQ Management DESCRIPTION: Sets the Content Security Policy (CSP) header value for HTTP API responses to the default policy that permits self-source scripts with unsafe-eval and unsafe-inline. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_31 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.csp.policy = script-src 'self' 'unsafe-eval' 'unsafe-inline'; object-src 'self' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Apache Reverse Proxy Configuration for RabbitMQ Management UI DESCRIPTION: Apache configuration directives for setting up a reverse proxy to the RabbitMQ management web UI on port 15672.
