SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_41 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` AllowEncodedSlashes NoDecode ProxyPass "/api" http://localhost:15672/api nocanon ProxyPass "/" http://localhost:15672/ ProxyPassReverse "/" http://localhost:15672/ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Pinning Erlang Package Version DESCRIPTION: Configures APT preferences to pin Erlang packages to a specific version. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # /etc/apt/preferences.d/erlang Package: erlang* Pin: version 1:26.2.5.6-1 # Note: priority of 1001 (greater than 1000) allows for downgrading. # To make package downgrading impossible, use a value of 999 Pin-Priority: 1001 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Absolute Disk Free Limit Configuration (Bytes) DESCRIPTION: Configuration example showing how to set the disk free limit to 1GB using byte value. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/disk-alarms.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` disk_free_limit.absolute = 1000000000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Both HTTP and HTTPS Listeners for RabbitMQ Management DESCRIPTION: Enables both HTTP and HTTPS listeners on different ports (15672 for HTTP and 15671 for HTTPS). Requires specifying certificate paths for the HTTPS listener. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.tcp.port = 15672 management.ssl.port = 15671 management.ssl.cacertfile = /path/to/ca_certificate.pem management.ssl.certfile = /path/to/server_certificate.pem management.ssl.keyfile = /path/to/server_key.pem ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Establishing WebSocket STOMP Connection DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code to establish a WebSocket connection and initialize STOMP client. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/web-stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` var ws = new WebSocket('ws://127.0.0.1:15674/ws'); var client = Stomp.over(ws); // ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring LDAP with Internal Database Fallback DESCRIPTION: Configuration that tries LDAP first for authentication and authorization, then falls back to RabbitMQ's internal database if the user cannot be authenticated through LDAP. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # try LDAP first auth_backends.1 = ldap # fall back to the internal database auth_backends.2 = internal ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring LDAP with Internal Database Fallback DESCRIPTION: Configuration that tries LDAP first for authentication and authorization, then falls back to RabbitMQ's internal database if the user cannot be authenticated through LDAP. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # try LDAP first auth_backends.1 = ldap # fall back to the internal database auth_backends.2 = internal ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Cancelling a Consumer in Erlang DESCRIPTION: Shows how to cancel a consumer subscription using the consumer tag returned during subscription. After cancellation, the consumer may still receive in-flight deliveries but will eventually stop receiving messages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/erlang-client-user-guide.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` amqp_channel:call(Channel, #'basic.cancel'{consumer_tag = Tag}) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Authentication Backends Basic Config DESCRIPTION: Default authentication backend configuration using internal database. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_48 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_backends.1 = internal ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving RabbitMQ Admin Password from Kubernetes Secret DESCRIPTION: Command to retrieve and decode the base64-encoded password for the RabbitMQ admin user from the default-user Kubernetes secret created by the RabbitMQ Operator. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-operator/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_34 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl -n NAMESPACE get secret INSTANCE-default-user -o jsonpath="{.data.password}" | base64 --decode ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Memory High Watermark (Absolute) in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration for the memory threshold (as an absolute value) at which flow control is triggered. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_20 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` vm_memory_high_watermark.absolute = 2GB ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Mapping Multiple RabbitMQ Scopes to a Custom Role DESCRIPTION: This configuration maps a single custom scope 'api://rabbitmq:producer' to multiple RabbitMQ permissions, granting read, write, and configure access on all resources across all vhosts. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: erl CODE: ``` {rabbitmq_auth_backend_oauth2, [ %% ..., {scope_aliases, #{ <<"api://rabbitmq:producer">> => [ <<"rabbitmq.read:*/*">>, <<"rabbitmq.write:*/*">>, <<"rabbitmq.configure:*/*">> ] }}, %% ... ]} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Binding with RabbitMQ in Java DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to create a binding between a queue and an exchange with a specific routing key in RabbitMQ using Java. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-java.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` channel.queueBind(queueName, EXCHANGE_NAME, "black"); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Feature Flags and Their State in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to list all available feature flags in a RabbitMQ cluster along with their current state (enabled or disabled). This helps administrators understand which features are active. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin feature_flags list ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Maximum Channels Limit with curl DESCRIPTION: This curl command sets a maximum channels limit of 20 for user1 using the HTTP API. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/user-limits.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -v -u guest:guest -X PUT http://localhost:15672/api/user-limits/user1/max-channels \ -H "content-type: application/json" \ -d @- < [x] Sent '[error] Run. Run. Or it will explode.' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using RAR Token with AMQP Producer Application DESCRIPTION: Command to start a PerfTest producer application that connects to RabbitMQ using a Rich Authorization Request token for authentication and authorization. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_36 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make start-perftest-producer-with-token PRODUCER=producer_with_roles TOKEN=$(bin/jwt_token rar-token.json legacy-token-key private.pem public.pem) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Value Encoding with RabbitMQ CLI DESCRIPTION: Simple example of encoding a value using rabbitmqctl encode command with a passphrase. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_71 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl encode '<<"guest">>' mypassphrase ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Restarting Virtual Host DESCRIPTION: Restarts a failed virtual host's data stores and queues. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_57 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl restart_vhost test ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking RabbitMQ Alarms DESCRIPTION: Health check command that fails if there are alarms in effect on any cluster nodes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics check_alarms ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Memory Threshold on Running RabbitMQ Node DESCRIPTION: Command-line examples for updating the memory threshold on a running RabbitMQ node using rabbitmqctl, including setting relative and absolute thresholds. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/memory.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_vm_memory_high_watermark ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_vm_memory_high_watermark absolute ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_vm_memory_high_watermark 0.7 ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_vm_memory_high_watermark absolute "4G" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complete TLS Connection Example with RabbitMQ .NET Client DESCRIPTION: A complete example that creates a TLS-enabled connection to RabbitMQ, creates a channel, declares and then deletes a queue. The example demonstrates setting up the SSL connection parameters and using async/await pattern. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` using System; using System.IO; using System.Text; using RabbitMQ.client; using RabbitMQ.Util; namespace RabbitMQ.client.Examples { public class TestSSL { public static async Task Main(string[] args) { ConnectionFactory cf = new ConnectionFactory(); cf.Ssl.Enabled = true; cf.Ssl.ServerName = System.Net.Dns.GetHostName(); cf.Ssl.CertPath = "/path/to/client_key.p12"; cf.Ssl.CertPassphrase = "MySecretPassword"; using (IConnection conn = await cf.CreateConnectionAsync()) { using (IChannel ch = await conn.CreateChannelAsync()) { Console.WriteLine("Successfully connected and opened a channel"); await ch.QueueDeclareAsync("rabbitmq-dotnet-test", false, false, false, null); Console.WriteLine("Successfully declared a queue"); await ch.QueueDeleteAsync("rabbitmq-dotnet-test"); Console.WriteLine("Successfully deleted the queue"); } } return 0; } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complete TLS Connection Example with RabbitMQ .NET Client DESCRIPTION: A complete example that creates a TLS-enabled connection to RabbitMQ, creates a channel, declares and then deletes a queue. The example demonstrates setting up the SSL connection parameters and using async/await pattern. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` using System; using System.IO; using System.Text; using RabbitMQ.client; using RabbitMQ.Util; namespace RabbitMQ.client.Examples { public class TestSSL { public static async Task Main(string[] args) { ConnectionFactory cf = new ConnectionFactory(); cf.Ssl.Enabled = true; cf.Ssl.ServerName = System.Net.Dns.GetHostName(); cf.Ssl.CertPath = "/path/to/client_key.p12"; cf.Ssl.CertPassphrase = "MySecretPassword"; using (IConnection conn = await cf.CreateConnectionAsync()) { using (IChannel ch = await conn.CreateChannelAsync()) { Console.WriteLine("Successfully connected and opened a channel"); await ch.QueueDeclareAsync("rabbitmq-dotnet-test", false, false, false, null); Console.WriteLine("Successfully declared a queue"); await ch.QueueDeleteAsync("rabbitmq-dotnet-test"); Console.WriteLine("Successfully deleted the queue"); } } return 0; } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Connecting to RabbitMQ and Creating a Stream in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to establish a connection to RabbitMQ and create a stream with specific retention settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-javascript-stream.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const client = await rabbit.connect({ hostname: "localhost", port: 5552, username: "guest", password: "guest", vhost: "/", }); console.log("Making sure the stream exists..."); const streamSizeRetention = 5 * 1e9; const streamName = "stream-offset-tracking-javascript"; await client.createStream({ stream: streamName, arguments: { "max-length-bytes": streamSizeRetention } }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Gradle Dependency Configuration for RabbitMQ Java Client 4.0 DESCRIPTION: Gradle dependency configuration line to include RabbitMQ Java Client version 4.0.0 in a Gradle project. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2016-11-24-rabbitmq-java-client-4-0-is-released/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: groovy CODE: ``` compile 'com.rabbitmq:amqp-client:4.0.0' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: List MQTT Connection Protocol Values DESCRIPTION: Possible protocol version values that can be returned by the list_mqtt_connections command when querying protocol information from MQTT connections. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_73 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {'MQTT', N/A} {'MQTT', 3.1.0} {'MQTT', 3.1.1} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Absolute Disk Free Space Limit with Numeric Value in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration example showing how to set the disk free space limit to 1GB using an absolute numeric value (in bytes). SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/disk-alarms.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` disk_free_limit.absolute = 1000000000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: AMQP 1.0 Shovel forward header properties DESCRIPTION: Header names that can be added to shovelled messages to indicate their origin and routing information. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/shovel-dynamic.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` x-shovelled ``` LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` creation_time ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Message Priority Tests with OMQ in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Shell commands to test message priorities in RabbitMQ quorum queues using the OMQ testing client. The commands demonstrate queue declaration, publishing messages with different priorities, and message consumption. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2024-08-28-quorum-queues-in-4.0/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` # declare a quorum queue (you can use the Management UI or any other method) rabbitmqadmin declare queue name=qq queue_type=quorum # publish normal priority messages (10 publishers, 10k messages each) omq amqp --publishers 10 --consumers 0 --publish-to /queues/qq --message-priority 1 --pmessages 10000 # publish high priority messages omq amqp --publishers 10 --consumers 0 --publish-to /queues/qq --message-priority 10 --pmessages 10000 # consume all messages from the queue omq amqp --publishers 0 --consumers 1 --consume-from /queues/qq --consumer-credits 100 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deactivating Federation Policy DESCRIPTION: Command to remove a federation policy by its name, which will stop federation for the previously matching exchanges. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/federated-exchanges/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl clear_policy exchange-federation ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complete Log Receiver Implementation DESCRIPTION: Full implementation of the log receiver program with severity-based filtering SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-go.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: go CODE: ``` package main import ( "log" "os" amqp "github.com/rabbitmq/amqp091-go" ) func failOnError(err error, msg string) { if err != nil { log.Panicf("%s: %s", msg, err) } } func main() { conn, err := amqp.Dial("amqp://guest:guest@localhost:5672/") failOnError(err, "Failed to connect to RabbitMQ") defer conn.Close() ch, err := conn.Channel() failOnError(err, "Failed to open a channel") defer ch.Close() err = ch.ExchangeDeclare( "logs_direct", // name "direct", // type true, // durable false, // auto-deleted false, // internal false, // no-wait nil, // arguments ) failOnError(err, "Failed to declare an exchange") q, err := ch.QueueDeclare( "", // name false, // durable false, // delete when unused true, // exclusive false, // no-wait nil, // arguments ) failOnError(err, "Failed to declare a queue") if len(os.Args) < 2 { log.Printf("Usage: %s [info] [warning] [error]", os.Args[0]) os.Exit(0) } for _, s := range os.Args[1:] { log.Printf("Binding queue %s to exchange %s with routing key %s", q.Name, "logs_direct", s) err = ch.QueueBind( q.Name, // queue name s, // routing key "logs_direct", // exchange false, nil) failOnError(err, "Failed to bind a queue") } msgs, err := ch.Consume( q.Name, // queue "", // consumer true, // auto ack false, // exclusive false, // no local false, // no wait nil, // args ) failOnError(err, "Failed to register a consumer") var forever chan struct{} go func() { for d := range msgs { log.Printf(" [x] %s", d.Body) } }() log.Printf(" [*] Waiting for logs. To exit press CTRL+C") <-forever } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Log Location with rabbitmq-diagnostics in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to find the current log file location using the rabbitmq-diagnostics CLI tool in a Bash shell. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics -q log_location ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using --help Option for Specific Commands in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the --help option to get detailed help for a specific command (status) using rabbitmq-diagnostics in PowerShell. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics.bat status --help ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining RabbitMQ Usage Page in Markdown DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the structure and content of a Markdown page explaining how to use RabbitMQ. It includes a title, copyright notice, and introductory text for developers. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/use-rabbitmq.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` --- title: How to Use RabbitMQ --- # How to Use RabbitMQ This section is mainly for **developers** who are creating applications that exchanges messages through RabbitMQ. If you are new to RabbitMQ, you might want to start with [Getting Started](/tutorials). These tutorials will guide you on how to use RabbitMQ. The rest of this section contains the reference documentation about RabbitMQ features and use cases. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Failed Cluster Join Example - Bash DESCRIPTION: Example showing an error when attempting to join a node to a cluster that lacks quorum, demonstrating Khepri's consensus requirements. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/metadata-store/clustering.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl -n rabbit@host-5 join_cluster rabbit@host-4 # => Error: # => Khepri has timed out on node rabbit@host-5. # => Khepri cluster could be in minority. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Specifying node name in rabbitmq-upgrade DESCRIPTION: Shows how to specify a target node when using the rabbitmq-upgrade command. The default node is "rabbit@hostname" unless overridden. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmq-upgrade.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` -n node ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing RabbitMQ Listeners with rabbitmq-diagnostics DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to check all enabled listeners on a RabbitMQ node using the rabbitmq-diagnostics CLI tool. The output includes interface, port, protocol, and purpose for each listener. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/monitoring/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics -q listeners --node rabbit@target-hostname # => Interface: [::], port: 25672, protocol: clustering, purpose: inter-node and CLI tool communication # => Interface: [::], port: 5672, protocol: amqp, purpose: AMQP 0-9-1 and AMQP 1.0 # => Interface: [::], port: 5671, protocol: amqp/ssl, purpose: AMQP 0-9-1 and AMQP 1.0 over TLS # => Interface: [::], port: 15672, protocol: http, purpose: HTTP API # => Interface: [::], port: 15671, protocol: https, purpose: HTTP API over TLS (HTTPS) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Exporting Definitions via HTTP API DESCRIPTION: Examples of using curl to export definitions through the RabbitMQ HTTP API, with optional JSON formatting using jq. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/definitions.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Requires management plugin to be enabled, # placeholders are used for credentials and hostname. # Use HTTPS when possible. curl -u {username}:{password} -X GET http://{hostname}:15672/api/definitions # Requires management plugin to be enabled, # placeholders are used for credentials and hostname. # Use HTTPS when possible. # # jq is a 3rd party tool that must be available in PATH curl -u {username}:{password} -X GET http://{hostname}:15672/api/definitions | jq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Shovel Using curl Command DESCRIPTION: Example curl command for creating a shovel between local queues using the HTTP API. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/shovel-dynamic.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -v -u guest:guest -X PUT http://localhost:15672/api/parameters/shovel/%2f/my-shovel \ -H "content-type: application/json" \ -d @- <>='/2, return/1, fail/1]). '>>='({just, X}, Fun) -> Fun(X); '>>='(nothing, _Fun) -> nothing. return(X) -> {just, X}. fail(_X) -> nothing. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complete RabbitMQ Worker Implementation with Acknowledgments and Fair Dispatch in Python DESCRIPTION: Complete implementation of a reliable worker that processes messages from a durable queue, acknowledges messages after processing, and uses prefetch to ensure fair workload distribution among workers. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-python.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` #!/usr/bin/env python import pika import time connection = pika.BlockingConnection( pika.ConnectionParameters(host='localhost')) channel = connection.channel() channel.queue_declare(queue='task_queue', durable=True) print(' [*] Waiting for messages. To exit press CTRL+C') def callback(ch, method, properties, body): print(f" [x] Received {body.decode()}") time.sleep(body.count(b'.')) print(" [x] Done") ch.basic_ack(delivery_tag=method.delivery_tag) channel.basic_qos(prefetch_count=1) channel.basic_consume(queue='task_queue', on_message_callback=callback) channel.start_consuming() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running RabbitMQ Worker in Java DESCRIPTION: This bash command shows how to run the Worker program, which will consume messages from the RabbitMQ queue and process them. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-java.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: Bash CODE: ``` java -cp $CP Worker ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Binding with FanoutExchange in Spring AMQP DESCRIPTION: Example of creating a binding between a queue and a fanout exchange using Spring AMQP's BindingBuilder. This binding connects a queue to receive all messages from the fanout exchange. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-spring-amqp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` @Bean public Binding binding1(FanoutExchange fanout, Queue autoDeleteQueue1) { return BindingBuilder.bind(autoDeleteQueue1).to(fanout); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Fanout Exchange with Spring AMQP DESCRIPTION: Configuration class that sets up a fanout exchange with two anonymous queues and their bindings. Includes separate profiles for sender and receiver configurations. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-spring-amqp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` import org.springframework.amqp.core.*; import org.springframework.context.annotation.Bean; import org.springframework.context.annotation.Configuration; import org.springframework.context.annotation.Profile; @Profile({"tut3", "pub-sub", "publish-subscribe"}) @Configuration public class Tut3Config { @Bean public FanoutExchange fanout() { return new FanoutExchange("tut.fanout"); } @Profile("receiver") private static class ReceiverConfig { @Bean public Queue autoDeleteQueue1() { return new AnonymousQueue(); } @Bean public Queue autoDeleteQueue2() { return new AnonymousQueue(); } @Bean public Binding binding1(FanoutExchange fanout, Queue autoDeleteQueue1) { return BindingBuilder.bind(autoDeleteQueue1).to(fanout); } @Bean public Binding binding2(FanoutExchange fanout, Queue autoDeleteQueue2) { return BindingBuilder.bind(autoDeleteQueue2).to(fanout); } @Bean public Tut3Receiver receiver() { return new Tut3Receiver(); } } @Profile("sender") @Bean public Tut3Sender sender() { return new Tut3Sender(); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Restarting a Failed Virtual Host in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to restart a failed virtual host named 'test' in RabbitMQ. This will restart the data stores and queues for the specified virtual host. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_58 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl restart_vhost test ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Default User Credentials in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Shows configuration settings for overriding default user credentials in RabbitMQ. These settings must be in place before the first node boot as they only apply on initial startup. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # default is "guest", and its access is limited to localhost only. # See ./access-control#default-state default_user = a-user # default is "guest" default_pass = 768a852ed69ce916fa7faa278c962de3e4275e5f ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting a Back-off Policy for Connection Recovery in Java DESCRIPTION: Shows how to customize the back-off delay policy for automatic connection recovery in Java. This example sets a fixed delay of 2 seconds between reconnection attempts. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/amqp-client-libraries.md#2025-04-09_snippet_71 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` Connection connection = environment.connectionBuilder() .recovery() .backOffDelayPolicy(BackOffDelayPolicy.fixed(Duration.ofSeconds(2))) .connectionBuilder().build(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Named Configuration with Shell Command DESCRIPTION: Command that uses a named connection profile from the configuration file to execute a command against a specific RabbitMQ environment. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` # will use the settings from the section called [staging] rabbitmqadmin --node staging show churn ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Subscribing to Multiple Severities in Objective-C DESCRIPTION: This code shows how to create bindings for multiple severities when subscribing to logs in RabbitMQ using Objective-C. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-objectivec.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: objectivec CODE: ``` RMQQueue *q = [ch queue:@"" options:RMQQueueDeclareExclusive]; NSArray *severities = @[@"error", @"warning", @"info"]; for (NSString *severity in severities) { [q bind:x routingKey:severity]; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running RabbitMQ Log Receiver for All Severities DESCRIPTION: This bash command demonstrates how to run the ReceiveLogsDirect program to receive log messages of all severities (info, warning, error) and display them on the console. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-java.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` java -cp $CP ReceiveLogsDirect info warning error # => [*] Waiting for logs. To exit press CTRL+C ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Binding with FanoutExchange in Spring AMQP DESCRIPTION: Example of creating a binding between a queue and a fanout exchange using Spring AMQP's BindingBuilder. This binding connects a queue to receive all messages from the fanout exchange. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-spring-amqp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` @Bean public Binding binding1(FanoutExchange fanout, Queue autoDeleteQueue1) { return BindingBuilder.bind(autoDeleteQueue1).to(fanout); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Inspecting Channel Memory Usage with RabbitMQ Diagnostics DESCRIPTION: Uses the rabbitmq-diagnostics command to display memory breakdown, showing the amount of memory used by channels. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/channels/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics memory_breakdown -q --unit mb # => [elided for brevity] # ... # => connection_channels: 3.596 mb (2.27%) # ... # => [elided for brevity] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Free Disk Space Monitoring in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Log entry showing that disk free space monitoring has been disabled, which occurs on unrecognized platforms. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/disk-alarms.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` 2019-04-01 11:04:54.002 [info] <0.329.0> Disabling disk free space monitoring ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding RabbitMQ Repository Signing Keys DESCRIPTION: These commands add the RabbitMQ signing key and Launchpad PPA signing key to the system, enabling apt to trust packages signed by these keys. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # primary RabbitMQ signing key curl -1sLf "https://github.com/rabbitmq/signing-keys/releases/download/3.0/rabbitmq-release-signing-key.asc" | sudo gpg --dearmor | sudo tee /usr/share/keyrings/com.github.rabbitmq.signing.gpg > /dev/null # Launchpad PPA signing key for apt curl -1sLf "https://keyserver.ubuntu.com/pks/lookup?op=get&search=0xf77f1eda57ebb1cc" | sudo gpg --dearmor | sudo tee /usr/share/keyrings/net.launchpad.ppa.rabbitmq.erlang.gpg > /dev/null ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ Quorum Queues in Erlang DESCRIPTION: Example configuration for RabbitMQ quorum queues using advanced.config file. Sets the default replica count to 5 and increases the commands soft limit to 64. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/quorum-queues/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [ %% five replicas by default, only makes sense for nine node clusters {rabbit, [{quorum_cluster_size, 5}, {quorum_commands_soft_limit, 64}]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Connection Metrics Tables DESCRIPTION: Connection-level metrics for monitoring network traffic and process performance SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/prometheus/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Metric | Description | |-------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------| | rabbitmq_detailed_connection_incoming_bytes_total | Total number of bytes received on a connection | | rabbitmq_detailed_connection_outgoing_bytes_total | Total number of bytes sent on a connection | | rabbitmq_detailed_connection_process_reductions_total | Total number of connection process reductions | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Consuming Filtered Stream Messages DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to consume messages from a RabbitMQ stream with filtering enabled, including client-side validation of the filter value. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/streams.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` channel.basicQos(100); // QoS must be specified channel.basicConsume( "my-stream", false, Collections.singletonMap("x-stream-filter", "california"), // set filter (consumerTag, message) -> { Map headers = message.getProperties().getHeaders(); // there must be some client-side filter logic if ("california".equals(headers.get("x-stream-filter-value"))) { // message processing // ... } channel.basicAck(message.getEnvelope().getDeliveryTag(), false); // ack is required }, consumerTag -> { }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Internal Authentication Backend in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to configure RabbitMQ to use only the internal authentication backend, which is the default setting. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # rabbitmq.conf # # 1 here is a backend name. It can be anything. # Since we only really care about backend # ordering, we use numbers throughout this guide. # # "internal" is an alias for rabbit_auth_backend_internal auth_backends.1 = internal ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Khepri Feature Flag in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: CLI command to enable the khepri_db experimental feature flag in RabbitMQ using PowerShell. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/metadata-store/how-to-enable-khepri.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat enable_feature_flag --experimental khepri_db ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complete RabbitMQ Task Publisher Implementation in C# DESCRIPTION: This is the complete implementation of a RabbitMQ task publisher (producer) in C#. It includes queue declaration, message persistence, and publishing messages to the queue. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-dotnet.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` using System; using System.Text; using RabbitMQ.Client; class NewTask { public static void Main(string[] args) { var factory = new ConnectionFactory() { HostName = "localhost" }; using (var connection = factory.CreateConnection()) using (var channel = connection.CreateModel()) { channel.QueueDeclare(queue: "task_queue", durable: true, exclusive: false, autoDelete: false, arguments: null); var message = GetMessage(args); var body = Encoding.UTF8.GetBytes(message); var properties = channel.CreateBasicProperties(); properties.Persistent = true; channel.BasicPublish(exchange: "", routingKey: "task_queue", basicProperties: properties, body: body); Console.WriteLine($" [x] Sent {message}"); } Console.WriteLine(" Press [enter] to exit."); Console.ReadLine(); } private static string GetMessage(string[] args) { return ((args.Length > 0) ? string.Join(" ", args) : "Hello World!"); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Memory Breakdown Using rabbitmq-diagnostics CLI Tool in Bash DESCRIPTION: Example of using the rabbitmq-diagnostics tool to get memory usage breakdown with readable units (MB). This provides similar information to the HTTP API but in a more human-readable format. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/monitoring/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics -q memory_breakdown --unit "MB" # => connection_other: 50.18 mb (22.1%) # => allocated_unused: 43.7058 mb (19.25%) # => other_proc: 26.1082 mb (11.5%) # => other_system: 26.0714 mb (11.48%) # => connection_readers: 22.34 mb (9.84%) # => code: 20.4311 mb (9.0%) # => queue_procs: 17.687 mb (7.79%) # => other_ets: 4.3429 mb (1.91%) # => connection_writers: 4.068 mb (1.79%) # => connection_channels: 4.012 mb (1.77%) # => metrics: 3.3802 mb (1.49%) # => binary: 1.992 mb (0.88%) # => mnesia: 1.6292 mb (0.72%) # => atom: 1.0826 mb (0.48%) # => msg_index: 0.0317 mb (0.01%) # => plugins: 0.0119 mb (0.01%) # => queue_slave_procs: 0.0 mb (0.0%) # => mgmt_db: 0.0 mb (0.0%) # => reserved_unallocated: 0.0 mb (0.0%) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complete Log Emitter with Direct Exchange in Swift RabbitMQ Client DESCRIPTION: Full implementation of a function that emits log messages with specified severity through a direct exchange. It creates a connection, channel, and exchange before publishing the message. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-swift.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: swift CODE: ``` func emitLogDirect(_ msg: String, severity: String) { let conn = RMQConnection(delegate: RMQConnectionDelegateLogger()) conn.start() let ch = conn.createChannel() let x = ch.direct("direct_logs") x.publish(msg.data(using: .utf8), routingKey: severity) print("Sent '\(msg)'") conn.close() } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Publishers with Different Targets in C# DESCRIPTION: Examples of creating publishers in C# with different target types: publishing to an exchange with a routing key, to an exchange without a routing key, and directly to a queue. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/amqp-client-libraries.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: C# CODE: ``` // publish to an exchange with a routing key Publisher publisher = await connection.PublisherBuilder() .Exchange("foo") .Key("bar") .BuildAsync(); // publish to an exchange without a routing key Publisher publisher = await connection.PublisherBuilder() .Exchange("foo") // /exchanges/foo .BuildAsync(); // publish to a queue IPublisher publisher = await _connection.PublisherBuilder() .Queue("some-queue")// /queues/some-queue .BuildAsync(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: AWS IAM Policy for EC2 Instance Discovery DESCRIPTION: JSON policy definition for IAM roles to allow EC2 instances to use the Instance Metadata Service for peer discovery. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2018-02-18-peer-discovery-subsystem-in-rabbitmq-3-7/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "Version": "2012-10-17", "Statement": [ { "Effect": "Allow", "Action": [ "autoscaling:DescribeAutoScalingInstances", "ec2:DescribeInstances" ], "Resource": [ "*" ] } ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Maximum Queue Limit for a Virtual Host DESCRIPTION: Command to set a maximum limit of 1024 queues for a RabbitMQ virtual host using the rabbitmqctl set_vhost_limits command with a JSON configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_28 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_vhost_limits -p vhost_name '{"max-queues": 1024}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Clearing Certificate Cache in RabbitMQ (PowerShell) DESCRIPTION: Command to clear the PEM cache for SSL certificates in RabbitMQ using rabbitmqctl in a PowerShell environment. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_47 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat eval -n [target-node@hostname] 'ssl:clear_pem_cache().' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ Shovel for Queue Migration DESCRIPTION: Commands to set up and remove a shovel for migrating messages between virtual hosts. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2023-03-02-quorum-queues-migration/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_parameter shovel migrate-QUEUE_TO_MIGRATE \ '{"src-protocol": "amqp091", "src-uri": "amqp:///OLD_VHOST", "src-queue": "QUEUE_TO_MIGRATE", "dest-protocol": "amqp091", "dest-uri": "amqp:///NEW_VHOST", "dest-queue": "QUEUE_TO_MIGRATE"}' rabbitmqctl clear_parameter shovel migrate-QUEUE_TO_MIGRATE ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TLS Peer Verification in RabbitMQ (Classic Format) DESCRIPTION: Configuration example for enabling TLS peer verification in RabbitMQ using the classic Erlang configuration format. Configures SSL listeners and certificate settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [ {rabbit, [ {ssl_listeners, [5671]}, {ssl_options, [{cacertfile,"/path/to/ca_certificate.pem"}, {certfile,"/path/to/server_certificate.pem"}, {keyfile,"/path/to/server_key.pem"}, {verify, verify_peer}, {fail_if_no_peer_cert, true}]} ]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Up RPC Client Connection in C# DESCRIPTION: Initialization code for RPC client that sets up connection and declares callback queue for receiving responses. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-six-dotnet.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` var consumer = new EventingBasicConsumer(_channel); _channel.BasicConsume( consumer: consumer, queue: _replyQueueName, autoAck: true); consumer.Received += (model, ea) => { HandleResponse(ea); }; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing RabbitMQ Management API with OAuth Token DESCRIPTION: Command to access the RabbitMQ management API using a client credential flow with Keycloak. Uses the mgt_api_client which has administrator permissions. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples-keycloak.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make curl-keycloak url=http://localhost:15672/api/overview client_id=mgt_api_client secret=LWOuYqJ8gjKg3D2U8CJZDuID3KiRZVDa ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ TLS Configuration in INI Format DESCRIPTION: Example RabbitMQ configuration file in INI format that enables TLS on port 5671. It specifies the locations of CA certificate, server certificate, and private key files, and enables peer verification. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` listeners.ssl.default = 5671 ssl_options.cacertfile = /path/to/ca_certificate.pem ssl_options.certfile = /path/to/server_certificate.pem ssl_options.keyfile = /path/to/server_key.pem ssl_options.verify = verify_peer ssl_options.fail_if_no_peer_cert = true # If the private key file is password protected, set this value: # ssl_options.password = PASSWORD ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling AWS Peer Discovery Plugin in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to enable the AWS (EC2) peer discovery plugin which must be done before the first node boot for proper cluster formation. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins --offline enable rabbitmq_peer_discovery_aws ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Binding Exchanges Using Java RabbitMQ Client DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to bind two exchanges using the Java RabbitMQ client. Creates a binding from a source exchange to a destination exchange with a specified routing key using Channel#exchangeBind method. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/e2e.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` Channel ch = conn.createChannel(); ch.exchangeBind("destination", "source", "routingKey"); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Channel Max in RabbitMQ INI File DESCRIPTION: This INI configuration sets the maximum number of channels allowed per connection in RabbitMQ to 16. This can help optimize memory usage by limiting the number of channels applications can use. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/memory-use/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` channel_max = 16 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Binding Exchanges Using RabbitMQ .NET Client DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to bind a destination exchange to a source exchange with a routing key using the RabbitMQ .NET client. The ExchangeBind method creates a unidirectional binding where messages will flow from the source exchange to the destination exchange. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/e2e.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` var ch = conn.CreateModel(); ch.ExchangeBind("destination", "source", "routingKey"); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Relaxed Queue Property Checks for Migration DESCRIPTION: Configures RabbitMQ to relax queue property equivalence checks when transitioning to quorum queues. This helps with gradual migration by preventing channel exceptions when applications redeclare queues. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # this setting is meant to be used during transitionary periods when # RabbitMQ default queue type is changed but not all applications have been # updated yet quorum_queue.property_equivalence.relaxed_checks_on_redeclaration = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating an AMQP 1.0 Message for RabbitMQ Streams DESCRIPTION: Java code to create a message with properties and a binary payload using the message builder provided by the Producer. RabbitMQ Streams uses the AMQP 1.0 message format for interoperability. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2021-07-19-rabbitmq-streams-first-application/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` Message message = producer.messageBuilder() .properties() .creationTime(System.currentTimeMillis()) .messageId(i) .messageBuilder() .addData("hello world".getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8)) .build(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring SSL Options in RabbitMQ (INI) DESCRIPTION: Default configuration for TLS settings in RabbitMQ, which is initially set to none (disabled). SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` ssl_options = none ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying RabbitMQ Documentation Contribution Section in HTML DESCRIPTION: This HTML code snippet creates a section encouraging users to contribute to improving the RabbitMQ documentation. It includes a heading, a paragraph of text, and a link to the GitHub repository where the website source code is hosted. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/semantics.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: HTML CODE: ```

``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing RabbitMQ Node Information via HTTP API DESCRIPTION: Details for accessing node information through the /api/nodes and /api/nodes/(name) endpoints. These endpoints return various node statistics including memory usage, disk space, process counts, and configuration information. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_32 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` /api/nodes ``` LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` /api/nodes/(name) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring SSL Options in RabbitMQ (INI) DESCRIPTION: Default configuration for TLS settings in RabbitMQ, which is initially set to none (disabled). SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` ssl_options = none ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Authenticating with Basic Auth in RabbitMQ HTTP API (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Example of using Basic Authentication to authenticate against the RabbitMQ HTTP API using curl. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -i --header "authorization: Basic " http://localhost:15672/api/vhosts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Import Statements for Documentation Components DESCRIPTION: React/JavaScript imports for documentation site components used to render the TLS documentation, including tabs and .NET client URL references. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import { DotNetClientDocURL, } from '@site/src/components/DotNetClient'; import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs'; import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem'; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Console Debug Level DESCRIPTION: Sets the console logging level to debug. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.console.level = debug ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Resetting Log Level to Info at Runtime in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to reset log level back to info at runtime using rabbitmqctl. This reduces verbosity after debugging is complete. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_36 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl -n rabbit@target-host set_log_level info ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Binding Exchanges Using RabbitMQ .NET Client DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to bind a destination exchange to a source exchange with a routing key using the RabbitMQ .NET client. The ExchangeBind method creates a unidirectional binding where messages will flow from the source exchange to the destination exchange. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/e2e.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` var ch = conn.CreateModel(); ch.ExchangeBind("destination", "source", "routingKey"); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Size-based Log Rotation DESCRIPTION: Configuration example showing how to set up log file rotation based on file size with a retention policy. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # rotate when the file reaches 10 MiB log.file.rotation.size = 10485760 # keep up to 5 archived log files in addition to the current one log.file.rotation.count = 5 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Inspecting Channel Memory Usage with RabbitMQ Diagnostics DESCRIPTION: Uses the rabbitmq-diagnostics command to display memory breakdown, showing the amount of memory used by channels. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/channels/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics memory_breakdown -q --unit mb # => [elided for brevity] # ... # => connection_channels: 3.596 mb (2.27%) # ... # => [elided for brevity] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring WAL File Size Limit in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Sets the maximum size of the Write-Ahead Log (WAL) file before it is flushed to disk. Default value is 512 MiB. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/quorum-queues/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` raft.wal_max_size_bytes = 64000000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ Node Name in rabbitmq-env.conf DESCRIPTION: Example configuration that changes the default node name prefix from 'rabbit' to 'hare'. Demonstrates basic rabbitmq-env.conf syntax including comments and environment variable assignment. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmq-env.conf.5.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # I am a complete rabbitmq-env.conf file. # Comment lines start with a hash character. # This is a /bin/sh script file - use ordinary envt var syntax NODENAME=hare ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Generating TLS Certificates Using tls-gen Tool in Bash DESCRIPTION: A sequence of commands that clone the tls-gen repository and use its basic profile to generate a CA certificate and server/client certificate pairs with a specified password for testing purposes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` git clone https://github.com/rabbitmq/tls-gen tls-gen cd tls-gen/basic # private key password make PASSWORD=bunnies make verify make info ls -l ./result ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example RabbitMQ Cluster Status Output in Kubernetes DESCRIPTION: Example YAML output showing the status conditions of a RabbitMQ cluster. The conditions indicate the readiness of pods, cluster availability, warnings, and reconciliation status. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/troubleshooting-operator.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` Name: test-rabbit Namespace: rabbitmq-system API Version: rabbitmq.com/v1beta1 Kind: RabbitmqCluster ... Status: Binding: Name: sample-default-user Conditions: Last Transition Time: 2023-07-07T11:57:10Z Reason: AllPodsAreReady Status: True Type: AllReplicasReady # true when all RabbitMQ pods are 'ready' Last Transition Time: 2023-07-07T11:57:10Z Reason: AtLeastOneEndpointAvailable Status: True Type: ClusterAvailable # true when at least one RabbitMQ pod is 'ready' Last Transition Time: 2023-07-07T11:55:58Z Reason: NoWarnings Status: True Type: NoWarnings Last Transition Time: 2023-07-07T11:57:11Z Message: Finish reconciling Reason: Success Status: True Type: ReconcileSuccess ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Suspending Listeners Command DESCRIPTION: Command to temporarily suspend all listeners on a node to prevent new client connections. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl suspend_listeners ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Establishing WebSocket Connection for STOMP DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code to create a WebSocket connection and initialize a STOMP client. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/web-stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` var ws = new WebSocket('ws://127.0.0.1:15674/ws'); var client = Stomp.over(ws); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Inter-node TLS Using a Separate TLS Option File on Linux DESCRIPTION: Configuration for rabbitmq-env.conf that uses the -ssl_dist_optfile flag to specify a separate TLS configuration file. This approach simplifies the command line arguments by moving TLS configuration details to a dedicated file. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/clustering-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # NOTE: the following path is system dependent and will change between Erlang # versions ERL_SSL_PATH="/usr/lib64/erlang/lib/ssl-9.4/ebin" # -pa $ERL_SSL_PATH prepends the directory ERL_SSL_PATH points at to the code path # -proto_dist inet_tls tells the runtime to encrypt inter-node communication # -ssl_dist_optfile tells the runtime where to find its inter-node TLS configuration file SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS="-pa $ERL_SSL_PATH -proto_dist inet_tls -ssl_dist_optfile /etc/rabbitmq/inter_node_tls.config" RABBITMQ_CTL_ERL_ARGS="-pa $ERL_SSL_PATH -proto_dist inet_tls -ssl_dist_optfile /etc/rabbitmq/inter_node_tls.config" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Overflow Behavior Policy with rabbitmqctl on Windows DESCRIPTION: Windows-specific command for setting a 2-message limit with reject-publish overflow behavior. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/maxlength/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat set_policy my-pol "^two-messages$" ^ "{""max-length"":2,""overflow"":""reject-publish""}" ^ --apply-to queues ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: LDAP SNI Configuration DESCRIPTION: Sets Server Name Indication for LDAP TLS connections. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # Sets Server Name Indication for LDAP connections. # If an LDAP server host is available via multiple domain names, set this value # to the preferred domain name target LDAP server auth_ldap.ssl_options.sni = ldap.identity.eng.megacorp.local ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Proxy Protocol for RabbitMQ Web STOMP DESCRIPTION: Configuration to enable the proxy protocol for the Web STOMP plugin, allowing it to work behind load balancers that use this protocol. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/web-stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` web_stomp.proxy_protocol = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Growing Queue Replicas in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to add a new replica on a specified node for matching quorum queues. Supports selective growth using patterns for vhost and queue names. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmq-queues.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-queues grow "rabbit@newhost" "all" --vhost-pattern "a-vhost" --queue-pattern ".*" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting a Back-off Policy for Connection Recovery in C# DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to set a custom back-off delay policy for automatic connection recovery in C#. This example uses a custom IBackOffDelayPolicy implementation. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/amqp-client-libraries.md#2025-04-09_snippet_72 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` class MyBackOffDelay : IBackOffDelayPolicy { ... } await AmqpConnection.CreateAsync( ConnectionSettingBuilder.Create().RecoveryConfiguration( RecoveryConfiguration.Create() .BackOffDelayPolicy(new MyBackOffDelay())).Build()); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Direct Exchange DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create a direct exchange for routing messages SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-ruby.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` channel.direct('logs'); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running the Consumer DESCRIPTION: Command to run the receive.exs script using Mix with expected output. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-elixir.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` mix run receive.exs # => [*] Waiting for messages. To exit press CTRL+C, CTRL+C # ... # => [x] Received Hello World! ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TLS Syslog DESCRIPTION: Configuration for TLS-enabled Syslog output with certificate settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.syslog = true log.syslog.transport = tls log.syslog.protocol = rfc5424 log.syslog.ssl_options.cacertfile = /path/to/ca_certificate.pem log.syslog.ssl_options.certfile = /path/to/client_certificate.pem log.syslog.ssl_options.keyfile = /path/to/client_key.pem ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring an Exclusive Queue in Elixir DESCRIPTION: Creates an exclusive queue that will be automatically deleted when the connection closes. This is useful for temporary queues needed only for the duration of a connection. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-elixir.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: elixir CODE: ``` {:ok, %{queue: queue_name}} = AMQP.Queue.declare(channel, "", exclusive: true) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Custom Scope Field in OAuth 2.0 Tokens for RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration to use a different token field for scopes instead of the default 'scope' key. This is useful when working with OAuth providers that use custom scope field names. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_oauth2.resource_server_id = my_rabbit_server auth_oauth2.additional_scopes_key = my_custom_scope_key ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining AMQP URI Syntax using ABNF DESCRIPTION: This ABNF snippet defines the syntax rules for AMQP URIs, including the structure for authority, userinfo, username, password, and vhost components. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/uri-spec.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ABNF CODE: ``` amqp_URI = "amqp://" amqp_authority [ "/" vhost ] [ "?" query ] amqp_authority = [ amqp_userinfo "@" ] host [ ":" port ] amqp_userinfo = username [ ":" password ] username = *( unreserved / pct-encoded / sub-delims ) password = *( unreserved / pct-encoded / sub-delims ) vhost = segment ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring AWS Peer Discovery DESCRIPTION: Initial configuration for AWS-based peer discovery showing how to specify the discovery backend. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = aws # the backend can also be specified using its module name ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying RabbitMQ Network Partition Handling Options in HTML DESCRIPTION: This HTML snippet creates an unordered list to display the three main options for handling network partitions in RabbitMQ: 'ignore', 'pause_minority', and 'autoheal'. Each list item describes when to use the respective mode. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/partitions.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```
  • ignore: use when network reliability is the highest practically possible and node availability is of topmost importance. For example, all cluster nodes can be in the same rack or equivalent, connected with a switch, and that switch is also the route to the outside world.
  • pause_minority: appropriate when clustering across racks or availability zones in a single region, and the probability of losing a majority of nodes (zones) at once is considered to be very low. This mode trades off some availability for the ability to automatically recover if/when the lost node(s) come back.
  • autoheal: appropriate when are more concerned with continuity of service than with data consistency across nodes.
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting User Limits DESCRIPTION: Configures connection and channel limits for specific users using JSON configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_59 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_user_limits limited_user '{"max-connections": 64}' ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_user_limits limited_user '{"max-channels": 16}' ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl clear_user_limits limited_user 'max-connections' ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_user_limits limited_user '{"max-connections": 0}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: JWT Token with Custom Scopes in Standard Scope Field DESCRIPTION: This JWT token example shows custom scopes in the standard 'scope' field. It includes 'api://rabbitmq:producer' and 'api://rabbitmq:Administrator' scopes that would be mapped to RabbitMQ permissions via scope aliases. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` { "sub": "producer", "scope": [ "api://rabbitmq:producer", "api://rabbitmq:Administrator" ], "aud": [ "rabbitmq" ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ Environment in YAML DESCRIPTION: Sets RabbitMQ environment configuration. The example sets the RABBITMQ_DISTRIBUTION_BUFFER_SIZE environment variable. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-operator/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiVersion: rabbitmq.com/v1beta1 kind: RabbitmqCluster metadata: name: rabbitmqcluster-sample spec: rabbitmq: envConfig: | RABBITMQ_DISTRIBUTION_BUFFER_SIZE=some_value ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Observer Interface DESCRIPTION: Command to start a CLI observer interface with configurable refresh interval SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics observer --interval 10 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Classic Cluster Node Discovery DESCRIPTION: Configuration for classic peer discovery backend, specifying the list of nodes to contact for clustering on first boot. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_42 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.classic_config.nodes.1 = rabbit@hostname1 cluster_formation.classic_config.nodes.2 = rabbit@hostname2 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Stream Filtering in Java DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to configure stream filtering for a RabbitMQ consumer using the Java client library. It specifies filter values and sets the option to match unfiltered messages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/amqp-client-libraries.md#2025-04-09_snippet_36 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` Consumer consumer = connection.consumerBuilder() .queue("some-stream") .stream() .filterValues("invoices", "orders") .filterMatchUnfiltered(true) .builder() .messageHandler((context, message) -> { // message processing }) .build(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Bunny Ruby Client for RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Installs the Bunny gem, which is the Ruby client for RabbitMQ, using Rubygems package manager. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-ruby.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` gem install bunny --version ">= 2.13.0" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Illustrating Credit Flow Grant Direction in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how credit is granted backward in the RabbitMQ processing chain. It demonstrates that the message store grants credit to the queue process, which then grants credit to the channel, which finally grants credit to the reader. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2015-10-06-new-credit-flow-settings-on-rabbitmq-3-5-5/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` reader <--[grant]-- channel <--[grant]-- queue process <--[grant]-- message store. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Generating CPU Flame Graph from perf Data with FlameGraph Tool DESCRIPTION: This command creates an SVG flame graph from folded stack samples. It sets the title for the graph and processes the stack trace data in out.folded_sched to generate a visual CPU flame graph. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2022-05-31-flame-graphs/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` ./FlameGraph/flamegraph.pl --title="CPU Flame Graph" out.folded_sched > cpu.svg ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Encrypting Configuration Values with RabbitMQ CLI (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the rabbitmqctl encode command to encrypt configuration values on Unix-like systems. It shows examples for encoding both Erlang binary and string values. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_46 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl encode '"amqp://fred:secret@host1.domain/my_vhost"' mypassphrase {encrypted,<<"... long encrypted value...">> ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying MacOS Firewall Command Help DESCRIPTION: Command to show available options and arguments for the socketfilterfw utility, which may vary between MacOS releases. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_37 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo /usr/libexec/ApplicationFirewall/socketfilterfw --help ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling HTTPS Transport for apt on Debian DESCRIPTION: Installs the apt-transport-https package to enable HTTPS transport for apt. This is necessary for downloading RabbitMQ and Erlang packages from secure repositories. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo apt-get install apt-transport-https ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Stream Publishers in RabbitMQ with bash DESCRIPTION: Command for displaying publisher information (connection PID, publisher ID, and stream) for RabbitMQ streams. This example shows how to retrieve specific publisher properties using the list_stream_publishers command. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmq-streams.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-streams list_stream_publishers connection_pid publisher_id stream ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Clearing Auth Backend Cache DESCRIPTION: Command to clear the authentication cache across all cluster nodes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/auth-cache-backend.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl clear_auth_backend_cache ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Verifying the New RabbitMQ Signing Key Signature DESCRIPTION: Command to check if the new RabbitMQ nightly signing key is signed by the old key. This helps validate the authenticity of the key transition. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/static/key-transition-0x0697F46E2DF405B6.txt#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` gpg --check-sigs 0xD441A9DDBA058EF7 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling HTTPS Transport for apt on Debian DESCRIPTION: Installs the apt-transport-https package to enable HTTPS transport for apt. This is necessary for downloading RabbitMQ and Erlang packages from secure repositories. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo apt-get install apt-transport-https ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Global TLS Options for RabbitMQ Erlang Client (Erlang) DESCRIPTION: Example of configuring global TLS options for the RabbitMQ Erlang client using the advanced.config file. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/uri-query-parameters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {amqp_client, [ {ssl_options, [ {cacertfile, "path-to-ca-certificate"}, {certfile, "path-to-certificate"}, {keyfile, "path-to-keyfile"}, {verify, verify_peer} ]} ]}. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using RabbitMQ CLI Tools for Server Management DESCRIPTION: Examples of RabbitMQ CLI tools for monitoring and managing the server. These commands check connectivity, status, cluster membership, and configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/install-rpm.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # checks if the local node is running and CLI tools can successfully authenticate with it sudo rabbitmq-diagnostics ping # prints enabled components (applications), TCP listeners, memory usage breakdown, alarms # and so on sudo rabbitmq-diagnostics status # prints cluster membership information sudo rabbitmq-diagnostics cluster_status # prints effective node configuration sudo rabbitmq-diagnostics environment ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Temporary Queue in Swift DESCRIPTION: Creates a non-durable, exclusive queue with a generated name using the RabbitMQ Swift client. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-swift.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Swift CODE: ``` var q = ch.queue("", options: .exclusive) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Quorum Queue WAL Segment Size in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Sets the maximum size of the write-ahead log (WAL) segment for quorum queues before it's flushed to disk. This affects how much message data can be kept in memory under steady load. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/persistence-conf.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # Flush current WAL file to a segment file on disk once it reaches 32 MiB in size raft.wal_max_size_bytes = 32000000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Server Certificate to Java Trust Store using keytool DESCRIPTION: This command imports a server certificate into a Java trust store using the keytool utility. The certificate is imported with the alias 'server1' into a keystore file named 'rabbitstore'. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` keytool -import -alias server1 -file /path/to/server_certificate.pem -keystore /path/to/rabbitstore ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Executing Stream Consumer in Java DESCRIPTION: Maven command to run a Java class that consumes messages from a RabbitMQ stream. The consumer demonstrates the ability to read messages with their metadata including creation time, content type, exchange, and routing key information. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2021-10-07-rabbitmq-streams-interoperability/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` ./mvnw -q compile exec:java -Dexec.mainClass='com.rabbitmq.stream.Interoperability$Consume' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complete .NET RabbitMQ TLS Connection Example DESCRIPTION: Full example demonstrating TLS connection setup, queue operations, and proper connection handling using the RabbitMQ .NET client. Shows creation of secure channel and basic queue operations. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` using System; using System.IO; using System.Text; using RabbitMQ.client; using RabbitMQ.Util; namespace RabbitMQ.client.Examples { public class TestSSL { public static int Main(string[] args) { ConnectionFactory cf = new ConnectionFactory(); cf.Ssl.Enabled = true; cf.Ssl.ServerName = System.Net.Dns.GetHostName(); cf.Ssl.CertPath = "/path/to/client_key.p12"; cf.Ssl.CertPassphrase = "MySecretPassword"; using (IConnection conn = cf.CreateConnection()) { using (IModel ch = conn.CreateModel()) { Console.WriteLine("Successfully connected and opened a channel"); ch.QueueDeclare("rabbitmq-dotnet-test", false, false, false, null); Console.WriteLine("Successfully declared a queue"); ch.QueueDelete("rabbitmq-dotnet-test"); Console.WriteLine("Successfully deleted the queue"); } } return 0; } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Viewing RabbitMQ Service Logs DESCRIPTION: Commands for accessing and filtering RabbitMQ service logs using journalctl on systemd-based systems. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_32 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` journalctl --system ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo journalctl --system | grep rabbitmq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking RabbitMQ HTTP API Listeners DESCRIPTION: Command to inspect configured HTTP API listeners using rabbitmq-diagnostics tool. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics -s listeners # => Interface: [::], port: 15672, protocol: http, purpose: HTTP API # => Interface: [::], port: 15671, protocol: https, purpose: HTTP API over TLS (HTTPS) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing MQTT WebSocket Client DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code to initialize and configure the MQTT WebSocket client using the Paho library SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/web-mqtt.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` var wsbroker = location.hostname; // mqtt websocket enabled broker var wsport = 15675; // port for above var client = new Paho.MQTT.Client(wsbroker, wsport, "/ws", "myclientid_" + parseInt(Math.random() * 100, 10)); client.onConnectionLost = function (responseObject) { debug("CONNECTION LOST - " + responseObject.errorMessage); }; client.onMessageArrived = function (message) { debug("RECEIVE ON " + message.destinationName + " PAYLOAD " + message.payloadString); print_first(message.payloadString); }; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Custom Log File Name in rabbitmq.conf DESCRIPTION: Configuration example showing how to override the default log file name in the rabbitmq.conf file.
