SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.file = rabbit.log ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling File Logging in rabbitmq.conf DESCRIPTION: Configuration example showing how to deactivate logging to a file in the rabbitmq.conf file. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.file = false ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining AMQP URI Syntax using ABNF DESCRIPTION: This ABNF snippet defines the syntax rules for AMQP URIs, including the structure for authority, userinfo, username, password, and vhost components. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/uri-spec.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ABNF CODE: ``` amqp_URI = "amqp://" amqp_authority [ "/" vhost ] [ "?" query ] amqp_authority = [ amqp_userinfo "@" ] host [ ":" port ] amqp_userinfo = username [ ":" password ] username = *( unreserved / pct-encoded / sub-delims ) password = *( unreserved / pct-encoded / sub-delims ) vhost = segment ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Custom Log Message Format without PID in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration for a custom log message format that omits process ID. This creates a more compact log format but removes information that can be essential for troubleshooting. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_44 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # '$time [$level] $pid $msg' is the default format log.console.formatter.plaintext.format = $level $time $msg ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Getting Help for Specific Command in rabbitmqadmin DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to get help for a specific command in rabbitmqadmin v2. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin declare queue --help ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Viewing Git Tags for RabbitMQ Releases DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to list all version tags in a RabbitMQ repository using git tag command. This helps identify available release versions. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/src/pages/github.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` git tag # omitted for brevity # => v3.13.0 # => v3.12.13 # => v3.12.12 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Cipher Suites in Classic Config Format for RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Example configuration for TLS cipher suites using the classic Erlang term config format in RabbitMQ. Shows how to specify allowed cipher suites with proper quotation marks. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_38 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` %% list allowed ciphers [ {ssl, [{versions, ['tlsv1.2', 'tlsv1.1']}]}, {rabbit, [ {ssl_listeners, [5671]}, {ssl_options, [{cacertfile,"/path/to/ca_certificate.pem"}, {certfile, "/path/to/server_certificate.pem"}, {keyfile, "/path/to/server_key.pem"}, {versions, ['tlsv1.2', 'tlsv1.1']}, %% This list is just an example! %% Not all cipher suites are available on all machines. %% Cipher suite order is important: preferred suites %% should be listed first. %% Different suites have different security and CPU load characteristics. {ciphers, [ "ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384", "ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384", "ECDH-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384", "ECDH-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384", "DHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384", "DHE-DSS-AES256-GCM-SHA384", "ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256", "ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256", "ECDH-ECDSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256", "ECDH-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256", "DHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256", "DHE-DSS-AES128-GCM-SHA256" ]} ]} ]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Feature Flags via Environment Variable DESCRIPTION: Example of setting the RABBITMQ_FEATURE_FLAGS environment variable to specify which feature flags should be enabled when a new node starts for the first time. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/feature-flags/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # this is just an example, in practice this list will be much longer RABBITMQ_FEATURE_FLAGS=quorum_queue,implicit_default_bindings ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Dead Letter Exchange in Java DESCRIPTION: Sets up a dead letter exchange for a queue using the Java client. Messages that expire or are dropped due to queue length limits will be sent to this exchange instead of being discarded completely. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2014-01-23-preventing-unbounded-buffers-with-rabbitmq/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` channel.exchangeDeclare("some.exchange.name", "direct"); Map args = new HashMap(); args.put("x-dead-letter-exchange", "some.exchange.name"); channel.queueDeclare("myqueue", false, false, false, args); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Shovel via HTTP API Request Body DESCRIPTION: JSON payload for creating a new shovel through the HTTP API, defining source and destination parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/shovel-dynamic.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` { "value": { "src-protocol": "amqp091", "src-uri": "amqp://localhost", "src-queue": "source-queue", "dest-protocol": "amqp091", "dest-uri": "amqp://remote.rabbitmq.local", "dest-queue": "destination-queue" } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Heartbeat Configuration DESCRIPTION: Connection heartbeat timeout configuration SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` heartbeat = 60 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Federation Upstream in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: Command to set federation upstream parameters using rabbitmqctl in PowerShell. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/federation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat set_parameter federation-upstream my-upstream ` '"{""uri"":""amqps://target.hostname:5671?cacertfile=drive:\path\to\ca_bundle.pem&certfile=drive:\path\to\client_certificate.pem&keyfile=drive:\path\to\client_key.pem&verify=verify_none"",""expires"":3600000}"' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring management plugin cache multiplier in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Setting that affects caching duration for expensive management queries. The cache will multiply the elapsed query time by this value to determine the cache duration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_35 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.db_cache_multiplier = 5 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Quorum Queue Health in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to verify if quorum queues will maintain their quorum if a node is shut down. Exits with non-zero code if quorum would be lost. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/upgrade.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics check_if_node_is_quorum_critical ``` LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics.bat check_if_node_is_quorum_critical ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Stream Consumers in RabbitMQ using CLI DESCRIPTION: This command lists all stream consumers in a virtual host, showing details such as connection PID, stream name, messages consumed, active status, and activity status. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2022-07-05-rabbitmq-3-11-feature-preview-single-active-consumer-for-streams/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` docker exec rabbitmq rabbitmqctl list_stream_consumers \ connection_pid,stream,messages_consumed,active,activity_status ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Heartbeat Timeout in Java Client DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to set the heartbeat timeout to 60 seconds using the Java client for RabbitMQ. It uses the ConnectionFactory class to configure the requested heartbeat value before creating a connection. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/heartbeats.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` ConnectionFactory cf = new ConnectionFactory(); // set the heartbeat timeout to 60 seconds cf.setRequestedHeartbeat(60); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Essential Dependencies for RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: These commands update the package lists and install curl and gnupg, which are prerequisites for downloading signing keys and packages over HTTPS. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo apt-get update -y sudo apt-get install curl gnupg -y ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Double Hyphen to Separate Options from Positional Arguments DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to use the double hyphen (--) to explicitly separate options from positional arguments, ensuring values starting with hyphens are treated correctly. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl add_user --node rabbit@host1.messaging.eng.coolcorporation.banana -- "a-user" "a-pa$$w0rd" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying RabbitMQ ERL_MAX_PORTS Value DESCRIPTION: Command to check the effective ERL_MAX_PORTS value of a RabbitMQ node using rabbitmqctl. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl eval 'erlang:system_info(port_limit).' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Limiting Inter-node Communication to IPv4 Loopback DESCRIPTION: RabbitMQ configuration to restrict inter-node communication to the IPv4 loopback interface, suitable only for single-node deployments. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # Limit inter-node communication listener to a local interface (using an IPv4 address). # # This particular configuration only makes sense for single-node clusters. # For multi-node clusters, nodes must listen on an "internal network-local" interface # that would allow cluster peers to connect but not be exposed to the public Internet distribution.listener.interface = 127.0.0.1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Event Stream Processing with jq DESCRIPTION: Command to consume internal events and process them through jq JSON processor. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_38 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics consume_event_stream | jq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring OAuth 2.0 Issuer in RabbitMQ (INI) DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to configure the OAuth 2.0 issuer URL in RabbitMQ using the INI format. It sets the resource server ID and the issuer URL. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_oauth2.resource_server_id = my_rabbit_server auth_oauth2.issuer = https://my-idp-provider/somerealm ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Managing Virtual Host Parameters via RabbitMQ HTTP API DESCRIPTION: HTTP API endpoints for setting, deleting, and retrieving virtual host-scoped parameters in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/parameters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` PUT /api/parameters/{component_name}/{vhost}/{name} DELETE /api/parameters/{component_name}/{vhost}/{name} GET /api/parameters ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using rabbitmq-diagnostics to Check Configuration Status DESCRIPTION: Command for using rabbitmq-diagnostics to verify the configuration files being used by a local RabbitMQ node. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # displays key rabbitmq-diagnostics status ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Minimal JWT Token Structure for RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This shows the minimal JWT token structure that RabbitMQ can validate. It includes an empty standard scope array, a custom scope field with management tag, and the audience claim set to 'rabbitmq'. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` { "scope": [ ], "extra_scope": [ "rabbitmq.tag:management" ], "aud": [ "rabbitmq" ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Clearing Topic Permissions in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Removes topic permissions for a specific user on a given exchange in a virtual host. This command is used to revoke a user's access to publish or consume messages from a topic exchange. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_24 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl clear_topic_permissions -p my-vhost janeway amq.topic ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Connecting to OpenSSL s_server with s_client DESCRIPTION: Command to connect to the OpenSSL s_server using s_client, specifying client certificates and verification options. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/troubleshooting-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` openssl s_client -connect localhost:8443 \ -cert client_certificate.pem -key client_key.pem -CAfile ca_certificate.pem \ -verify 8 -verify_hostname CN_NAME ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TLS for LDAP Connections in RabbitMQ (INI format) DESCRIPTION: This configuration snippet enables TLS for LDAP connections in RabbitMQ and disables peer verification for simplicity (not recommended for production). SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_ldap.servers.1 = ldap.eng.megacorp.local auth_ldap.servers.2 = 192.168.0.100 # enables TLS for connections to the LDAP server auth_ldap.use_ssl = true # Disables peer certificate chain verification. See the section on Peer Verification # below. # # Doing so loses one of the key benefits of TLS and make the setup less secure # but also simplifies node configuration. auth_ldap.ssl_options.verify = verify_none ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Multiple OAuth 2.0 Resources in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Basic configuration for setting up two OAuth 2.0 resources (rabbit_prod and rabbit_dev) in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples-multiresource.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_oauth2.resource_servers.1.id = rabbit_prod auth_oauth2.resource_servers.2.id = rabbit_dev ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying RabbitMQ Broker Status DESCRIPTION: Shows detailed status information about the RabbitMQ broker, including running applications, versions, OS details, and resource statistics. The command uses the 'status' action without any additional parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_45 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl status ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Virtual Host Protection from Deletion Using CLI DESCRIPTION: Command that removes the deletion protection from a RabbitMQ virtual host using the rabbitmqctl command line tool, allowing it to be deleted. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ## removes virtual host deletion protection rabbitmqctl disable_vhost_protection_from_deletion "vhost-name" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic HTTP Backend Cache Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration example for caching HTTP backend authentication requests. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/auth-cache-backend.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_backends.1 = cache auth_cache.cached_backend = http auth_http.http_method = post ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing RabbitMQ Queues (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Uses rabbitmqctl to list queues, their types, and message counts. This command helps verify the number of messages published to the stream queue. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2022-05-31-flame-graphs/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ./sbin/rabbitmqctl list_queues name type messages --formatter=pretty_table ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Custom Encryption Settings in advanced.config DESCRIPTION: Example of configuring custom encryption settings in RabbitMQ's advanced.config file, including cipher type, hash function, and iteration count. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_56 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [ {rabbit, [ ... {config_entry_decoder, [ {passphrase, "mypassphrase"}, {cipher, blowfish_cfb64}, {hash, sha256}, {iterations, 10000} ]} ]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Memory Breakdown Output Example DESCRIPTION: Example output from rabbitmq-diagnostics memory_breakdown command showing memory allocation across different categories including quorum queues, binary data, connections, and system components. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/memory-use/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` quorum_queue_procs: 0.4181 gb (28.8%) binary: 0.4129 gb (28.44%) allocated_unused: 0.1959 gb (13.49%) connection_other: 0.1894 gb (13.05%) plugins: 0.0373 gb (2.57%) other_proc: 0.0325 gb (2.24%) code: 0.0305 gb (2.1%) quorum_ets: 0.0303 gb (2.09%) connection_readers: 0.0222 gb (1.53%) other_system: 0.0209 gb (1.44%) connection_channels: 0.017 gb (1.17%) mgmt_db: 0.017 gb (1.17%) metrics: 0.0109 gb (0.75%) other_ets: 0.0073 gb (0.5%) connection_writers: 0.007 gb (0.48%) atom: 0.0015 gb (0.11%) mnesia: 0.0006 gb (0.04%) msg_index: 0.0002 gb (0.01%) queue_procs: 0.0002 gb (0.01%) reserved_unallocated: 0.0 gb (0.0%) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing RabbitMQ Queues on Windows DESCRIPTION: Command to list RabbitMQ queues using rabbitmqctl tool on Windows systems. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-ruby.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat list_queues ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring message store file size limit in RabbitMQ (advanced) DESCRIPTION: Advanced configuration for message store segment file size. Changing this for a node with an existing database is dangerous and can lead to data loss. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_53 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {rabbit, [ %% Changing this for a node %% with an existing (initialised) database is dangerous and can %% lead to data loss! {msg_store_file_size_limit, 16777216} ]} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling RabbitMQ Prometheus Plugin DESCRIPTION: Command to enable the rabbitmq_prometheus plugin for Prometheus-compatible metric collection. This plugin is recommended for production environments due to its low overhead. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/monitoring/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_prometheus ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Essential Dependencies for RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: These commands update the package lists and install curl and gnupg, which are prerequisites for downloading signing keys and packages over HTTPS. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo apt-get update -y sudo apt-get install curl gnupg -y ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Increasing Atom Limit via Environment Variable DESCRIPTION: Alternative approach to increase the atom limit to 9 million using the environment variable for environments with large numbers of quorum queues. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/runtime.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` RABBITMQ_MAX_NUMBER_OF_ATOMS=9000000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ Shovel from AMQP 1.0 to AMQP 0.9.1 DESCRIPTION: Configuration example for transferring messages from an AMQP 1.0 source to an AMQP 0.9.1 destination. Specifies connection parameters, message handling settings, and destination exchange declarations. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/shovel-static.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {rabbitmq_shovel, [ {shovels, [ {my_first_shovel, [ {source, [ {protocol, amqp10}, {uris, [ "amqp://fred:secret@host1.domain/my_vhost", ]}, {source_address, <<"my-source">>}, {prefetch_count, 10} ]}, {destination, [ {protocol, amqp091}, {uris, ["amqp://"]}, {declarations, [ {'exchange.declare', [ {exchange, <<"my_direct">>}, {type, <<"direct">>}, durable ]} ]}, {publish_properties, [ {delivery_mode, 2} ]}, {add_forward_headers, true}, {publish_fields, [ {exchange, <<"my_direct">>}, {routing_key, <<"from_shovel">>} ]} ]}, {ack_mode, on_confirm}, {reconnect_delay, 5} ]} ]} ]} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Mixed Authentication and Authorization Backends in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This example configures RabbitMQ to use the internal database for authentication and the source IP range backend for authorization. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # rabbitmq.conf # auth_backends.1.authn = internal # uses module name because this backend is from a 3rd party auth_backends.1.authz = rabbit_auth_backend_ip_range ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configure Virtual Host Queue Limits DESCRIPTION: Commands to set and manage queue limits for a virtual host SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_vhost_limits -p vhost_name '{"max-queues": 1024}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Debug Log Level at Runtime in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to switch to debug log level at runtime using rabbitmqctl. This allows changing log verbosity without restarting the service. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_35 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl -n rabbit@target-host set_log_level debug ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying RabbitMQ Queue Leader Information DESCRIPTION: This command lists the queues and their leaders using the RabbitMQ CLI tool. It's used to determine which node became the new leader after a change in the cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2022-03-29-at-least-once-dead-lettering/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: zsh CODE: ``` kubectl exec my-rabbit-server-1 -c rabbitmq -- rabbitmqctl list_queues --formatter=pretty_table --quiet name leader ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Connection Authentication Log Example DESCRIPTION: Example log entry showing successful user authentication and virtual host access grant. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_34 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` 2018-11-22 10:44:33.663 [info] <0.620.0> connection <0.620.0> (127.0.0.1:52771 -> 127.0.0.1:5672): user 'guest' authenticated and granted access to vhost '/' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Log Levels via RabbitMQ CLI DESCRIPTION: Command-line instructions for dynamically changing log levels in a running RabbitMQ instance. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_29 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl -n rabbit@target-host set_log_level debug ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl -n rabbit@target-host set_log_level info ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sample Retention Policy Configuration DESCRIPTION: Defines data retention policies for different types of statistics and time ranges SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_31 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.sample_retention_policies.global.minute = 5 management.sample_retention_policies.global.hour = 60 management.sample_retention_policies.global.day = 1200 management.sample_retention_policies.basic.minute = 5 management.sample_retention_policies.basic.hour = 60 management.sample_retention_policies.detailed.10 = 5 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Configuration File Location for a Specific Node DESCRIPTION: This bash command uses rabbitmq-diagnostics with the -n option to check the configuration file location for a specific RabbitMQ node, including remote nodes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics status -n [node name] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Including MQTT WebSocket Client Library DESCRIPTION: HTML script tag to include the Paho MQTT JavaScript client library. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/web-mqtt.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Publishers with Different Targets in Java DESCRIPTION: Examples of creating publishers in Java with different target types: publishing to an exchange with a routing key, to an exchange without a routing key, and directly to a queue. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/amqp-client-libraries.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: Java CODE: ``` // publish to an exchange with a routing key Publisher publisher1 = connection.publisherBuilder() .exchange("foo").key("bar") // /exchanges/foo/bar .build(); // publish to an exchange without a routing key Publisher publisher2 = connection.publisherBuilder() .exchange("foo") // /exchanges/foo .build(); // publish to a queue Publisher publisher3 = connection.publisherBuilder() .queue("some-queue") // /queues/some-queue .build(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Configuration Status for a Specific RabbitMQ Node DESCRIPTION: Command for using rabbitmq-diagnostics to check the configuration status of a specific node, including remote nodes, using the -n switch. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics status -n [node name] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Static Service Address for RabbitMQ Consul Peer Discovery DESCRIPTION: Sets a static service address to be registered with Consul instead of auto-computing it. This allows explicit control over how RabbitMQ nodes are discovered by peers. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = consul cluster_formation.consul.host = consul.eng.example.local cluster_formation.consul.svc = rabbitmq # do not compute service address, it will be specified below cluster_formation.consul.svc_addr_auto = false # service address, will be communicated to other nodes cluster_formation.consul.svc_addr = hostname1.rmq.eng.example.local # use long RabbitMQ node names? cluster_formation.consul.use_longname = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting PerfTest Producer with OAuth Client DESCRIPTION: This command starts a PerfTest producer application authenticated using the OAuth client 'producer_with_roles', which has permissions mapped from custom scopes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_27 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make start-perftest-producer PRODUCER=producer_with_roles ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Feature Branch in Git for RabbitMQ Development DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create a new feature branch using Git checkout. The branch naming convention follows 'repository-name-NN' pattern where NN is the GitHub issue number. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/src/pages/github.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` git checkout -b ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Memory Calculation Strategy in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Default configuration for memory usage reporting strategy, which determines how memory consumption is calculated. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` vm_memory_calculation_strategy = rss ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: LDAP Other Bind in Classic Config Format DESCRIPTION: Example of setting LDAP other bind configuration using classic configuration format. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [ {rabbitmq_auth_backend_ldap, [ {other_bind, {"a-username", "a-password"}} ]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting AMQP 1.0 Application Properties DESCRIPTION: Adds custom application properties when republishing messages in AMQP 1.0. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/shovel-static.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {application_properties, [ {<<"application-key-1">>, <<"value-1">>}, {<<"application-key-2">>, <<"value-2">>} ]} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting mirroring synchronization batch size in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration for the batch size used to transfer messages to an unsynchronized replica (queue mirror) during eager batch synchronization. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_48 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` mirroring_sync_batch_size = 4096 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Expanded Form of Do-Notation DESCRIPTION: The expanded form of the do-notation, showing how it's transformed into nested monadic bind operations with function composition, giving the monad complete control over execution flow. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2011-05-17-can-you-hear-the-drums-erlando/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` Monad:'>>='(foo(), fun (A) -> Monad:'>>='(bar(A, dog), fun (B) -> ok end)). ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ Connection with TLS and Disabled Peer Verification (INI) DESCRIPTION: Example of a RabbitMQ connection URI with TLS enabled but peer verification disabled, specifying certificate files and server name indication. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/uri-query-parameters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` amqps://myhost?cacertfile=/path/to/ca_certificate.pem &certfile=/path/to/client_certificate.pem &keyfile=/path/to/client_key.pem &verify=verify_none &server_name_indication=myhost ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Formatting Feature Flags Output with Pretty Tables DESCRIPTION: Shows how to improve the readability of feature flag information by using the pretty_table formatter and selecting specific columns to display. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/feature-flags/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl -q --formatter pretty_table list_feature_flags \ name state provided_by desc doc_url ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring Feature Flag in Erlang DESCRIPTION: Example of how to declare a feature flag as a module attribute for quorum queues, including description, documentation URL, stability status and migration function reference. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/feature-flags/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` -rabbit_feature_flag( {quorum_queue, #{desc => "Support queues of type quorum", doc_url => "https://www.rabbitmq.com/docs/quorum-queues", stability => stable, migration_fun => {?MODULE, quorum_queue_migration} }}). ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Overflow Behavior Policy with rabbitmqctl (Bash) DESCRIPTION: This command sets a policy named 'my-pol' that limits the 'two-messages' queue to 2 messages and sets the overflow behavior to reject new publishes using rabbitmqctl in Bash. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/maxlength/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy my-pol "^two-messages$" \ '{"max-length":2,"overflow":"reject-publish"}' \ --apply-to queues ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Handling Positional Arguments That Start with Hyphens DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to handle special cases where positional arguments (like passwords) start with hyphens or double hyphens, using the explicit positional argument separator. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl add_user --node rabbit@host1.messaging.eng.coolcorporation.banana -- "a-user" "--!a-pa$$w0rd" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Exploring Commands in a Specific Group DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to get help for commands within a specific command group. This helps users understand what operations are available in each category. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin {group name} help ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling RabbitMQ Server as a System Service on Linux with systemctl DESCRIPTION: Command to enable the RabbitMQ server as a system service that automatically starts at boot time. This must be run with administrator privileges. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-rpm.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` systemctl enable rabbitmq-server ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic OAuth 2.0 Provider Configuration in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This shows the standard configuration for a single OAuth 2.0 provider in RabbitMQ, specifying the resource server ID, scope prefix, issuer URL, and TLS certificate location for secure connections. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_oauth2.resource_server_id = rabbitmq-prod auth_oauth2.scope_prefix = rabbitmq. auth_oauth2.issuer = https://prodkeycloak:8080/realm/prod auth_oauth2.https.cacertfile = /opts/certs/prodcacert.pem ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting RabbitMQ with OAuth2 DESCRIPTION: Command to start RabbitMQ with OAuth2 authentication mode enabled SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/oauth2-examples-proxy.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` MODE=oauth2-proxy make start-rabbitmq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating RabbitMQ User DESCRIPTION: Command to create a new non-administrative user in RabbitMQ with a specified username and password. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl add_user janeway changeit ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Resource Access Query Example DESCRIPTION: Example of a complex resource access query using boolean operations to control access based on username and object name. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_38 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {resource_access_query, {'or', [{'and', [{equals, "${name}", "test1"}, {equals, "${username}", "user1"}]}, {'and', [{equals, "${name}", "test2"}, {'not', {equals, "${username}", "user1"}}]} ]}} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Handling Returned Messages in RabbitMQ Erlang Client DESCRIPTION: Example of handling undeliverable messages that are returned by the broker. This is useful for messages published with immediate or mandatory flags that couldn't be routed to any queue. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/erlang-client-user-guide.md#2025-04-09_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` amqp_channel:register_return_handler(Channel, self()), amqp_channel:call(Channel, #'exchange.declare'{exchange = X}), Publish = #'basic.publish'{exchange = X, routing_key = SomeKey, mandatory = true}, amqp_channel:call(Channel, Publish, #amqp_msg{payload = Payload}), receive {BasicReturn, Content} -> #'basic.return'{reply_text = <<"unroutable">>, exchange = X} = BasicReturn %% Do something with the returned message end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Managing RabbitMQ Listeners with rabbitmqctl DESCRIPTION: Commands to suspend and resume listener connections on RabbitMQ nodes. Shows how to target specific nodes in a cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # suspends listeners on node rabbit@node2.cluster.rabbitmq.svc: it won't accept any new client connections rabbitmqctl suspend_listeners -n rabbit@node2.cluster.rabbitmq.svc ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl resume_listeners ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # resumes listeners on node rabbit@node2.cluster.rabbitmq.svc: it will accept new client connections again rabbitmqctl resume_listeners -n rabbit@node2.cluster.rabbitmq.svc ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Default Account Configuration DESCRIPTION: Default virtual host and user account settings SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` default_vhost = / ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` default_user = guest ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` default_pass = guest ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` default_user_tags.administrator = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Default User Tags in RabbitMQ (INI) DESCRIPTION: Default tags for the default user, granting administrator privileges by default. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_37 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` default_user_tags.administrator = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Memory High Watermark in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This command sets the memory high watermark to 0, effectively blocking all publishing in a RabbitMQ cluster by triggering a resource alarm. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/publishers/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_vm_memory_high_watermark 0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring Exchanges and Queues with Alternate Exchange in Java DESCRIPTION: This Java code snippet demonstrates how to declare exchanges and queues with an Alternate Exchange. It creates a direct exchange 'my-direct' with an AE 'my-ae', declares 'my-ae' as a fanout exchange, and sets up queues and bindings. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ae.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` Map args = new HashMap(); args.put("alternate-exchange", "my-ae"); channel.exchangeDeclare("my-direct", "direct", false, false, args); channel.exchangeDeclare("my-ae", "fanout"); channel.queueDeclare("routed"); channel.queueBind("routed", "my-direct", "key1"); channel.queueDeclare("unrouted"); channel.queueBind("unrouted", "my-ae", ""); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Queue Length Policy on Windows DESCRIPTION: Windows-specific command to set a queue size limit policy using rabbitmqctl.bat. Sets 1MiB limit with proper Windows command escaping. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/maxlength/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat set_policy my-pol "^one-meg$" ^ "{""max-length-bytes"":1048576}" ^ --apply-to queues ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Verifying Package Signatures with GPG DESCRIPTION: Command to verify a RabbitMQ package signature using GPG. This requires the signature file (.asc) and the corresponding package file. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/signatures.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` gpg --verify [filename].asc [filename] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Federation Status Check Commands DESCRIPTION: Commands to check federation status and policy application. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/federation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_exchanges name policy | grep federate-me # This command will be available only if federation plugin is enabled rabbitmqctl federation_status ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Erlando Parse Transformers in Erlang Module DESCRIPTION: Shows how to add the necessary -compile attributes to enable Erlando's parse transformers in an Erlang module. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2011-05-17-can-you-hear-the-drums-erlando/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` -module(test). -compile({parse_transform, cut}). -compile({parse_transform, do}). ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting cluster keepalive interval in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration for how frequently nodes should send keepalive messages to other nodes in milliseconds. This is distinct from net_ticktime. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_44 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_keepalive_interval = 10000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Allowing Basic Authentication Alongside OAuth 2.0 for RabbitMQ Management UI (INI) DESCRIPTION: Configuration to allow both OAuth 2.0 and Basic Authentication in the RabbitMQ management UI. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.oauth_disable_basic_auth = false ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Configuration for MQTT Benchmarks DESCRIPTION: Configuration file (rabbitmq.conf) used for the MQTT latency and throughput benchmarks. It includes settings for MQTT and classic queue optimization. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2023-03-21-native-mqtt/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` mqtt.mailbox_soft_limit = 0 mqtt.tcp_listen_options.nodelay = true mqtt.tcp_listen_options.backlog = 128 mqtt.tcp_listen_options.sndbuf = 87380 mqtt.tcp_listen_options.recbuf = 87380 mqtt.tcp_listen_options.buffer = 87380 classic_queue.default_version = 2 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Testing TLS Connection to RabbitMQ Node DESCRIPTION: Command to test TLS connection establishment directly with a RabbitMQ node on port 5671. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/troubleshooting-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` openssl s_client -connect localhost:5671 -cert client_certificate.pem -key client_key.pem -CAfile ca_certificate.pem ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Login Session Timeout for RabbitMQ Management UI DESCRIPTION: Configuration to set the login session timeout for the RabbitMQ Management UI. The value in minutes controls how long a user stays logged in before being automatically signed out. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_40 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.login_session_timeout = 60 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Reinstalling RabbitMQ Homebrew Formula DESCRIPTION: Sequence of commands to completely uninstall and reinstall RabbitMQ using Homebrew, including removal of data directories and configuration files. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-homebrew.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` brew services stop rabbitmq brew uninstall rabbitmq # Now delete all node's data directories and configuration files. # This assumes that Homebrew root is at /opt/homebrew rm -rf /opt/homebrew/etc/rabbitmq/ rm -rf /opt/homebrew/opt/rabbitmq/ rm -rf /opt/homebrew/var/lib/rabbitmq/ # the launch agent file rm -f $HOME/Library/LaunchAgents/homebrew.mxcl.rabbitmq.plist # re-install brew install rabbitmq ## start the service if necessary # brew services start rabbitmq ## after starting the service, enable all feature flags # /opt/homebrew/sbin/rabbitmqctl enable_feature_flag all ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Federation Status Check Commands DESCRIPTION: Commands to check federation status and policy application. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/federation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_exchanges name policy | grep federate-me # This command will be available only if federation plugin is enabled rabbitmqctl federation_status ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Connection States for MQTT Connections DESCRIPTION: Possible connection states for MQTT connections that can be returned by the list_mqtt_connections command when querying connection_state information. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_74 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` starting running blocked ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding RabbitMQ Repository for Debian Bookworm DESCRIPTION: This bash script adds the RabbitMQ and Erlang package repositories to the apt sources list for Debian Bookworm. It includes both primary and redundant mirror URLs for improved availability. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/rabbitmq.list < connection <0.620.0> (127.0.0.1:52771 -> 127.0.0.1:5672): user 'guest' authenticated and granted access to vhost '/' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing RabbitMQ Connection Information via HTTP API DESCRIPTION: Endpoints for retrieving information about connections to RabbitMQ. These provide similar data to the rabbitmqctl list_connections command but with node instead of pid field. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_33 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` /api/connections ``` LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` /api/connections/(name) ``` LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` /api/connections/(name)/channels ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Verifying File Descriptor Limits for RabbitMQ Process DESCRIPTION: This bash command displays the effective limits of a running RabbitMQ process. It requires the process ID of the Erlang VM running RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cat /proc/$RABBITMQ_BEAM_PROCESS_PID/limits ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring WebSocket Frame Type for RabbitMQ Web STOMP DESCRIPTION: Configuration to switch the WebSocket endpoint from the default UTF-8 text mode to binary mode for handling binary messages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/web-stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` web_stomp.ws_frame = binary ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Advanced TLS Options for Web STOMP DESCRIPTION: INI configuration for advanced TLS options, including cipher suites and TLS versions. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/web-stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` web_stomp.ssl.port = 15673 web_stomp.ssl.backlog = 1024 web_stomp.ssl.certfile = /path/to/server_certificate.pem web_stomp.ssl.keyfile = /path/to/server_key.pem web_stomp.ssl.cacertfile = /path/to/ca_certificate_bundle.pem web_stomp.ssl.password = changeme web_stomp.ssl.honor_cipher_order = true web_stomp.ssl.honor_ecc_order = true web_stomp.ssl.client_renegotiation = false web_stomp.ssl.secure_renegotiate = true web_stomp.ssl.versions.1 = tlsv1.2 web_stomp.ssl.versions.2 = tlsv1.1 web_stomp.ssl.ciphers.1 = ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 web_stomp.ssl.ciphers.2 = ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 web_stomp.ssl.ciphers.3 = ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-SHA384 web_stomp.ssl.ciphers.4 = ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA384 web_stomp.ssl.ciphers.5 = ECDH-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 web_stomp.ssl.ciphers.6 = ECDH-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 web_stomp.ssl.ciphers.7 = ECDH-ECDSA-AES256-SHA384 web_stomp.ssl.ciphers.8 = ECDH-RSA-AES256-SHA384 web_stomp.ssl.ciphers.9 = DHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Publishers with Different Targets in Go DESCRIPTION: Examples of creating publishers in Go with different target types: publishing to an exchange with a routing key, to an exchange without a routing key, and directly to a queue. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/amqp-client-libraries.md#2025-04-09_snippet_20 LANGUAGE: Go CODE: ``` // publish to an exchange with a routing key publisher, err := connection.NewPublisher(context.Background(), &ExchangeAddress{ Exchange: "foo", Key: "bar", }, nil) // publish to an exchange without a routing key publisher, err := connection.NewPublisher(context.Background(), &ExchangeAddress{ Exchange: "foo", }, nil) // publish to a queue publisher, err := connection.NewPublisher(context.Background(), &QueueAddress{ Queue: "some-queue"}, nil) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing RabbitMQ Server Version Component in JSX DESCRIPTION: This code snippet imports the RabbitMQServerVersion component from a specific path. This component is likely used to display the current RabbitMQ server version dynamically in the documentation. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/whats-new.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` import { RabbitMQServerVersion, } from '@site/src/components/RabbitMQServer'; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Default Memory High Watermark in RabbitMQ (INI) DESCRIPTION: Default relative memory high watermark setting, which triggers flow control when the process uses more than 60% of available RAM. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` vm_memory_high_watermark.relative = 0.6 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing RabbitMQ Queues on Windows DESCRIPTION: Command to list all queues in RabbitMQ on Windows systems using the rabbitmqctl.bat script. Note that sudo is not used on Windows platforms. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-python.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat list_queues ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Complete RabbitMQ LDAP Authentication in Classic Format DESCRIPTION: Complete classic configuration format example that combines both authentication and authorization settings in a single file. This includes server connection, access queries, and permission rules. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_29 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [ {rabbit, [{auth_backends, [rabbit_auth_backend_ldap]}]}, {rabbitmq_auth_backend_ldap, [ {servers, ["my-ldap-server"]}, {user_dn_pattern, "cn=${username},ou=People,dc=example,dc=com"}, {use_ssl, false}, {port, 389}, {log, false}, {vhost_access_query, {in_group, "ou=${vhost}-users,ou=vhosts,dc=example,dc=com"}}, {resource_access_query, {for, [{permission, configure, {in_group, "cn=admin,dc=example,dc=com"}}, {permission, write, {for, [{resource, queue, {in_group, "cn=admin,dc=example,dc=com"}}, {resource, exchange, {constant, true}}]}}, {permission, read, {for, [{resource, exchange, {in_group, "cn=admin,dc=example,dc=com"}}, {resource, queue, {constant, true}}]}} ] }}, {topic_access_query, {for, [{permission, write, {match, {string, "${routing_key}"}, {string, "^a"}}}, {permission, read, {constant, true}} ] }}, {tag_queries, [{administrator, {constant, false}}, {management, {constant, true}}]} ] } ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing RabbitMQ Server Version Component in JSX DESCRIPTION: This code snippet imports the RabbitMQServerVersion component from a specific path. This component is likely used to display the current RabbitMQ server version dynamically in the documentation. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/whats-new.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` import { RabbitMQServerVersion, } from '@site/src/components/RabbitMQServer'; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running RabbitMQ Queue Size Check with rabbitmqctl DESCRIPTION: Bash command for listing queues after running the benchmark, showing the different message counts in classic and quorum queues between AMQP 0.9.1 and AMQP 1.0 protocols. This demonstrates how AMQP 1.0's link-level flow control allows higher throughput to faster queues. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2024-09-02-amqp-flow-control/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ./sbin/rabbitmqctl --silent list_queues name type messages --formatter=pretty_table ┌────────────────────────┬─────────┬──────────┐ │ name │ type │ messages │ ├────────────────────────┼─────────┼──────────┤ │ classic-queue-amqp-091 │ classic │ 159077 │ ├────────────────────────┼─────────┼──────────┤ │ quorum-queue-amqp-091 │ quorum │ 155782 │ ├────────────────────────┼─────────┼──────────┤ │ classic-queue-amqp-10 │ classic │ 1089075 │ ├────────────────────────┼─────────┼──────────┤ │ quorum-queue-amqp-10 │ quorum │ 148580 │ └────────────────────────┴─────────┴──────────┘ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Stream Producer with Filter Value in Java DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to configure a RabbitMQ stream producer with filter value extraction logic using the stream Java client. The filter value is extracted from the message's application properties. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2023-10-24-stream-filtering-internals/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` Producer producer = environment.producerBuilder() .stream("invoices") .filterValue(msg -> msg.getApplicationProperties().get("region").toString()) .build(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Specifying RabbitMQ Exchange Prefix Rule DESCRIPTION: Describes the rule for exchange names in RabbitMQ, where exchanges with the 'amq.' prefix cannot be declared or deleted, as per AMQP 0-9-1 specification. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/spec-differences.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` amq. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Soft File Descriptor Limit for RabbitMQ on Linux DESCRIPTION: This command sets the soft file descriptor limit to 4096 for the RabbitMQ server process. It should be added to the /etc/default/rabbitmq-server file or rabbitmq-env.conf to be applied before the service starts. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_61 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ulimit -S -n 4096 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting the amqp_client Erlang Application DESCRIPTION: Ensures that the amqp_client Erlang application is started. This must be done before attempting to use any functionality from the RabbitMQ Erlang client. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/erlang-client-user-guide.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` application:ensure_started(amqp_client). ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling TLS Certificate Authentication for STOMP DESCRIPTION: Configuration to enable authentication using TLS client certificates for STOMP connections. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` stomp.ssl_cert_login = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Applying Pod Disruption Budget Configuration DESCRIPTION: Bash command to apply the PodDisruptionBudget configuration to a Kubernetes cluster using kubectl. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-operator/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl apply -f rabbitmq-pdb.yaml ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting a User in RabbitMQ (Bash and PowerShell) DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to delete a user in RabbitMQ using the rabbitmqctl command in both Bash and PowerShell. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl delete_user 'username' ``` LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat delete_user 'username' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing a Migration Function for RabbitMQ Feature Flags in Erlang DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows the implementation of a migration function for a RabbitMQ feature flag. It handles both the enable and is_enabled cases, performing necessary table migrations and checks. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/feature-flags/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` quorum_queue_migration(FeatureName, _FeatureProps, enable) -> Tables = ?quorum_queue_tables, rabbit_table:wait(Tables), Fields = amqqueue:fields(amqqueue_v2), migrate_to_amqqueue_with_type(FeatureName, Tables, Fields); quorum_queue_migration(_FeatureName, _FeatureProps, is_enabled) -> Tables = ?quorum_queue_tables, rabbit_table:wait(Tables), Fields = amqqueue:fields(amqqueue_v2), mnesia:table_info(rabbit_queue, attributes) =:= Fields andalso mnesia:table_info(rabbit_durable_queue, attributes) =:= Fields. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Benchmarking Quorum Queues with perf-test in High Throughput Scenario DESCRIPTION: Shell command using perf-test to benchmark quorum queues performance with multiple message sizes. Similar configuration to classic queues test but using the quorum queue type option. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2022-05-16-rabbitmq-3.10-performance-improvements/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` # quorum queues perf-test --producers 2 --consumers 2 --confirm 3000 --multi-ack-every 3000 --qos 3000 \ --variable-size 10:900 --variable-size 100:900 --variable-size 1000:900 --variable-size 5000:900 \ --quorum-queue --queue qq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Enabled RabbitMQ Plugins DESCRIPTION: Lists all implicitly or explicitly enabled plugins containing 'rabbit' in their name. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmq-plugins.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins list -e rabbit ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Virtual Hosts in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Health check that verifies if all virtual hosts are running in the target node. This command is useful for ensuring the proper functioning of all configured virtual hosts. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics check_virtual_hosts --timeout 60 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Advanced OAuth 2.0 Provider Configuration in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This demonstrates how to configure an OAuth 2.0 provider using the oauth_providers configuration structure, which is more suitable when supporting multiple providers or advanced configurations. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_oauth2.resource_server_id = rabbitmq-prod auth_oauth2.scope_prefix = rabbitmq. auth_oauth2.default_oauth_provider = prodkeycloak auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.prodkeycloak.issuer = https://prodkeycloak:8080/realm/prod auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.prodkeycloak.https.cacertfile = /opts/certs/prodcacert.pem ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting RabbitMQ Docker Container with Okta Configuration DESCRIPTION: Commands to start a RabbitMQ Docker container configured to use Okta for OAuth 2.0 authentication. The MODE environment variable is set to 'okta' before running the container. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples-okta.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` export MODE=okta make start-rabbitmq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Global Parameter with Object Value in RabbitMQ API DESCRIPTION: JSON payload for setting a global runtime parameter with an object value. This example sets cluster tags with environment, availability zone, and region information. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "name": "cluster_tags", "value": { "environment": "production", "az": "us-east-3", "region": "us-east" } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Finding RabbitMQ Cluster Service Name in Kubernetes DESCRIPTION: Command to retrieve the service name and namespace for a RabbitMQ cluster from the custom resource status. This information is needed to connect applications to the RabbitMQ service. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-operator/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_32 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl get rabbitmqcluster INSTANCE \ -ojsonpath='Name: {.status.admin.serviceReference.name} -- Namespace: {.status.admin.serviceReference.namespace}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Federation Status Example Output DESCRIPTION: Example output from the federation_status command showing a federated exchange with its complete status information, including the type, name, vhost, connection details, and timestamp of the last status update. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/federation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # This command will be available only if federation plugin is enabled rabbitmqctl federation_status # => [[{type,<<"exchange">>}, # => {name,<<"my-exchange">>}, # => {vhost,<<"/">>}, # => {connection,<<"upstream-server">>}, # => {upstream_name,<<"my-upstream-x">>}, # => {status,{running,<<"">>}}, # => {timestamp,{{2020,3,1},{12,3,28}}}]] # => ...done. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Saving RabbitMQ Logs to File in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to run the receive_logs.go program and redirect its output to a log file. This demonstrates how to capture RabbitMQ messages in a file for later review. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-go.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` go run receive_logs.go &> logs_from_rabbit.log ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complete Classic Config Format TCP Settings DESCRIPTION: Comprehensive TCP configuration using the classic Erlang terms format, including kernel and rabbit application settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_27 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [ {kernel, [ {inet_default_connect_options, [{nodelay, true}]}, {inet_default_listen_options, [{nodelay, true}]} ]}, {rabbit, [ {tcp_listen_options, [ {backlog, 4096}, {nodelay, true}, {linger, {true,0}}, {exit_on_close, false} ]} ]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting kernel parameters dynamically with sysctl for RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to set Linux kernel parameters interactively using sysctl to increase the maximum number of file handles, which is important for systems handling many connections. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_33 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sysctl -w fs.file-max 200000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding a Stream Replica using RabbitMQ CLI DESCRIPTION: This command adds a new replica to a specified stream on a given node. It requires the virtual host, stream name, and target node as parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/streams.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-streams add_replica [-p ] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Identity-Provider Initiated Logon for OAuth DESCRIPTION: Configuration for Identity-Provider initiated logon to allow users to be automatically redirected to RabbitMQ without additional authentication flows. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.oauth_enabled = true management.oauth_initiated_logon_type = idp_initiated management.oauth_provider_url = https://my-web-portal ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Restarting a Stream in RabbitMQ using Bash DESCRIPTION: This command restarts a stream including all of its replicas. It allows specifying a preferred leader node during the restart. The stream name, virtual host, and preferred leader node are required parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmq-streams.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-streams restart_stream --vhost "a-vhost" "a-stream" --preferred-leader-node "node" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Traditional State Management in Erlang DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the traditional way of managing state in Erlang, which involves incrementally numbering variables. This approach can be cumbersome and error-prone when adding or removing lines of code. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2011-05-17-can-you-hear-the-drums-erlando/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` State1 = init(Dimensions), State2 = plant_seeds(SeedCount, State1), {DidFlood, State3} = pour_on_water(WaterVolume, State2), State4 = apply_sunlight(Time, State3), {DidFlood2, State5} = pour_on_water(WaterVolume, State4), {Crop, State6} = harvest(State5), ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Log Entry for Missing RabbitMQ Configuration File DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the log entry when RabbitMQ cannot find or read the specified configuration file. It shows the node name, home directory, and the missing config file path. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` node : rabbit@example home dir : /var/lib/rabbitmq config file(s) : /var/lib/rabbitmq/hare.conf (not found) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Identity-Provider Initiated Logon in RabbitMQ Management UI DESCRIPTION: Configuration example showing how to set up Identity-Provider initiated logon in the RabbitMQ Management UI. This configuration enables OAuth 2.0 authentication and configures it to use idp_initiated flow type with a specific provider URL. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.oauth_enabled = true management.oauth_initiated_logon_type = idp_initiated management.oauth_provider_url = https://my-web-portal ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Handling RabbitMQ Publisher Confirms with a Linked List in C# DESCRIPTION: This code shows how to track outbound messages with a linked list and handle confirms, nacks, and returns. It demonstrates cleaning the list and logging warnings for nack-ed or returned messages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-seven-dotnet.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` var outstandingConfirms = new ConcurrentDictionary(); void HandleAck(ulong sequenceNumber, bool multiple) { if (multiple) { var confirmed = outstandingConfirms.Where(k => k.Key <= sequenceNumber); foreach (var entry in confirmed) { outstandingConfirms.TryRemove(entry.Key, out _); } } else { outstandingConfirms.TryRemove(sequenceNumber, out _); } } void HandleNack(ulong sequenceNumber, bool multiple) { if (multiple) { var nacked = outstandingConfirms.Where(k => k.Key <= sequenceNumber); foreach (var entry in nacked) { outstandingConfirms.TryRemove(entry.Key, out string body); Console.WriteLine($"[WARNING] message {body} has been nack-ed. Sequence number: {sequenceNumber}, multiple: {multiple}"); } } else { outstandingConfirms.TryRemove(sequenceNumber, out string body); Console.WriteLine($"[WARNING] message {body} has been nack-ed. Sequence number: {sequenceNumber}, multiple: {multiple}"); } HandleAck(sequenceNumber, multiple); } void HandleReturn(ushort replyCode, string replyText, string exchange, string routingKey, IBasicProperties properties, ReadOnlyMemory body) { Console.WriteLine($"[WARNING] message {sequenceNumber} has been basic.return-ed"); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Memory Threshold on Running Node DESCRIPTION: Commands to update memory threshold on a running RabbitMQ node without requiring a restart. These changes remain in effect until the node stops unless also updated in the configuration file. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/memory.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_vm_memory_high_watermark ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_vm_memory_high_watermark absolute ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_vm_memory_high_watermark 0.7 ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_vm_memory_high_watermark absolute "4G" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring APT Repository for RabbitMQ on Debian Bullseye DESCRIPTION: This bash script configures the APT repository for installing RabbitMQ and Erlang on Debian Bullseye. It adds the necessary repository sources for both RabbitMQ server and Erlang packages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/rabbitmq.list < ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Certificate Expiration in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Checks the expiration date on the certificates for every listener on the target node configured to use TLS. Supports different time units like days, weeks, months, and years. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics check_certificate_expiration --unit weeks --within 6 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Error Log Level for Default Category in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This configuration sets the log level to 'error' for the default category in RabbitMQ, meaning only errors or higher severity messages will be logged. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.default.level = error ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing User Topic Permissions in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: This command lists all virtual hosts to which a specific user has been granted access and their topic permissions. It requires the username as a parameter. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_28 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_user_topic_permissions janeway ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Docker Network for RabbitMQ Streams DESCRIPTION: This command creates a Docker network named 'rabbitmq-streams' for the RabbitMQ server and performance tool containers to communicate. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2021-07-13-rabbitmq-streams-overview/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` docker network create rabbitmq-streams ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Labeling Service and Pod Monitors DESCRIPTION: Commands to add team labels to ServiceMonitor and PodMonitor resources. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/operator-monitoring.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl label ServiceMonitor rabbitmq team=frontend kubectl label PodMonitor rabbitmq-cluster-operator team=frontend ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Consumer with RabbitMQ in C# DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create an asynchronous consumer in C# that processes messages from a specified queue and settles them after processing. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/amqp-client-libraries.md#2025-04-09_snippet_27 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` IConsumer consumer = await connection.ConsumerBuilder() .Queue("some-queue") .MessageHandler(async (context, message) => { // deal with the message await context.AcceptAsync();// settle the message } ).BuildAndStartAsync(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Memory Calculation Strategy in RabbitMQ (INI) DESCRIPTION: Default strategy for memory usage reporting, set to 'rss' which uses operating system RSS memory reporting. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_27 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` vm_memory_calculation_strategy = rss ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Increasing Initial Frame Size Limit in RabbitMQ Configuration (Erlang) DESCRIPTION: Shows how to increase the initial frame size limit to 8192 bytes using the advanced.config file in Erlang syntax. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/troubleshooting-oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [ {rabbit, [ {initial_frame_max, 8192} ]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Error Logging for Disabled Required Feature Flag in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the error message logged when a required feature flag is not enabled upon starting or upgrading RabbitMQ to version 3.11.0 or later. It demonstrates how RabbitMQ will refuse to start if the necessary feature flags are not enabled. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2022-07-20-required-feature-flags-in-rabbitmq-3.11/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` 2022-07-13 11:29:28.366877+02:00 [error] <0.232.0> Feature flags: `implicit_default_bindings`: required feature flag not enabled! It must be enabled before upgrading RabbitMQ. 2022-07-13 11:29:28.366905+02:00 [error] <0.232.0> Failed to initialize feature flags registry: {disabled_required_feature_flag, 2022-07-13 11:29:28.366905+02:00 [error] <0.232.0> implicit_default_bindings} 2022-07-13 11:29:28.372830+02:00 [error] <0.232.0> 2022-07-13 11:29:28.372830+02:00 [error] <0.232.0> BOOT FAILED 2022-07-13 11:29:28.372830+02:00 [error] <0.232.0> =========== 2022-07-13 11:29:28.372830+02:00 [error] <0.232.0> Error during startup: {error,failed_to_initialize_feature_flags_registry} 2022-07-13 11:29:28.372830+02:00 [error] <0.232.0> ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting a User in RabbitMQ (Bash and PowerShell) DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to delete a user in RabbitMQ using the rabbitmqctl command in both Bash and PowerShell. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl delete_user 'username' ``` LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat delete_user 'username' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Benchmarking Stream with AMQP 0.9.1 in RabbitMQ 4.0 Using PerfTest DESCRIPTION: Java command for benchmarking a stream with AMQP 0.9.1 protocol in RabbitMQ 4.0. The test shows lower throughput (~89,000 msg/s) compared to AMQP 1.0 due to the overhead of translating between AMQP 0.9.1 and AMQP 1.0 formats.
