SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2024-08-21-amqp-benchmarks/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ java -jar target/perf-test.jar \ --predeclared --exchange amq.default \ --routing-key my-stream --queue my-stream \ --flag persistent --flag mandatory \ --pmessages 1000000 --size 12 --confirm 192 --qos 5000 --multi-ack-every 5000 id: test-104223-225, sending rate avg: 88912 msg/s id: test-104223-225, receiving rate avg: 88912 msg/s id: test-104223-225, consumer latency min/median/75th/95th/99th 701/1340/1523/2500/4524 µs id: test-104223-225, confirm latency min/median/75th/95th/99th 788/1983/2130/2437/2970 µs ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Erlang Scheduler Count in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Sets the number of Erlang schedulers to 4 using the +S flag, regardless of available CPU cores. This configuration is useful in shared or CPU-constrained environments. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/runtime.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` RABBITMQ_SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS="+S 4:4" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Mirroring Policy for Two Nodes in Bash DESCRIPTION: Bash command to set a policy that mirrors queues with names starting with "two." to exactly two nodes in the cluster, with automatic synchronization. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ha/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy ha-two "^two\." \ '{"ha-mode":"exactly","ha-params":2,"ha-sync-mode":"automatic"}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Encrypted Configuration Example DESCRIPTION: Example of using encrypted configuration values for sensitive data like passwords. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_51 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [ {rabbit, [ {default_user, <<"guest">>}, {default_pass, {encrypted, <<"cPAymwqmMnbPXXRVqVzpxJdrS8mHEKuo2V+3vt1u/fymexD9oztQ2G/oJ4PAaSb2c5N/hRJ2aqP/X0VAfx8xOQ==">> } }, {config_entry_decoder, [ {passphrase, <<"mypassphrase">>} ]} ]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Node Interface Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration for RabbitMQ inter-node communication listener interface in rabbitmq.conf. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` distribution.listener.interface = ::1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying Erlang Cookie Hash in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Outputs a hashed value of the shared secret used by the target node to authenticate CLI tools and peers. This command is useful for troubleshooting authentication issues in RabbitMQ clusters. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics erlang_cookie_hash -q ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Variable Expansion in RabbitMQ Topic Permission Patterns DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how variables can be used in topic permission patterns. The pattern expands to match topics that start with the username followed by a hyphen and any characters. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: regex CODE: ``` '^{username}-.*' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Global Parameters in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Sets a global runtime parameter that isn't tied to a virtual host. The example sets mqtt_default_vhosts with a JSON document mapping client certificates to virtual hosts. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_50 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_global_parameter mqtt_default_vhosts '{"O=client,CN=guest":"/"}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Cluster Node Shutdown Example DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates shutting down nodes and checking cluster status using rabbitmqctl commands. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/clustering.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # on rabbit1 rabbitmqctl stop # => Stopping and halting node rabbit@rabbit1 ...done. # on rabbit2 rabbitmqctl cluster_status # => Cluster status of node rabbit@rabbit2 ... # => [{nodes,[{disc,[rabbit@rabbit1,rabbit@rabbit2,rabbit@rabbit3]}]}, # => {running_nodes,[rabbit@rabbit3,rabbit@rabbit2]}] # => ...done. # on rabbit3 rabbitmqctl cluster_status # => Cluster status of node rabbit@rabbit3 ... # => [{nodes,[{disc,[rabbit@rabbit1,rabbit@rabbit2,rabbit@rabbit3]}]}, # => {running_nodes,[rabbit@rabbit2,rabbit@rabbit3]}] # => ...done. # on rabbit3 rabbitmqctl stop # => Stopping and halting node rabbit@rabbit3 ...done. # on rabbit2 rabbitmqctl cluster_status # => Cluster status of node rabbit@rabbit2 ... # => [{nodes,[{disc,[rabbit@rabbit1,rabbit@rabbit2,rabbit@rabbit3]}]}, # => {running_nodes,[rabbit@rabbit2]}] # => ...done. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Decommissioning MQTT Node Command in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to safely remove an MQTT node from a RabbitMQ cluster. Must be executed before disabling the plugin or removing the node from the cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_73 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl decommission_mqtt_node rabbit@stringer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Certificate to Mono System-wide Trust Certificate Store DESCRIPTION: Bash command to add a CA certificate to the Mono system-wide Trust certificate store on Linux. This requires administrative privileges and enables all .NET applications on the system to trust servers presenting certificates signed by this CA. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Linux with Mono certmgr -add -c -m Trust /path/to/cacert.cer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Multiple OAuth 2.0 Resource Servers in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Example configuration for multiple OAuth 2.0 resource servers (prod and dev) sharing the same identity provider. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_oauth2.issuer = https://my-idp.com/ auth_oauth2.resource_servers.1.id = prod auth_oauth2.resource_servers.2.id = dev ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Viewing RabbitMQ System Logs with journalctl DESCRIPTION: These commands show how to view RabbitMQ-specific system logs using journalctl on systemd-based distributions. They require superuser privileges. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_33 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` journalctl --system sudo journalctl --system | grep rabbitmq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Up Mixed-Version Cluster Testing Environment DESCRIPTION: Series of commands to set up and run tests in a mixed-version cluster environment with feature flags. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/feature-flags/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` git clone https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server.git secondary-umbrella cd secondary-umbrella git checkout v3.12.x make co cd secondary-umbrella/deps/rabbitmq_federation make dist SECONDARY_UMBRELLA=/path/to/secondary-umbrella \ RABBITMQ_FEATURE_FLAGS= \ make tests ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Username Variable Pattern DESCRIPTION: Permission pattern that uses variable expansion for username-based access control. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: regex CODE: ``` ^{username}-.* ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring MQTT TCP Buffer Settings DESCRIPTION: Configuration for TCP buffer settings specific to MQTT connections, setting buffer sizes to 32 KiB and configuring connection behavior. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` mqtt.tcp_listen_options.backlog = 128 mqtt.tcp_listen_options.nodelay = true mqtt.tcp_listen_options.linger.on = true mqtt.tcp_listen_options.linger.timeout = 0 mqtt.tcp_listen_options.sndbuf = 32768 mqtt.tcp_listen_options.recbuf = 32768 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Message TTL Policy for Queues using rabbitmqctl DESCRIPTION: This command sets a policy that applies a 60-second TTL to all queues using rabbitmqctl. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ttl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy TTL ".*" '{"message-ttl":60000}' --apply-to queues ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complete Log Message Publisher Implementation in Ruby DESCRIPTION: Full implementation of a log message publisher using RabbitMQ with the Bunny client. It establishes a connection, creates a fanout exchange, and publishes messages to it. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-ruby.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` #!/usr/bin/env ruby require 'bunny' connection = Bunny.new connection.start channel = connection.create_channel exchange = channel.fanout('logs') message = ARGV.empty? ? 'Hello World!' : ARGV.join(' ') exchange.publish(message) puts " [x] Sent #{message}" connection.close ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting User Channel Limit via HTTP API using curl DESCRIPTION: This curl command demonstrates how to set the maximum channels limit for a user using the RabbitMQ HTTP API. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/user-limits.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -v -u guest:guest -X PUT http://localhost:15672/api/user-limits/user1/max-channels \ -H "content-type: application/json" \ -d @- < "Hello World!" words -> Enum.join(words, " ") end AMQP.Basic.publish(channel, "", "task_queue", message, persistent: true) IO.puts " [x] Sent '#{message}'" AMQP.Connection.close(connection) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing TCP Listeners with Process Information (IPv4) DESCRIPTION: Uses the ss command to display listening TCP sockets that use IPv4 along with their associated OS processes. This provides a comprehensive view of all listening TCP services. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/troubleshooting-networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` sudo ss --tcp -f inet --listening --numeric --processes ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Required Dependencies for RabbitMQ Stream Client in Rust DESCRIPTION: This code snippet imports the necessary types and error handling structures from the RabbitMQ stream client library for Rust. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-rust-stream.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: rust CODE: ``` use rabbitmq_stream_client::error::StreamCreateError; use rabbitmq_stream_client::types::{ByteCapacity, Message, ResponseCode}; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Multiple RabbitMQ Nodes with Management Plugin on Different Ports DESCRIPTION: Commands to start two RabbitMQ nodes on a single machine with the management plugin configured to use different ports to avoid collision. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/clustering.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` RABBITMQ_NODE_PORT=5672 RABBITMQ_SERVER_START_ARGS="-rabbitmq_management listener [{port,15672}]" RABBITMQ_NODENAME=rabbit rabbitmq-server -detached RABBITMQ_NODE_PORT=5673 RABBITMQ_SERVER_START_ARGS="-rabbitmq_management listener [{port,15673}]" RABBITMQ_NODENAME=hare rabbitmq-server -detached ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring OAuth 2.0 Authentication Backend DESCRIPTION: RabbitMQ configuration to enable the OAuth 2.0 authentication and authorization backend. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_backends.1 = rabbit_auth_backend_oauth2 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Memory Breakdown via HTTP API in JSON DESCRIPTION: This curl command retrieves the memory breakdown for a RabbitMQ node using the HTTP API and formats the output as JSON. It shows detailed memory usage for various components of the system. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/memory-use/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` curl -s -u guest:guest http://127.0.0.1:15672/api/nodes/rabbit@mercurio/memory | python -m json.tool { "memory": { "atom": 1041593, "binary": 5133776, "code": 25299059, "connection_channels": 1823320, "connection_other": 150168, "connection_readers": 83760, "connection_writers": 113112, "metrics": 217816, "mgmt_db": 266560, "mnesia": 93344, "msg_index": 48880, "other_ets": 2294184, "other_proc": 27131728, "other_system": 21496756, "plugins": 3103424, "queue_procs": 2957624, "total": 89870336 } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: AMQP 1.0 Configuration for Event Exchange DESCRIPTION: Complete configuration example for setting up the Event Exchange plugin to use AMQP 1.0 protocol with the default virtual host. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/event-exchange.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` event_exchange.vhost = / event_exchange.protocol = amqp_1_0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Memory Calculation Strategy DESCRIPTION: Strategy configuration for memory usage reporting SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_20 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` vm_memory_calculation_strategy = rss ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Port Connectivity Check Command - Bash DESCRIPTION: Validates TCP connection acceptance on all listener ports of the target node SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics check_port_connectivity ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring UNIX Epoch Timestamp Format in rabbitmq.conf DESCRIPTION: Configuration example showing how to use microseconds since UNIX epoch for log timestamp formatting instead of the default RFC 3339 format. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.file = true log.file.level = info # use microseconds since UNIX epoch for timestamp format log.file.formatter.time_format = epoch_usecs ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying RabbitMQ Node Certificates DESCRIPTION: Command to display node certificates for TLS-configured listeners. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics certificates ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Connections and Channel Counts DESCRIPTION: Uses rabbitmqctl to list connections and their corresponding channel counts. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/channels/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_connections name channels -q # => name channels # => 127.0.0.1:52956 -> 127.0.0.1:5672 10 # => 127.0.0.1:52964 -> 127.0.0.1:5672 33 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing RabbitMQ Queues on Windows DESCRIPTION: Command to list all queues and their message counts in RabbitMQ on Windows systems. This uses the rabbitmqctl.bat command-line tool without sudo. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-spring-amqp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat list_queues ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating HTML Table for RabbitMQ Monitoring Tools in Markdown DESCRIPTION: This code snippet generates an HTML table within a Markdown document, listing various monitoring tools for RabbitMQ along with their respective online resources and GitHub repositories. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/monitoring/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ```
Monitoring ToolOnline Resource(s)
AppDynamics AppDynamics, GitHub
AWS CloudWatch GitHub
Zenoss RabbitMQ ZenPack, Instructional Video
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Encrypted Configuration Example DESCRIPTION: Example of using encrypted configuration values for sensitive data like passwords. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_51 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [ {rabbit, [ {default_user, <<"guest">>}, {default_pass, {encrypted, <<"cPAymwqmMnbPXXRVqVzpxJdrS8mHEKuo2V+3vt1u/fymexD9oztQ2G/oJ4PAaSb2c5N/hRJ2aqP/X0VAfx8xOQ==">> } }, {config_entry_decoder, [ {passphrase, <<"mypassphrase">>} ]} ]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Binding a Queue to an Exchange in Elixir DESCRIPTION: Creates a binding between a queue and the 'logs' exchange, instructing the exchange to send messages to this queue. This establishes the relationship needed for message delivery. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-elixir.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: elixir CODE: ``` AMQP.Queue.bind(channel, queue_name, "logs") ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Out Specific RabbitMQ Commit with Git DESCRIPTION: This git command checks out a specific commit from the master branch that includes the performance optimization (PR #4606). The commit is identified by its SHA hash and includes improvements to the routing table lookup mechanism. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2022-05-31-flame-graphs/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` git checkout c22e1cb20e656d211e025c417d1fc75a9067b717 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying Erlang Cookie Hash in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Outputs a hashed value of the shared secret used by the target node to authenticate CLI tools and peers. This command is useful for troubleshooting authentication issues in RabbitMQ clusters. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics erlang_cookie_hash -q ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: AMQP 1.0 Benchmark Results with Enhanced Flow Control DESCRIPTION: Performance benchmark output showing message throughput and latency metrics with enhanced flow control settings in RabbitMQ 4.0. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2024-08-21-amqp-benchmarks/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` # quiver //host.docker.internal//queues/my-quorum-queue \ --durable --count 1m --duration 10m --body-size 12 --credit 5000 RESULTS Count ............................................. 1,000,000 messages Duration ............................................... 12.0 seconds Sender rate .......................................... 83,459 messages/s Receiver rate ........................................ 83,396 messages/s End-to-end rate ...................................... 83,181 messages/s Latencies by percentile: 0% ........ 9 ms 90.00% ....... 47 ms 25% ....... 27 ms 99.00% ....... 61 ms 50% ....... 35 ms 99.90% ....... 76 ms 100% ....... 81 ms 99.99% ....... 81 ms ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complete RabbitMQ Producer Implementation in Ruby DESCRIPTION: Full implementation of a durable task queue producer with proper connection handling and message persistence. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-ruby.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` #!/usr/bin/env ruby require 'bunny' connection = Bunny.new(automatically_recover: false) connection.start channel = connection.create_channel queue = channel.queue('task_queue', durable: true) message = ARGV.empty? ? 'Hello World!' : ARGV.join(' ') queue.publish(message, persistent: true) puts " [x] Sent #{message}" connection.close ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting UAA Authorization Server DESCRIPTION: Command to start the UAA authorization server that will issue JWT tokens for OAuth 2.0 authentication with RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make start-uaa ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting HTTP Strict Transport Security in RabbitMQ Management DESCRIPTION: Configuration for setting the HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) header in the RabbitMQ Management UI responses to enhance security. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_37 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.hsts.policy = max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Persistence for RabbitmqCluster in YAML DESCRIPTION: Specifies persistence settings for the RabbitmqCluster, including storage class name and capacity. The example sets a custom storage class and 20Gi of storage. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-operator/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiVersion: rabbitmq.com/v1beta1 kind: RabbitmqCluster metadata: name: rabbitmqcluster-sample spec: persistence: storageClassName: fast storage: 20Gi ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating RabbitMQ Super Stream DESCRIPTION: Command line example showing how to create a super stream named 'invoices' with 3 partitions using the rabbitmq-streams CLI tool. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/streams.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-streams add_super_stream invoices --partitions 3 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Consumer Timeout in RabbitMQ (INI) DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to set the consumer timeout value in the rabbitmq.conf file. The timeout is specified in milliseconds, with examples for 30 minutes and one hour. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/consumers.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # 30 minutes in milliseconds consumer_timeout = 1800000 ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # one hour in milliseconds consumer_timeout = 3600000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Third-Party Authentication Backend in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Example of configuring a third-party authentication backend plugin in RabbitMQ. This demonstrates using the full module name for plugins that don't have a shortcut alias. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # note that the module name begins with a "rabbit_", not "rabbitmq_", like plugin # names usually do auth_backends.1 = rabbit_auth_backend_ip_range ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Handshake Timeout in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Default configuration for the maximum time allowed for AMQP 0-9-1 handshake after socket connection and TLS handshake, specified in milliseconds. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` handshake_timeout = 10000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running RabbitMQ Stream Performance Test DESCRIPTION: This command runs the RabbitMQ stream performance test tool in a Docker container, connecting to the RabbitMQ server to create a stream and perform publish/consume operations. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2021-07-13-rabbitmq-streams-overview/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` docker run -it --rm --network rabbitmq-streams pivotalrabbitmq/stream-perf-test \ --uris rabbitmq-stream://rabbitmq:5552 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting ERL_SSL_PATH in RabbitMQ Environment Configuration DESCRIPTION: These commands set the ERL_SSL_PATH environment variable in the RabbitMQ configuration file, which is necessary for loading the TLS module. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/clustering-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` erl -noinput -eval 'io:format("ERL_SSL_PATH=~s~n", [filename:dirname(code:which(inet_tls_dist))])' -s init stop > /tmp/ssl-path.txt cat /tmp/ssl-path.txt /etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-env.conf > /tmp/new-rabbitmq-env.conf mv -f /tmp/new-rabbitmq-env.conf /etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-env.conf ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring systemd for epmd IPv6 Listening DESCRIPTION: This systemd unit file configuration sets epmd to listen only on IPv6 interfaces. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` ListenStream=[::1]:4369 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Quorum Queue WAL Segment Size in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Sets the maximum size of a write-ahead log (WAL) segment for quorum queues before it's flushed to disk. This affects how much message data can be kept in memory under steady load. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/persistence-conf.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # Flush current WAL file to a segment file on disk once it reaches 32 MiB in size raft.wal_max_size_bytes = 32000000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Downloading rabbitmqadmin v1 from RabbitMQ Management Plugin DESCRIPTION: Instructions for downloading rabbitmqadmin v1 from a RabbitMQ node with the management plugin enabled. The URL format is provided for accessing the download link. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` http://{hostname}:15672/cli/rabbitmqadmin ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using JWT Token with Secondary Signing Key DESCRIPTION: This command shows how to make an API request to the RabbitMQ management endpoint using a token signed with a secondary signing key. It uses a Python script to generate the token with the alternate key. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make curl-with-token URL=http://localhost:15672/api/overview TOKEN=$(bin/jwt_token scope-and-extra-scope.json legacy-token-2-key private-2.pem public-2.pem) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Management Plugins DESCRIPTION: Lists all plugins containing 'management' in their name with verbose output. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmq-plugins.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins list -v management ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Distribution Listener Interface in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Default configuration for the network interface used for communication with other cluster members and CLI tools. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` distribution.listener.interface = 0.0.0.0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Connection Parameters in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Key connection parameters including channels, channel_max, frame_max, and client properties that define connection behavior and limits. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_81 LANGUAGE: markup CODE: ``` channels channel_max frame_max client_properties ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Multiple Resource Servers Configuration in INI DESCRIPTION: Configuration example for multiple OAuth 2.0 resources with different scope prefixes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_24 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_oauth2.issuer = http//some_idp_url auth_oauth2.scope_prefix = rabbitmq. auth_oauth2.resource_servers.1.id = rabbit_prod auth_oauth2.resource_servers.2.id = rabbit_dev auth_oauth2.resource_servers.2.scope_prefix = dev-rabbitmq. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Negative Acknowledgement without Requeue in .NET RabbitMQ Client DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to negatively acknowledge a delivery without requeueing using the .NET client for RabbitMQ. The message will be discarded or sent to a Dead Letter Exchange if configured. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/confirms.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` // this example assumes an existing channel (IModel) instance var consumer = new EventingBasicConsumer(channel); consumer.Received += (ch, ea) => { var body = ea.Body.ToArray(); // negatively acknowledge, the message will // be discarded channel.BasicReject(ea.DeliveryTag, false); }; String consumerTag = channel.BasicConsume(queueName, false, consumer); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Publishing Messages in Batches with RabbitMQ Publisher Confirms in C# DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to publish messages in batches and wait for the entire batch to be confirmed. It uses a batch size of half the allowed outstanding confirmations. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-seven-dotnet.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` int batchSize = 100; var outstandingMessageCount = 0; var messagesSent = 0; for (int i = 0; i < MESSAGE_COUNT; i++) { byte[] body = Encoding.UTF8.GetBytes(i.ToString()); await channel.BasicPublishAsync("", "queue-name", null, body); outstandingMessageCount++; if (outstandingMessageCount == batchSize) { await AwaitConfirmsAsync(channel); outstandingMessageCount = 0; } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Comprehensive Stream TCP Listener Options Configuration DESCRIPTION: Advanced configuration for Stream plugin TCP listener options including buffer sizes, connection queue length, TCP keepalives, and other networking parameters to optimize performance. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/stream.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` stream.listeners.tcp.1 = 127.0.0.1:5552 stream.listeners.tcp.2 = ::1:5552 stream.tcp_listen_options.backlog = 4096 stream.tcp_listen_options.recbuf = 131072 stream.tcp_listen_options.sndbuf = 131072 stream.tcp_listen_options.keepalive = true stream.tcp_listen_options.nodelay = true stream.tcp_listen_options.exit_on_close = true stream.tcp_listen_options.send_timeout = 120 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Hello World Example in Elixir DESCRIPTION: The equivalent Hello World program implemented in Elixir, demonstrating the more Ruby-like syntax with module definition using 'defmodule' and function definition using 'def'. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2013-06-03-using-elixir-to-write-rabbitmq-plugins/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: elixir CODE: ``` # module_name.ex defmodule ModuleName do def hello do IO.puts "Hello World" end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Handshake Timeout in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Default configuration for the maximum time allowed for AMQP 0-9-1 handshake after socket connection and TLS handshake, specified in milliseconds. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` handshake_timeout = 10000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Net Tick Time in RabbitMQ Advanced Config DESCRIPTION: This Erlang configuration snippet demonstrates how to set the net_ticktime to 120 seconds in the advanced.config file for RabbitMQ, doubling the default value of 60 seconds. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/nettick.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [ {kernel, [{net_ticktime, 120}]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Different Log Levels for File and Connection Logs in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet configures debug level for file logging and info level for connection events in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.file.level = debug log.connection.level = info ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Classic Config Peer Discovery in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration example for using the classic config mechanism for peer discovery, specifying the backend and listing node addresses. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2018-02-18-peer-discovery-subsystem-in-rabbitmq-3-7/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = rabbit_peer_discovery_classic_config cluster_formation.classic_config.nodes.1 = rabbit@hostname1.eng.example.local cluster_formation.classic_config.nodes.2 = rabbit@hostname2.eng.example.local ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Unbinding Queue from Exchange in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Shows how to remove bindings between exchanges and queues using the management API. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/amqp-client-libraries.md#2025-04-09_snippet_63 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` management.unbind() .sourceExchange("my-exchange") .destinationQueue("my-queue") .key("foo") .unbind(); ``` LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` IBindingSpecification bindingSpec = management.Binding() .SourceExchange("my-exchange") .DestinationQueue("my-queue") .Key("foo"); await bindingSpec.UnbindAsync(); ``` LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` management.unbind(BindingSpecification( source_exchange="my-exchange", destination_queue="my-queue", )) ``` LANGUAGE: go CODE: ``` // bindingPath is the bind result err = management.Unbind(context.TODO(), bindingPath) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TLS-Enabled RabbitMQ Connection with Peer Verification DESCRIPTION: Example URI for a secure AMQPS connection with TLS peer verification enabled. Specifies paths to CA certificate, client certificate, and client key files with verify_peer setting to ensure certificate chain validation. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/uri-query-parameters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` amqps://myhost?cacertfile=/path/to/ca_certificate.pem &certfile=/path/to/client_certificate.pem &keyfile=/path/to/client_key.pem &verify=verify_peer &server_name_indication=myhost ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Federation Upstream in RabbitMQ for Blue-Green Migration DESCRIPTION: Command to set up the federation upstream parameter pointing to the 'blue' cluster from the 'green' cluster. This establishes the connection between clusters for message federation. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/blue-green-upgrade.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_parameter federation-upstream blue \ '{"uri":"amqp://node-in-blue-cluster"}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring DLX via Policy using PowerShell DESCRIPTION: Sets up a dead letter exchange policy named 'DLX' that applies to all queues using rabbitmqctl in PowerShell. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/dlx.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy DLX ".*" "{""dead-letter-exchange"":""my-dlx""}" --apply-to queues --priority 7 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring a Durable Queue in C# RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to declare a durable queue in RabbitMQ using C#. It sets the 'durable' parameter to true when declaring the queue. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-dotnet.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` await channel.QueueDeclareAsync(queue: "hello", durable: true, exclusive: false, autoDelete: false, arguments: null); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring a Shovel Using RabbitMQ HTTP API Endpoint DESCRIPTION: HTTP API endpoint pattern for declaring a shovel. The request requires a JSON document containing shovel configuration parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/shovel-dynamic.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` PUT /api/parameters/shovel/{vhost}/{name} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Docker registry secret for private registry access DESCRIPTION: Command to create a Kubernetes Secret with credentials for accessing a private Docker registry, where the RabbitMQ Cluster Operator images are stored. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/install-operator.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl -n rabbitmq-system create secret \ docker-registry rabbitmq-cluster-registry-access \ --docker-server=DOCKER-SERVER \ --docker-username=DOCKER-USERNAME \ --docker-password=DOCKER-PASSWORD ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Port Listener Check Command - Bash DESCRIPTION: Verifies if the target node is listening on a specific port SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics check_port_listener 5672 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring net_ticktime in Windows Environment Configuration DESCRIPTION: Creates a configuration file that sets the Erlang net_ticktime value, which controls node communication timeout intervals. This needs to be set via environment variables on Windows. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/windows-configuration.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` @echo off set SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS=-kernel net_ticktime 120 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring WebSocket Frame Type for Web STOMP DESCRIPTION: INI configuration to set the WebSocket frame type to binary for the Web STOMP plugin. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/web-stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` web_stomp.ws_frame = binary ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Stream Consumers in RabbitMQ with bash DESCRIPTION: Command for displaying consumer information (connection PID, subscription ID, and stream) for RabbitMQ streams. This example shows how to retrieve specific consumer properties using the list_stream_consumers command. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmq-streams.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-streams list_stream_consumers connection_pid subscription_id stream ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Memory Watermark Configuration DESCRIPTION: Memory threshold configuration for flow control SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` vm_memory_high_watermark.relative = 0.6 ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` vm_memory_high_watermark.absolute = 2GB ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` vm_memory_high_watermark.relative = 0.4 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Absolute Disk Free Limit Configuration - RabbitMQ INI DESCRIPTION: Configuration example showing how to set an absolute disk free space limit of 1GB in bytes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/disk-alarms.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` disk_free_limit.absolute = 1000000000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring net_ticktime in Windows Environment Configuration DESCRIPTION: Creates a configuration file that sets the Erlang net_ticktime value, which controls node communication timeout intervals. This needs to be set via environment variables on Windows. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/windows-configuration.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` @echo off set SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS=-kernel net_ticktime 120 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Docker Daemon Limits for RabbitMQ Containers DESCRIPTION: This JSON configuration sets the default ulimits for Docker containers, specifically setting the maximum number of open file handles (nofile) to 64000. This configuration should be placed in the Docker daemon configuration file at /etc/docker/daemon.json on Docker hosts. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_54 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "default-ulimits": { "nofile": { "Name": "nofile", "Hard": 64000, "Soft": 64000 } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TLS in Erlang RabbitMQ Client DESCRIPTION: Example of setting up TLS options for the RabbitMQ Erlang client, including certificate paths, verification settings, and server name indication. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_49 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` SslOpts = [{cacertfile, "/path/to/ca_certificate.pem"}, {certfile, "/path/to/client/certificate.pem"}, {keyfile, "/path/to/client/private_key.pem"}, %% only necessary with intermediate CAs %% {depth, 2}, %% Note: it is recommended to set 'verify' to %% to 'verify_peer' to ensure that X509 %% certificate chain validation is enabled %% %% Do not set 'verify' or set it to verify_none %% if x509 certificate chain validation is %% not desired {verify, verify_peer}, %% If Server Name Indication validation is desired, %% set the following option to the host name to which %% the connection is made. If necessary, this option %% may be set to another host name to match the server %% certificate's CN= value. %% Do not set this option or set it to the atom 'disable' %% to disable SNI validation {server_name_indication, "my.rmq-server.net"}], Params = #amqp_params_network{host = "my.rmq-server.net", port = 5671, ssl_options = SslOpts} {ok, Conn} = amqp_connection:start(Params), ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ Operator Log Level DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration to set debug log level for the RabbitMQ cluster operator deployment. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-operator/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_42 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiVersion: apps/v1 kind: Deployment metadata: name: rabbitmq-cluster-operator namespace: rabbitmq-system spec: template: spec: containers: - args: - --zap-log-level=debug command: - /manager ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting RabbitMQ 3.13+ Docker Container for Stream Filtering DESCRIPTION: This shell command starts a RabbitMQ 3.13+ Docker container with the necessary configuration for stream operations, including setting the advertised host for the stream plugin. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2023-10-16-stream-filtering/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` docker run -it --rm --name rabbitmq -p 5552:5552 \ -e RABBITMQ_SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS='-rabbitmq_stream advertised_host localhost' \ rabbitmq:3.13 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Mirroring Policy for Specific Nodes in Bash DESCRIPTION: Bash command to set a policy that mirrors queues with names starting with "nodes." to specific nodes (nodeA and nodeB) in the cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ha/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy ha-nodes "^nodes\." \ '{"ha-mode":"nodes","ha-params":["rabbit@nodeA", "rabbit@nodeB"]}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic RabbitMQ Management UI OAuth 2.0 Configuration DESCRIPTION: Essential configuration entries in rabbitmq.conf for enabling OAuth 2.0 authentication in the RabbitMQ Management UI using service-provider initiated login SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # ... management.oauth_enabled = true management.oauth_client_id = rabbit_client_code auth_oauth2.issuer = https://uaa:8443 # ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Multiple OAuth 2.0 Resources in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Example configuration for setting up two OAuth 2.0 resources (rabbit_prod and rabbit_dev) in RabbitMQ, including common settings and OAuth provider configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/oauth2-examples-multiresource.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_oauth2.resource_servers.1.id = rabbit_prod auth_oauth2.resource_servers.2.id = rabbit_dev auth_oauth2.preferred_username_claims.1 = preferred_username auth_oauth2.preferred_username_claims.2 = user_name auth_oauth2.preferred_username_claims.3 = email auth_oauth2.scope_prefix = rabbitmq. auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.keycloak.issuer = https://keycloak:8443/realms/test auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.keycloak.https.cacertfile = /etc/rabbitmq/keycloak-ca_certificate.pem auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.keycloak.https.verify = verify_peer auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.keycloak.https.hostname_verification = wildcard auth_oauth2.default_oauth_provider = keycloak ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sample Output of AMQP Filter Expressions Demo DESCRIPTION: Console output showing the results of the AMQP filter expressions demo, including published messages and filtered consumption by different consumers. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2024-12-13-amqp-filter-expressions/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` publisher sent message 0 with color green publisher sent message 1 with color blue publisher sent message 2 with color purple publisher sent message 3 with color purple publisher sent message 4 with color green publisher sent message 5 with color green consumer (filter green) received message 0 consumer (filter green) received message 4 consumer (filter green) received message 5 consumer (filter purple) received message 2 consumer (filter purple) received message 3 consumer (filter blue) received message 1 consumer (filter &s:e) received message 1 consumer (filter &s:e) received message 2 consumer (filter &s:e) received message 3 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Federation Upstream in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: PowerShell command to set up a federation upstream named 'origin' using rabbitmqctl. The upstream is configured with a URI pointing to the remote host. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/federated-exchanges/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat set_parameter federation-upstream origin '"{""uri"":""amqp://remote-host.local:5672""}"' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting a Federation Policy in RabbitMQ via HTTP API DESCRIPTION: Uses the RabbitMQ HTTP API to set a policy named 'federate-me' in the root virtual host that applies to exchanges with names starting with 'federated.' and configures them to use all federation upstreams with priority 1. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/parameters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` PUT /api/policies/%2f/federate-me {"pattern": "^federated\.", "definition": {"federation-upstream-set":"all"}, "priority": 1, "apply-to": "exchanges"} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example TLSv1.2 Connection Success Output DESCRIPTION: The expected output when successfully connecting to a RabbitMQ server using TLSv1.2, showing the protocol and negotiated cipher suite. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_31 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` SSL-Session: Protocol : TLSv1.2 Cipher : ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example of modern ini-style SSL configuration in rabbitmq.conf DESCRIPTION: A snippet showing how to configure SSL options using the modern ini-style format in rabbitmq.conf. This includes setting certificate paths and verification options. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # A new style format snippet. This format is used by rabbitmq.conf files. ssl_options.cacertfile = /path/to/ca_certificate.pem ssl_options.certfile = /path/to/server_certificate.pem ssl_options.keyfile = /path/to/server_key.pem ssl_options.verify = verify_peer ssl_options.fail_if_no_peer_cert = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Removing Docker Images for RabbitMQ Streams Setup DESCRIPTION: This snippet removes existing Docker images for RabbitMQ 3.9 and the stream performance test tool to ensure a clean setup. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2021-07-13-rabbitmq-streams-overview/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` docker rmi rabbitmq:3.9 pivotalrabbitmq/stream-perf-test ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Formatting Feature Flag List with Pretty Tables DESCRIPTION: Enhanced command that lists feature flags with improved table formatting for better readability. This command displays multiple columns including name, state, provider, description, and documentation URL. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/feature-flags/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl -q --formatter pretty_table list_feature_flags \ name state provided_by desc doc_url ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Test Case Setup with Feature Flag Check in Erlang DESCRIPTION: Example of how to set up a test case that checks and enables feature flags before running tests, with proper error handling and skip logic. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/feature-flags/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` init_per_testcase(Testcase, Config) -> Config1 = rabbit_ct_helpers:run_steps( Config, rabbit_ct_broker_helpers:setup_steps() ++ rabbit_ct_client_helpers:setup_steps()), case rabbit_ct_broker_helpers:enable_feature_flag(Config1, quorum_queue) of ok -> Config1; Skip -> end_per_testcase(Testcase, Config1), Skip end. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring IPv6-Only Listener DESCRIPTION: Configures RabbitMQ to listen only on a specific IPv6 interface. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` listeners.tcp.1 = fe80::2acf:e9ff:fe17:f97b:5672 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting User Limits in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Examples of setting various user limits including max connections and channels for 'limited_user'. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_60 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_user_limits limited_user '{"max-connections": 64}' ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_user_limits limited_user '{"max-channels": 16}' ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl clear_user_limits limited_user 'max-connections' ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_user_limits limited_user '{"max-connections": 0}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Minimum Password Length Validator in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Sets up a credential validator that enforces a minimum password length of 30 characters. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/passwords.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` credential_validator.validation_backend = rabbit_credential_validator_min_password_length credential_validator.min_length = 30 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting PerfTest Consumer with OAuth 2.0 Authentication DESCRIPTION: Command to launch a PerfTest consumer application that authenticates to RabbitMQ using a JWT token previously obtained from UAA. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make start-perftest-consumer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Applying RabbitMQ ConfigMap using kubectl DESCRIPTION: Bash command to apply a ConfigMap to your Kubernetes cluster. The ConfigMap contains RabbitMQ configuration that will be mounted as a volume on RabbitMQ pods. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2020-08-10-deploying-rabbitmq-to-kubernetes-whats-involved/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl apply -f configmap.yaml ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Error Response for Unauthorized Access DESCRIPTION: JSON response returned when a client attempts to access the Management API without proper authorization. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/oauth2-examples-multiresource.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` {"error":"not_authorized","reason":"Not_Authorized"} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Docker Daemon Configuration for RabbitMQ Limits DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for setting kernel limits in Docker environment SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/install-rpm.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "default-ulimits": { "nofile": { "Name": "nofile", "Hard": 64000, "Soft": 64000 } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Stream Publishers with Specific Fields in RabbitMQ CLI DESCRIPTION: This command displays the connection PID, publisher ID, and stream for each RabbitMQ stream publisher. It demonstrates how to use the list_stream_publishers command with specific publisher info items. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmq-streams.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-streams list_stream_publishers connection_pid publisher_id stream ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Publishing Message to Named Exchange DESCRIPTION: Publishes a message to the 'logs' exchange with an empty routing key, as routing keys are ignored in fanout exchanges. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-javascript.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` channel.publish('logs', '', Buffer.from('Hello World!')); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Idempotently Deleting an Exchange in RabbitMQ with Shell Command DESCRIPTION: Command to delete an exchange with the idempotently flag, which means 404 Not Found responses won't be considered errors, useful for scripts that need to be run multiple times. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` # --idempotently means that 404 Not Found responses will not be considered errors rabbitmqadmin --vhost "events" delete exchange --name "target.exchange.name" --idempotently ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Rich Authorization Permission to Scope Translation Algorithm in RabbitMQ OAuth 2.0 DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how scope suffixes are constructed from location attributes and combined with actions to produce complete scopes. It shows the algorithm for transforming Rich Authorization Requests into JWT token scopes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` scope_suffix = /|/ ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` scope = .: ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` scope = . ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Publishing Messages for the Second Run in Shell DESCRIPTION: Shell command to publish another batch of messages to the stream for testing the offset tracking functionality in the second run. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-javascript-stream.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` npm run offset-tracking-publish ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: AMQP 1.0 Shovel URI query parameters DESCRIPTION: Various query parameters supported in AMQP 1.0 URIs for Shovel connections, including idle_time_out, hostname, sasl, and TLS-related options. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/shovel-dynamic.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` idle_time_out ``` LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` hostname ``` LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` sasl ``` LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` cacertfile ``` LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` certfile ``` LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` keyfile ``` LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` verify ``` LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` fail_if_no_peer_cert ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Heartbeat Timeout in .NET RabbitMQ Client DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to set the heartbeat timeout to 60 seconds using the .NET client's ConnectionFactory. This must be configured before creating a connection. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/heartbeats.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` var cf = new ConnectionFactory(); // set the heartbeat timeout to 60 seconds cf.RequestedHeartbeat = TimeSpan.FromSeconds(60); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Mirrored Queue Sync Status in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to verify if mirrored queues have synchronized replicas. Exits with non-zero code if any queue has no synchronized mirrors. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/upgrade.md#2025-04-09_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics check_if_node_is_mirror_sync_critical ``` LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics.bat check_if_node_is_mirror_sync_critical ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Rejecting Multiple Messages with RabbitMQ in Java DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to reject multiple messages with a single nack operation using the multiple flag. This rejects all unacknowledged messages up to and including the specified delivery tag. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/nack.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` GetResponse gr1 = channel.basicGet("some.queue", false); GetResponse gr2 = channel.basicGet("some.queue", false); channel.basicNack(gr2.getEnvelope().getDeliveryTag(), true, true); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Message Prefetch Count for Fair Dispatch in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Code to set the prefetch count to ensure fair work distribution among consumers. This tells RabbitMQ not to give more than one message to a worker until it has processed and acknowledged the previous one. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-elixir.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: elixir CODE: ``` AMQP.Basic.qos(channel, prefetch_count: 1) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Mirroring Policy for Specific Nodes via HTTP API DESCRIPTION: HTTP API request to set a policy that mirrors queues with names starting with "nodes." to specific nodes (nodeA and nodeB) in the cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ha/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` PUT /api/policies/%2f/ha-nodes { "pattern":"^nodes\.", "definition":{ "ha-mode":"nodes", "ha-params":["rabbit@nodeA", "rabbit@nodeB"] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Verifying UAA Server Status DESCRIPTION: Command to check if the UAA server container is running using Docker ps SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples-idp-initiated.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker ps | grep uaa ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Message Prefetch in RabbitMQ with Objective-C DESCRIPTION: Code to set the prefetch count for a RabbitMQ channel in Objective-C. This limits the number of unacknowledged messages a worker can have, ensuring fair dispatch among multiple workers. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-objectivec.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: objectivec CODE: ``` [ch basicQos:@1 global:NO]; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Basic RabbitMQ Connection with URI Parameters DESCRIPTION: Example of a non-encrypted AMQP connection URI with heartbeat and connection timeout parameters specified. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/uri-query-parameters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` amqp://myhost?heartbeat=5&connection_timeout=10000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Pre-declared Topology in RabbitMQ.conf DESCRIPTION: Configuration snippet for the rabbitmq.conf file to enable pre-declared topology support for shovels. This allows shovels to use existing queues and exchanges rather than declaring them. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/shovel-dynamic.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` shovel.configuration.fail_if_source_not_available = false shovel.configuration.fail_if_destination_not_available = false ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Channel Negotiation Error Log DESCRIPTION: Example of error log when client attempts to negotiate higher channel limit than server maximum. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/channels/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` 2019-02-11 16:03:16.543 [error] <0.882.0> closing AMQP connection <0.882.0> (127.0.0.1:49911 -> 127.0.0.1:5672): failed to negotiate connection parameters: negotiated channel_max = 2047 is higher than the maximum allowed value (32) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting Queue Members in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Command to remove a quorum queue replica from a specified node for a specific queue in a virtual host. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmq-queues.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-queues delete_member --vhost "a-vhost" "a-queue" "rabbit@decomissioned-node" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring WebSocket Options for Web STOMP DESCRIPTION: INI configuration for WebSocket-specific options in the Web STOMP plugin. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/web-stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` web_stomp.ws_opts.compress = true web_stomp.ws_opts.idle_timeout = 60000 web_stomp.ws_opts.max_frame_size = 50000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring Queues in rabbitmqadmin DESCRIPTION: These commands demonstrate how to declare different types of queues (quorum, stream, classic) using rabbitmqadmin v2. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin --vhost "events" declare queue --name "target.quorum.queue.name" --type "quorum" --durable true ``` LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin --vhost "events" declare queue --name "target.stream.name" --type "stream" --durable true ``` LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin --vhost "events" declare queue --name "target.classic.queue.name" --type "classic" --durable true --auto-delete false ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Raft Segment Entry Count for Large Messages DESCRIPTION: Configures a reduced number of Raft log entries per segment file, optimized for large message workloads. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/quorum-queues/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` raft.segment_max_entries = 128 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing RabbitMQ Signing Key from MIT Keyserver with GPG DESCRIPTION: Retrieves and imports the RabbitMQ signing key from the MIT key server using GPG. This is an alternative to keys.openpgp.org. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/signatures.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` gpg --keyserver "pgp.mit.edu" --recv-keys "0x0A9AF2115F4687BD29803A206B73A36E6026DFCA" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Verifying UAA Server Status DESCRIPTION: Command to check if the UAA server container is running using Docker ps SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples-idp-initiated.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker ps | grep uaa ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Runtime Thread Statistics in RabbitMQ CLI DESCRIPTION: This command uses the RabbitMQ diagnostics tool to generate a breakdown of thread activity, showing percentages for various states like emulator, port, gc, check_io, other/aux, and sleep. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/runtime.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics runtime_thread_stats ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing RabbitMQ Message Receiver with Spring AMQP DESCRIPTION: Message receiver class that uses Spring AMQP's @RabbitListener annotation to listen for messages from the 'hello' queue and process them with a @RabbitHandler method. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-spring-amqp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` package org.springframework.amqp.tutorials.tut1; import org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.annotation.RabbitHandler; import org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.annotation.RabbitListener; @RabbitListener(queues = "hello") public class Tut1Receiver { @RabbitHandler public void receive(String in) { System.out.println(" [x] Received '" + in + "'"); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Detecting Invalid Keyfile or Certificate File Errors in Erlang DESCRIPTION: These errors suggest that the broker's keyfile or certificate file is invalid. Ensure that the keyfile matches the certificate and both are in PEM format with correct delimiters. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/troubleshooting-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {ssl_upgrade_error, ekeyfile} ``` LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {ssl_upgrade_error, ecertfile} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TLS for Inter-node Communication in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Sets SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS to enable TLS for inter-node communication, specifying the path to the combined keys file and setting the server password if the private key is encrypted. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/clustering-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS="-pa $ERL_SSL_PATH \ -proto_dist inet_tls \ -ssl_dist_opt server_certfile /path/to/combined_keys.pem \ -ssl_dist_opt server_password password" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ File Descriptor Limits with systemd DESCRIPTION: Configuration for setting maximum open file handles limit using systemd. This creates a drop-in configuration file to set LimitNOFILE for the RabbitMQ service. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/install-rpm.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` [Service] LimitNOFILE=64000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Automatic Deregistration of Failed Nodes in Consul DESCRIPTION: This configuration sets the time after which failed nodes should be automatically deregistered from Consul. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_29 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = consul cluster_formation.consul.host = consul.eng.example.local # health check interval (node TTL) in seconds cluster_formation.consul.svc_ttl = 30 # how soon should nodes that fail their health checks be unregistered by Consul? # this value is in seconds and must not be lower than 60 (a Consul requirement) cluster_formation.consul.deregister_after = 90 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using RAR Token with RabbitMQ Management API DESCRIPTION: Bash command that demonstrates how to access the RabbitMQ Management API using a Rich Authorization Request token. It uses curl with a token generated from a JSON file and signed with the appropriate keys. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/oauth2-examples/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_29 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` make curl-with-token URL=http://localhost:15672/api/overview TOKEN=$(bin/jwt_token rar-token.json legacy-token-key private.pem public.pem) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Synchronous Get with Timeout sequence diagram for AMQP 1.0 DESCRIPTION: Diagram showing how the drain field enables a synchronous get operation with timeout in AMQP 1.0. The consumer sets drain=True to request either a message transfer or an immediate flow response, allowing it to detect timeouts unambiguously. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2024-09-02-amqp-flow-control/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` Receiver Sender ================================================================= ... flow(link-credit=1) ----------> *wait for link-credit <= 0* flow(drain=True) ---+ +--- transfer(...) \ / x / \ (1) <--+ +--> (2) <---------- flow(...) ... ----------------------------------------------------------------- (1) If a message is available within the timeout, it will arrive at this point. (2) If a message is not available within the timeout, the drain flag will ensure that the sender promptly advances the delivery-count until link-credit is consumed. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing a Topic Exchange Message Consumer in Go DESCRIPTION: This code implements a subscriber that receives log messages from a topic exchange. It allows binding to the exchange with multiple routing key patterns using wildcard characters (* and #). The consumer connects to RabbitMQ, declares the topic exchange, and creates a temporary queue to receive messages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-five-go.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: go CODE: ``` package main import ( "log" "os" amqp "github.com/rabbitmq/amqp091-go" ) func failOnError(err error, msg string) { if err != nil { log.Panicf("%s: %s", msg, err) } } func main() { conn, err := amqp.Dial("amqp://guest:guest@localhost:5672/") failOnError(err, "Failed to connect to RabbitMQ") defer conn.Close() ch, err := conn.Channel() failOnError(err, "Failed to open a channel") defer ch.Close() err = ch.ExchangeDeclare( "logs_topic", // name "topic", // type true, // durable false, // auto-deleted false, // internal false, // no-wait nil, // arguments ) failOnError(err, "Failed to declare an exchange") q, err := ch.QueueDeclare( "", // name false, // durable false, // delete when unused true, // exclusive false, // no-wait nil, // arguments ) failOnError(err, "Failed to declare a queue") if len(os.Args) < 2 { log.Printf("Usage: %s [binding_key]...", os.Args[0]) os.Exit(0) } for _, s := range os.Args[1:] { log.Printf("Binding queue %s to exchange %s with routing key %s", q.Name, "logs_topic", s) err = ch.QueueBind( q.Name, // queue name s, // routing key "logs_topic", // exchange false, nil) failOnError(err, "Failed to bind a queue") } msgs, err := ch.Consume( q.Name, // queue "", // consumer true, // auto ack false, // exclusive false, // no local false, // no wait nil, // args ) failOnError(err, "Failed to register a consumer") var forever chan struct{} go func() { for d := range msgs { log.Printf(" [x] %s", d.Body) } }() log.Printf(" [*] Waiting for logs. To exit press CTRL+C") <-forever } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Viewing MacOS Application Firewall Help DESCRIPTION: Command to display help information for the socketfilterfw utility, which can vary between MacOS releases. This helps in understanding the available command line arguments for configuring the Application Firewall. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_41 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo /usr/libexec/ApplicationFirewall/socketfilterfw --help ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Automatic Deregistration of Failed Nodes in Consul DESCRIPTION: This configuration sets the time after which failed nodes should be automatically deregistered from Consul. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_29 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = consul cluster_formation.consul.host = consul.eng.example.local # health check interval (node TTL) in seconds cluster_formation.consul.svc_ttl = 30 # how soon should nodes that fail their health checks be unregistered by Consul? # this value is in seconds and must not be lower than 60 (a Consul requirement) cluster_formation.consul.deregister_after = 90 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Distribution Port Range Maximum in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Default configuration for the upper bound of server port range used for communication with other cluster members and CLI tools. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` distribution.listener.port_range.max = 25672 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Detailed Authentication Attempts via HTTP API (JSON) DESCRIPTION: Example JSON response from the RabbitMQ HTTP API endpoint that provides a breakdown of authentication attempts per source. This endpoint requires source tracking to be enabled in the configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2021-03-01-auth-attempts-metrics/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` [{ "remote_address":"127.0.0.1", "username":"guest", "protocol":"http", "auth_attempts":533, "auth_attempts_failed":0, "auth_attempts_succeeded":533 }, { "remote_address":"127.0.0.1", "username":"roger", "protocol":"amqp091", "auth_attempts":10, "auth_attempts_failed":10, "auth_attempts_succeeded":0 }, { "remote_address":"127.0.0.1", "username":"bugs", "protocol":"amqp091", "auth_attempts":2, "auth_attempts_failed":0, "auth_attempts_succeeded":2 }] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting a Queue in rabbitmqadmin DESCRIPTION: These commands demonstrate how to delete a queue, including an idempotent deletion, using rabbitmqadmin v2. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management-cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin --vhost "events" delete queue --name "target.queue.name" ``` LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` rabbitmqadmin --vhost "events" delete queue --name "target.queue.name" --idempotently ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring OAuth 2.0 Signing Keys in rabbitmq.conf DESCRIPTION: Configuration example showing how to set up multiple signing keys for OAuth 2.0 token verification. It defines a resource server ID, custom scope key, username claims, default key, signing key paths, and allowed algorithms. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_oauth2.resource_server_id = new_resource_server_id auth_oauth2.additional_scopes_key = my_custom_scope_key auth_oauth2.preferred_username_claims.1 = username auth_oauth2.preferred_username_claims.2 = user_name auth_oauth2.default_key = id1 auth_oauth2.signing_keys.id1 = test/config_schema_SUITE_data/certs/key.pem auth_oauth2.signing_keys.id2 = test/config_schema_SUITE_data/certs/cert.pem auth_oauth2.algorithms.1 = HS256 auth_oauth2.algorithms.2 = RS256 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Overriding Feature Flags on Initial Startup using Bash Environment Variable DESCRIPTION: This environment variable setting overrides the list of feature flags to enable on initial startup of a new, unclustered RabbitMQ node. It enables all feature flags in version 4.0.4 except for khepri_db.
