Furthermore MQTT 5.0 property Content Type is already defined. | | Variable Header | Message Expiry Interval | uint | | properties | expiration | shortstr | seconds to milliseconds | | Variable Header | Topic Alias | ushort | | | | | | | Variable Header | Response Topic | utf8 | | properties | headers, Key: x-reply-to-topic | longstr | AMQP 0.9.1 property reply_to refers to a queue name, not to a topic name | | Variable Header | Correlation Data | binary | `shortstr` | properties | correlation_id | shortstr | | | | | | | properties | headers, Key: x-correlation-id | longstr | | | Variable Header | User Property | utf8 string pair | name is `shortstr` | properties | headers | longstr | RabbitMQ cannot have shortstr as e.g. header values. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Connection URIs DESCRIPTION: Defines a list of AMQP connection URIs for connecting to brokers. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/shovel-static.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {uris, [ "amqp://fred:secret@host1.domain/my_vhost", "amqp://john:secret@host2.domain/my_vhost" ]} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deactivating Queue Federation Policy in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Removes the queue federation policy named 'queue-federation', which will stop federation for the previously matching queues. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/federated-queues/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl clear_policy queue-federation ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting RabbitMQ Server as a Detached Application in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: Command to start the RabbitMQ broker as a background application that is not attached to the Command Prompt window. This allows the broker to run independently of the terminal session. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-windows-manual.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` rabbitmq-server.bat -detached ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Statistics Collection Interval in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to increase the statistics collection interval in RabbitMQ to reduce CPU and memory consumption when dealing with a large number of connections. The interval is set to 60 seconds (60000 milliseconds). SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/connections/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # sets the interval to 60 seconds collect_statistics_interval = 60000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Time-Based Reconciliation for RabbitMQ Topology Operator DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration to enable periodic reconciliation of all topology objects by setting the 'SYNC_PERIOD' environment variable in the Operator deployment. This example sets a 5-minute reconciliation interval. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-topology-operator.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiVersion: apps/v1 kind: Deployment metadata: [...] name: messaging-topology-operator namespace: rabbitmq-system spec: template: spec: containers: - command: - /manager env: - name: SYNC_PERIOD value: 5m # needs to be in a format that's readable by golang time.ParseDuration(), e.g. "1000s", "5.3h" or "20h35m" ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Queue Binding in Ruby DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create a basic binding between a queue and an exchange SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-ruby.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` queue.bind(exchange_name) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Node Name Suffixes with Consul Discovery DESCRIPTION: This configuration demonstrates how to append a suffix to node names retrieved from Consul when using long node names. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_31 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = consul cluster_formation.consul.host = consul.eng.example.local cluster_formation.consul.svc = rabbitmq # do compute service address cluster_formation.consul.svc_addr_auto = true # compute service address using node name cluster_formation.consul.svc_addr_use_nodename = true # use long RabbitMQ node names? cluster_formation.consul.use_longname = true # append a suffix (node.rabbitmq.example.local) to node names retrieved from Consul cluster_formation.consul.domain_suffix = example.local ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Inspecting Shovels via HTTP API DESCRIPTION: Example curl commands for retrieving shovel information through the HTTP API. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/shovel-dynamic.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # Note: this user's access is limited to localhost! curl -v -u guest:guest -X GET http://localhost:15672/api/shovels/ # Note: this user's access is limited to localhost! curl -v -u guest:guest -X GET http://localhost:15672/api/shovels/%2f # Note: this user's access is limited to localhost! curl -v -u guest:guest -X GET http://localhost:15672/api/shovels/vhost/%2f/my-shovel ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Console Logging and Disabling File Logging in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet activates console logging, sets its level to 'info', and disables file logging in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.console = true log.console.level = info log.file = false ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Reference to Guaranteed Multicast Module in Erlang DESCRIPTION: A reference to the guaranteed multicast (atomic broadcast) module in RabbitMQ's codebase that enables reliable communication between nodes in a mirrored queue setup. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2011-10-25-high-availability-in-rabbitmq-solving-part-of-the-puzzle/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` http://hg.rabbitmq.com/rabbitmq-server/file/default/src/gm.erl ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring LDAP Group Lookup Base in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration example for setting the group lookup base DN for nested group searches in RabbitMQ's LDAP plugin using the classic config format. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [ {rabbitmq_auth_backend_ldap, [ %% ... {group_lookup_base, "ou=groups,dc=example,dc=com"} ]} ] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Permission Configuration Example DESCRIPTION: Example of configuring permissions based on user DN attributes and constant values. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_30 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {resource_access_query, {for, [{permission, configure, {equals, {attribute, "${user_dn}", "description"}, {string, "can-declare-${resource}s"} }}, {permission, write, {constant, true}}, {permission, read, {constant, true}} ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Standard LDAP Configuration DESCRIPTION: Basic LDAP configuration in rabbitmq.conf format. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_35 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` auth_backends.1 = ldap auth_ldap.servers.1 = my-ldap-server auth_ldap.user_dn_pattern = cn=${username},ou=People,dc=example,dc=com auth_ldap.use_ssl = false auth_ldap.port = 389 auth_ldap.log = false ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing All TCP Connections with netstat DESCRIPTION: Uses netstat to list all TCP connection sockets with numeric addresses and associated program names. This command shows all connections regardless of their state and is useful for connection troubleshooting. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/troubleshooting-networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo netstat --all --numeric --tcp --programs ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Failed Attempt to Delete a Protected Virtual Host Using HTTP API DESCRIPTION: Example showing the 412 Precondition Failed error that occurs when trying to delete a virtual host that has been protected from deletion using the HTTP API. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -sL -u guest:guest -X DELETE http://localhost:15672/api/vhosts/vh1/ # => < HTTP/1.1 412 Precondition Failed ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Export Virtual Host Definitions in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to export all definitions from a specific virtual host to a file, which will be used to import definitions to the new virtual host after modification. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/migrate-mcq-to-qq.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # exports definitions of a specific virtual host rabbitmqctl export_definitions --vhost="{original_vhost}" /path/to/original_vhost.json ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Inspecting TCP Listeners on Port 1883 using lsof (IPv6) DESCRIPTION: Checks for processes listening on port 1883 using IPv6, useful for verifying MQTT over IPv6 configurations. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/troubleshooting-networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` sudo lsof -n -i6TCP:1883 | grep LISTEN ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking plugin directories and enabled plugins file DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use rabbitmq-plugins to check plugin directories and the enabled plugins file path, useful for troubleshooting plugin loading issues. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/plugins.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins directories -s # => Plugin archives directory: /path/to/rabbitmq/plugins # => Plugin expansion directory: /path/to/node/node-plugins-expand # => Enabled plugins file: /path/to/enabled_plugins ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Encoding Values with rabbitmqctl on Unix Systems DESCRIPTION: Example of encoding a sensitive value (connection URI) using rabbitmqctl on Unix-based systems with a passphrase. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_52 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl encode '"amqp://fred:secret@host1.domain/my_vhost"' mypassphrase {encrypted,<<"... long encrypted value...">>} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling JSON Formatted Console Logging in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This configuration enables console logging with 'info' level and JSON formatting, while disabling file logging in RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.console = true log.console.level = info log.console.formatter = json log.file = false ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Heartbeat Interval for RabbitMQ Java Client on Google App Engine DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to set a low heartbeat interval (4-5 seconds) for the RabbitMQ Java client when used on Google App Engine. This is necessary to avoid running into low InputStream read timeouts on GAE. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/java-api-guide.md#2025-04-09_snippet_44 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` ConnectionFactory factory = new ConnectionFactory(); cf.setRequestedHeartbeat(5); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Server TLS Version Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration examples for limiting TLS versions on the RabbitMQ server side. Shows how to configure the server to accept only TLSv1.3 or TLSv1.2 and later versions. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/ssl/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_27 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` listeners.ssl.1 = 5671 ssl_options.cacertfile = /path/to/ca_certificate.pem ssl_options.certfile = /path/to/server_certificate.pem ssl_options.keyfile = /path/to/server_key.pem ssl_options.versions.1 = tlsv1.3 # Limits enable cipher suites to only those used by TLSv1.3. # There are no cipher suites supported by both TLSv1.3 and TLSv1.2. ssl_options.ciphers.1 = TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384 ssl_options.ciphers.2 = TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256 ssl_options.ciphers.3 = TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256 ssl_options.ciphers.4 = TLS_AES_128_CCM_SHA256 ssl_options.ciphers.5 = TLS_AES_128_CCM_8_SHA256 ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` listeners.ssl.1 = 5671 ssl_options.cacertfile = /path/to/ca_certificate.pem ssl_options.certfile = /path/to/server_certificate.pem ssl_options.keyfile = /path/to/server_key.pem ssl_options.versions.1 = tlsv1.2 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Advanced TCP Configuration DESCRIPTION: Complete advanced configuration combining TCP settings and kernel options in Erlang term format. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_30 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [ {kernel, [ {inet_default_connect_options, [{nodelay, true}]}, {inet_default_listen_options, [{nodelay, true}]} ]}, {rabbit, [ {tcp_listen_options, [ {backlog, 4096}, {nodelay, true}, {linger, {true,0}}, {exit_on_close, false} ]} ]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring AWS Private IP Usage DESCRIPTION: Configuration setting to use private IP addresses instead of private hostnames for node names in AWS. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2018-02-18-peer-discovery-subsystem-in-rabbitmq-3-7/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.aws.use_private_ip = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Stream Filtering in Python DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to configure stream filtering for a RabbitMQ consumer using the Python client library. It sets filter values and enables matching of unfiltered messages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/amqp-client-libraries.md#2025-04-09_snippet_38 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` class MyMessageHandler(AMQPMessagingHandler): def __init__(self): super().__init__() def on_message(self, event: Event): # accepting self.delivery_context.accept(event) # deal with the message stream_address = AddressHelper.queue_address("some-stream") consumer = consumer_connection.consumer( stream_address, message_handler=MyMessageHandler(), stream_filter_options=StreamOptions(stream_filters=["invoices", "order"], match_unfiltered=True), ) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TLS for RabbitMQ Prometheus Endpoint DESCRIPTION: Configuration for enabling TLS security on the Prometheus metrics endpoint, including certificate paths and optional password for encrypted keyfile. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/prometheus/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` prometheus.ssl.port = 15691 prometheus.ssl.cacertfile = /full/path/to/ca_certificate.pem prometheus.ssl.certfile = /full/path/to/server_certificate.pem prometheus.ssl.keyfile = /full/path/to/server_key.pem prometheus.ssl.password = password-if-keyfile-is-encrypted ## To enforce TLS (disable the non-TLS port): # prometheus.tcp.listener = none ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Consumer Timeout Policy in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Uses rabbitmqctl to set a policy that overrides the consumer timeout for a group of queues. The timeout is specified in milliseconds. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/consumers.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # override consumer timeout for a group of queues using a policy rabbitmqctl set_policy queue_consumer_timeout "with_delivery_timeout\.*" '{"consumer-timeout":3600000}' --apply-to classic_queues ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Avoiding Race Conditions in RabbitMQ Channel Operations DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates a potential race condition when using isOpen() method and suggests a better approach to handle channel operations safely by catching exceptions. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/java-api-guide.md#2025-04-09_snippet_28 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` public void brokenMethod(Channel channel) { if (channel.isOpen()) { // The following code depends on the channel being in open state. // However there is a possibility of the change in the channel state // between isOpen() and basicQos(1) call ... channel.basicQos(1); } } ``` LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` public void validMethod(Channel channel) { try { ... channel.basicQos(1); } catch (ShutdownSignalException sse) { // possibly check if channel was closed // by the time we started action and reasons for // closing it ... } catch (IOException ioe) { // check why connection was closed ... } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Message TTL Policy using rabbitmqctl in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: This command sets a policy that applies a 60-second TTL to all queues using rabbitmqctl in a PowerShell environment. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ttl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_policy TTL ".*" "{""message-ttl"":60000}" --apply-to queues ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TLS Certificate Common Name Authentication DESCRIPTION: Configuration to use the Common Name from client certificates for authentication instead of the default Distinguished Name format. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` ssl_cert_login_from = common_name ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Statistics Collection Mode in RabbitMQ (INI) DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to set the statistics collection mode in RabbitMQ. The default configuration is shown, which disables statistics collection. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_36 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` collect_statistics = none ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ Plugin Directories in Linux/MacOS DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to configure multiple plugin directories in RabbitMQ using a colon-separated list in the rabbitmq-env.conf file on Linux or MacOS systems. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/plugins.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Example rabbitmq-env.conf file that features a colon-separated list of plugin directories PLUGINS_DIR="/usr/lib/rabbitmq/plugins:/usr/lib/rabbitmq/lib/rabbitmq_server-3.11.6/plugins" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting Stream Replica Command Example DESCRIPTION: Example command showing how to remove a stream replica from a specific node and virtual host using the rabbitmq-streams CLI tool SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmq-streams.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-streams delete_replica --vhost "a-vhost" "a-queue" "rabbit@decomissioned-node" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting RabbitMQ Cluster Name DESCRIPTION: Command to set the cluster name for RabbitMQ nodes in a federation. The cluster name helps identify nodes in the federation graph, which is important when DNS might not provide distinct names for machines. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/federation-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl set_cluster_name "east1-production" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Dependencies and Running the Application DESCRIPTION: Shell commands to install dependencies and run both the consumer and producer parts of the application in separate terminals. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-go-stream.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` go get -u # In one terminal go run receive.go # In another terminal go run send.go ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Custom Node Name in RabbitMQ Environment Configuration DESCRIPTION: Example configuration that changes the default node name prefix from 'rabbit' to 'hare'. Shows basic syntax of rabbitmq-env.conf including comments and environment variable definition. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmq-env.conf.5.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # I am a complete rabbitmq-env.conf file. # Comment lines start with a hash character. # This is a /bin/sh script file - use ordinary envt var syntax NODENAME=hare ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking RabbitMQ Node Status with rabbitmqctl on Windows DESCRIPTION: This command performs a basic health check on the RabbitMQ node and displays information about it if it's running. It uses rabbitmqctl.bat and should be run from the sbin directory. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/install-windows-manual.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat status ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring OAuth Providers in RabbitMQ for Multiple Realms DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the configuration for two OAuth providers (dev and prod) in RabbitMQ, both pointing to the same Keycloak instance but different realms. It includes SSL configuration for secure communication. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/oauth2-examples-multiresource.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.devkeycloak.issuer = https://keycloak:8443/realms/dev auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.devkeycloak.https.cacertfile = /etc/rabbitmq/keycloak-ca_certificate.pem auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.devkeycloak.https.verify = verify_peer auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.devkeycloak.https.hostname_verification = wildcard auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.prodkeycloak.issuer = https://keycloak:8443/realms/prod auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.prodkeycloak.https.cacertfile = /etc/rabbitmq/keycloak-ca_certificate.pem auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.prodkeycloak.https.verify = verify_peer auth_oauth2.oauth_providers.prodkeycloak.https.hostname_verification = wildcard ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring a Queue and Publishing a Message in RabbitMQ with Go DESCRIPTION: Code that declares a queue named 'hello' and publishes a message to it. Uses context with timeout for publishing and includes queue configuration parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-go.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: go CODE: ``` q, err := ch.QueueDeclare( "hello", // name false, // durable false, // delete when unused false, // exclusive false, // no-wait nil, // arguments ) failOnError(err, "Failed to declare a queue") ctx, cancel := context.WithTimeout(context.Background(), 5*time.Second) defer cancel() body := "Hello World!" err = ch.PublishWithContext(ctx, "", // exchange q.Name, // routing key false, // mandatory false, // immediate amqp.Publishing { ContentType: "text/plain", Body: []byte(body), }) failOnError(err, "Failed to publish a message") log.Printf(" [x] Sent %s\n", body) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Calculating Minimum Network Bandwidth for RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Formula for computing the minimum required network bandwidth for RabbitMQ cluster nodes. Takes into account message rate, message size, and protocol overhead to calculate bits per second needed. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/production-checklist.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` MR * MS * 110% * 8 ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` 20K * 6 KB * 110% * 8 bit/B = 20000 * 6000 * 1.1 * 8 = 1.056 (gigabit/second) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: TCP Socket Exit Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration for TCP socket closure behavior on client disconnect SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_42 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` tcp_listen_options.exit_on_close = false ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Logging Authentication Failure in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the server log output for a failed authentication attempt due to incorrect credentials. It includes connection acceptance, error message, and connection closure. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/access-control.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` 2019-03-25 12:28:19.047 [info] <0.1613.0> accepting AMQP connection <0.1613.0> (127.0.0.1:63839 -> 127.0.0.1:5672) 2019-03-25 12:28:19.056 [error] <0.1613.0> Error on AMQP connection <0.1613.0> (127.0.0.1:63839 -> 127.0.0.1:5672, state: starting): PLAIN login refused: user 'user2' - invalid credentials 2019-03-25 12:28:22.057 [info] <0.1613.0> closing AMQP connection <0.1613.0> (127.0.0.1:63839 -> 127.0.0.1:5672) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Erlang Dependencies DESCRIPTION: Command to install required Erlang packages for RabbitMQ operation. Includes core runtime and additional modules needed for full functionality. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo apt-get install -y erlang-base \ erlang-asn1 erlang-crypto erlang-eldap erlang-ftp erlang-inets \ erlang-mnesia erlang-os-mon erlang-parsetools erlang-public-key \ erlang-runtime-tools erlang-snmp erlang-ssl \ erlang-syntax-tools erlang-tftp erlang-tools erlang-xmerl ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling a Deprecated Feature for Testing in RabbitMQ Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration example showing how to disable a deprecated feature to test applications as if the feature was already removed from RabbitMQ. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/deprecated-features/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # Try RabbitMQ as if the deprecated feature was gone. deprecated_features.permit.some_deprecated_feature = false ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a RabbitMQ User with Provided Credentials DESCRIPTION: Kubernetes manifest for creating a RabbitMQ user with username and password provided from an existing Kubernetes secret named 'my-rabbit-user'. The user is assigned 'policymaker' and 'monitoring' tags. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-topology-operator.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` apiVersion: rabbitmq.com/v1beta1 kind: User metadata: name: import-user-sample spec: tags: - policymaker - monitoring # other available tags are 'management' and 'administrator' rabbitmqClusterReference: name: rabbit-example importCredentialsSecret: name: my-rabbit-user # name of the secret ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Memory Paging Ratio DESCRIPTION: Configuration for memory-based message paging threshold SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` vm_memory_high_watermark_paging_ratio = 0.5 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Up RabbitMQ and Erlang Repositories on Debian Bullseye DESCRIPTION: Comprehensive script for setting up RabbitMQ and Erlang repositories, adding signing keys, and installing packages on Debian Bullseye. Includes steps for adding mirrors and installing specific Erlang versions. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` #!/bin/sh sudo apt-get install curl gnupg apt-transport-https -y ## Team RabbitMQ's main signing key curl -1sLf "https://keys.openpgp.org/vks/v1/by-fingerprint/0A9AF2115F4687BD29803A206B73A36E6026DFCA" | sudo gpg --dearmor | sudo tee /usr/share/keyrings/com.rabbitmq.team.gpg > /dev/null ## Community mirror of Cloudsmith: modern Erlang repository curl -1sLf https://github.com/rabbitmq/signing-keys/releases/download/3.0/cloudsmith.rabbitmq-erlang.E495BB49CC4BBE5B.key | sudo gpg --dearmor | sudo tee /usr/share/keyrings/rabbitmq.E495BB49CC4BBE5B.gpg > /dev/null ## Community mirror of Cloudsmith: RabbitMQ repository curl -1sLf https://github.com/rabbitmq/signing-keys/releases/download/3.0/cloudsmith.rabbitmq-server.9F4587F226208342.key | sudo gpg --dearmor | sudo tee /usr/share/keyrings/rabbitmq.9F4587F226208342.gpg > /dev/null ## Add apt repositories maintained by Team RabbitMQ sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/rabbitmq.list <>} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring Fanout Exchange in PHP DESCRIPTION: Creates a fanout exchange named 'logs' that broadcasts messages to all bound queues. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-php.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: php CODE: ``` $channel->exchange_declare('logs', 'fanout', false, false, false); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Virtual Host Metadata using HTTP API DESCRIPTION: Updates an existing virtual host's metadata through the HTTP API, including changing description, tags, and default queue type settings. Uses the same endpoint as creation but with different payload. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -u userename:pa$sw0rD -X PUT http://rabbitmq.local:15672/api/vhosts/qa1 \ -H "content-type: application/json" \ --data-raw '{"description": "QA environment for issue 1662", "tags": "qa,project-a,qa-1662", "default_queue_type": "quorum"}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling a RabbitMQ Plugin DESCRIPTION: Disables the specified plugin (rabbitmq_management) and all plugins that depend on it. This ensures that dependent plugins are also properly disabled. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmq-plugins.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins disable rabbitmq_management ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Virtual Host Limit in RabbitMQ (JSON) DESCRIPTION: JSON payload for the PUT /api/vhost-limits/{vhost}/{name} endpoint to set a per-vhost limit. This example sets the limit value to 100. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` {"value": 100} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing RabbitMQ Cluster Operator with kubectl rabbitmq plugin DESCRIPTION: Alternative method to install the RabbitMQ Cluster Operator using the kubectl rabbitmq plugin. This simplifies the installation process. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/quickstart-operator.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl rabbitmq install-cluster-operator ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Visualizing RabbitMQ Queue with Mermaid Flowchart DESCRIPTION: A flowchart diagram showing a queue representation in RabbitMQ, displayed as a node with a queue name using Mermaid syntax. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/src/components/Tutorials/TutorialsIntro.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: mermaid CODE: ``` flowchart LR Q[[queue_name]] class Q mermaid-queue ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Stream Subscription in STOMP DESCRIPTION: Example of a STOMP SUBSCRIBE frame for stream consumption with offset specification. Demonstrates setting ack mode, prefetch count, and stream offset parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: stomp CODE: ``` SUBSCRIBE destination:/amq/queue/my-stream ack:client prefetch-count:10 x-stream-offset:next ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling a Specific Feature Flag in RabbitMQ using Bash DESCRIPTION: This command enables a specific feature flag in RabbitMQ using the rabbitmqctl CLI tool. Replace with the actual feature flag name. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/feature-flags/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl enable_feature_flag ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Docker Container Limits for RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Docker daemon configuration to set kernel limits for containers. This JSON configuration sets both soft and hard limits for maximum open files to 64000. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-rpm.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "default-ulimits": { "nofile": { "Name": "nofile", "Hard": 64000, "Soft": 64000 } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Timestamp Header to Messages in RabbitMQ Shovel DESCRIPTION: Boolean configuration that controls whether a custom header 'x-shovelled-timestamp' should be added to messages before republishing. The header contains the timestamp when the message was shovelled. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/shovel-static.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {add_timestamp_header, true} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Operator Policy Changes Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration setting to disable modification of operator policies via the HTTP API and Web UI. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/parameters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.restrictions.operator_policy_changes.disabled = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting RabbitMQ with OAuth2 Proxy Configuration DESCRIPTION: Command to start RabbitMQ with the OAuth2 Proxy mode enabled, allowing it to work with the OAuth 2.0 authentication setup. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/oauth2-examples-proxy.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` MODE=oauth2-proxy make start-rabbitmq ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling RabbitMQ Management Plugin DESCRIPTION: Command to disable the 'rabbitmq_management' plugin and all plugins that depend on it. This shows how to deactivate a plugin and its dependents. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/man/rabbitmq-plugins.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins disable rabbitmq_management ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting RabbitMQ Server in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: Command to start a new RabbitMQ node using the rabbitmq-server.bat command in PowerShell. By default, this will use Mnesia as the metadata store backend. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/metadata-store/how-to-enable-khepri.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` rabbitmq-server.bat ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting a Listener on a Publisher in Java DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to add a listener to a RabbitMQ publisher in Java. The listener can react to state changes of the publisher instance. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/amqp-client-libraries.md#2025-04-09_snippet_67 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` Publisher publisher = connection.publisherBuilder() .listeners(context -> { // ... }) .exchange("foo").key("bar") .build(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TCP Listener Options for STOMP DESCRIPTION: Advanced TCP listener configuration including buffer sizes, connection queue length, TCP keepalives, and timeouts. These settings can help optimize network performance for STOMP connections. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` stomp.listeners.tcp.1 = 127.0.0.1:61613 stomp.listeners.tcp.2 = ::1:61613 stomp.tcp_listen_options.backlog = 4096 stomp.tcp_listen_options.recbuf = 131072 stomp.tcp_listen_options.sndbuf = 131072 stomp.tcp_listen_options.keepalive = true stomp.tcp_listen_options.nodelay = true stomp.tcp_listen_options.exit_on_close = true stomp.tcp_listen_options.send_timeout = 120 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring classic cluster formation nodes in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration for classic peer discovery backend, specifying which nodes to contact when forming a cluster on first boot. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_32 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.classic_config.nodes.1 = rabbit@hostname1 cluster_formation.classic_config.nodes.2 = rabbit@hostname2 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Closing RabbitMQ Connection DESCRIPTION: Properly closing the channel and connection after message publication. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-php.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: php CODE: ``` $channel->close(); $connection->close(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Protected Virtual Host Using Definition JSON DESCRIPTION: JSON definition for creating a virtual host that is protected from deletion using the definition import feature. The protection is enabled by setting the 'protected_from_deletion' metadata key to true. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_24 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "name": "protected", "description": "", "metadata": { "description": "This virtual host is protected from deletion with a special metadata key", "tags": [], "default_queue_type": "classic", "protected_from_deletion": true }, "tags": [], "default_queue_type": "classic" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Federation Policy with PowerShell DESCRIPTION: Defines a policy to federate exchanges matching a pattern using PowerShell SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/federation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat set_policy --apply-to exchanges federate-me "^amq\." ` '"{""federation-upstream-set"":""all""}"' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting a Virtual Host After Removing Protection Using CLI DESCRIPTION: Command to delete a RabbitMQ virtual host after its deletion protection has been removed, showing the successful output message. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/vhosts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl delete_vhost "vhost-name" # => Deleting vhost "vhost-name" ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Passwordless User in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create a user without a password using rabbitmqctl commands. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/passwords.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl add_user passwordless-user "pa$$wordless" rabbitmqctl clear_password passwordless-user ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Connecting to STOMP Broker DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code showing how to connect to the STOMP broker with credentials and callbacks. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/web-stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // ... var on_connect = function() { console.log('connected'); }; var on_error = function() { console.log('error'); }; client.connect('guest', 'guest', on_connect, on_error, '/'); // ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Temporary Queue DESCRIPTION: Declares an exclusive, auto-delete queue with a server-generated name. The queue will be automatically deleted when the connection closes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-three-javascript.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` channel.assertQueue('', { exclusive: true }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ and Erlang apt Repositories for Debian Bookworm DESCRIPTION: Adds apt repository configurations for RabbitMQ and Erlang on Debian Bookworm. This includes mirrors for redundancy and separate repositories for Erlang and RabbitMQ server packages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/rabbitmq.list < RabbitMQ broker 2.0.0 RabbitMQ Java Client 2.0.0 RabbitMQ Erlang Client 2.0.0 RabbitMQ .NET Client 2.0.0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Bulk Deleting Users with JSON Payload in RabbitMQ API DESCRIPTION: Example JSON payload for the POST /api/users/bulk-delete endpoint that allows bulk deletion of multiple users. The payload contains an array of usernames to be deleted. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` {"users" : ["user1", "user2", "user3"]} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing RabbitMQ Queue Information via HTTP API DESCRIPTION: Endpoints for retrieving information about queues in RabbitMQ. These provide similar data to the rabbitmqctl list_queues command plus message statistics and additional details. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_36 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` /api/queues ``` LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` /api/queues/(vhost) ``` LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` /api/queues/(vhost)/(name) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Encrypting Values in RabbitMQ with encode Command DESCRIPTION: The encode command encrypts values using a specified passphrase. It allows customization of the encryption settings through optional parameters for cipher, hash algorithm, and iteration count. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_64 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl encode '<<"guest">>' mypassphrase ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl encode --cipher blowfish_cfb64 --hash sha256 --iterations 10000 '<<"guest">>' mypassphrase ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Detecting Stuck Processes in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Samples stack traces of Erlang processes and reports those with identical samples which may indicate processes not making progress. The -q flag enables quiet mode. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmq-diagnostics.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics maybe_stuck -q ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Decrypting Configuration Values with RabbitMQ CLI (PowerShell) DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the rabbitmqctl decode command to decrypt previously encrypted configuration values on Windows using PowerShell. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_49 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl decode "{encrypted, <<""..."">>}" mypassphrase # => <<"guest">> rabbitmqctl decode "{encrypted, <<""..."">>}" mypassphrase # => "amqp://fred:secret@host1.domain/my_vhost" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling VT/ANSI Escape Sequences in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: PowerShell command to enable VT/ANSI escape sequences in the console, fixing the display of formatted text output from RabbitMQ CLI tools. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/windows-configuration.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` Set-ItemProperty HKCU:\Console VirtualTerminalLevel -Type DWORD 1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Monitoring-Only User in RabbitMQ using Bash DESCRIPTION: This bash script demonstrates how to create a user with monitoring-only access to the RabbitMQ management UI. It creates a user, tags it with the 'monitoring' tag, and grants empty permissions which allow viewing but not modifying resources. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # See the Access Control guide to learn about user management. # # Password is provided as a command line argument. # Note that certain characters such as !, &, $, #, and so on must be escaped to avoid # special interpretation by the shell. rabbitmqctl add_user 'monitoring' '2a55f70a841f18b97c3a7db939b7adc9e34a0f1b' # tag user 'monitoring' with a tag of the same name rabbitmqctl set_user_tags 'monitoring' 'monitoring' # grant the user empty permissions rabbitmqctl set_permissions --vhost 'vhost-name' 'monitoring' '^$' '^$' '^$' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: AMQP Connection Error Log for JWT Token Size Limit DESCRIPTION: Server log output showing an AMQP connection being closed due to JWT token exceeding the maximum frame size limit. The error occurs during connection handshake when a large token is provided. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/troubleshooting-oauth2.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` 2025-03-15 05:55:21.689185+00:00 [info] <0.2771.0> accepting AMQP connection <0.2771.0> (10.8.121.164:45024 -> 10.8.121.141:5672) 2025-03-15 05:55:24.745906+00:00 [error] <0.2771.0> closing AMQP connection <0.2771.0> (10.8.121.164:45024 -> 10.8.121.141:5672): 2025-03-15 05:55:24.745906+00:00 [error] <0.2771.0> {handshake_error,starting,0, 2025-03-15 05:55:24.745906+00:00 [error] <0.2771.0> {amqp_error,frame_error, 2025-03-15 05:55:24.745906+00:00 [error] <0.2771.0> "type 1, all octets = <<>>: {frame_too_large,6307,4088}", 2025-03-15 05:55:24.745906+00:00 [error] <0.2771.0> none}} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Per-Node Channel Maximum DESCRIPTION: Configuration setting to limit the maximum number of channels that can be opened on each node in a cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/channels/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` channel_max_per_node = 500 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deactivating Topology Recovery in C# DESCRIPTION: Shows how to deactivate topology recovery while keeping connection recovery active in C#. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/amqp-client-libraries.md#2025-04-09_snippet_76 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` await AmqpConnection.CreateAsync( ConnectionSettingBuilder.Create().RecoveryConfiguration( RecoveryConfiguration.Create() .Topology(false)) // deactivate topology recovery .Build()); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring DETS-based Retained Message Store for MQTT DESCRIPTION: Configuration example for using a disk-based DETS store for MQTT retained messages, with a configurable sync interval. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/mqtt.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` ## use DETS (disk-based) store for retained messages mqtt.retained_message_store = rabbit_mqtt_retained_msg_store_dets ## only used by DETS store (in milliseconds) mqtt.retained_message_store_dets_sync_interval = 2000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Rotating RabbitMQ Log Files DESCRIPTION: Command to trigger internal log rotation for RabbitMQ logs. The rotation is performed asynchronously according to logging settings in the configuration file. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl rotate_logs ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing All RabbitMQ Plugins DESCRIPTION: Lists all available RabbitMQ plugins with their status. Each plugin is prefixed with status indicators showing if they are enabled and running. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmq-plugins.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins list ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing RabbitMQ Feature Flags DESCRIPTION: Command to list feature flags with specific columns for detailed information. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_76 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_feature_flags name state ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Memory Breakdown Output DESCRIPTION: Example output from rabbitmq-diagnostics memory_breakdown command showing memory usage distribution across different categories including quorum queues, binary heap, connections, and system components. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/memory-use/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` quorum_queue_procs: 0.4181 gb (28.8%) binary: 0.4129 gb (28.44%) allocated_unused: 0.1959 gb (13.49%) connection_other: 0.1894 gb (13.05%) plugins: 0.0373 gb (2.57%) other_proc: 0.0325 gb (2.24%) code: 0.0305 gb (2.1%) quorum_ets: 0.0303 gb (2.09%) connection_readers: 0.0222 gb (1.53%) other_system: 0.0209 gb (1.44%) connection_channels: 0.017 gb (1.17%) mgmt_db: 0.017 gb (1.17%) metrics: 0.0109 gb (0.75%) other_ets: 0.0073 gb (0.5%) connection_writers: 0.007 gb (0.48%) atom: 0.0015 gb (0.11%) mnesia: 0.0006 gb (0.04%) msg_index: 0.0002 gb (0.01%) queue_procs: 0.0002 gb (0.01%) reserved_unallocated: 0.0 gb (0.0%) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing RabbitMQ Feature Flags DESCRIPTION: Command to list feature flags with specific columns for detailed information. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_76 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_feature_flags name state ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Downloading Stream PerfTest Tool DESCRIPTION: These commands download the Stream PerfTest JAR file, which is used to demonstrate and test stream filtering functionality. The tool requires Java 11 or later. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2023-10-16-stream-filtering/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` cd /tmp wget -O stream-perf-test.jar \ https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-java-tools-binaries-dev/releases/download/v-stream-perf-test-latest/stream-perf-test-latest.jar ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Erlang Dependencies with Version Pinning DESCRIPTION: Installs specific versions of Erlang packages required by RabbitMQ using version pinning. Sets a supported Erlang version and installs multiple Erlang components needed for RabbitMQ operation. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-debian.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` supported_erlang_version="1:26.2.5.6-1" sudo apt-get install -y erlang-base=$supported_erlang_version \ erlang-asn1=$supported_erlang_version \ erlang-crypto=$supported_erlang_version \ erlang-eldap=$supported_erlang_version \ erlang-ftp=$supported_erlang_version \ erlang-inets=$supported_erlang_version \ erlang-mnesia=$supported_erlang_version \ erlang-os-mon=$supported_erlang_version \ erlang-parsetools=$supported_erlang_version \ erlang-public-key=$supported_erlang_version \ erlang-runtime-tools=$supported_erlang_version \ erlang-snmp=$supported_erlang_version \ erlang-ssl=$supported_erlang_version \ erlang-syntax-tools=$supported_erlang_version \ erlang-tftp=$supported_erlang_version \ erlang-tools=$supported_erlang_version \ erlang-xmerl=$supported_erlang_version ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complete Log Receiver Implementation DESCRIPTION: Full implementation of a direct log receiver that subscribes to specific severity levels SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-four-ruby.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` #!/usr/bin/env ruby require 'bunny' abort "Usage: #{$PROGRAM_NAME} [info] [warning] [error]" if ARGV.empty? connection = Bunny.new connection.start channel = connection.create_channel exchange = channel.direct('direct_logs') queue = channel.queue('', exclusive: true) ARGV.each do |severity| queue.bind(exchange, routing_key: severity) end puts ' [*] Waiting for logs. To exit press CTRL+C' begin queue.subscribe(block: true) do |delivery_info, _properties, body| puts " [x] #{delivery_info.routing_key}:#{body}" end rescue Interrupt => _ channel.close connection.close exit(0) end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding a RabbitMQ User with Basic Syntax in Bash DESCRIPTION: Example of adding a user to RabbitMQ using the rabbitmqctl add_user command with username and password as positional arguments. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/cli.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl add_user "a-user" "a-pa$$w0rd" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: AMQP 1.0 Source Address Configuration DESCRIPTION: Mandatory configuration for setting the source address of an AMQP 1.0 link. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/shovel-static.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {source_address, <<"my-address">>} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: AMQP Message Properties Code Example DESCRIPTION: Examples of AMQP message property fields used for delivery mode and priority settings in RabbitMQ queues. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/queues.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: AMQP CODE: ``` delivery_mode priority ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing a Task Producer in Objective-C with RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to create a 'newTask' method that connects to RabbitMQ, creates a channel, and publishes a message to a queue. The method accepts a string parameter that represents the task to be executed. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-two-objectivec.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Objective-C CODE: ``` - (void)newTask:(NSString *)msg { NSLog(@"Attempting to connect to local RabbitMQ broker"); RMQConnection *conn = [[RMQConnection alloc] initWithDelegate:[RMQConnectionDelegateLogger new]]; [conn start]; id ch = [conn createChannel]; RMQQueue *q = [ch queue:@"hello"]; NSData *msgData = [msg dataUsingEncoding:NSUTF8StringEncoding]; [ch.defaultExchange publish:msgData routingKey:q.name]; NSLog(@"Sent %@", msg); [conn close]; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TCP Options for MQTT Connections in INI DESCRIPTION: INI configuration that optimizes TCP settings for MQTT connections to maximize throughput. This increases TCP buffer sizes to 192 KiB and configures important TCP socket options. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` mqtt.tcp_listen_options.backlog = 128 mqtt.tcp_listen_options.nodelay = true mqtt.tcp_listen_options.linger.on = true mqtt.tcp_listen_options.linger.timeout = 0 mqtt.tcp_listen_options.sndbuf = 196608 mqtt.tcp_listen_options.recbuf = 196608 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Consumer Timeout in RabbitMQ INI DESCRIPTION: Configuration examples for setting consumer acknowledgement timeout in rabbitmq.conf. Shows how to set timeout values in milliseconds. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/consumers.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # 30 minutes in milliseconds consumer_timeout = 1800000 ``` LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # one hour in milliseconds consumer_timeout = 3600000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: TLS-Only Configuration DESCRIPTION: Shows how to deactivate non-TLS listeners and configure TLS-only connections with SSL options. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` # deactivates non-TLS listeners, only TLS-enabled (activated) clients will be able to connect listeners.tcp = none listeners.ssl.default = 5671 ssl_options.cacertfile = /path/to/ca_certificate.pem ssl_options.certfile = /path/to/server_certificate.pem ssl_options.keyfile = /path/to/server_key.pem ssl_options.verify = verify_peer ssl_options.fail_if_no_peer_cert = false ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Bulk Deleting Users with JSON Payload in RabbitMQ API DESCRIPTION: Example JSON payload for the POST /api/users/bulk-delete endpoint that allows bulk deletion of multiple users. The payload contains an array of usernames to be deleted. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/http-api-reference.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` {"users" : ["user1", "user2", "user3"]} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Establishing a RabbitMQ Connection DESCRIPTION: Elixir code that establishes a connection to RabbitMQ and opens a channel for communication. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-elixir.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: elixir CODE: ``` {:ok, connection} = AMQP.Connection.open {:ok, channel} = AMQP.Channel.open(connection) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Management DB Cache Multiplier DESCRIPTION: Configures the cache duration multiplier for management plugin queries, affecting how long expensive query results are cached. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/configure.md#2025-04-09_snippet_45 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.db_cache_multiplier = 5 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Verifying Java Installation for RabbitMQ Tutorial DESCRIPTION: Bash command to verify that Java is correctly installed and available in the system PATH. This is a prerequisite for running the RabbitMQ Stream tutorial. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-java-stream.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` java --help ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating TLS Secret for RabbitMQ Server Certificates in Kubernetes DESCRIPTION: Command to create a Kubernetes TLS secret containing the server certificate and private key for RabbitMQ TLS encryption. This secret will be referenced in the RabbitmqCluster resource. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-operator/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_27 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl create secret tls tls-secret --cert=server.pem --key=server-key.pem ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring RabbitMQ Inter-node TLS Using ssl_dist_optfile in rabbitmq-env.conf (Linux) DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to simplify TLS configuration for RabbitMQ node-to-node communication by using the -ssl_dist_optfile option. It specifies the SSL path and points to an external configuration file that contains all TLS options. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/clustering-ssl.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # NOTE: the following path is system dependent and will change between Erlang # versions ERL_SSL_PATH="/usr/lib64/erlang/lib/ssl-9.4/ebin" # -pa $ERL_SSL_PATH prepends the directory ERL_SSL_PATH points at to the code path # -proto_dist inet_tls tells the runtime to encrypt inter-node communication # -ssl_dist_optfile tells the runtime where to find its inter-node TLS configuration file SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS="-pa $ERL_SSL_PATH -proto_dist inet_tls -ssl_dist_optfile /etc/rabbitmq/inter_node_tls.config" RABBITMQ_CTL_ERL_ARGS="-pa $ERL_SSL_PATH -proto_dist inet_tls -ssl_dist_optfile /etc/rabbitmq/inter_node_tls.config" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Additional RabbitMQ Plugins in YAML DESCRIPTION: Specifies additional plugins to enable in RabbitMQ. The example enables the rabbitmq_top and rabbitmq_shovel plugins. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/kubernetes/operator/using-operator/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiVersion: rabbitmq.com/v1beta1 kind: RabbitmqCluster metadata: name: rabbitmqcluster-sample spec: rabbitmq: additionalPlugins: - rabbitmq_top - rabbitmq_shovel ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic RabbitMQ Operations in Erlang DESCRIPTION: This Erlang module demonstrates basic RabbitMQ operations including connection establishment, channel opening, queue declaration, message publishing, message consumption, and manual acknowledgement. It uses a polling consumer for simplicity and does not implement publisher confirms. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/erlang-client-user-guide.md#2025-04-09_snippet_29 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` -module(amqp_example). -include("amqp_client.hrl"). -compile([export_all]). test() -> %% Start a network connection {ok, Connection} = amqp_connection:start(#amqp_params_network{}), %% Open a channel on the connection {ok, Channel} = amqp_connection:open_channel(Connection), %% Declare a queue #'queue.declare_ok'{queue = Q} = amqp_channel:call(Channel, #'queue.declare'{}), %% Publish a message Payload = <<"foobar">>, Publish = #'basic.publish'{exchange = <<>>, routing_key = Q}, amqp_channel:cast(Channel, Publish, #amqp_msg{payload = Payload}), %% Poll for a message Get = #'basic.get'{queue = Q}, {#'basic.get_ok'{delivery_tag = Tag}, Content} = amqp_channel:call(Channel, Get), %% Do something with the message payload %% (some work here) %% Ack the message amqp_channel:cast(Channel, #'basic.ack'{delivery_tag = Tag}), %% Close the channel amqp_channel:close(Channel), %% Close the connection amqp_connection:close(Connection), ok. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring AWS Autoscaling Group Membership for RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: This configuration snippet enables the use of AWS autoscaling group membership for RabbitMQ peer discovery. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/cluster-formation.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` cluster_formation.peer_discovery_backend = aws cluster_formation.aws.region = us-east-1 cluster_formation.aws.access_key_id = ANIDEXAMPLE cluster_formation.aws.secret_key = WjalrxuTnFEMI/K7MDENG+bPxRfiCYEXAMPLEKEY cluster_formation.aws.use_autoscaling_group = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Priority Queue in STOMP DESCRIPTION: Example of a STOMP SUBSCRIBE frame that creates a priority queue by specifying the x-max-priority header. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: stomp CODE: ``` SUBSCRIBE destination:/queue/my-priority-queue x-max-priority:5 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Erlang Kernel TCP Settings DESCRIPTION: Advanced configuration for Erlang kernel TCP settings including nodelay options. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/networking.md#2025-04-09_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` [ {kernel, [ {inet_default_connect_options, [{nodelay, true}]}, {inet_default_listen_options, [{nodelay, true}]} ]}]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining AMQP 1.0 Flow Frame Fields for Session Flow Control in XML DESCRIPTION: XML definition of the fields used in AMQP 1.0 flow frames for session flow control. These fields include next-incoming-id, incoming-window, next-outgoing-id, and outgoing-window, which are used to manage the flow of transfer frames between endpoints. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2024-09-02-amqp-flow-control/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: xml CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Protocol and URI Configuration DESCRIPTION: Shows how to configure the protocol type and connection URIs for a shovel, including authentication credentials and vhost specification. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/shovel-static.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {protocol, amqp091} ``` LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {uris, [ "amqp://fred:secret@host1.domain/my_vhost", "amqp://john:secret@host2.domain/my_vhost" ]} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RabbitMQ Exchange Metrics Table DESCRIPTION: Exchange-specific metrics for monitoring message publishing and routing behavior SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/prometheus/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Metric | Description | |---------------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|\n| rabbitmq_detailed_exchange_messages_published_total | Total number of messages published to an exchange |\n| rabbitmq_detailed_exchange_messages_confirmed_total | Total number of messages published to an exchange and [confirmed](./confirms#publisher-confirms) |\n| rabbitmq_detailed_exchange_messages_unroutable_returned_total | Total number of messages published as mandatory to an exchange and returned to the publisher as [unroutable](./publishers#unroutable) |\n| rabbitmq_detailed_exchange_messages_unroutable_dropped_total | Total number of messages published as non-mandatory to an exchange and dropped as [unroutable](./publishers#unroutable) | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling RabbitMQ Event Exchange Plugin DESCRIPTION: Command to activate the rabbitmq_event_exchange plugin, which requires no additional configuration after installation. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/event-exchange.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_event_exchange ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Custom Log Level Format in RabbitMQ DESCRIPTION: Configuration example for customizing the log level format. This specific setting uses lowercase, four-character format for log levels. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_38 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` log.file.formatter.level_format = lc4 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing String Sub-query in RabbitMQ LDAP Authentication DESCRIPTION: Structure for string sub-query that substitutes arguments into a string. This should be used within match or equals queries as it returns a string rather than a boolean. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ldap.md#2025-04-09_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {string, Pattern} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Spring AMQP Topic Sender with Java DESCRIPTION: Command to run the RabbitMQ topic exchange sender example with Spring profiles for 60 seconds duration. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-five-spring-amqp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` java -jar target/rabbitmq-tutorials.jar \ --spring.profiles.active=topics,sender \ --tutorial.client.duration=60000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding RabbitMQ CLI Tools to PATH DESCRIPTION: Commands to add RabbitMQ CLI tools to the system PATH for both Intel and Apple Silicon Macs. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-homebrew.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # for macOS Intel export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin # for Apple Silicon export PATH=$PATH:/opt/homebrew/sbin ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Tracking Published Messages with Sequence Numbers in RabbitMQ with Java DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use a concurrent map to track outbound messages by their sequence numbers. It demonstrates storing the message body with its corresponding sequence number before publishing. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-seven-java.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` ConcurrentNavigableMap outstandingConfirms = new ConcurrentSkipListMap<>(); // ... code for confirm callbacks will come later String body = "..."; outstandingConfirms.put(channel.getNextPublishSeqNo(), body); channel.basicPublish(exchange, queue, properties, body.getBytes()); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Queue Mirror Status via CLI DESCRIPTION: Command to list queue names and their mirror status including synchronized mirror PIDs SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ha/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_queues name mirror_pids synchronised_mirror_pids ``` LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat list_queues name mirror_pids synchronised_mirror_pids ``` LANGUAGE: batch CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat list_queues name mirror_pids synchronised_mirror_pids ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Queue Mirror Status via CLI DESCRIPTION: Command to list queue names and their mirror status including synchronized mirror PIDs SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/ha/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl list_queues name mirror_pids synchronised_mirror_pids ``` LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat list_queues name mirror_pids synchronised_mirror_pids ``` LANGUAGE: batch CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat list_queues name mirror_pids synchronised_mirror_pids ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Protocol and URI Configuration DESCRIPTION: Shows how to configure the protocol type and connection URIs for a shovel, including authentication credentials and vhost specification. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/docs/shovel-static.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {protocol, amqp091} ``` LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` {uris, [ "amqp://fred:secret@host1.domain/my_vhost", "amqp://john:secret@host2.domain/my_vhost" ]} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Common OAuth2 Settings DESCRIPTION: Configuration of common OAuth2 settings that apply to all resources including enabled status, logon type, and required scopes. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` management.oauth_enabled = true management.oauth_initiated_logon_type = sp_initiated management.oauth_scopes = openid rabbitmq.tag:management rabbitmq.read:*/* ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: HTTPS Configuration in Classic Erlang Config Format DESCRIPTION: Configures the management plugin to use HTTPS using the classic Erlang config format. This example sets TLS cipher suites, certificate paths, and security options as in the previous example. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/management/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` %% The classic config format example is provided primarily for completeness sake, %% using the modern `rabbitmq.conf` format for configuring this plugin is highly recommended. [ {rabbitmq_management, [ {ssl_config, [{port, 15671}, {ssl, true}, {cacertfile, "/path/to/ca_certificate.pem"}, {certfile, "/path/to/server_certificate.pem"}, {keyfile, "/path/to/server_key.pem"}, %% don't do peer verification to HTTPS clients {verify, verify_none}, {fail_if_no_peer_cert, false}, {client_renegotiation, false}, {secure_renegotiate, true}, {honor_ecc_order, true}, {honor_cipher_order, true}, {versions,['tlsv1.2']}, {ciphers, ["ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384", "ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384", "ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-SHA384", "ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA384", "ECDH-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384", "ECDH-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384", "ECDH-ECDSA-AES256-SHA384", "ECDH-RSA-AES256-SHA384", "DHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384" ]} ]} ]} ]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Log Location in RabbitMQ with PowerShell DESCRIPTION: Command to find the current log file location using rabbitmq-diagnostics CLI tool in PowerShell. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/logging.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` rabbitmq-diagnostics.bat -q log_location ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting a Listener on a Connection in Java DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to add a listener to a RabbitMQ connection in Java. The listener can react to state changes, providing access to previous and current states, failure causes, and the connection resource. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/amqp-client-libraries.md#2025-04-09_snippet_64 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` Connection connection = environment.connectionBuilder() .listeners(context -> { // set one or several listeners context.previousState(); // the previous state context.currentState(); // the current (new) state context.failureCause(); // the cause of the failure (in case of failure) context.resource(); // the connection }).build(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Optimized RabbitMQ Stream Publisher (Shell) DESCRIPTION: This shell command runs the optimized publisher application for RabbitMQ streams. It demonstrates how the publisher starts from the last published message and only sends new messages. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2021-07-28-rabbitmq-streams-message-deduplication/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` ./mvnw -q compile exec:java -Dexec.mainClass='com.rabbitmq.stream.Deduplication$PublishSmartDedupSecondDay' Connecting... Connected. Starting publishing at 10 Publishing 10 message with deduplication enabled. Messages confirmed? yes ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing RabbitMQ Client with erlang.mk DESCRIPTION: Dependency declaration for installing the rabbit_common package using erlang.mk build tool. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/client-libraries/erlang-client.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: makefile CODE: ``` dep_rabbit_common = hex &version-erlang-client; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Implicit Connect for STOMP Clients DESCRIPTION: Configuration to enable implicit connection for STOMP clients, allowing them to omit the CONNECT frame and begin communicating immediately using default credentials. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-4.0/stomp.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` stomp.default_user = guest stomp.default_pass = guest stomp.implicit_connect = true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Safe Division Function Using Maybe Monad DESCRIPTION: Example of using the Maybe monad to implement a safe division function that handles division by zero gracefully, showing how monads can make error handling code more concise and readable. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/blog/2011-05-17-can-you-hear-the-drums-erlando/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: erlang CODE: ``` if_safe_div_zero(X, Y, Fun) -> do([maybe_m || Result <- case Y == 0 of true -> fail("Cannot divide by zero"); false -> return(X / Y) end, return(Fun(Result))]). ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Required Packages for Producer DESCRIPTION: Go code showing the necessary imports for creating a RabbitMQ stream producer application. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/tutorials/tutorial-one-go-stream.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: go CODE: ``` import ( "bufio" "fmt" "github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-stream-go-client/pkg/amqp" "github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-stream-go-client/pkg/stream" "log" "os" ) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking RabbitMQ Node Status with PowerShell DESCRIPTION: This command performs a basic health check on a RabbitMQ node and displays information about the node if it is running. It's useful for monitoring and troubleshooting. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/install-windows-manual.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl.bat status ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Closing Connections in RabbitMQ (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Examples of using rabbitmqctl to close connections in RabbitMQ. The first command closes 10 connections on the 'qa_env' vhost, while the second closes all connections globally. SOURCE: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-website/blob/main/versioned_docs/version-3.13/man/rabbitmqctl.8.md#2025-04-09_snippet_71 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl close_all_connections -p qa_env --limit 10 'Please close' ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` rabbitmqctl close_all_connections --global ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: TLS Vulnerability Test Results for RabbitMQ Configuration DESCRIPTION: Output from a TLS security scan showing that this RabbitMQ TLSv1.2 configuration is not vulnerable to common TLS exploits like Heartbleed, POODLE, and ROBOT.
